La cuisine est équipé pour les repas, un frigo est à la disposition des invités, les chambres sont confortables et climatisées, deux hamacs sont installés à la cour pour les fins de soirée, à 15-20 minutes de Manhattan en métro et en ligne direct, qui est à 5 minutes de marche et à 20-25 minutes de l'aquarium de New York (un incontournable)et la plage de Coney Island et ses parcs d'attractions. Nous étions un groupe de 11 personnes, adultes et enfants et avons vraiment apprécié notre rencontre avec Lisel, nous avons trouvé notre endroit pour séjourné à NYC à l'avenir. JP

We recently spent a week at the Cbg Guest house in Brooklyn.  A wonderful experience for a family -- 3 kids under 11 -- with Lisel as an attentive and gracious hostess.  The neighborhood is great with lots going on, good food choices and a nice coffee shop on the corner to get you going in the morning.  Getting around all of NYC is really easy as well with subway access within a 10 minute walk. The room and beds were great and it was really nice to have access to a full kitchen.  I highly  recommend the Cbg Guest house for people wanting to have access to NYC from a neighborhood base.  We will be coming back.

My stay at Lisel's lovely guest house has been the perfect transition home away from home that I needed.  She has decorated her house so that you want to take a seat and stay for awhile.  I have met some incredible house guests and we've taken to going out on the town or cooking dinner together.  You will be pleasantly pleased by all that is offered. CV
What a lovely stay. Both Linda and I felt at home and we were. I would recommend at stay at Lisel's home.
The host canceled my reservation 14 days before arrival.

Lisel's place is very comfortable and quiet. My husband, my mother, my 18 month old and I were quite happy to stay there. Even though the rooms we were in were not entirely private, it was always very quiet. And our fellow guests were a nice mix of people, and all very courteous.

My husband and I really enjoyed our short stay here. The house is filled with books and artsy clutter. Lisel and Seija are friendly and very pleasant hosts. We also ate breakfast at Seija's vegan restaurant, Sun in Bloom. Delicious.

Lisel is generous and welcoming. The house is clean, the bed in the first floor front bedroom very comfortable. We had a very quiet night, with the exception of a car alarm. The bathroom situation is quirky, with a shower just off the living room and the teensiest powder room in the world, but it just takes a little flexibility and good humor to adjust.

Great, quiet but fun Park Slope neighborhood--a bookbinder a couple doors away, coffee shop, all sorts of restaurants around the corner on Fifth. We had a Colombian lunch at Bogota and a wonderful supper at Alchemy. It's just a few short blocks to the Bergen St. subway station. Be advised there are two Bergen St. stations!

Clean friendly cozy and very convenient. Not fancy, but very homey.  Lisel the owner does serious community work for Haiti relief. Large  shared kitchen. Like staying in someone's home, which it is. Perfect for visiting family for a few days. Lisel is very gracious and conscientious and fixed room mix- up immediately. Large stone shower. I'd stay here again for sure. Thanks!
A wonderful experience.  Lisel couldn't have been more gracious and welcoming.  The bed was super comfortable and the location was perfect.

My friend & I stayed in the CBJ Guest House for 5 days last week. Lisel was very welcoming and helpful with places to see in the area. The room was extremely comfortable. Great location as well!!! Great access to the subway & awesome restaurants all within walking distance. I highly recommend staying here to future guests.

We got the main bedroom on the third floor. The room is amazingly colorful and lovely. I fell in love with the blue color and the paintings on the walls by local artists. She is an artist!!! 
And as we asked, there was a IKEA daybed set up for my friend. We got clean bed clothes and even clean towers!!! It was very cozy 4 days staying in the house. 
The subway is within 5 mins walking distance. So it's actually a good place to stay for visiting NYC but wanting to avoid the crowds in Manhattan. 
There's some lovely little restaurants around. And you can get bagel and coffee very early in the morning with a little walk less than 3 mins!!! 
Anyway, I'll definitely recommend this house to my friends.

I reached out to CBG with a unique request. I was looking to host a cooking party with 15 of my closest friends hosted by a personal chef. I live in the city but my apartment really isn't conducive to that type of experience. I planned to host at a friend's place but something came up and they canceled on me 3 days before I was supposed to have the event. Another friend referred me to this site and I came across CBG. After pitching my unique request, Lisel got back to me immediately and said she'd be happy to have me. She made everything very convenient for me & my guests and there were no issues getting what was needed - it was overall a wonderful exchange. The only drawback (& why I'm giving 4 stars vs. 5) is the kitchen is a little cluttered. Granted there were a few of us packed in but you can tell the house has been occupied for a while. Overall, it was a great experience. I'd recommend CBG to anyone in the future.

Good atmosphere and host very kind. Very good location, in 30min you are in the center.
Thank you very much!

Our time at Lisel's guest house was amazing!  We were in town for a conference and she was very accomodating for our large group.  Half of our group needed to stay another night and Lisel was very helpful in switching some things around to make it work for us.  The location was amazing and was very close to everything Park Slope had to offer.  The home was clean yet comfy and had a full kitchen for our use.  Our group of 9 had plenty of hot water for showers and we were able to come and go as we please.  We were treated like family and will definitely be back next time we're in Brooklyn!
Great host, super accommodating. Booked for a business stay and was totally pleased.

It's difficult to describe the Community Be Good Guesthouse because it is a very different experience than many of us are used to, especially when traveling in New York City.  It's more like staying with a friend you've never met before than staying in a B & B.  I looked all over the Park Slope area for a place for my Mom, husband and I to stay near where my daughter lives for her college graduation.  Finding a single room for three people in NYC is nearly impossible (and extremely expensive to take two rooms).  The traditional B & B's in Park Slope all had terrible reviews for friendliness and helpfulness - in fact they all seemed obnoxious, which was borne out when I called one of them.  Then I discovered Airbnb and the CBG Guesthouse.  From the first contact, Lesal was friendly, direct, helpful, accommodating.  If you need luxury, this is not the place to stay, but if you want to feel like family and talk with an engaging, intelligent, thoughtful and wise woman and be in a wonderful area at a really reasonable price, this is a gem!  Although it requires suspending the "hotel" mentality, we all (including my 82 year old mother) thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would stay there again in an instant (despite the "smallest bathroom in the world" and shower in the office space).   Thanks to Lesal and Cecilio and all who make this wonderful space possible!
I had a very comfortable stay here at the guest house. Great hospitality, great home and a very quick response on short notice. The area is also a big plus located in downtown area.

This is a wonderful house on a tree lined street in Brooklyn close to subways, and lots of great restaurants, shops and coffee houses.  It is clean and comfortable with a beautiful back garden and a full kitchen that guests may use.  The host is friendly but not overbearing.  I highly recommend it.

Lisel was such a warm and inviting hostess. My friends drove me down to Brooklyn to help me find a place to live, and Lisel was incredibly insightful and quick to share advice and contacts with us. The house provided all of the necessary amenities like wifi, a clean, shared, bathroom and kitchen. It's close to several great cafes, restaurants and grocery stores. I would certainly recommend this Guest Home to young travellers, and those who enjoy a space that harbors community and connection. 
Thanks, Lisel!

Lisle was fantastic. Very helpful and accommodating. The other guests were quiet and respectful. I have used AirBnb and stayed in Guest Houses before and this house was unique in my experience. Although the house has a 'wild' and eclectic feel with a tremendous number of books and art objects there was also a very strong sense of order and cleanliness.

We travel to NYC 3-5 times a year and have friends in the neighborhood and are hoping that we will have the opportunity to stay again.

Our stay at Lisel's was great.  I needed to add a room at the last minute. She was so accommodating. My family really enjoyed her home. It is very different from what they're accustomed to. For me, I found there is so much information in the host and the home. If you're an avid reader, you will find much joy in the abundance of literature there. This is a great place for family and good friends to stay. I would definitely stay there again.
Another good note, Lisel is very passionate in her service to community both near and far. I enjoy people who are unselfish in their plight to serve those that are less fortunate.

Cozy and charming, the community be good guesthouse was everything we could have wanted in a home away from home for our 3 day stay.  Lisel and friends were incredibly accommodating, the place was clean and cheery and the neighborhood was fantastic.
We had a wonderful stay in this cozy house. The neighborhood is great with easy access to multiple subway lines. And the host was very friendly.

Great stay.  Nice laid back vibe for a shared house.  No issues to report.  Would stay there again. 
cheers
jc
Our stay at lisel home was very cool : the people, the place very close to subway station and a good area, especially the bogota cafe! We come bAck in one week !!! Thanks lisel
Great place, loved it!
A lovely place to stay in a wonderful neighborhood - would highly recommend!

First: it is a very nice house with a wonderful garden and a nice neighbourhood! There are two subway stations nearby and in the 5th Street round the corner are many nice bars, cafes, restaurants and shops.
The people living at the guest house are very open and friendly.

There were two things they were not convenient. From our room (we had room #2) was only a thin wall with a window to the neighbour room. When our neighbour came late at night we heard him and our room was light as at daytime ... 
There are also only three bathrooms for all the guest rooms an the people living there. This is may be a little too less.
We stayed two nights at the cbg guesthouse, everything was perfect, we will definetly stay there the next time we visit New York.
Such a warm, wonderful place to stay, in a fabulous location! We all ate well, slept well, and made some new friends! I'll definitely stay again.

Aside from being a cozy, comfortable accommodation, located in a wonderful and lively neighborhood, Cbg Guest House provided myself, my husband and our two teenagers with a great place to meet up with other like minded folks. We came to the area to investigate possible universities for the young men.  Lisel was a wonderful resource.  She not only shared her knowledge of the area, but she also shared her life experiences and even a book!!! When leaving, we felt as if we'd found a home away from home. It also felt good to know that some of the money paid went to help re-build Haiti. So much better that a corporate hotel!!!!!!
Starting to feel like a home away from home at Lisel's - thank you so much for having us again!

I came with a Mother/Daughter group of 5 moms and 5 teenage daughters.  It was a great place for us to stay- relaxed and homey.  We really appreciated  cooking our meals in the kitchen and gathering to chat in the dining room.  The location of comtybegood is fantastic.  It's only a few blocks to the subway and only a block or two to shopping and restaurants.  Lisel was very welcoming and friendly.  We would love to come back and stay here in the future.
Excellent place, friendly hosts and nice house with great location!

We had a wonderful stay at Community Be Good.  Our room was large, clean and comfortable and the neighborhood was quiet and pleasant. There was a large variety of restaurants within easy walking distance. We also walked to the beautiful Prospect Park (the Brooklyn Botanic Garden was wonderful!) and over to the Brooklyn Academy of Music for a film.  It was easy to access the subway to Manhattan, too.  Though we go to NYC fairly often, it was our first stay over in Park Slope and we plan to do it again!

Lisel was a very friendly Host. We loved the neighborhood and all the very good inexpensive restaurants very close to the house. We were two families with 7 children and everyone felt like he was at home !

My friends and I thoroughly enjoyed staying at CBG guest house. It was cozy and located only 5 minutes away from the Barclay's center. We were there for only one night but had a great sleep. I would definitely recommend staying here!

Great place. Calm and nice. Location is convenient. Lisel is easy to talk to and communicates well.

 I'll stay there again when in NYC.

Just spent 5 days @ CBG in Brooklyn with family & friends (we were 8 in total).  CBG is a super place in a great location.

Lisel was a super host and setup comfortable rooms for all of us. The accommodations were great.  CBG is a charming house & a readers paradise - I have never seen that many books in 1 house.

We also loved the neighborhood; many coffee shops & restaurants and only a short walk to the metro to Manhatten.  We even walked across the Brooklyn bridge into Manhatten.  

I recommend CBG without reservation !
Lisel is a friendly person, her house has big rooms with a lovely garden. It is close to the metro. A great coffee shop is just around the corner with fresh brioches and muffins. Thanks Lisl.
Lisel was a wonderful hostess. Our room was just as described, with all the amenities described, and in a perfect location for our needs. Would definitely return, thank you!

We were happy to have a place to stay in the brownstone house with the great location - coffee shop a few steps away - close proximity to the subway lines - and revitalized, hip neighborhood. The house is architecturally interesting with lots of ornamental detail in the house and well-proportioned rooms with high ceilings.

Our host Dupree was very friendly and accommodating. We are a family of five, man and wife with 3 children and were offered 2 rooms for our stay with access to a large kitchen, bathroom, and garden terrace out back.

I and my friend stayed at her house for 7 days. We enjoyed very much!  Lisel is very nice, kind and reliable person.
The room was so quiet that we could sleep well. We could get access to a big subway station to go to Manhattan so easily.
A couple of bathrooms are equipped and it was so convenient.
Thank you!
Enjoyed the stay.  Took a while to get used to the routine because we had never stayed in this kind of accommodations before.  Overall, it was a good experience.

Une maison dans Brooklyn, bien située, très agréable et propre, joliment aménagée et décorée. Le jardin aux beaux jours est parfait pour un petit déjeuner au soleil. Hôtes accueillants, et riches d'échange et de partage ! Je conseille à tous !
Je suis venue avec une amie et mon fils de 2 ans.

For our group of four adult couples, this accomodation was a good choice. We enjoyed both the noise and excitement of the big City and Park Slope with all its quirky little shops and restaurants. The weather was great, and we were lucky to stay at Liesl's and have access to her garden.
The beds were comfortable and the living was easy at Liesl's place. We are in awe of her ardent work for humanitarian causes, and the fact that one contributes to her projects by choosing her guesthouse makes the stay all the more pleasant.

Lisel is an excelent host, we had a great time, the house is realle close from the metro station which makes it easy to move in new york so we got to konw it pretty good. 

There were 10 of us in the house and didnt have a problem to sleep or anything.

Thank you so much Lisel for everything, whenever we go back to new york we will be there.
Nous avons passé un bon séjour chez Lisa très convivial, Pour une famille nombreuse le tarif est imbattable. La situation est facile proche du subway.
We really enjoyed our stay here. Lisel was an excellent hostess.

We really enjoyed our stay at Community be good. Lisel is a great host, friendly and knowledgeable. The location is very convenient with several train stations close by (5min walk) and the neighborhood is great, charming streets, very safe and with a lot of good restaurants and coffee places to go to. We were a large group of 10 adults and kids and the house was very convenient with plenty of rooms and bathrooms.

Mi estancia en la comunidad de Lisel fue esplendida.Ella es una gran anfitriona, siempre esta dispuesta a yudar en todo. La comunidad esta muy bien situada, cerca de una estacion de trenes que te llevan directamente a Manhattan. Me senti como en una gran familia y si alguna vez volvemos a Nueva York sin duda alguna volveremos a repetir  con ella.

My family and I had a very pleasant stay. The room was really comfortable, and everyone in the house was kind and welcoming !

The neigborhood is very calm and relaxing, and the location is great : The subway is just around the corner, there is also a great coffee shop down the street and a good mexican restaurant nearby !

We were as if we were at home in Lisel's house... Feeling so good!!
The area is also very welcoming: quiet and safe streets with beautiful trees, some pubs and the supermarket 1 minute walk from Lisel's house.
We are in Brooklyn real life! 
Lisel's house is also very closed to Atlantic avenue subway station where most of Brooklyn trains stop. It's very convenient to go anywhere. 
This is also very closed to Barclay's center hosting Brooklyn Nets NBA games (great in case you are fond of Basket-ball).
Well, we will be very happy to visit Lisel back when our boys will be old enough to  visit such an amazing city.
Thanks a lot for this wonderful week in NYC!
Friendly, fun and great location. Kids had a good time too.

Lisel was absolutely wonderful. I contacted her with a very last minute request and she was nothing more than extremely helpful. We were lucky to find such a great host and the rest of the people staying at the place were great as well. The neighborhood is really nice, there are tons of restaurants and bars around.

I'll definitely keep this place in mind for future visits!

The neighborhood was very pleasant, easy to access cafes,  bars and various shops and stores on foot, plus there's a little mall and a few subway stations nearby. The area is also very green and quiet. 
The host was nice and accommodating. The apartment will be awesome for voracious readers, basically every wall is full of books. The facilities are all in working order. The place was clean though a little cluttered, which I personally like. One negative point or maybe a tip for future travelers - if you're a tall person, and you're sleeping in the extra bed / cot, ask the host about its exact dimensions and decide accordingly - my body adopted by the second night ;) Because the place is big, you can usually expect a few travelers, so that gives you a sort of privacy through numbers, which is also something a lot of people would like. If you want to socialize with the host or boarders, there are common areas with usually some interesting people to talk to.
Lisel was very welcoming and flexible in accommodating our large party (10).

I visited with my husband and teenage daughter.  We really enjoyed our stay here.   We were comfortable in the bedrooms and enjoyed the pretty colors, art, and books around the house.  We relaxed on the patio, and met other guests.   It was nice talking with the host, who does interesting things with her life.   Thanks for a nice haven in busy New York.
Lovely room in a beautifully decorated home, large enough for our group of three.  A pleasant location with shops and restaurants nearby. Would be pleased to come back.

Staying with Lisel was great.
The house is really cool and the room is super convenient and private because it is right as you enter the front hallway.
We had 2 big comfortable beds.
There are all kinds of extra amenities in the kitchen - and a relaxing back porch.
It has a great location - 2 minutes from Gorilla Coffee and a 5 min. walk from the Barkley Center and the Metro!
I miss it already!

Do you remember those days when you were backpacking through Asia/Europe/South America etc and you stayed at a really cool hostel? This is what Lisel's place remember me off . Everyone was lovely. There are a lot of shared facilities (bathroom, kitchen etc) and you can come and go as you please.

Lisel was really hospitable! We checked in a little late but she settled us down really quickly and showed us around her place :) the room looks exactly like the ones in the picture. The common kitchen is free for all to use!
Very nice neighbourhood, nice guesthouse with a great host and super nice people staying! Great kitchen open for guests and supporting the community cause is a very good idea! Thank you for the stay!

Lisel made us feel like home. She was very flexible with our schedule and very helpful. We had a room with two beds and we shared kitchen and bathroom. Bathroom was super clean and the kitchen had everything we needed for cooking. The backyard was great. The room was not exactly as in the pictures regarding furniture and the wall needs painting, everything looks much more worn and old. Anyway, it is in a nice neighborhood, with lots of restaurants and very close to multiple subway stations.

If you like Brooklyn, if you like Haiti, if you care, if you like sharing, talking, connecting, cooking, chilling, please join this house in this great neighbourhood. Enjoy the sun in the backyard, have a chat with the activist-host on new forms of social economy, or on how to save the world vol.3, and then go sip some hip coffee on the swedish espresso bar nextdoor.

Nous étions 7, en famille et avons tous été enchantes de notre sejour chez Lisel.
Les chambres étaient propres et spacieuses. Nous avions quasiment la maison pour nous tout seuls car Lisel est très discrète. Quand elle était la, c'était un plaisir de discuter et d'échanger avec elle.
Le quartier autour de la maison est plein de magasins et de restaurants, très agréable et sécuritaire et il est possible de se rendre à peu près partout dans Manhattan sans changer de ligne de metro et de manière très rapide.
Un endroit idéal que nous recommandons à tous.

Lisel is a woman with a heart of Gold, she's generous, understanding and very compassionate about her cause. The house is so cosy, clean, efficient and in a lovely neighborhood, although I stayed there for only one night, but I absolutely loved it. The room that I shared with two other friends had TV, clean sheets and towels. Lisel showed us around, introduced us to other airbnb guests and welcomed us into her house with open arms. I would absolutely stay there again.
Location is great! The place was cozy , there's a cute little garden in the back. Lisel was such a great host, easy to contact and kind.

Wonderful place wonderful host, very child friendly, traditional Brooklyn. Really convenient, 3 different subway stations a close walk. Surrounded by yummy cafes and restaurants. I would happily recommend this place to anyone looking for an authentic New York experience. Lisel the host is the star of the show, friendly and fascinating. We'll be back!
The brownstone is located on a great street in a wonderful location in Park Slope.  The house has a big communal kitchen and space and everyone was very friendly.

we had a lovely stay at this house. the location was perfect for our needs. the neighborhood had so many things to offer in the way of food, drink, and eye candy. we very much appreciated the relaxed but clean atmosphere of the house - the eclectic decor, the comfy covered back patio, the ease of going and coming. 

i only have a couple of complaints. the room we ended up staying in is not in any of the pictures on the listing and was much more cramped, less brightly-lit, and with smaller beds than what is advertised. also, it was not completely clear from the description that all of the facilities are communal. from the images and the write up, we thought we'd have our own kitchen and bathroom. that being said, we did not mind the communal atmosphere at all! we just had a different expectation. i will say, however, that we were the only people staying in the house at the time (other than the few who live there, who were more than lovely but we only barely ran into). if the house were full of guests, the communal bathroom situation could have been a bit trickier.
Very friendly and welcoming environment. Both the bedroom and bathroom are clean, modern, comfortable and provided a very smooth and relaxing stay.
It felt like being home. Very easy and fast communication. Lisel is a very helpful person. House and Bathrooms were very clean. Looking forward to stay there next time as well.

Staying in Lisels house made our stay very relaxed. I traveled with my son of 11 and husband and after a long day of sightseeing on Manhattan going back to Brooklyn is just so relaxing. We stayed for 5 nights. 
Cozy small places to eat on 5th and a Gorilla coffeeshop just round the corner and supermarket Keyfood 100 meters away.
Very easy with subway and bus 63 to the new Brooklyn Height Promenade.
Lisel was very hospitable and kind. Easy to communicate with leading up to the stay and was great throughout. We'd highly recommend!

Lisel went above and beyond to accommodate our group of 8. She was quick to reply to my questions and she did what she could to make our stay as great as possible. There were quite a few rules but they weren't a hassle, and everything was pretty well labeled to make them easier to follow.
Sono stata benissimo. Ho trovato un ambiente accogliente e solare. La convivenza con gli altri ospiti è stata simpatica. I collegamenti della metro strategici.
Lisel was great!  We felt very welcome and were made to feel at home!  I was nice to talk to the other people staying at the house.  We has a great time!
Good location. Gracious and personable host.   Kitchen and bathroom in lower level are shared.

Lisel is not just a wonderful host, but a wonderful human being.  It's been a privilege getting to know her and stay with her for a few days.  I would recommend her place to everyone.  Thank you Lisel!!!
Perfect Public Transportation Location

We stayed a Lisel's a couple of night around New Year's Eve. Her mansion is located in a very cool and convenient Brooklyn area.
The house is big and has all the amenities you can imagine, but what stands out are Lisel's manners and hospitality, and the work she's doing. Keep up! There again any time.
I'm sure you will love this house and the area is wonderful
Lisel is a great host and very helpful. Her house is great location in Brooklyn, very convenient. We had good stay and would like to come back.
Nice room and nice people!
Lisel is a wonderful host. The house is really nice. Located in a nice and safe neighborhood. I would recommend the place to my friends.
Lisel's home is in a great neighborhood and very convenient to restaurants, shops, and the subway. Our room was very clean and Lisel is kind and helpful. We would happily stay there again.

My best air b and b experience thus far. The location is in a great neighborhood of Brooklyn and it is conveniently located to the subway, food, entertainment venues, and many other businesses. Lisel was a great host and a very inspiring person. I really appreciated her kind and thoughtful demeanor and someone who I enjoyed speaking to. Definitely will stay with her again if I need to go back to Brooklyn :).

Lisel's place was very nice and comfortable, and we loved the neighborhood too. Prospect park and plenty of great restaurants are nearby, along with subway stops also. Lisel was so kind, and we greatly enjoyed chatting with her. Highly recommend staying here!

Our group of 4 had a pleasant stay with Lisel! After confirming our booking, Lisel always ensured that she responded promptly to any questions we had. She awaited our arrival and provided a tour of the home upon check-in (don’t forget your $25 key deposit which is returned upon check-out). There is plenty of space in the backyard to relax and hammock when the weather is nice. You have access to the kitchen, fridge, coffee. Nearby are local small shops, grocery and access to subways stops (< 10min walk). This is a communal home with relaxed vibes. Cute stay, thank you!

Lisel is a super host. The house is amazing and the room is quiet and big! Located in a beautiful neighbourhood, Lisel has wonderful recommendation to visit it. Superbe maison dans Brooklyn et un superbe projet. Une AirBnb comme on aime.
The host canceled this reservation 10 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
A wonderful place. Quiet and peaceful.

The location was only a few blocks from Barclay's and the subway. It was the perfect location for us. Everyone staying there was so nice and helpful. Lisel was also nice enough to let us check in a little earlier than expected due to our flight arriving early. That helped us out a LOT.  This was my first Air bnb experience and trip to New York. Thanks again for everything! It all turned out cool.
Community setting, great location, super nice people and very safe.

Very eclectic place to stay. We didn't have much to do with Lisel, but met Cecilio (?) and a very pleasant young Tanzanian lady who were both very helpful. The room was generously sized. TV was fickle (but you're not in NY to watch the telly). The bed was very firm. Bathroom facilities were good. It was pretty much as explained in the ad. Very close to restaurants and the Barclays Centre and also a hub for transport.
Bra läge med bra pris. Väldigt trevlig värdinna, både pratig och hjälpsam.

Lisel‘s place was just perfect for a weekend in Brooklyn with good old friends. Perfectly located and well connected, her place was great to spend the day walking and photographing and going out at night. We were welcomed and supported throughout the weekend and could probably even have gotten more out of the place and community had we not been out most of the time. We definitely recommend Lisel’s place to other travelers.

Lisel is really nice and the location is great! The rooms, kitchen and the bathrooms were clean and also great. 
And when you‘re locked out, she will safe you :D! I would come back next time!

Staying with Lisel was great! Great place with a friendly vibe. She was very accommodating and flexible as we had to book on short notice. The other renters/ airbnbers I met during my stay were all super friendly as well, they were generous in offering info on the area, cooking supplies or just a nice conversation. Would definitely recommend!
Lisel is a great host. Great location. Would love to visit again!
The location is perfect- close to shops, restaurants and the subway (Barclay/Atlantic avenue) for access throughout the city.

One of my best AirBnB experience! The house is really beautiful and well-decorated, giving a nice and cozy feeling. The kitchen is huge and there are plenty of stuffs Liesel let me use during my stay. You definitely need to check out the backyard! 

Also, you'll also help the Haitian community by just staying there. I seriously want to live there forever or make my future home look like this :)
Lisel's place is good. I receive quick responses for all my

Le logement est très bien placé, dans un quartier de Brooklyn très agréable et vivant, logement typique (style brownstone) calme pour dormir, avec un jardin à l'arrière et une cuisine bien équipée, 
Lisel est très accueillante et vous renseignera très facilement sur le quartier et plus globalement sur le pays.
De plus, En logeant chez Lisel, vous participez à un soutien à Haïti 🇭🇹, une bonne action !

The house  is very well placed, in a district of typical very pleasant, alive and housing Brooklyn (style brownstone) calm down to sleep, with a garden in the back and a well equipped cooking(kitchen), Lisel is very welcoming and will inform you very easily about the district and more globally about the country.
 Furthermore, by living at Lisel, you participate in a support for Haiti,  a good deed!
Lisel is amazing! She has such a spirit for helping others
It is very close to the Subways. There is a shopping mall walking distance. The local dining was great. Prospect park was walkable.
Séjour très agréable chez Lisel avec qui nous avons eu des discussions très enrichissantes. Quartier formidable, plusieurs lignes de  metro tres proches.
we had a great time staying here for the hillsong conference. it was right next to the barclay center which was great.
Very nice place!
The location is perfect and the space is beautiful and homey. We slept really well and felt comfortable and safe. I would recommend the place to anybody.

The Cbg Guest House is a treat. Hosted by the remarkable and welcoming Lisel, it's located in Park Slope close to Gorilla Coffee, plenty of good restaurants and easy subway access. This friendly rambling place is a gem.  

Peter H.
I was made very welcome. The room was comfortable and the house clean. A great stay. Thank you.

Staying at CbG has been a wonderful experience for me! Lisel Burns is an excellent host, the place is convenient and comfortable, the other guests are friendly and interesting. I feel lucky to have made such a great choice! Thanks! Estelle

Lisel organised for us to stay with Fiona and Daniel in Marlborough Road. While this was a little further away (20-30min subway to Manhattan) we could not have been happier with our stay. They have a lovely old house an easy (5min) walk to the subway (Q and B lines). The family were welcoming and wonderful hosts, often offering us advise on sights to see, local places to eat and how to travel about town. The bedroom we stayed in was large and clean with a comfortable double bed and an ensuite with a shower over a large tub.  We could not recommend this lovely family more highly.

I found the overall vibe of the guesthouse to be warm, welcoming and worldly - an ideal combination for a visit to the Big Apple. Park Slope is one of my favorite neighborhoods in Brooklyn and the Cbg guesthouse is in a great spot with so many great restaurants close by. The 2, 3, B and Q are all within a 6 or 7 min walk, so Manhattan is just a few stops away.

Lisel provides a great guesthouse with a great cause; I wholeheartedly recommend staying here. Bathrooms are shared, but kept so clean you feel like it's your own, and the kitchen is great for cooking or storing leftovers. 

Needless to say, I'm a fan and would stay here again in a new York minute.
Great location! Accommodations are casual.

I was in town to complete an orientation with Doctors Without Borders, so what better a place to stay than with Lisel, community organizer and friend of Haiti?
She has made her home into a welcoming place for true travelers and humanitarians. The bed was clean and comfy, the kitchen warm and welcoming and the garden truly a treat after a long day indoors in Manhattan! And not to mention tres pratique! Near great coffee and every train station you will ever need.
And it's so nice to know a portion of the fee goes to Haiti. I will stay there again and again...hope there's room, Lisel!

Lisel Burns offers a safe and very friendly sanctuary in a delightful part of Park Slope.  No fuss, no stress!  It felt good to contribute in some small way to her community-building vision.  Thanks, Lisel.

Enjoyed my time in this brownstone at Park Slope in Brooklyn. Lisel, the host, although busy with her community work suggested various things  for me to do which I didn't have the time to take up, unfortunately.  It was good to be able to sit in the sunny backyard and watch the squirrels and see a different part of NY - as well as meet some locals and other guests. Really easy access to the Atlantic St \Barclay Centre subway and you can get anywhere fast.

Lisel was gracious enough to accommodate my friend and I even on a very short notice (we were attending a show in Manhattan coming from upstate). The room itself was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. The house itself was also eclectic and I couldn't help but gaze at the various books and cultural artifacts that rested quietly on the shelves. Overall a good experience. Thanks Lisel!
Lisel is great and so interesting to talk to. Great location, clean and friendly.
The stay was great. SO happy to have found such a host in the same neighborhood of the venue the band was performing. Lisel was a great and welcoming host.

Lisel and Betsy were very accomodating! Betsy was at work when we arrived, but she left us a key so we could get in to the house before heading to Manhattan. Both the house and room were very nice. The location is very conveniently located -- close to at least two different subway stations. We only spent one night, but when asked to leave our luggage at the house on the second day so we wouldn't have to carry it around New York, they let us do so. The only thing that caught us off guard was that we had to move from Betsy's house to Lisel's (only a short walk down the street) at 11am after our night, and we were still asleep because of the late New Year's celebrations. It wasn't that big a deal; it just surprised us.
Great location, comfortable room and Lisel was a gracious host. We look forward to returning!

Such a charming place, full of life. The neighboorhood is very safe and there are plenty of things to do. Eventhough we just see here a few times, the host was really kind! Thanks for everything! We'll go back soon! :)

Great communication. We love that we could easily change to different room #5. Lot of space , Nice light from Windows, quiet street soft bed, nice garden we could use.
Conveniënt to Subway and lovely neighbourhood. Friendly and helpful hosts

The house was great as of the house keeper! A big Brownstone house, exactly what we were looking for staying in Brooklyn, we really felt like home! Private room with comfortable beds. Close to Manhattan through subway, Prospect Park in walking distance, very nice neighborhood with some restaurants and bars if you wanna hang out. Take the time to have little talk to Lisel, she's an adorable person. I would definitely recommand it :)
Lisel was very friendly and welcoming, the  room nice (the bathroom very small on the first floor, but fortunately I'm short), good and very well connected area!

Lisel's place is a wonderful place to stay in Brooklyn! Great location in Park Slope with easy access to the subway.  Lisel was available to help with anything we may have needed during our trip. The rooms and bathrooms are comfortable, and the house is located in a quiet area. Wonderful garden! Perfect to enjoy some time outdoors or a morning cup of coffee. Will definitely be back!

great neighborhood.  walking distance to anything.

lisel is a warm and affable host.

This rental is in a great location, very close to the center of the city. Though convenient, it still feels like a home. 

Lisel is very welcoming, providing a friendly and unique stay in New York City. If ever we had a problem or needed help, we could always find a solution with her. The environment is vibrant yet relaxed. With great company, the house makes its visitors feel like part of a community. You'll always feel safe and comfortable at Communitybegood, and have an amazing base for your trip to New York.
Lisel's guest house has provided a friendly and convenient experience. Thanks!
Really nice place with a positive atmosphere.

Lisel was a great host and very accommodating(especially given our late arrival). She was also very responsive and answered all of our questions thoroughly.  

The room was exactly as advertised and is in a great location.  

Overall; a great stay and highly recommended.
The place is is prime Brooklyn location with a lot of amenities around. The host is very culturally aware and she has great values.
I had a great experience there! They are really nice. Highly recommend!
Great location. Great hostess!
Great place to stay, very accommodating and for a good cause

Our family of 5 (three nine year old children plus mum and dad) from the UK stayed at Ctybegood for a week over New Year.  We had a great time and feel very fortunate to have found such a lovely place.  The Citybegood house is an original brownstone with a bohemian vibe. Lisel et al are great people, with inspiring community values who really welcomed us and were always attentive and interested in our needs while respecting our space.
The Slope area in Brooklyn is a fantastic, thriving and buzzy place. There’s a great place for coffee as well as restaurants, and a large grocery store just at the bottom of the road, literally seconds away. 
The Subway is less than 5 minutes away and it only takes 10 minutes to Manhattan. 
We all had a great time with music and dance at Brooklyn museum, which has a free open evening the first Saturday of the month. If you’re more interested in community values rather than posh hotels then this is for you.
Great location in the heart of Park Slope !  Very easy to check in and check out.  We would stay here again.

I felt at home. The rooms are comfortable and Lisel extremely welcoming. The area is beautiful, surrounded by nice restaurants, coffee places, and very close to all subways that can take you into the city in a matter of minutes. Lisel is very involved in social movements, which is inspiring and makes your stay with her so much more meaningful.

Lisel is very accommodating and very prompt to answer any questions - fast response to my emails. The brownstone is in a beautiful area of Park Slope with easy access to subways and shops.  We came and went with ease.  Thank you, Lisel!

Absolutely wonderful! It was such a joy to spend the weekend here.  It's a unique and comfy space, a large rambling house with an enormous back yard, but Lisel's hospitality is what makes this so special. I don't think I've ever felt so at home while traveling.

My husband and I had a very nice stay at Lisel's Cbg Guest House.  Our taxi cab was just taking off when I heard somebody saying, "Bienvenidos!"  Lisel was waiting for us at the doorsteps, which made me feel at home immediately.  Cbg #2 room was clean and comfy and eclectically decorated.  She placed an additional sofa for our visitor daughters and asked me to choose a throw from her Guatemalan blankets.  We could use the kitchen freely and visitors are welcomed.  If you like to do yoga, there is a by donation place 2.5 blocks from the Guest House, and lots of places to eat or to have a cup of coffee. I heard from a couple of people that the best coffee in the neighborhood happens to be a few steps from Cbg. She is surrounded by nice & helpful people (Seija, Tasha, Cecilio, Martha, & Cheryl) We would go back to this place without hesitation.  Lisel: You were gone when we left, but thank you much  for your hospitality!  Jesus & Rosalba

CBg Guest House was a great find. Lisel's terrific: kind, welcoming, curious about her guests but not intrusive, and ready with good advice about where to get good local coffee etc. She and the house are both very hospitable. The home and garden are relaxed, lived-in-but-clean, comfortable spaces. It's not for someone looking for a hotel-ish experience; more like staying with a really lovely friend-of-a-friend. Transportation to Manhattan is also a breeze, with a number of subway lines an easy walk away. I'll stay here again!

I stayed in the front room on the middle floor @ CBG. Slept like a baby in the most comfortable bed ever. The room was comfy & warm. The other room on that floor doesn't have a window, which would be a drag. Didn't see the downstairs rooms, but the German couple who was staying there seemed happy. The bathroom on the 2nd floor is tiny & the shower is in the living room (very odd), but the other bathroom on the 1st floor is lovely and big (with an accessible shower if you need it). Nice big kitchen if you want to cook for yourself or hang out with the other guests. The location was absolutely perfect for me - I don't really know anything about NYC and was a little nervous about walking around alone at night in Brooklyn. Park Slope is sort of upper middle class hipster chic - lots of indie bakeries, coffee shops & boutiques. Strollers everywhere. You're in between 3 or 4 subway stations & a short walk from the LIRR from JFK. Couldn't be more convenient. There's a grocery store across the street & a Target a couple of blocks away if you forgot anything. Lisel is super nice, though we only met once. Only thing odd is that it's kind of like staying in your aunt's spare room, but you have to pay her $130 - that's what AirBNB is for, though. For me it was definitely worth it as a single woman who wanted safety & convenience. If you're more familiar with Brooklyn or traveling in a group you could probably stay in a dodgier neighborhood cheaper. Still cheaper than any hotel you'll ever find. Highly recommended. Thanks, Lisel!

Cbg Guest House is very warm, serene abode. Its location is ideal: it gives one immediate access to 5th Avenue's section Union-Street-to-15th-Street-and-above area. At the same time, it gives one access to the Vanderbilt, Atlantic, etc., Avenues' universe. Even more important, it is just a couple blocks from Prospect Park. What's not to like. Quality eating places and specialty-coffee store abound. So do the subway stops. Lisel is an extraordinarily welcoming, laid-back yet thorough, alert landlady. Every single aspect of my experience has been perfect. Highly recommended.

CBG was a lovely place to stay - as others have said, it's a home away from home. I recently travelled alone from Australia to NY and of the three places I stayed during my trip this was definitely the best. Lisel allowed me to book a room at CBG on short notice and was very welcoming. I didn't see much of her as I was not there for long and she had her own business to attend to, however, from the conversations we had, I found her to be an interesting and friendly person. The house itself is really cute and full of colourful, hippy charm. There is a gorgeous garden out back, big kitchen, great shower, comfortable rooms, lots of paintings, mosaics and books. I stayed in the front room (downstairs) and although I was only there one night it was the little sanctuary I needed after such a long and stressful trip getting to NY. I was able to come and go as I pleased without infringing upon anyone (I spent the night out with friends and returned quietly and easily at 4am through the lower level entrance right next to my room). Lisel allowed me to stay late into the following afternoon so I could wait for a friend to come meet me. The bed was comfortable and Lisel provided both towels and toiletries. The area itself, Park Slope, is a beautiful part of Brooklyn - I wish I could've stayed longer to explore it more. For anyone who is unsure of where to stay in Brooklyn due to safety or cost, this place is definitely value for money and it is located in one of the nicest and safest areas of Brooklyn. The subway station is 2 mins up the road. I went walking here alone both during the day and night (4am from main st back to CBG) and found it to be a very quiet, safe and interesting area. There are plenty of shops, places to eat, friendly people, beautiful Brownstones, trees and birds. All in all a great place to stay, I highly recommend CBG and I will hopefully be back next time I come to NY.

A great homely address ! We were a real tribe, coming from France with four adults et five children, and everybody found his place in this great and friendly house. 
Lisel is a very kind host, ready to give you some advice for your visit. And the location in Brooklyn, with the wild little garden, is perfect to rest after long walks in Manhattan. 
We hope to come again. Cecile & co.

The CBG is a very homely, clean and comfortable place that is located not too far from Manhattan (took us about 20 minutes to get where we needed to be when we stayed there). Lisel was kind enough to help us when we needed a place to stay. Unfortunately Lisel was away, so we met by Roman who was friendly and very accommodating.

The big disappointment (aside from not being able to stay longer) was not getting a chance to meet Lisel as she has quite an eclectic library.
Really enjoyed the stay. Great location, kind hospitality. Thanks!
Great location to everything I needed to get to. My stay was nice.
A nice, homey, and affordable place to stay in NY!

Really great location close to great places to eat of all variety and loads of shops including a supermarket.
Has everything you'll need and not just the owner is there to help you out, but her help too.

This is a great place to stay, very big, quiet and friendly. The area is great with many shops and restaurants and 2 subway stations very close. Lisel wa very kind and helpful, I've already recommended the place to everyone I know!

We were lucky to find a place to stay so close to our daughter in Brooklyn.  It was really fun to actually see the inside of a brownstone!  We don't have such things in Texas.  Our bed was comfortable and the water was hot in the shower.  What more could we ask for?

Had a very nice stay at the Cbg Guest House.  It is very comfortable and so conveniently located.  Accomodated my family of 4 perfectly for a one-night trip to Brooklyn.  Hope to stay their again soon.

Our host was extremely nice and the location could not have been better, just off of 5th Avenue in Park Slope and within easy access of the 1/9 
trains and easy walking distance of the Atlantic/Pacific hub. And 5th Avenue is the place to be in Park Slope with all the best restaurants and nightlife. The Key Food just down the street is a great resource that you can use if planning to cook in the well-stocked kitchen. We were in town 
for a wedding and my mother-in-law had some issues with the place she had been supposed to stay, and Lisel was extremely helpful in our efforts to find a place for my mother-in-law (the mother of the bride, in fact)--and in the end, my mother-in-law stayed here, too. CBG is a little unconventional in their approach--as Lisel put it "we're a little quirky, but if you like quirky we a great place to stay." I like quirky and we had 
a great experience. On top of that, the CBG mission (helping those in need in Haiti) is admirable and I am glad that some of the money I paid is going to that cause. I would certainly stay here again.

Just the perfect place to experience Brooklyn (and I guess, if you can make the time, Manhattan ;) It's a cozy, charming and homey place to stay. Warm, considerate hosts. I highly recommend. I'm so glad I found them!
Extremely friendly, welcoming and accommodating.  Interesting folks and a great cause.  I'll definitely stay again.

We enjoyed our stay very much.  We were due in NYC in just a couple of days, and had experienced a cancellation from another host,  so we were very grateful for Cbg being available and helpful at the last minute. Lisel was very friendly and I greatly appreciate her involvement with helping the poor in Haiti.  Her fascinating and eclectic home was welcoming almost to a fault - I felt a bit like I was intruding in her personal space.  We were just there to sleep and bathe, so we didn't use the kitchen or backyard garden, but they were lovely as well.

Lisel is the most amazing hostess. She stocks her home with everything you could possibly need, and made my stay very easy and enjoyable. Park Slope is a lot of fun. There are more people smiling in Park Slope than there are people smiling in the whole of Manhattan. 
All the best
Steven
My parents seemed to like the space. There was an issue with the heat but it was resolved. I'd recommend the space.

This was the 2nd week that my parents stayed with cbg and, according to them, the stay this week was more exciting than the last and the room availability was astounding. Also, Lisel gave them the same discount to her price this week as the one last week and we're forever grateful to her for that. Her communication with me continues to be stellar. Lisel's a great host to my  parents.

My friend and I enjoyed a fabulous four nights at Community Be Good and felt right at home. Lisel is a warm and caring woman who is most welcoming. We were unprepared for the sudden heatwave, but the next day a window air-conditioner had been installed. We loved meeting the other guests, especially the families. Loved the garden and the hammocks. The neighbourhood is vibrant with so many excellent places to eat. It was an oasis to return home to after the mayhem of Manhattan. We enjoyed exploring Brooklyn. The Museum was wonderful as was our visit to the Wyckoff Farmhouse. Loved chatting with Lisel. I'll return again for sure! Thank-you for making us feel so at homel!

We enjoyed our visit here. We had a fairly large private room with a double bed,  an air conditioner, ceiling fan and couch. The room was clean and comfortable and it was only a couple blocks away from our daughter. The convenient location was the primary factor in making our determination to stay here, but the friendly atmosphere and comfortable room made it a very nice stay.

We stayed with Lisel for a little over a month while looking for a permanent place to live in Brooklyn. If you are staying more than a few nights, expect to become part of the household. The front room is large, and you will have your privacy whenever you wish. Lisel is a fascinating woman, and does some amazing charitable and community work both in NY and Haiti. If you desire, you'll have the chance for some interesting conversation or to read something from the formidable collection of books in the house.

CBG feels more like an eclectic share house than a guest house, which was great for us, but may not suit everyone. As part of a household, you might need to be flexible. Lisel asked me to move rooms for a few nights around July 4th so she could accommodate a family who had nowhere else to stay. Sure, that might be a tad inconvenient, but as I found out later, I was actually moving to Lisel's own room while she slept on a cot in the basement in order to accommodate everyone who needed a place to stay. If you think that was a pretty awesome thing for somebody to do, then this is the place for you. For people with the right mindset, CBG is highly recommended.

Lisel is an excellent host, and Community Be Good is a friendly, safe, clean place to stay. There's a community fridge and kitchen, as well as easy access to the subway. For the NYC area, the place is fairly quiet inside and out. This place is for open-hearted travelers .
The stay was great. SO happy to have found such a host in the same neighborhood of the venue the band was performing. Lisel was a great and welcoming host.

My wife and I stayed at Communitybegood for the month of May whilst we renovated our apartment. Lisel is a warm generous host. The house is relaxed and welcoming and very comfortable. It is in a great location close to the park and an easy commute to the city.
We had a great stay.
My husbsnd and I had a wonderful stay at Lisel's. Great atmosphere and fabulous location. Lots of common space to spread out and enjoy when not sight seeing.

The place was sooo nice! The nice brownstone with the nice colorful entry and stairs welcomes its guests from the very first moment. You feel that it's home and that a colorful, traveling, open and social person (Lisel) lives over there. You feel like part of the house and of the area when you stay there for some days. It's very centered and at the same time in one of the nices streets in Brooklyn, Park Slope. There are other nice houses around it and nice people on the street, and trees and it's nice and calm but not lonely as there are the people on the street who live there all some time. Just around the corner there is a great coffee (Gorilla Coffee) great small shops for food, fresh fruits, clothes, cute - cosy - lively - comfortable pubs, bars and cafes just 2 minutes away in 5th Street with great food, music etc. All what you need is there. You can reach the subway by foot in 5-10 minutes in all directions. In a few minutes you are directly in Manhattan or in some more minutes in other parts of New York or down at the beach. :-)
A great place to stay... the house itsself as well locationwise the surroundings. The room was cozy and the bed comfortable and colorful :-) Lisel was really nice to meet and talk too! We would really recommend her great house! Plus the social issue behind it, which every person automatically donates for through paying the room :-) Thank  you Lisel and New York for welcoming us and letting us have such a great time!
Felt instantly welcome and at-home here. Lovely location, wonderful owners, and a great feel overall!

Had a good few days here. After a dull few days in a chain hotel nearby, I was glad of the colour, character, perhaps a little chaos, of CommunityBeGood. Loses lovely and helpful. Location convenient for Park Slope, and close to metro into Manhattan.
The hostess greeted me at the front door at the time I said I would come and made me feel welcome.  The neighborhood was perfect and the artwork in her home lovely.

Highly recommended for anyone who is looking for a safe, clean and convenient place to stay in Brooklyn. The host is kind, considerate and generous. She is using her own house to do the Airbnb housing as a charitable fund-raising project for people in Haiti. In one word, if you want to have a wonderful stay and do some good deeds at the same time, just contact the host!!!

I had a wonderful experience at this B & B.  My room was very clean and comfortable.  I appreciated the shared facilities: large, comfortable kitchen, dining room and garden seating in the yard.  The shower was large and clean.  Host Lisel was conscientious, knowledgeable, hospitable, thorough and interesting.  Her recommendations for neighborhood restaurants were helpful and on track for my interests.  I enjoyed chatting with her about her involvements in community and social action.  
This was my first air bnb experience.  I usually stay in corporate hotels  when I travel for business, but this time I wanted to get a sense of the Brooklyn neighborhood - Mission accomplished.  The air bnb listing was accurate describing the facility and room.  Also, staying here, I was more able to connect with the community.  And it's true, and important, that part of the fee for your room goes as a contribution to a charity that supports redevelopment in Haiti.  
So an excellent experience overall.  I'll return to this place and am encouraged to try other air bnb listings.

this was my first Airbnb home stay, & initially I had some trepidation, until I spoke with Lisel on the phone..I was put @ ease, & from the moment of my arrival @ CommunityBeGood I felt @ home...Lisel welcomed me & familiarised me with the home...such a lovely home, I was blessed with the master bedroom; wonderful space & beautiful sense of cleanliness & Presence throughout the whole home, gorgeous community of guests--made new connections, home is conveniently located in what I consider to be one of the best areas of Brooklyn; great atmosphere & some of the best quality food in NYC...a home away from home for me, I had no desire to leave, & would love to return...a wonderful beginning to my Airbnb experience, thank you ever so much Lisel & guests...xOx

Lisel was very hospitable. On arriving we got a tour of the place and helped us get comfortable. She gave us the keys and also a general information about the area. There were plenty of sheets, towels and other things for immediate use. We also had some interaction with guests from different parts of the world visiting NY including activists and artists. The place was clean and very close to busy Ave., where we were able to find lots of restaurants and bars. The proximity to prospect park was a great plus too.

Lisel is a pretty nice host and the location is super good. It's near two metro stations with all the lines you need to get to any places in Manhattan. The 5th ave nearby has so many good restaurants. You don't have a private bathroom. The shared bathrooms are clean but shampoos and body washes are almost running out. The sofa bed is more comfortable than i thought, which is good. The real bed is small and can only fit one person.

I'm one that is easily satisfied as long as my accommodations are clean. Unfortunately, this was not the case here. I couldn't believe the condition of the bedding. I had to find clean bedding in the bathroom and change it myself.
Lisel is fantastic and went above and beyond to be an amazing host!

Lisel is an amazing person who has a global mindset! We loved staying at her place. Amazing neighbourhood and very comfortable place. Very clean and relaxed house. Lisel was so flexible with the details of our stay, such as check in and check out. Highly recommended!

Lisel is an awesome host. Her home is wonderful! We loved staying with her. The neighborhood is safe and family friendly. Lisel gives so much back to her community. It was a pleasure to meet and get to know her. She is a remarkable soul. This trip has been amazing and we look forward to the next time we can stay here. 
Thank you so much!!

Just as described, it was a cozy room in a fantastic location. Lisel and the other guests/habitants were all lovely, it was nice and quiet all the time. The location is great, lots of places to eat, hang out and explore nearby. We will be back again!

We have chosen Lisel's place for our short NYC Thanksgiving escape. Our main consideration was Park Slope, but the social impact story behind the place also sounded attractive. It all ended as ambient and atmospheric experience in a very special home where we finally spent around 2 hours just talking to the host and sharing a Thanksgiving dinner. What I did not expect of what looked like an informal guesthouse, was a feel of ultimate home-like comfort. We even had a bathrobe! Little elements of style, paintings, books, decorations, toys for our daughter... this is why we choose airbnb when we travel! And the charity thing behind it all just adds the flavor! We will be happy to come back.

We felt home the minute that we had stepped through the front gates! The Brownstone is in a great neighborhood! I felt as if she was "my favorite aunt" that I was coming to visit, as Lisel makes the space truly feel like home.....

 It is warm and filled with with bright colors, beautiful artwork and positive energy. Diversity, equality, and empowerment is supported!  She is an avid recycler as we are which is awesome to see! There were "guest" shelves with snacks/food items  that we could have.

There amazing bookshelves line the walls in many different spaces, and the multitude of spiritual, personal growth, self-help, daily-meditations etc.  
I am excited to book again, and plan on doing so soon! ☮️❤️😁
We had a good time: comfortable room, clean bathroom and kitchen, easy conversation with Lisel & other guests. A great option in the great neighborhood.

From the moment we stepped foot into this amazing brownstone, Lisel made us feel right at home. The room was large and super comfortable. The outside temps may have been freezing, but we were cozy and warm in our peaceful surroundings. Lisel’s home is quiet, yet it is vibrant and full of life. Lisel goes out of her way to make sure her guests are familiarized with the ins and outs of the house, and that they feel comfortable accessing all there is to offer. She is very knowledgeable about the neighborhood as well as local  sites and transportation options. This home is run from the heart, and you feel the love when you are there.

Lisel's place was great.  Rm 2 is a nice bedroom (1 bed and a pull-out coach).  We especially enjoyed the backyard space where you can sit-out and relax.  The location is also great - close to the metro and prospect park with a lot of great restaurants near by.
Thank you for being such a great host, Lisel!
Nice place!

Nice quiet place near the Barclay stadium
Walking distance to the stadium and good food. Right next to a metro station so it's in a prime location to travel anywhere.

Lisel is very warm and welcoming, and the location is great. Unfortunately I was not aware that this is a hostel with many guests, as opposed to a single family home with one or two rooms rented out. In light of that, it didn’t work for my needs, however Lisel very understanding and helpful in the cancellation process.

Lisel is an enthusiastic and helpfulness hostess who is also very passionate about her help with the Haiti fund. She gave us lots of information and printed our tickets for a festival! Would definitely stay again, the neighbourhood is great! Thanks 😊

Lisel and Rita are lovely hosts, it was great to meet and listen to them. The room is clean and comfortable. Location is good to live the heart of Brooklyn and is very close to a staple like prospect park and to everything you need, like restaurants or shops; furthermore, it is a few minutes walk to the subway. Thanks!

Stayed two weeks at Central Park North apt in the budget room. The apartment is really near Subway and buses. Central Park is 1 minute far!. STepahnie is very nice ans just want help you want you need. Very good price for New York and beautiful apartment. Highly recommended.See you for my next time in NYC!

Stephanie was a wonderful host. She was very knowledgeable about the city and offered great input while my wife and I were considering where to move in New York. The apartment was in a great location and the room was clean. It was very easy to find parking as well. We would recommend her accommodations to anyone.

Stephanie, Abdoulaye y el pequeño Princeton conforman una familia muy linda, multilingüe. Nos dieron consejos y recomendaciones apenas llegamos y nos trataron muy bien.
El barrio es muy recomendable, cerca de varias líneas de subte y de buses.

We really enjoyed our stay with Stephanie and her family. Nice room in a quiet neighbourhood in Harlem. Located only one block from Central Park and Subway station. 
Stephanie and her family was very friendly and helpful.  
/Gunilla

Stephanie was a very genuine lady who did her best to help as much as she could. She is a very busy person so it was sometimes a bit difficult to touch base with her.
Her maison d'art appartment was very quiet, private and well appointed with a classy private (Website hidden by Airbnb) is well located to the subway and a variety of good eateries.
She recommended the nearby jazz place and I was very glad she told me because I thought it was a terrific New york experience.

We, my son and me, had lovely days at the home of Stephanie, she and her husband where very helpfull and nice. we enjoyed of not beeing in a standard unpersonal hotel but in a private environment. Clean bathroom, room for two a bit small (it was a room with one big bed, but i asked for a additional bed), nice place. so near to he central park (jogging every morning). great area (near to appollo theater, subway etc) thanks Stephanie and family!

My friend and i  stayed with Stephanie for 4 days back in May. She was an excellent host and made us feel so welcome. The location was great and very close walking distance to the metro!! Would definitely stay there again if i went back to New York.

We loved staying with Stephanie, the only down point was that we had to walk up to the 4th floor with our suitcases because there's no lift in the building.

Greetings Joke and Piet

Stephanie and her family were very friendly and welcoming. We really enjoyed our stay here, plenty of privacy even though you are in someone's house, very clean and only about a 10-15 minute subway ride into times square.

Stephanie is a wonderful and friendly (Website hidden by Airbnb) and my wife stayed in her house and she gave us all support !She made us feel  like in our own (Website hidden by Airbnb) takes only 10 minutes to Times Square by subway and it is in front of Central Park.Stephanie's house is a  great and comfortable place to stay in New York.Go and be hosted by Stephanie ,Princeton and little Princeton,a Beatiful and lovely family!
Our stay at Stephanie´s was very nice. She was very nice to us and gave us advice on the city attractions, restaurants, markets and means of transportation. Thanks Stephanie! Cheers

The apartment is located in Harlem, conveniently one block from the 110th street [A, B, C] and Central Park North [2, 3] subway stations which take you to the more exciting neighborhoods such as Midtown and the Villages. As noted in the description, the apartment is located on the 4th floor and requires you to walk up very narrow flights of stairs. Hence, if you have lots of heavy luggage and/or are physically unable to walk up stairs, it may not be convenient. Note that the bathroom is shared with the guests in the other room. I did not have any difficulty with scheduling usage but if you like privacy, keep this in mind. Also, I noted a strange smell in the hallways of the apartment. If you are sensitive to these smells, you may need to hold your nose (as I had to do).

Although we were unable to meet Stephanie as she was away on business, her husband was very accomodating and helpful. The room and amenities were as described and we had a pleasant stay at their location. Thank you again! :)

Excellent location. The subway and bus were only a block from the apartment. We could get to Museum Mile in less than 20 minutes from the apartment. We arrived from Florida during a heatwave and the window air conditioner in the bedroom was a welcome relief. Sophie checked us in and made sure we were settled with maps and tour books. The apartment was clean, well kept and as advertised.

This was a great apartment, very clean and organized. It was very helpful that Sophie had a package ready for me with maps, recommended places and a guide with events happening in NYC. I would have been lost without those guides! Great hospitality. The apartment is located on the northern part of Manhattan which is more residential and less touristy, but very close to the subway station. Great hosts, thank you so much for everything!

Had a nice few days at Stephanie's place. Stephanie was not there, but a friend/partner of hers met me and set up my visit. She was helpful and friendly as was Stephanie's husband. Slight confusion about my check in day, but it worked out with little drama. Room wasn't decorated or anything, but clean with an a/c unit, desk and comfortable bed.  Shared clean bathroom with other travelers who were also friendly. I felt comfortable with everyone there. Wifi access worked well. Location convenient to subway systems and a few businesses one avenue over. Fourth floor walkup, which was not a problem for me, but others should take note. Again, I had a good experience here.
Sophie and Stephanie's husband were very hospitable. The location is good, very close to transportation. It just wasn't that clean, I found some bugs in the kitchen drawer. Other than that it was ok.

Excellent value for money, a very clean tidy apartment. and plenty of clean linen.  Using the kitchen and late checkout a real bonus. Stephanie was away but Sophie was friendly and helpful, Sharing a bathroom could be a problem with inconsiderate other guests.  Close to Subway stations

Stephanie was not in town while I was there, but her husband was present and he was very nice and helpful. Stephanie's friend, Sophie, met us, gave us the keys and a tour of the apartment. She also provided maps, an events brochure and local restaurant ideas. The whole house was clean. My friend and I needed to leave our bags at the apartment after we checked out and they were very accommodating. It was a wonderful experience.

Stephanie and husband were very friendly and gave lots of helpful info about the area when we got there. The room and apt were clean and pleasant. They were available to chat, yet were not intrusive at all. Quiet apt overall. Fellow guest was polite and cooperative too, in regards to sharing the bathroom.

Stephanie is a wonderful host, we were made to feel very welcome and comfortable for our stay in New York. Very convenient location near the subway and central park, close enough to get to Times Square in about 15 minutes but far enough out to escape the tourists when you've had enough. Stephanie has lots of knowledge about where to go and what to see in the local area, more than willing to share information but also gives you space and privacy. Would love to have had the time to explore more of Harlem itself.

Good location, good price and nice hosts. Thank you for your hospitality and help throughout the city. We enjoyed our stay! Tip: go to the baptist church on sunday, it's located near the apartment and is truly worth experiencing.
un accueil familial très touchant. A proximité des métro bus ... Calme de la chambre, propreté. Notre séjour chez Stéphanie a été extra

STephanie's cozy room was a major godsend for my girlfriend and i . We braved the highways and drove up from D.C. to Harlem for a reading I was a part of at NYC. We knew the hotels were super pricey and we decided to try airbnb on a whim. Best decision ever. Stephanie's friend met us with the keys once we arrived and led us to our small bedroom. Although there were other guests there, we mostly saw Stephanie, her hubby Abulai, and their cute as a button son. Great location to the subway and it was nice to be able to walk less than a few feet and end up right at the top of Central Park.

We lucked out that Friday afternoon and found a great parking spot across the street and we left our car there the whole weekend with no problems or tickets.

We read in one persons description that there was a weird smell in the apartment. Not true. If anything, the stairwell of the building was where the weird smell was and the apartment smelled fine.  Over all a great time was had. We didn't really use the kitchen at all or the living room space because we were out in the city during the day, but overall we felt welcomed, safe, and secure.

Stephanie's family and apartment was great, we stayed for a week at her house and it was the best. NY offers a really tiring experience and you need to have a good night's sleep to keep up with its speed, and staying at Stephanie's really made that possible. One of the best things about it was the closeness to 2 subway stations, central park is just one block to the south. Great neighborhood, very calm. Also her family was the best, her husband was really nice to us and we loved her little boy. As an extra tip you should visit her art gallery, great exhibits of artists around the world.

Stephanie is a great host, she is friendly, welcoming and gave us all the information we needed to have a great time in New York city. Her place is in a great location with easy access to the subways and buses. We would defiantly stay here again and would recommend it to others if you are on a budget but want to stay close to the city in a clean and comfortable place.

Très bonne expérience avec Stéphanie et sa famille, accueillante et enthousiaste. L'hébergement est de qualité, et l'environnement agréâble à souhait.
Un plan de la ville, ainsi qu'une liste de toutes adresses utiles était prêts à notre arrivée.
Le lieu est très facile d'accès en métro, taxi et est à deux pas de Central Park Nord.
I.D.É.A.L
Allez-y sans hésiter, très bon rapport qualité/ prix sur l'offre!

Stephanie was a fantastic host and her apartment a wonderful place to rest and recoup after long days of sightseeing! The apartment is in a very handy location, next to a few subway stations and with all facilities within walking distance. We had a great few days in NYC and would recommend Stephanie's place to anyone who wants a cosy, lovely place to visit NYC from. Thank you!!
Great spot, very close to the subway. Apartment was very nice and Stephanie and her family were great!

We had wonderful time while we were staying at Stephanie's place. The place is very nice, clean and comfortable. The location is good, very close to the subway. I love her family! especially the little boy. strongly recommended! :)

Magnifique séjour de 3 semaines chez Stéphanie ! Le logement est extrêmement confortable, et très bien situé (10 minutes de Times Square avec la ligne 2 de métro/2 minutes à pieds du Nord de Central Park). De plus, la famille de Stéphanie est formidable : très accueillante, elle vous met à l'aise, et est d'une aide précieuse pour les périples New-Yorkais.

Pour un prochain séjour, j'y retournerai sans hésiter ! MERCI POUR TOUT !

Stephanie's apartment was fantastic. The room was absolutely comfortable, the bathroom was impecable and we were not bothered at all by anyone in the house the time we were there. The location was perfect, less than 2 minute walk from two metro stations and less than a minute walk from beautiful central park. Would definitely stay here again!
Great place, pretty good location and very easy to great anywhere you want to go in NYC. STephanie and her family were very friendly and helpful to us!

It was my first time using AirBnb. Me and my 9 year old daughter stayed with Stephanie for 5 days and the experience was amazing! We were received very well and the location is great, very close of everything including the subway station. I will certainly stay there another time and I strongly recommend this place.

Essa foi a primeira vez que usei Airbnb. Eu a minha filha de 9 anos ficamos com Stephanie por 5 dias e a experiencia foi maravilhosa. Fomos muito bem recebidos, a localizacao e' otima, muito perto de uma estacao do (Website hidden by Airbnb) certeza ficaremos la outras vezes e eu recomendo.

Une tres bon acceuil que ce soit de Stéphanie ou de Sophie (sa collègue).
Un appartement vraiment sympathique et fonctionnel, pas trop mal situé dans Manhattan.
Je le recommande à beaucoup de gens.
Et j'y retournerais volontiers.
Merci beaucoup.

The room was clean and cozy,Stephanie was very helpful and provided the information regarding to the NYC. I really enjoyed my stay. Only one thing was the floor was cracking when people (Website hidden by Airbnb) mom stayed awake because of this.

Très bon accueil (plan de la ville et des métros fournis, + de bons conseils) et très bien placé, à 2 minutes du métro.

En résumé super !
