Laurelle was very hospitable and easy to contact. Her place was perfect for two people to stay in and the location was great. The building is quiet and the doorman was very helpful and sweet! The apartment is close to the subway and walking distance from several bars and restaurants in the area. I highly recommend it!

Perfect location close to the subway, Central Park, great restaurants and delis. So as a base to discover Manhattan it's absolutely spot on. The apartment itself is as described, located in a relatively calm street away from the crowds and a positive plus was quiet neighbours in the building. Laurelle was a great host, both in communicating before, during and after the stay, Couldn't be better!

This place was as nice as described on the website. We loved it and we would stay there again: great location, the place was quiet, welcoming and very clean. The bed was good and the shower very nice. Laurelle was very helpful and nice. We loved it!
We highly recommend this place!!

Laurelle's studio is charming, cozy and perfect for two people. Located in a very nice area of Manhattan, with a comfy bed and good shower.   

We felt like locals and had a really cool experience.  It is close to lot's of nice restaurants, bars and delis.  Walking distance from Central Park, Times Square and all major metro lines.  There is a doorman, elevator and it is very well equiped.

It could be a bit more organized and clean. I also suggest  to make some more space to leave gest's personal luggage.  Apart from that the place is perfect!

We stayed in Laurelle's apartment for 5 nights in July 2011.  The apartment is exactly as shown in the photos.  It is situated in a very good location and within easy walking distance of Central Park and Time Square.  There are also some very good restaurants in the area.  Laurelle was a very good host and recommended things for us to see and do in the area.  I would definitely stay here again.
Great Location!!!

We stayed here for a week and really enjoyed the central location.  Times Square, Central Park, subways, supermarkets and hell's kitchen restaurants were all easy walking distance.  Tommi was super helpful with directions from the airport which made connections much easier.  The apartment is surprisingly quiet given the busy city is right there.  Using the laundry facilities in the building was also handy towards the end of our stay.  We also used the computer at the apartment for getting on the internet to book things and check out things to do.  The photos are exactly what you can expect, it's not a huge place but doesn't claim to be, it's still muh better than a hotel at a similar price!
great place

Quiet, safe, comfortable, charming.  Superb location.  Great value.  Laurelle was a kind and considerate host, and great with communication.  The Midtown Pied-a-terre will be at the top of my list when I visit the area again.

Love, love, loved it! Brilliant location, beautiful apartment, lovely host. Not a bad word. Hot powerful shower. Comfy bed (if your under 6ft 4 and not a big sook). Close to delicious food- both restaurants and markets. Super close to great shows and times square! Will def stay here again on next visit. Thanks!
Highly recommended. great space, great location, and very gracious and professional home owner.

Tommi's place was clean (smelled of cinnamon) and set up to accommodate our needs perfectly. We needed an extra bed which Tommi helpfully set up for us in advance. She also left little post-its for us that explained everything we needed to know - the locations of tucked away power outlets, where the kitchen utensils were etc. 

She was also a great communicator - replying to emails quickly as well as keeping in touch via SMS to make sure we were settled in OK.

I would definitely consider staying here again.

Wow, was so nice I enjoyed my stay so well I hardly knew I was there !! Went by much too fast !! 
Thanks Tommi

Tommi's apartment is just as described. Perfect location - grocerys, restaurants, fast foods, pharmacys, closest subway 2 blocks away, central park just 5 blocks - everything you need by walking distance. It has a confortable bed (but taller people may have problems), a nice kitchen (doesnt have a microwave) and a bathroom (with a body mirror!) 

Tommi is the most wonderful host, always helping when needed (when we didn't know how to use the tv, or to close the windows), she let us use the apt telephone to make local calls and even though she wasnt in town she send a friend to deliver the keys and was always there to assist us.

The things I wasn't very glad about was the lightning, witch are very poor, even if you turn on all the lights and the bathroom curtains witch doesnt close very well and overflows the bathroom. 
Also, the tv is old and it's kind of difficult to deal with it, but you won't go to NYC to watch tv so thats fine. Other than that, great stay and would definatelly book again.
Excelente ubicación. Muy amable el trato con Tommi. El apartamento es acogedor y cálido.

We had a great stay at the apartment. Location was absolutely fantastic, literally walk out the door and you're in Central Park and a short walk gets you to the heart of time square. Apartment itself was great, warm and cost and had all the amenities we could have asked for. The host was also extremely helpful and very easy to get along with.

Tommi's place is nice and cozy, and perfectly located for the main touristy area as well as some nice bars and restos in Hell's Kitchen area. Communications with Tommi were always timely, and friendly.  I recommend the place for a couple more than for friends.

Our time at Tomis apartment was great! The apartment is just like the pictures, there is even a full mirror, which was great! It's in a great location, close to all the main subway lines, we could even go to Times Square walking! And Tommi was a great host, always helpful.
This studio flat in Midtown was a great location and cozy and comfy.  And Tommi was super helpful about seeing to our needs!  Had a great time.

Thank you so much Tommi for having us in your home!!! 
The location is truly perfect. Cafes at your doorstep and the park from a few blocks away.
The studio is cozy and so inviting. The bed is super comfy and the shower was great!
Thanks for making it so easy Tommi.

We hope to stay again:)

Cx

WOW!  What a great stay.  Perfect location.  Happy to see there was an Elevator.  Parking Garage on the same street.  Tommi was very nice and accommodating.  the space was comfortable and perfect.  Plenty to do within walking distance.  If you are looking for a place in Midtown.  Stop looking.  This is the place.

Personification of great hospitality. Came to my rescue twice when i had no place to stay. Excellent communication. A cozy apartment near an amazing location. Everything in a walking distance. Tommi has been very professional in detailing out everything that one needs during a short stay. Love the apartment!

We were very happy with the location which was absolutely perfect! I also very appreciate the responsible and reliable attitude of Tommi, who responded us always immediately and was very helpful with everything. The cooperation and personal attitude was 100% satisfaction.

Tommi (Laurelle) was very helpful and informative and answered any communication very quickly.  Her apartment is in a great location, with lots of nice bars and restaurants close by and not far from Times Square and Broadway.  There are no stairs to enter the building and there is a lift, so perfect if stairs are a problem.  The apartment is small but works well for one or two people.  There are a lot of personal belongings in and on every surface in the apartment and a completely full fridge so very little room for hanging clothes or storing food, and no microwave.  The TV is old and must be turned on and off via a switch on the TV. Laurelle was very kind and helpful, a lovely host.

This place was great, perfect distance from everything. Plenty of restaurants and stores around within walking distance. We stayed here for New Years and walked to time square for the ball drop. The apartment itself was cozy and just what we needed for the stay. Tommi was great and i would stay here again.
Un super emplacement !! Je recommande à qui veut visiter Manhattan !! Hôte adorable, qui vous indiquera de bonnes adresses. Idéal pour un couple.
Great location.   Very nice building.   Small but nice studio.  Perfect for solo or couples.

La comunicación con Tommi ha sido muy buena desde el principio. Estaba en el piso para recibirnos, a pesar de que el avión llegó con retraso y me escribió durante la estancia para asegurarse de que todo estaba bien. El apartamento está bien situado y dispone de todo lo detallado en el anuncio. La cama es cómoda y la ducha funciona bien. Sin embargo, las sábanas tenían manchas y agujeros, la cortina de la ducha presentaba moho y, en general, el piso no estaba tan limpio como nos hubiera gustado.

Appartement très bien placé entre central park et time square. à 3 minutes à pied du métro. Tommi est vraiment très gentille et nous a très bien accueilli. Le logement est très sympa, il manque juste une table et une armoire pour mettre ses vêtements. Mais lors d'un séjour à New-York on est plus dans la rue qu'enfermé dans un appartement :)
This apartment was super cute and in the perfect location! There was a doorman and elevator too which was a plus. I would recommend this place to anyone.

The location was great and Tommi was very helpful and accomdating. The apartment is a bit small and crowded, so there was not a lot of place for personal belongings. Also, there is a strong smell of incense and aromatic oils in the apartment, which can be problematic for people with allergies.

Tommi  (Laurelle) was a great host. Nice, helpful and answering any questions very fast.
The apartment was in a great and safe location close to Times Square, Broadway, Central Park and Metro Stations. Nice Bakeries, Restaurants, Bars, small Supermarkets were very close.
The apartment is small and as shown on the pics.  A bit crowded, so not a lot of space for our belongings.  but ok for 1 week.
Laurelle, thank you. You were a lovely host.

We could not have asked for anything more! Tommi (Laurelle) was a wonderful, gracious hostess. The space is quirky, cute, and the location is ideal! We rarely needed to use Uber, many activities are well within walking distance. Highly recommended!

The house was very confortable ! 
Nice ubication near subways and a lot of restaurants. Downstairs there is a doorman so u will be secure and safe.
Laurelle was very kind with us, easy to comunicate and very respectfull. She
 help us with all that we need. Great host, reccomended 100%!

The location of Laurelle's (Tommi) home is perfect. Safe neighborhood and walking distance to restaurants, CVS, Central Park, coffee shops, etc. Also close to transit entrances, so we never had to take an Uber or cab! Loved the vibe of this unique little apartment. Laurelle greeted us upon check in to exchange keys and share recommendations for places nearby. Overall, we had a positive experience during our weekend stay!

This apt. has a really groovy, funky decor and vibe - tons of character - I loved it!  I felt very comfortable there. It's small but not at all cramped. Laurelle (Tommi) was super responsive and a good communicator, and very friendly and welcoming. All the info was clear and there were no surprises with her place. The building is safe and I felt very comfortable staying there as a single female. The building itself is on a quiet residential block, but the street one block away is chock full of restaurants, bars, cafes, diners, grocery stores, drug stores, etc. A great location convenient to all that Midtown has to offer. Enjoyed my stay very much!

Tommi's place was a nice place to stay in New York. She was extremely responsive and very nice about everything. The apartment was very busy with her stuff, but that wasn't bothering much. The location is great.

Her place is great!
I live in NYC but needed a place to stay for the weekend.
The neighborhood is great, so many good choices of places to eat!
I never got such a good nights sleep.
Her apartment is so relaxing even with the liveliness of the neighborhood.

We had a really good time in NYC from the first day to the very last minute. The area is save, subway is just at the corner. Close to everywhere. Thank you Dana again to let us stay in your apartment.
Great spot in a fantastic location.  Dana's description is spot on.  Her place is terrific.

my stay at dana was just perfect. unfortunately i didn't meet her as she was already out of town when i got to NYC but she organized everything to get me her apartment key. i love new york and i love everything around east village - so i was more than happy to find a suitable apartment in that area. the apartment is simply perfect, it has everything you need and it's beautifully decorated plus it's very bright during the day. the bed is super comfy and it was very clean. i felt like home immediately. it's on the 4th floor - good morning and evening training :) i highly recommend dana as a host and i will be back for sure. thank you so much! Tiziana

I have to say this is a tough review to write, because I know that by giving such a glowing review it decreases my chances of seeing Dana's place available again!  Dana was a fantastic host from start to finish - communication and check in was seamless.  Her place is ideal if you like the neighborhood, which I do, and don't mind the 4 floor walkup, which I appreciate.  I would highly recommend Dana's place, and hope I get to stay there in my future travels to New York.
Beautiful apartment and great location. Perfect for exploring the East Village and neighbouring area. Dana was very accommodating with the dates. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay although too short!

Me and my son had a very great stay in Dana's apartment in late Sept 2014. It was exactly as described in her presentation and all worked out perfectly. A comfortable double-bed plus a broad couch gave us good sleep. Although we have the windows open during the nights it was very quiet and safe.
East Village is nice and perfect starting point for discover the rest of Manhattan, and the near surroundings is something to explore with small shops, bars, restaurants etc. 
Dana was perfect in her communication all the time, answered rapidly and helped us when we needed it, despite we never met her in person. 
If one need a two small room apartment in a quiet part of the town, we can highly recommend Dana's place. It's not overwhelming luxury, but you feel that you are in one's personal, nice furnitured (mostly from the 50-60th decades) home. A really good choice! Thanks for a wonderful week - even the weather was perfect!

We had a fantastic stay at Dana's lovely apartment.  It was really warm (which was great as it was freezing outside!), clean and spacious for two people.  Dana was really great at keeping in touch with us and was there to meet us when we arrived from the airport.  The flat is really well located in the East Village near lots of restaurants, shops and cafes and only a short 8 min walk to Union Square which has lots of metro stops and a big Whole Foods - bonus!

Dana is a wonderful host. Very accommodating and helpful, providing an extensive "house manual" with answers to every question. She is also readily available by phone or text for advice and recommendations. The neighborhood is so convenient and perfect for a NYC East Village experience. Prospective renters should know that this a fourth floor walk-up apartment. Thanks, Dana--I hope to be back soon!

Dana's apartment is wonderful.  Great location, beautiful furniture, and good amenities.  The internet speed is ridiculously fast!  Dana is quick to respond to requests - other AirBnBers could learn from her.

Dana was an extremely gracious and responsive host, and went out of her way to make us feel welcome.  Her residence is as described, fully appointed and comfortable, and in the heart of Manhatten with ready access to all amenities and transportation.  It is perfect for a jaunt to NYC.

Dana was quick to respond to emails and made the entire process smooth and easy.  The apartment is ideally located in East Village and is very quiet - especially at night.  The bed is comfortable and the apartment very functional.   I won't hesitate to book again if it's available.

Dana was great to deal with. Prompt, friendly, and willing to go out of her way to make my stay in NYC great.

I stayed in her lovely and homey East Village apartment for two weeks. It was warm, quiet, with basically no neighbourhood noise at all (very rare), had a comfortable bed, a nice huge desk, a functional kitchen, and an old but very decent bathroom (especially for NYC!). The apartment is on the fourth floor - as other reviewed have noted - but is probably a good thing for those indulging themselves and needing to burn off some extra calories. The foyer is a bit dark and uninviting - especially to those who have not been in many NYC apartments - but this is standard and just the style of the original building.

The neighbourhood is vibrant and buzzing with things to see and do. A number of Momofuku eateries are barely a block away, as is a cinema, a couple of markets, coffee shops, bagel joints, Japanese restaurants, and just about anything else you could want. Most metro connections are only a short walk away and so it is trivial to get whenever you need to go.

I would happily stay with Dana again when I need a comfortable base to visit NYC.

A great place in cool neighborhood. The apartment was as described and Dana was very responsive and a pleasure to deal with. There is no higher recommendation than saying that I'd definitely stay there again next time I'm in NYC if it is available.

Great apartment in an awesome location. Plenty of room for my husband and I, and even enough space to comfortably put up our niece for a couple of nights when she came in from Brooklyn. Great decor and book collection. We arrived a little earlier than expected, but Dana was very gracious in accommodating us.

Dana's place is the first one I've ever booked with Airbnb. She was helpful and easy to reach during the booking process, and gave simple and clear instructions for the stay.

The apartment is in a great neighborhood, feels very homey and is pretty quiet (which is always appreciated, even surprising, in New York). Overall it fits the given description.

In a word, would definitely book again.

Dana is a great host, very communicative and helpful. We weren't able to access the internet when we first arrived and she literally dropped everything she was doing at that moment to solve the problem, fixing the issue in five minutes or less. Great spot in the East Village w/ mid-century modern decor (and yes, very quiet!) - good size for a NYC one-bdroom. The neighborhood has managed to preserve some of its authenticity, void of tourists and modern condos. Hundreds of restaurants, bars and little shops. If you want to feel removed from much hassle and bustle, but with lots to do and explore, this is the neighborhood.

Dana's place was great! Creative and "homey" (because it's literally a designer's apartment), we found it very easy to unwind while there, get gear up for some real New York adventures. Her place felt like an extension of the amazing city we explored. 

Dana was easy to communicate with, laid back, and very accommodating. All of our dialogue was online, but we never felt like we couldn't reach out if we had a question. 

The neighbors were surprisingly quiet, which especially helpful at night. A little bit of street noise, but SO minimal to even a few blocks away. 

Note: up 4 flights of stairs. No problem for us, but just something to prepare for if you have heavy luggage, a child, or are unable to hoof it up to the 4th floor. 

Overall, great experience. Thank you Dana! You rock.

Great, spacios 1 bedroom that has everything one needs in one of my favourite NYC locations. 
The place is clean, quiet and comfortable - the only thing I woul note is the walk-up to the 4th floor. That said, I would stay there again next time I hope. Thanks Dana!
El apartamento de Dana es muy cómodo para pasar unos días en New York. Nos facilitó en todo momento la llegada y es muy amable. El apartamento tiene de todo lo que se necesita para estar cómodo.
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 12 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

We had such a lovely stay at Dana’s place! It was exactly as pictured but had so much more to offer. It was warm and cozy but gave us the much needed space we required as we were travelling with a toddler. Dana was so receptive and easy to contact. I would definitely recommend her place to anyone, it’s the perfect home away from home.

Ssameer is a very polite and uncomplicated person. He is a real foodie :-) and can provide you with many of information about any kind of restaurant you are looking for. I stayed for 15 days in his apartment. It is clean, cosy, quite and it has everything you need incl. wifi. Public transportations are just around the corner and it takes about 20-30 minutes to be in the middle of action in NY. 30$ for the private room is really worth it and in addition it has a very comfy mattress. I enjoyed my stay at this place and can absolutely recommend it!
nice host. honest and easy going. would board with again.

Liked Saameer's place very much. Stayed there with my wife for 4 nights. Communication with Saameer is easy, answers phone and emails promptly. He was very polite and friendly. Never bothered us one bit. Was never annoyed at all my inquiries....just chill. The other rommie was also chill as hell. Everyone was quiet and I slept like a fricking baby.

Location is super convenient. Just take the 1 train 1 block away and eat at innexpensive Dominican dinners uptown for cheap and tasty food. This area near City college is gentrifying like (Website hidden by Airbnb) unrcognizable from when I used to live in nYC 2 years ago. The area is safe and friendly as hell.

If you need an affordable place to stay and enjoy NYC, go to Saameer's.

Cheers...and thanks you again Saameer.

Ssameer is friendly, courteous and accommodating. The apt is extremely warm, but that's just steam heat in an apt bldg. The beds are serviceable, and the bathroom is clean. Shower has plenty of hot water. We were also comfortable in the neighborhood, and as advertised, the subway entrance is a short 1-1/2 blocks away @ Hamilton Place and Broadway. We would recommend this apt, especially for people under 40. My age group may require more padding on the mattress. :) A bargain for Manhattan, no question.

If you are looking for mints on your pillow and cheesy tourist attractions, stay at the Marriott in Times Square. If you want a clean, secure room in a laid-back environment, and possibly to get to know some real New Yorkers, stay with Sameer! The apartment is super-convenient and includes all the basics (kitchen access, clean shared bathroom, linens/towels, WiFi). The neighborhood is a very diverse, mostly residential one with great cheap restaurants and everything else you need. And Sameer himself is the ideal host/roommate-- helpful without being nosy or pushy, easy to make arrangements with, etc. This is the best deal in town!

Ssameer was a delight to be around and made the process very easy. The room was clean, basic and comfortable and I'd gladly stay there again or recommend the space to others. Best value in the city, and a neat neighborhood, too. Be sure to check out the Riverbank park while you're there, as well as the great, cheap, eateries on Broadway.

Ssameer is easy going and really cool. The room is little but it wasn't a surprise.We loved the neighborhood and there is something pleasant about the apartment. Perfect for a short cheap stay in NYC.

Ssameer, has a good heart, friendly and willing to tell you all you need to know about NYC.
APT: Clean,private,internet connection 24/7. 
Close to subway, easy access to all basics.
I felt at home at ssameers home, highly recommended.
See you soon ssameer (bru)

I could talk about the comfortable apartment and its location in a good quiet neighborhood easily accessible to the subway, or I could talk about how it's probably the best bargain in Manhattan.  But the best thing you'll get from this deal is your new friend Ssameer.  He made me feel welcome right from the start and he was extremely helpful in so many ways.  When I forgot to pack my computer power cord he got online and hooked me up with a new one.  I also forgot my phone charger so he charged it up for me whenever I needed it.  We even took a trip out to Long Island to his favorite Cajun restaurant to get my opinion on it (it was great!).  The best part was probably just sitting around talking with him.  He's a great conversationalist and seems to be able to talk about any subject.  After a week I feel like I can really call him a friend.  He'll be seeing me again!

Sameer's place is strategically located near the subway station, with  access to the NYC's main attractions in less than 30 minutes - for first timers here, this really helped us a lot! He keeps his place clean & everything was in order, from clean towels to kitchen amenities, we really had no complaints ! The place is warm too - just nice for us who just came from a hot & humid country & can't really bear the cold! He lets us have our own space & time too, plus, as it's within college area, we felt safe walking around :) - at this price, I would recommend this to anyone!
central. la propreté laisse un peu à désirer mais pour le prix, on va pas rechigner... Et Ssameer est très sympa!

We visited in April and had a great great time. Sameer was extremely helpful, very friendly and the flat is very close to subway. Great price for comfortable place and Dunkin's just down the road :)Thank you again. Tom&Jana

The location can't be beat. I stayed only one night, but I found Ssameer to be a good host -- accommodating and friendly. The bed in the room I stayed in is not very soft, but I didn't have a problem sleeping. (Light sleepers ought to be aware, though.) Overall, a great experience, and I would definitely come back.

This is a highly recommended place to stay!  Ssameer is a fabulous host.  He was flexible about when we arrived, chatted with us and made sure we had everything we needed.  Very close to subway.   Although the room is small, it is clean and lots of luggage fits in the closet leaving plenty of space.  Thanks, Ssameer!

I can only recommend a stay at Ssameer's. He is a very nice, polite and considerate host and will give u tips about great places to eat or to visit and he always tries to be helpful. The provided room was small (though for one person it's perfectly fine) but clean (and w/ clean I mean European standards clean, not American - which is hard to find in NYC for that affordable price, believe me), quite quiet and even had a small closet in it - and u also get your own set of keys for the apartment. For NYC the neighbourhood is ok and the subway station is only 2 minutes away from Ssameer's place. In 15 - 20 minutes u can be in Midtown Manhattan (Penn Station). I was travelling alone and really felt safe at Ssameer's place. For this price you will find no better and cheaper place near Midtown to stay at than Ssameer's.
Ssameer's the bomb...period! If you don't have a great experience staying with him then it's on you.  He's helpful, neat, smart, funny and an over all good individual.  I'm gonna miss him!  Muah xoxo

Me and my boyfriend enjoyed the stay at Ssameer's place. However the room was pretty tiny and I can hardly imagine staying there during the summer. We lacked the fresh air a bit. The place was quite busy as there were 5 people (including us) at one moment and only one bathroom. This flat is very well located indeed and also Ssameer is very nice person thus for backpackers or those who don't want to spent their fortune on accommodation in NYC it's worth it. Thank you Ssameer, Oli@Gasper

Nicest little place in a quiet (as quiet as it may be in the center of Harlem) neighborhood. Friendly, obliging host. 
We absolutely loved our stay here and hope to stay here again on our next visit to NYC.
Igor & Tanya, Russia
had a good stay at Ssameer, perfect location, very close to the subway! perfect to visit nyc for the budget traveller!!!
Ssameer is one righteous dude. If you don't get along with him there's something wrong with you.

my friend and I stayed at ssameers place for 5 nights and really enjoyed his apartment. even tough he told us that the room might be a little small for 2 people it was just fine. there is a fan in the room and when you leave the door open at night the A/C also cools down the room a bit (as it was raelly hot and humid at that time in ny - around 100F)

the location is ok, but not really downtown - to times square probably 25 min by metro. but it seams to be quite safe and the subway and a supermarket are just around the corner.

unfortunately we did not even see ssameer even once, as we really had bad timing - anyway - thanks for everything sam, we loved our stay at your apartment!!

also the very funny coincidence that there were 2 other very nice "girls" ;) from our hometown at ssameers place when we were there was really nice!- hope you had a nice time after we left laura and isabella - it was very nice meeting you! and thanks again for everything :)

Sameer's a cool guy.  I was delayed making my way into Manhattan from Jersey and therefore late for our first meeting where I was supposed to get the keys.  He was very understanding and helpful in getting me on the right train.  If you have questions about the city or neighborhood or need recommendations on things to do or see in NYC he's happy to offer guidance.  He's a chill character that's into music, and overall really easy to get along with.
Ssameer is such a wonderful person to talk to! Though the room is a bit small but his heart is big enough to encompass all of us! :)

Ssameer war erste Klasse! Netter kann man Fremden nicht zeigen, willkommen zu sein. Das Zimmer, die Wohnung, war bestens vorbereitet und bot alles, was man für eine erholsame Nacht und einen guten Start in den neuen Tag benötigt. Inklusive einem guten Glas Wein am Abend und anregenden Tips für NY. Sehr zu empfehlen!

Ssameer is awesome! He prepared us a sweet nice little private room to stay in, with clean sheets and bath towels, I would highly recommend him if you want to ever stay over night in the city. Thank you very much!
Sameer was really nice and we had no issues at all!

Muy buena opción (¡y de las más baratas!) para viajar a Nueva York. El apartamento está al lado del metro en una zona muy tranquila y bien comunicado. Ssameer es un anfitrión genial, y te ayudará a encontrar lo que buscas en la ciudad si quieres salir de los recorridos más turísticos. ¡Saludos desde Cádiz, Ssameer! Pese a pasar allí buena parte de agosto, en casa no hacía nada de calor (aire acondicionado y/o ventiladores) y puedes disponer de toallas y sábanas, cosa que aligera el equipaje. ¡Muy recomendable!
We stayed at Ssameer's for three nights and it was great. Very clean and Ssameer was very kind and very helpful. Cant beat the price.

We had 5 days in Ssameer's apartment in early September 2010. Unfortunately he was away this time, but he was agree to provide a room for us.

The flat was not clean, because, I think, someone else was here before us.
We had a little problems with flushing of the toilet and draining the shower. In our first evening we could not open the flat's door and it was not funny. After dozen attempts it suddenly opened.

Room is small, just for sleeping, and the flat is very simple and crammed. 
As everybody says, location is very good- close to subway station. We easily can get to the centre of Manhattan.

It was not an aim to write a bad review, I just want to provide true information. 
It's a good place for staying in New York for this price. 
Anyway, thanks Ssameer!
SUPERB HOST. I REALLY RECOMMEND. GOT EVERYTHING WHAT I PAID FOR. GOOD CONNECTION TO THE CITY CENTER.CLEAN APARTMENT, AC WORKS,.....NOTHING TO APOLOGIZE 4

Ssameer is a very nice guy and he was very helpful with us. We stay more than a week to his place and it was very quiet. The neighbourhood is very safe and pleasant, we really enjoyed it ! 
Thanks Ssameer. 

The 2 French girls in NYC :)
This place was very good. Near to subway and shops. We spent a very good time in NY thanks to SSameer. We were very atisfied with this accommodation.
The location is good and you shouldm't have problems to get the key. Besides that, the host is very nice people. I recommend it!

Ssameer was heaven sent. He is the nicest person I've ever meet. Very hospitable. He made me feel like I was his little sister coming to visit from out of town. He made sure I was taken care of by asking if I was okay and did I need anything. I enjoyed every moment especially when we finally had the chance to chat and get to know each other. HE'S AWESOME!!!!
Ssameer is very nice.  Good location, close to subway and shops, convinient to travel to downtown.  Thanks.

I had the honor to be roommates with Ssameer for almost 2 months and I can only say: if you stay with him, you are the luckiest traveler in New York. His apartment is clean (no bugs at all!), cozy and he makes sure you feel welcome. It's almost like a hotel: he provides you with towels, his shampoo selection is huge (due to all of his guests leaving them behind), his hospitality is amazing. He is able to recommend the best restaurants in every single part of the city, and if you want to make him happy share some good wine and cheese with him. 

The only negative thing I could mention are the neighbors above - they sometimes tapdance in the middle of the night, or so it seems from that thumping upstairs. Everything else was so great, I was really sad to leave him. Man - I miss him already, and I just left his apartment yesterday!

This was another great stay at Ssameer's.  He was very accommodating of me arriving later than expected on Christmas Eve.  Even though it was stormy outside it was still warm and inviting at Ssameer's place.  Some great neighbors even helped me shovel out my Jeep after the huge storm so I could get back on the road.  Thanks, Ssameer!
Great host! Seemed to go out of his way to make my stay enjoyable. Would definitely stay with Ssameer again!

I would totally recommend staying at Ssameer's rental. The room itself is small but great for one person and great if you are visiting NYC and not planning on spending a lot of time indoors. Ssameer and his girlfriend were both very friendly and hospitable enough to advise me of the local NYC happenings.  The location was excellent as you really are only footsteps away for the subway and in a safe highly populated area.

Mr. Ssameer was the best host Ever!!! My story, yeah new to the city and was naive to the ins and outs of the city, and Mr. Ssameer was very helpful and patient with any queries & questions that I had, he was just awesome! The room was nice and cozy, the sheets were clean, the house was clean, I felt right at home!  I give this host  10 stars!!!

Great place, and a nice little room.   It was easy to find, and there was a great little grocery store right on the same block.  It was easy to check in, check out, and get some rest and relaxiation after a full day.
Two Thumbs Up.

its a great location on the west side right on Broadway, with easy subway and bus to midtown.

Host let me use his kitchen and dinnerware, saved alot of money cooking.

He's friendly, nice guy.

Room is small but nice, comfortable futon
Nice host, amazing room and accomodation . Ssameer gave me many suugests and tips to stay in Manhattan. He;s very brilliant, friendly and open minded . I reccomend this host and this place.
Great host.
The place was clean aand we had (Website hidden by Airbnb) was good

Clean and big enough to accommodate both of us during our time in NYC.  Sameer was willing to chat about the various ways to travel the city and suggested agreeable morning coffee venues, so no complaints here.  All-in-all a very enjoyable stay.
First time using airbnb? You should definitely go with Ssameer! He was a very hospitable host and highly recommended.
Very easy staying with Ssameer. Close to subway, everything was clean, and bed was comfortable.

Great Host !
The place is close to sub , 20 minutes from all party places.

Txs Ssameer

Sameer is a great host! The room is clean and comfy, so is the rest of the apartment. Sameer is a very considerate and laid back guy. If you don't know the city or the area he'll have a lot of helpful tips for you. He lets his guests use his kitchen so you can save a lot of money if you don't want to eat out every day. His place is literally next to the subway stop, which makes it a perfect location to explore the city from here. I'd definitely stay here again and will recommend it to friends who visit NYC. Five out of five stars! *****
We had a really nice time at Ssameer's place even if we did not have too much time to see each other. A very nice host!

I stayed at Ssameers for two weeks and I loved it. The neighborhood is friendly, there are shops close by, the subway is only a few steps away and if you’re into Zumba there is a free class on Saturdays only two blocks away. Ssameer is a lovely person, easy to deal with and a very warm and caring host. He’ll give you advice on anything from the smartest way to ride the subway, where to find the best pizza or the next dubstep party. After two weeks Ssameer’s home almost felt like my home too.
Nice place to stay. It is closer to downtown as expected. Ssamer is a very nice host, always ready to help and give you some advice.

Thanks to Ssameer we had a great time in NYC. Room and bed are perfect for 2, the neighbourhood is very pleasant, the place is very quiet and clean. He is a very friendly host, always ready to help and he gives useful advices to cope with the Big Apple.

P & P

Ssameer is really helpful and chatty. Very willing to share any advice (where to do laundry, get coffee, help in turbo charging iPhone etc). The place is located quite far on the upper side of Manhattan, but the metro is very conveniently located nearby so that is not a problem. There is also a supermarket down the street if one needs to pick up anything. Although I only stayed a night, it was a good experience overall.
Very convenient to all transport. A great place to base yourself in NY. Very small apartment but as we were out and about ideal.

zero oui je donne un grand 0 nous n avons j amais rencontre samir ensuite la personne qui nous a recu n etait pas  tres aimable meme le dernier jour de la remise des clefs meme pas un mot agreable rien;quand a la chambre j en parle meme pas bref vraiment pas agreable pour nous et pourtant suis pas difficile car nous voyageons souvent a travers le monde avec le systheme airbnb  Juin 2011
Help me out with a great place last minute, clean and quite. and easy to get to.

This was my first time using AirBnB. I was a woman traveling alone, and it was an excellent experience. Even though Ssameer was out of town when I arrived, he was very helpful. I called him when my flight was delayed to let him know that I would be arriving later than I thought that I would be. 

He gave me the contact information of one of the other people staying in his apartment, and he called to let them know that I would be arriving much later than I anticipated. He even made sure the public transportation route that I planned to take was the most convenient way to get to his place. 

The person acting as the host in his place was very helpful. It was very clean and conveniently located. There were plenty of places around it (though, I didn't get to see much because I only stayed one night), and it was very close to the subway. Highly recommended.
I couldn't meet Ssameer as he was away. I met dasha. The room was functional and bathroom was clean though shared. I was out most of the time and went back only to sleep. Value for money.

Very nice place, very well located near the subway station on 137th street. Ssameer was on vacation but Dasha welcomed us and gave us useful tips to visit certain places NY. The room was super clean and we were able to cook, use the fridge, use the bathroom as if you were living there and the price is very low compared with other offers ----> so the perfect place to spend your journey in NY city!
Clean, quiet, convenient. Perfect for a short stay.

Ssameer was away when I was in his flat but his friend looked after me and was very nice. I was really late because my plane was delayed but everyone was cool about it. Great location. Friendly, relaxed place to stay. If I returned to NYC I would want to stay here again.
it was great. clean. safe. very close to subway. if you need somewhere to stay in ny, and you don't have a lot of money, we recommend Ssameer's place. we only regret that we didn't meet Ssameer
Small and functional room close to subay station. Ssameer wasn't at home, but his friend Dasha was nice and helpfull. Very uncomplicated stay. Value for money.

Ssameer is a rock star. He was social but not pushy, truly relaxed. He's a true foodie and recommended great restaurants we would have missed. His apartment couldn't be more perfect for AirBNB and you can't beat the price. 

Loved our stay!
A+++

it was my first time with this site, and my first time in USA, and it was AMAZING.
Only bad point can be some problems with the bathroom, but nothing important and the host fix it fastly.
But it was nothing compare all good points like: the host because he is really nice and he take care about guest.        the room was nice with good bed and not so hot compare outside!!!!!!  there is climatisation in the appartement . and subway is so close!!!!!! 
we enjoyed a lot our time there,
thank you Ssamer for everything, and for sure i would like to come back there!!!!!!!

Situé au nord de Manhattan, l'appartement est très bien situé. On rejoint toutes les attractions touristiques en 30/35 minutes.

Je n'ai pu voir Ssameer que 15 minutes car il était en déplacement pendant mon séjour mais il avait l'air très sympa et accueillant.

First time in Ny and first booking with Airbnb. We had a great time at Ssameer's place: quiet neighbourhood, very small room but good, REALLY close to the subway. He is a very good host, nice and helpful, giving us great tips of the city :-)

We actually had to call off our trip, but my communications with Ssameer was very nice. I am going to make sure to try and stay at his place, once we figure out when we actually take our trip. Magdlanea

It was fantastic! The neighbourhood was so nice and friendly and ssameer was so friendly too. The room was adequat and i slept very well there. The subway is so near, just 2minutes! Really save area! 
I have already recommended ssameer in my circle of friends and will definitely book there again my next accommodation!
Ssameer was an amazing host! He was very helpfull and friendly. The place also very nice and comfortable, we loved staying in this house!

Friendly and nice host. Happy stay experience. I felt welcomed. 
The building is pretty old. The room is tiny, which is just a little bigger than a fulton/sofa. But I need to take class during the daytime, and the place is only 2 subway stops away from my campus, and I only need a place to sleep at night, so this place is good to me. 
I felt it's very convenient to commute between my campus and Ssameer's place. For the price and the location, it's a good value. 

Things need to be improved: The blanket and the quilt can be cleaner. They didn't smell very fresh and clean...

We had a great time in NY and staying at Sameer's made it possible. The subway is right there and it takes you everywhere, cheap good places to eat and a very safe neighborhood. 
Sameer was always willing to help us out with anything we needed and had great recommendations for us regarding where to go or what to do.
The more than 150 good comments he has on this site speak for themselves and Sameer lives up to them. 
I lack the words to truly describe what a great host he is, but you can prove that by staying at his place.
Yes, the room might be small, but the bed is comfortable and we slept really well every night. It's cheap and you sleep very well, what else do you need? The rest of the day you have the whole city of New York out there.

Seriously, everything Ssameer wrote about himself is true, He's a real nice new yorker. His positive attitude and general friendliness made me feel welcome in his home, which was one of the things I worried about before going to stay at his place.
The room is, as advertised, cozy, meaning small, but sufficient for base camp. Subway is less than a minute walk from the flat, the grocery store which is even closer was one of the nicest and most deliciously supplied i've seen during my entire week of sightseeing, I guess that bit of information might matter to some people, so here it is :)

We enjoyed staying at Sameer's place. It's very small but we didn't mind at all because you're just there to sleep anyway. The neighbourhood's safe and the appartment is really close to the subway. Sameer's a great guy who gave us a lot of useful tips and recommended some good restaurants to us (we loved the dumplings, by the way!). Things could be a tiny bit cleaner though, but it doesn't stop us from saying that if you want to stay in NY but you don't have that much money to spend, this is the best place to go. It really gives you the feeling of 'living' in NY, only if it's just for a few days or a week!

This was the second time I stayed at Ssameer's and just as last time he was a lovely host. I shared the room with a friend this time and even though it's quite small it worked out just fine. Location-wise, this is really a perfect spot. The place is clean and well looked after. It's not the most quiet of houses so you might prefer the other room that's in the back of the apartment if you are sensitive to noises from the stairwell.

Ssameer was really friendly and nice. 
My bf was a little shy and Ssameer was totally cool with letting us be. 
The room was as mentioned small, but the location is truly near to the subway. 
I appreciated that Ssameer offered us additional blankets to stay warm. 

All in all, it was a great experience staying here!

We spend 12 nights in Ssamer’s apartment. He was really welcoming and friendly, and contact before arrival was easy. Once there and when the sofa was unfolded, do not expect to walk in the "room", it’s impossible (6m² max, including a small closet). No ventilation and inability to open the window, and a noisy heating pipe where high heat escapes which is impossible to resolve. The sound insulation is insufficient between the apartments, especially when the stairwell is taken as a playground. In addition, another room rented by SSamer was occupied by two other guests. So the apartment was shared with 5people including the small bathroom, a hallway-kitchen and hallway-lounge. Talking about the bathroom, it includes the toilet, with problems of flush, a broken tub with a cleanliness limited which depends on the cleanliness of the five residents. The apartment on the ground floor offers no light.
Subway, a super market, a McDonalds and many other fast food are really close to the apartment . Thus, the apartment is recommended for small budget and very short stay.

Ssameer was a great host. He was constantly asking me if I was comfortable.  I really appreciated how warm the apartment was during the really cold week I was there.  The area is great with a supermarket a couple of hundred feet away and all kinds of restaurants.  The train is also down the block!  I definitely recommend his place!

Ssameer was super nice and helpful. He gave us an entire rundown of the neighborhood and getting around the city as soon as we arrived, which was great! The room is tiny but just fine if you´re gonna be walking around the city a lot, like we did. Location is SO convenient! (less than a block away from the subway station) The neighborhood is full of latino families, really colorful...ask Ssameer about the coffee at La Flor de Broadway, you won´t regret it. =)

apt right across from #1 line 
host very helpful with check in / out flexibility
a little bit noisy , but heeey it's the city !!

Didn't have much talk with Ssameer but overall he and his gf were very nice. The house was clean and quiet. The room we lived in was quite small, but I guess for 1 or 2 people, that should be enough.

We checked in at 1:00 in the morning and they had no complaints. I appreciated it a lot.

Thanks for a nice stay. Hope to come back soon.

The room was like the pictures and very clean. The apartment is very close to Metro station. 20 Min to downtown. No hot water for shower though! due to a problem that day,... but everything was perfect!

Took me a while to get around to this, but I have to write this review because Sameer was an awesome host. He was very hospitable with the space and amenities and always inquired cheerfully about our plans for the day. Also, having the subway so near makes this a great location. By the way, if he raves about a restaurant, go there -- his recommendations were spot-on. It was our first trip to New York and our first experience with Airbnb and we couldn't have picked a more helpful, friendly host. 

Would stay with Sameer again!

Staying with Ssameer worked out perfectly. I just needed a place to sleep at night since I was out hanging out with friends and seeing NYC all day.  That's exactly what I got. The room I stayed in was pretty small but was perfect for a single traveler. Wifi let me use my netbook to watch tv before i went to sleep and research activities for the day. Neighbors were occasionally noisy but you have to expect that in an apartment situation. Over all it was an ideal, laid back situation.

Everything was fine...Sameer and Miranda are very nice and easygoing people! Thanks for the trust and the nice time in your place!
Also the appartment is very close to Metro-Station which makes everything very convenient!

Ssameer is a great host.  He’s friendly, provides great local information, was accommodating to requests, and made sure we were comfortable. 

The place is a little small and he provides the bare essentials (towels, sheets, pillows, etc.), but if you are only going to be sleeping there at night, then that works out.  There is a laptop available for use and a fan in each room for the summer months.  

Two big pluses: if you are coming from La Guardia airport, you only need to take one bus (M60), which stops one subway ride from his place. It’s convenient and a lot cheaper compared to riding an airport shuttle and you’ll be using that metro bus pass later anyways.  The other plus is that there is a subway station literally almost right outside his place and the NYC metro is very quick and efficient.  
I would definitely recommend staying here.

Everything was great! Just as expected, as per reviews. Definitley most cleanest, convenient, cheapest place I've stayed in NY, and I have used airbnb 3 times now, plus my standards are high lol and I am a harsh critic. Highly recommended! Thank you Sameer for everything :)

I have to say that it was very pleasant stay. Room was very clean and there is everything in house that you need, including the kitchen in which you can cook. 

Apartment is situated very close to subway, it is less than 3 minutes by walk including traffic lights. Location is safe and good situated if you want to go watch Manhattan. It is about 15-20minutes by subway to Times Squares. Close to the apartment are restaurants, McDonald, Groceries and I did not have problem to get anything to eat at any time during the day or night. 

Ssameer was very kind and told me everything that I needed to know about the location, New York and was very helpful answering any question.

I can fully recommend this place.

Самое подходящее жилье в Нью-Йорке. Недалеко от метро, большого супермаркета и "Макдоналдса".  Если вы приезжаете домой только ночевать, то это место для вас. Район спокойный, можно безопасно гулять ночью. Всяко лучше, чем жить где-нибудь в районе Таймс-сквер. Прикольный рынок утром в субботу в парке рядом.

In general, the location is perfect for tourists who needs to travel by public transportation; The room itself is neat and clean, perfect for people who wants a budget accommodation. Ssameer together with Miranda are just super nice host telling everything you may need for travelling, especially information about good food. :-) I wish to have more time sharing with them, they are passionate about sharing a lot of good experience about the city and if you talk with them, you definitely will feel very happy as they are positively affectionate. I also enjoyed travelling/talking with the other housemates a lot, they are all amazing people in this nice house!

J'ai passé un très bon séjour, la personne qui était présente était très gentille et accueillante. L'appartement est très bien situé et proche de tous commerces et moyens de transport. La chambre est propre et correspond parfaitement à la photo dans l'annonce. Je conseille fortement cette location et je ne manquerais pas d'y loger à nouveau la prochaine fois que j'irais à NY.

My stay was just perfect. The person who was in the appartment was really nice and welcoming. The place is very well located, close to subway and shops. The room was clean and exactly as described. I will definitely recommend this place and stay there the next time I come to NY.

The location is perfect, very close of the subway. The room is like on the pictures, very clean. Ssameer was in vacations but Sally was a really nice host. It was a very good experience. I recommend this place.

Our stay was awesome. Ssameer wasn't there. But Sally was there to answer all of our questions and more. :) I guess we learned lots during our stay: about the city and more important - the people. The place is small but clean and comfortable, especially if you're out to the city for most of your active hours. Great value for the money! 3 mins walk to the subway. Around 20-30 mins by subway to the center of the city etc.  supermarket nearby. Grab your breakfast at the "flower restaurant" next to subway station ;-) The area of the city is dominican/spanish-speaking and seems quite safe, even if walking on the streets in the middle of the night. We are definitely coming back some time. 

房間 有一點小但是乾淨， 主人很有客氣， 地區是拉丁人住的， 算是比較低級， 但是感覺滿安全。 到市中心也不遠， 地鐵站也很近 (2-3分)附近有超市。

Очень удобное место, учитывая стоимость жилья в городе, очень и очень приемлемый компромис между стоимостью и расстоянием до центра города. Вполне согласен с "Йура" :)

Thank you! Everything was perfect! Metro is very close, close to shops and McDonald's, but most importantly - "Flower on Broadway" - a look back there the best cheesecake in New York!)) You will be met Sally - shi will be your mom)))I would stay here again.
Thank you Ssameer
Das Zimmer ist klein und einfach, aber für uns war es perfekt, da wir sowieso den ganzen Tag unterwegs waren. Super ist, dass sich das Bad gleich neben dem Zimmer befindet.
This was a great place to stay. Sally made me feel right at home. She provided everything I needed. This is a great deal for a convenient location in NYC. I would definitely stay there again.

This place was just as advertised.  Its not the Plaza Hotel but it is clean, very conveniently located with a friendly vibe.  One of the best things about the place is Sally who will be your host, your friend and your guide to New York if its your first time visiting.  She's lived in New York for a long time and gives excellent advice about where to go.  The only reason I'm not giving it a 5 star rating is that, like I said, its not the Plaza:)
location is good, safe close to subway. sally is really great host. i'd spent 4 days and tottaly enjoyed it.

We spend 4 days in New York city in Ssameer apartment. We had a great time and find everything we wanted in this apartment room. The room was as described on the photo and our host Sally was really helpful during these days. You should consider this apartment if you visit NYC because it's really close to the subway line and make the trip more convenient.

Clean, quiet, comfortable & easy access to public transportation.
Sally is a great host. I truly appreciate her helps and kindness.
Thanks a lot Sameer!

The the area and room was better than expected! Very happy to see the apartment in on the first floor. Sally did a great job at hosting and gave a lot of insight on NYC. Bathroom was very clean, wifi worked great, plenty of linens, very clean and accommodating. Very cozy. Quiet neighborhood.  Would definitely stay here again!
A nice place really close to the subway station. Cozy room with adequate space. Able to use kitchen and appliances too.
Decent room at a great price. Just 1/2 block from #1 metro stop at 137th ST. Great Dominican food in area. Nice host. Definitely would recommend this one.
The location is convenient, very close to the subway station. Sally is a great host. She is very knowledgeable about the tourist sites in NYC, and she gave me many helpful advices.
Chambre et appart ok. Grand placard pour les fringues. Proximité transports et commerces. Hôte très accueillant et super sympa. N'hésitez pas!!
Excellent deal for crazy NYC. . I meet follow international Travelers while there just for three nights that I now consider friends.  Thanks Ssameer !
Apart from not being able to pull the bed down and the rooom being so cold, Sally was great, and The location was awesome. I would def stay again though.

The apartment is clean and safe. on occasion I would like to stay one more day in the apartment, but at the time the agenda was packed, then sally helped me to find another place to stay. So if the calendar is full no chance to stay one more day at least. but otherwise the experience was almost perfect! Highly recommended! Thank you. Angelo from Rio de Janeiro.

Hello,

I stayed in Sameer's house for three days. It is pretty close to subway and in calm neighbourhood. The house is not prefect but good. The positive point of the house is the presence of a lade, named Sally. She is so kind, informative and hospitable. You can get lots of useful information about the City of New York from her.

Enjoy from being in New York.
Ssameer wasn't around, but Sally took great care of us! She is very helpful and kind. The private room is exactly as described: small, but quiet and great value for money!

Nous avons été bien accueillis par Sally, Ssameer n'était pas là. Nous avions un trousseau de clef personnel. Nous pouvions être indépendants, ce qui est primordial.
D'autres personnes logeaient dans l'appartement via airbnb, dans une autre chambre.
Nous logions dans une chambre individuelle, petite. Nous avions peu de place pour ranger nos affaires. La chambre et la salle de bain étaient moyennement propres.
L'appartement était proche du métro qui nous amenait au centre de Manhattan.
Nous étions peu à l'appartement car New York est une grande ville et nous voulions en profiter un maximum.
Le prix de location de l'appartement de Ssameer est très abordable. Pour le même prix, voire plus, nous aurions eu un hôtel miteux à New York.
La cuisine, le frigo et la salle de bain étaient collectifs. Il s'agissait plus d'une vie en communauté.

Nous sommes contents de notre expérience. 
Bien que nous arions aimé avoir un peu plus d'intimité, nous avons pu profiter de l'appartement, des magasins alentour (pharmacie, alimentation) et de la proximité du métro.

Ssameers place is a great place for barebones, cheap, fairly comfortable accommodation. The room was a little dingy and had a weird smell (sage or something?) that both my boyfriend and I seemed to be allergic to, but the bathroom was spotlessly clean.  The woman taking care of his place, Sally, was really helpful, especially when I got a stomach bug while there (she really mothered me and was so sweet). All in all, it was perfect for what we needed and you won't find a better deal in NYC. I would recommend it to fellow travelers.

Sally was a great host. She was very knowledgable about the NYC area and I enjoyed her very much! The apartment was everything the listing states. My room was very tiny but practical furnished. I just needed a place to rest my head after having a busy day in NY. 
and was happy for the close subway. I didnt meet Sameer but Sally was more than I needed as a host. She was so nice and it was a pleasure to talk to her about everything

My short stay in Ssameer's home was awesome. Sally knows how to welcome guests and help them enjoying their time in NY. The room is small but comfortable. The apartment is close to a metro entrance and it's really easy to go downtown.

We came from London and stayed for 3 nights in June and really liked it!
The room was relatively small but the area was really nice as you're in the heart of Harlem. 
Sally let us in and was so helpful, the perfect host!

Overall, enjoyed our stay.
The location is very good, close to the subway and bus. There are many bars around and a huge market. Sally is very kind, telling us a lot about NY and art. We had a happy week there.

Great location, super close to the metro, it's ideal if you want to visit New York for cheap. Sally, who is the hostess (Ssameer is not there) is very nice and really helpful. The room is tiny but convenient. It's pretty clean and there is a fan in a room (which saved our lives when we were there since it was extremely hot outside).

Sally is a great host who knows all you want possibly know about New York, United Stated and life in general. The apartment is really close to the subway so it helps you enjoy NY and get to know the less popular side of Manhattan as well.

De passage 4 jours à New-York pour visiter, j'ai beaucoup apprécié l'accueil de Sandy, qui est de très bon conseil et qui peut parler très correctement le français, ce qui m'a été bien utile...
A recommander
Très bon accueil par Sally et emplacement de l'appartement très pratique pour visiter tout New York (au pied du métro).
La ubicación del apartamento es buena para hacer turismo en Manhattan. La limpieza y seguridad también y la hospitalidad de la persona encargada de entregar y recibir las llaves fue excelente.

You'll probably be staying with Sally who was really welcoming and super interesting to have a conversation with. Overall a great place to stay literally a minute from the subway, but do be aware that the room is relatively small and basic.
Great location, close to the subway! Otherwise you get what you pay for. It is a cheap way to discover New York, but if cleanliness is your top priority, look for something else.

The room is rather small but is really well located (next to the subway and supermarket) and you're in NY ...you probably don't plan on staying in the apartment that long anyway. Sally was a really great host and helped us a lot when my friend's backpack got lost. Also, we left in the late afternoon and it was no problem to store our luggage in the aparment. All in all, you get what you pay for but in my opinion it's all you need to explore Manhattan.

The location was good, close to the city with great metro and bus connections and convenient in every way. The apartment was cozy and had a nice & relaxed atmosphere, thanks to Sally who was a very helpful and fun host, we had a great time. The smaller room is very small and not that comfortable in hot weather (however, there was partially air conditioning), it wasn't that clean either, the place actually doesn't quite look like in the photos. But the cool atmosphere & phantastic price make up for that and I enjoyed my stay.

Ssamers apartment is very good located. Just a few minutes walk to subway and you can be on Times Square in about 15 min. The neighborhood is safe, we didn't have any problems.
We didn't meet Ssamer but Sally. She is a really great host. She gave us some very good tips where to visit good spots and how to get there. She took the time to show us on Internet or on a map. 
The room is very tiny for 2 people but it is enough when you only need a space to sleep at night. 
The apartment and especially the bathroom and kitchen could have been cleaner. 
If you are looking for a cheap place just to sleep it is ok!

It was my first experience with Airbnb and I'm glad I could stay 3 nights at Ssameers apartment. It takes quite a long time to get there from JFK by public transportation, but otherwise the location is perfect - 1 min from subway (a few minutes to Manhattan); grocery and fastfoods nearby; safe. 
There was a rather small room with sofa bed for 2 people, clean (shared) bathroom and kitchen - as shown in the pictures.
You probably wont meet Ssameer there, but Sally. She's a perfect host. So friendly and willing to help with anything.
Thank you! Thumb up :)

I stayed at Ssameer's place with my best friend this November. We didn't meet Ssameer, but his roommate Sally was there to greet us. She is a really nice person and she really knows her way around town. Our room was a little small and the place, exspecially the kitchen, could have been cleaner, but other than that it was a good first Airbnb-experience. The place is very close to the subway, which will bring you right downtown. I would stay here again for a night or two.

For the price, it was amazing. Close to the subway, nice neighborhood, decent bed, and incredibly cheap. However, there was an occasional loud clanking from the pipe that runs through the room. Not the best thing when trying to sleep in a strange place. 

And the apartment is pretty dingy; probably most people I know would have been disgusted. But my husband and I are not easily grossed out, so it was fine for us. 

"Ssameer" was not there, but Sally was a delight to talk with and, since she knows and loves the city so well, a wonderful resource. 

Oh, and if you want a wash cloth that is not old and stained, bring your own.

I had a great stay at Ssameer's place but it's definitely not for everybody so know what you're getting into.

The good: Sally lives there and is great company and the best thing about the place. She knows NYC very well and is always a pleasure to speak with. Location is very good and extremely convenient to the subway and local grocery shopping and dining. Perfect location to explore NYC from. The price is very reasonable. The kitchen is fully-functional and you can save money by cooking.

The rest: you get what you pay for. The building and neighborhood are both fine, but the flat itself is a wreck. The super hasn't been in to paint or do repairs in over a decade and it looks like it's been a hard decade of partying in this place. The pictures on AirBNB look to be several years out-of-date; it's much shabbier now. Sally has cleared pathways through Ssameer's clutter so it's functional but everyday it's like waking up in a squat where there was a huge rave the night before. The electrical switches and outlets are missing cover plates, the floor while clean isn't one you want to walk on barefoot, and there are just mountains of stuff everywhere even bulging out in the closet in the guest room. Again, fine for what it is: an inexpensive crash pad. Great for a guy or two to explore NYC on the cheap but don't bring your girlfriend and don't even think of bringing a young child due to the dangerous electrical situation.

Also, learn from my experience and do NOT park on the street. Sally and Ssameer will both tell you to do so and they are correct that it's technically "free" to park on the streets but it was a major hassle and ended up costing me $230. Absolute best case: you'll spend 1-2 frustrating hours 4 or more times a week moving your car and prowling the neighborhood (I had multiple tours of everything between 130th and 160th) fighting all the locals for the few remaining spots before street cleaning times. More likely case: if you have out-of-town plates you'll find tickets on your car just for parking the same way that the locals do (which they seem to be immune to). My advice would be to just pay the $18 per day in the garage on 153rd street. If you can't afford $18 per day just don't bring your car into the city because you definitely can't afford the tickets from the "free" parking on the street. You've been warned!
Another good stay, this is my second so obviously I liked it. Longer review on my first stay.
Ne vous référez ni aux photos ni aux commentaires positifs.

Ssameer wasn't there, but Sally was and she knows EVERYTHING! Neighbor hood was safe and very convenient to the train and bus. Go eat at Flor de Broadway, it's right down the road. Food is great and cheap!!

My son and I enjoyed a hassle free stay at Ssameers place. It was as described, and may not suit everyone, but was just fine for us. Sally was an awesome host, who made us feel at home right away. She is very easy going, and only only expects common sense and decency in return. Very much like visiting a favourite aunt. We were lucky with parking, finding a place right out front, used the subways otherwise. Only had to move the car  on weekday mornings for an hour or so. Lots to do and see in the area while doing so .Affordable, friendly, safe and easy to get to where  you want to go while in NY, this is a place worth checking out.

Very pleasant stay. Ssameer is very flexible when I showed up later due to delays. Subway is only 1 block away, very convenient to get to anywhere in NYC. I would recommend and come back again when Im in NYC again.

I had a very mixed stay at this apartment. Sally had broken her back and Ssameer was travelling which meant no one was at the apartment when I arrived at 1am and I had to spend the night at a local motel. The next day I had to go to Sally's hospital on the first day of my trip in order to collect keys for the apartment to get in. When we were able to access the apartment, it was extremely dirty with very dirty floors and dirty dishes in the sink. There was also a dog which no one had warned us about. 

After we managed to clean the apartment, it was a much more habitable environment but a disappointing way to be greeted. Again these factors were no fault of Sally or Ssameer. Its major advantages are it's very close to the subway and the 1 train is extremely convenient for travelling into Manhattan. 

After communication with Ssameer, he was prepared to offer me a $60 refund which was disappointing considering the hassle I went through with the apartment but at this point I'd like this to just be resolved.
Nothing to add

Me encató quedarme en la casa donde vive Sally & Zorro. Super buena ubicación, buenos restaurantes donde se come bien y barato y a dos estaciones de la Universidad de Columbia. Sally me estuvo dando unas clases de pronunciación en inglés y conversamos sobre muchas cosas, desde Borges hasta las políticas de reciclaje en New York.  encanto de mujer :) 
El lugar es lo que promete ser. Y la compañía es mejor aún.

Sally, the host, was really nice with me all the time. She knows really well the city and she gave me good tips. The room is really simple there is a bed a wardrobe and a lamp. The house is really well located, very close to the subway stop and you can reach the city center in 20 minutes.

Een week verbleven in het appartement van Ssammeer. Ssammeer was er zelf niet, maar we zijn ontzettend goed ontvangen door Sally. We hebben veel tips van haar ontvangen wat erg fijn was! Het appartement was prima voor het bedrag dat we moesten betalen. Aanrader!

OLÁ!!!Eu realmente me senti bem na casa do Ssameer,fiquei em um quarto que não era o mostrado aqui,mas que era aconchegante e tranquilo para se ter um bom sono!Entrava e saia do apartamento quantas vezes fossem necessário,e meu quarto sempre estava da mesma maneira que eu deixava,super confiável!Adorei a localização,muito perto da estação de metro,e para mim ali funcionava a melhor linha de metro para pontos turísticos.Ele não estava no apartamento mas la estava uma anfitriã que me foi muito receptiva e conversamos muito,me deu dicas de compras,de passeios e era super alegre!Obrigado pela recepção,voltarei a NEW YORK sempre...pra mim um dos melhores lugares do mundo!!!SÉRGIO TRAUTMAN.

I guess it is a typical New York apartment. As the majority of the previous guests said Ssameer wasn't there, but Sally was. She is very nice host and knows a lot about the city, among other things. Subway is very nearby. Apartment is well located.

Well, basically all the thing described by the hundreds of reviews below :) Don't want to repeat them all.

El vecindario es muy tranquilo y seguro, tuvimos que esperar un poco porque Sally no estaba, solo que no vimos un correo donde nos avisaba, de todas formas nos dio tiempo para ir a Time Square, muy cerca en metro. Después de que conocimos a Sally y Zorro (el perrito) quedamos muy contentos, Sally es muy amable y super amigable, nos dio varios tips para conocer bien NY. El cuarto es lo que promete, una cocina muy pequeña pero nada que no se pueda reparar con una buena compañía. No hubo ningún problema para estacionar el carro, así que si van en coche es un buen lugar.

I went to New York for 4 days ,so I stay at Ssameer hosuse. Sally is my host ,she's very very very nice and very kind. So now I'm talking about Ssameer house. 

Saameer place is small apartment and I got a front room of that apartment. It's a tiny room ,but it's enough to staying for 2 peoples (no air conditioning).

You have to share a kitchen and bathroom with 3-5 peoples (Sally /Sally's son /other guest) but that's not bad at all. 

A bathroom is not clean at all but it's not bad. 

If you looking for a very cheap room in New York and easy to travelling you can choose this one. Because it's very close Metro subway (red line #1)

For voyager /traveller /backpacker. This place is good for you guys. But you looking for a big room ,beautiful view ,good facilities I think you should try to find another place such as a hotel and you have to pay double or triple money for that place. It's very expensive.

Quand je suis arrivée, j'ai été accueillie par Sally, une dame charmante, gentille et qui respecte complètement l'indépendance des gens. Ssameer est le propriétaire surement mais n'est jamais présent. 
La chambre est petite mais l'accès libre à la salle de bain et à la cuisine compense largement ! Sally est vraiment super agréable, elle connaît beaucoup de choses, c'est un plaisir de discuter avec elle (et son fils quand il est là!). L'appartement est en rez-de-chaussée, très pratique quand on est chargé !

Ssameer rents out the room for the duration of your stay but you will never actually see him. Sally is the one you interact with and the one who helps you out. She's very generous and knowledgable. She provided some advice for our time in the city and on the east coast. Thanks!
I was not greeted by Samer but Sally. Sally was very welcoming. The bedroom isn't great, but as for i am concerned it was enough. In short, it was nice.
she is very nice,she helps me a lot,i feel so lucky to meet her!God bless her!
I had a very good time wt/ Ssameer, he gave us a lot tip for taking subway, and he's very kind and hospitable! The place is convenience. Subway, market and McDonald's are just nearby!

The place was everything we could ask for.  It was super easy to get around and everyone was so helpful with every question we had.  We felt super safe and truly welcomed.  From
Now on every time I go to New York I hope to stay here.

Summed up: this place is a cheap room that's relatively close to Manhattan and very close to the 1 train. That was exactly what I was looking for so this place worked out well for me.

What to expect: You won't see much of SSameer, but there is a woman Sally that lives in the apartment and she is there pretty much all the time. Sleeps in the main room. The room that you sleep in is small but clean, and has a lock on the door which I appreciated. The rest of the apartment not as clean, mostly due to a small dog that lives there. There are wee-wee pads spread out on the floor around the apartment so if you're squeamish about dogs and their urine, this might be a problem. Additionally, there were 2 people staying in another room in the back. This means 5 people sharing one bathroom, which can be problematic. The bed itself if a futon, with ikea-type folding frame thing. Not very comfortable but at these prices I wasn't expecting luxury.

All and all, it's an affordable room. It will not enhance a vacation experience. But if you just need a cheap place to sleep in an expensive city and don't mind the hostel like environment, it does the trick.
Sameer was very accommodating and nice! I heart NY!

I was welcomed by my host on the night I arrived. He was friendly and I enjoyed talking to him (and Sally the other person staying there). The room was comfortable. I sleep very well on the bed. The location was perfect for traveling anywhere in the city. The subway was very close and the neighborhood safe. I would use this rental again.

Ssameer is nice and kind. He always reply message quickly. We got no problem to find this place and got many tips from him. The apartment's location is absolutely great(walk 3mins to 1 train). Room just like the photo: a futon bed and a closet. The kitchen and fridge you can use. Shower is ok but I took a bath one night which is awesome. There is a small dog in the apartment. Overall this is a good place for us to stay in NYC.
We stayed for 10 days! we had a great time! unfortunately we shared little with Ssamer! But he was very welcoming! Sally is fantastic!
Ssameer was really cool, and the front room was small, but cozy and comfortable. It was just what I needed.

Ssameer was very friendly and gave us helpful tips to getting around town, and referred us to a delicious Pizzeria.The location is PERFECT! Neighborhood is safe and and literally 2 minutes away from a variety of food stops including a McDonald's. The room was enough for 2 ppl. We basically would just sleep there so we hardly saw Ssameer. I would definitely consider his place again!
our second time at Sameer's apartment, so it's clear that we liked it. good location, 5 minutes from the subway, cheap area with good food and Sameer's always ready to recommend something!
Ssameer was a good host, gave me lots of tips on where to go while in the city.  I was glad I brought my laptop (almost didn't) as there was no TV.

My first visit to NYC wouldn't have been so great if I didn't have such a great and helpful host! Ssameer has some awesome tips on how to travel in the city, where to get tasty food specially pizza. Last but not the least, great conversations at home makes the house a very warm place to be. Btw the house is very clean all the time!!
This was a great place to stay in. Ssameer was friendly & helpful, the place is super-close to a subway station & grocery store, & I felt safe at all times.
