Ich war für 10 Nächte bei Ssameer zu Gast. Ich wurde herzlich empfangen und habe mich richtig wohl gefühlt. Ssameer ist großartig, und er hat jede Menge tolle Infos über NYC. Das Zimmer ist genau wie beschrieben, einfach perfekt. Die Lage ist auch super. Die Subway ist nur ca. 200m von der Wohnung entfernt, und in ein paar Minuten ist man damit direkt im Zentrum von Manhattan. Ich freu mich schon auf den nächten NYC-Trip, dann natürlich wieder bei Ssameer :-)

This was my first experience with airbnb & I am happy to report that I felt very comfortable & taken care of. Saamir is a superb host & I felt as though I were visiting a trusted friend or cousin. Nice neighborhood, comfortable futon in clean & private room. Affordable food near by.

Wir haben während unserer USA Reise fünf Tage in NYC bei Ssameer übernachtet. Er hat uns sehr nett zu Hause empfangen und auf uns gewartet, obwohl wir erst sehr spät angekommen sind. Schon vor der Anreise hat Ssameer Infos zur Anreise gesendet, vor Ort konnten wir dann noch mehr Ideen bezüglich unserer Unternehmungen in NYC austauschen. 
Während unseres Aufenthaltes waren noch andere Gäste in Ssameers Wohnung, dies war aber kein Problem, da wir viel unterwegs waren. 
Wir haben uns bei Ssameer sehr wohl gefühlt und danken ihm für seine Freundlichkeit.

We stayed at Ssameer's apartment in NYC for five nights during our trip to the USA.  He welcomed us at his house even though we arrived very late. Ssameer sent us infos even before we arrived and provided even more ideas for things to do in NYC once we were there. 
While we stayed at his apartment, other people stayed with Ssameer as well. This wasn't a problem though, since we were out a lot. 
We felt very comfortable at his apartment and are very grateful for his friendliness.
Trip was great! Everything was as we agreed.. Great location and the place is really nice!

We had a very nice trip to NYC thanks to Ssameer. We arrived late but he was there to greet us and give some tips. The room was exactly as depicted so you wont have any bad surprises. I would recommand to anyone traveling to NYC on a budget.
Ssameer was a great host! He was very welcoming and accommodating towards our needs & also offered great ways to get around the city.

We stayed 6 days at Ssameer flat. We enjoyed a lot, the subway station is just 2 blocks away. Ssameer is a very nice person, He gave us many tips about food, shops and transport. I will come back soon. Thanks a lot.

We had a great time in NYC at his place, I highly recommend this place. The proximity to the grocery store and subway line to the apartment was fantastic. That was the best part of this place. So glad we spent our money here instead of a corporate hotel. Great "local" lifestyle feel

We stayed at Ssameers place for 6 days and had a really good time. The apartment is perfectly located close to the subway, the room is clean though small, the bed is comfortable and the wifi works well. Ssameer is super nice and outgoing and will give you lots of information and great advice on where to eat, what to see and do in the city. We would definitely stay here again!

Sameer foi um ótimo host, nos recebeu bem e se mostrou muito prestativo, oferecendo muitas dicas sobre a cidade, principalmente sobre onde comer. Se mostrou receptivo e caloroso e se dispôs a nos ajudar com tudo, até mesmo deu dicas de culinária. O quarto é pequeno mas não chega a ser desconfortável, a casa fica em um lugar bom, com mercado, lugares para comer e metrô próximos, e possui uma vizinhança tranquila e segura.
Perfect !

Trip was very agreeable, helpful, and knowledgeable of New York. The room was sparse, but all we needed for sleeping. I can't remember if it's advertised in the listing or not, but the apartment does not have AC. There is a fan in the room though. 
Bring your own toiletries. Linens (towels and sheets) provided.
This place was pretty fine. The back up friend instead of the host did me really well. Wifi is well available. Metro is near.
Le logement est bien situé avec des commerces et métro à proximité, il est bien climatisé et nous avons été très bien reçu. Idéal pour passer quelques jour sur NY pour pas chère.

The place is cool. It is enough space for two persons and it is clean. Also you only need about 2 minutes to the subways and there are also bars and supermarkets close to the apartment.  I can only recommend it!

This place is really nice and the host is so friendly and tell us a lot of useful information. The location is unbeatable, close to the subway station and a supermarket just next to it. We do have a very good time here, thanks so much!

Logement très correct, chambre de petite taille, mais très suffisante pour nous qui ne restions que très peu à l'appartement. L'appartement est bien situé, au pied du métro, ligne très bien desservie, directe pour times square.
Very nice and cheap stay in Harlem Manhattan
Location, location, location. Great choice! Apartment was clean and comfy, price - quality ratio is unbeatable.
It's a nice place and it was perfect for my budget, it's near the subway and it's quiet in the morning, so there's no problem if you had a busy night and want to sleep more in the morning

The apartment is located in a good neighborhood and has metro in a 3 minute walking distance. To get to Time Square takes 20 min, to Downtown - about 40 min.
The room has a very small size (as in the picture in description) and has a small dressing room. Very flexible check-in and check-out time. 
The appartment has 3 bedroom and a living room. All bedrooms are rented. We didn't meet Ssameer. Apartment has a very reasonable price.

The room in Ssameer’s apartment was just everything we needed for our visit to New York City. The location is great (subway is just 1 minute away, supermarket with great variety 1 minute away… - we liked the neighborhood and felt save at any time).
Unfortunately we didn’t meet Ssameer, but the communication was always great and friendly - before and during the stay! He is answering questions right away and even gave us tips for our USA-trip before getting to our last travel destination New York City - thank you again :) 
Mitra, who welcomed us, was very friendly, helpful and the communication was very good, too. 
The price-performance ratio for Ssameer’s place is very fair.
Enjoyed my stay at Ssameer's.The place is as described and the neighborhood is very  practical with many amenities.
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Excellent flat. As advertised
i didn't meet Ssameer but i met Hang who was friendly and helped me with everything, Ssameer always was available by mail and the apartment is cozy and clean, i spent a great time there.

Since I've already stayed at Ssameer's a few years ago I decided to do it again. It was exactly like I remembered it. This time Ssameer was abroad but I could always get in contact with him online if necessary. Also, his flatmate Hang was there - a very nice, pleasant and helpful girl. I am a person that is very organized and plans everything so I suppose it can sometimes be a really demanding person that asks l (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) ts of question. Both Ssameer and Hang never lost their patience. Ssameer knows everything about the city and can give you great advice about where to go, that to see etc.

I stayed in the front room again - there is a day sofa and you also have a tiny closet in that room. The apartment is located in Harlem, I felt safe there. It's not a very noisy neighbourhood (no busy street), the subway station (City College) is 2 minutes away. You can go straight to Midtown (42nd Street) without having to change trains, and it doesn't take a lot of time either. There is a McDonalds, a small supermarket as well as a laundry center right around the corner.

I really can recommend stayin' at Ssameer's.

The room was as good as advertised. The location was very accessible through Laguardia, and the instructions on how to get there (through the listing) was spot on.  Ssameer was not in town at that time but he made sure that everything was arranged for my stay. And even then, I was in contact with him through chat and gave useful tips and places to go around the city. Overall it was a pleasant experience and I would highly recommend his place.
everything was good! the price is ok for this place. Not so far from the city center, but not so clean, by the way.

The location is nice. 1 min walk from line 1 subway station (137st). The flat is ok. The room is small, but exactly as shown in the picture. Worth noting that there is no a.c. in the bed room. There is a small fan though. Good value for those who plan to be out most of the time and want to be in manhattan

The location is great: metro station, supermarket, McDonald's all within a few steps walk. Trip was not there during my stay but his friend was very kind. The neighborhood is also very safe. I had a good time here. :)
I had a great stay at this apartment in West Harlem. The room is NYC small but can fit 2 people if you pack lightly. Checkin/checkout was great.
Very good location and nice flat
連絡などチェックインもスムーズでした。チェックアウトなど融通聞いてくれた。部屋が汚い。嫌な匂いがする。人を泊めるのだからもう少し掃除してほしい。

The room was just as advertised. The futon bed was actually comfortable and the apartment was clean. Trip and Hang are very hospitable and put in some time to talk to me during my stay. It's very close to public transportation . Trip will give you great advise on how to reduce your commute time and how to use the express trains. Definitely recommended for something affordable and a place to stay if you're visiting the city. It's a little North Manhattan but it super accessible via train so no worries for those coming back from a late night out.
Goede locatie, gemakkelijk te bereiken, gastvrouw was erg vriendelijk. Kleine kamer, met een raam en 2 kastjes. Prima voor de prijs dat betaald word.

Trip is a great host. The place is as described. Great value for your buck. But it's not a 5 star hotel... If you are the fancy type, you might want to look for something else. Otherwise, I'd recommend it for sure. I was there for a weekend conference at City College and would go back to Trip's place if I need to go back in that area.
Tripさんはこの家には住んでいません。 違う女性の家族がここの家の予約など管理されているようです。
A small room with a double cot. Nothing fancy but very close to the subway and easily accessible. Worth the money.

Trip and his roommate Hang were very nice hosts. Their place is very close to the 1 train. It's in a residential and commercial neighborhood, near City College.  Know that the room and kitchen are small though, so if you need space this may not be the place for you. Overall, I'd recommend Trip's place to travelers that want a cheap and simple place to stay near the train with a friendly host.

We met Ssameer just a few minutes at our Check in. He seemed more than friendly and helpful. Also he was very flexibel and answered questions very fast. 
I am sorry to mention this but the kitchen and the bathroom were not clean partially. Our room was clean. 
Also the heater and his roommates were very loud during the night but this is definitly not Ssameers fault.
Anyway we enjoyed our stay.

I warmly recommend Sameer's appartement ! My stay there was ideal and I greatly enjoyed both the perfect location of the place ( a few minutes away from the metro), and the kindness of my host. Ssameer welcomed me even though I arrived way earlier than the expected hour, and was always very considerate and helpful ! A perfect stay.

Excelente ubicación a un par de cuadras del subte 1 !!!
Tenés un supermercado a una cuadra, podés cocinar en el dpto así que abaratás más aún los costos.
Tranquilo, seguro para caminar, incluso un día volvimos cerca de las 0:00 y no nos sentimos inseguros para nada.
Es modesto y el cuarto es muy pequeño, más de lo que aparenta en las fotos pero es limpio y está muy bien para el precio que pide.
Además la atención fue muy amable.
Muy recomendable si querés gastar poco y estar a un toque de cualquier lado a través del transporte público. 
Sí van a estar 6 o 7 días conviene sacar una tarjeta de metro (metrocard) ilimitada por 7 días (u$33) que sirve también para los colectivos.
Cheap price. Close to downtown and metro. Very nice host :)

This space is not for someone that needs to be pampered. Rather it's for someone that's looking to spend time out in the city and needs a comfortable place to sleep. 

The room is small as mentioned. But it's just what a single traveler needs. It's located right by the front door and next to the bathroom, which I found to be very convenient. I didn't feel like I was in the hosts way. 

The host was very available for any questions or needs. 

The location is a very short walk to the 1 train and a 10 minute walk to the B/C lines. The neighborhood was great. Great deli spots, pharmacy, laundry, bars, and grocery all within walking distance. I would definitely stay here again.

일단 역과 엄청나게 가깝습니다. 뉴욕에 위치한 대부분의 랜드마크가 1호선과 가까이 있는데 타고 아래로 내려가기만 하면 센트럴파크,자유여신상,월스트리트,타임스퀘어 등을 보실수 있고
할렘가라고 해서 위험하다고 생각하시는 분도 많고 저도 걱정했었는데, 의외로 구석진곳에 있는게 아니라 큰 도로에 문이 있습니다. 가끔 밤에 돌아다니면 말거는 사람들 있는데 음식 구걸하는 착한 거지거나 노래틀어놓고 같이 춤추자고 하는 사람들 정도? 그래도 안심하라는 뜻은 아니니 어딜가서든 조심하시는 것이 좋습니다. 숙소 바로 아래로 조금 걷다보면 푸드마켓있고 요리할수 있는 공간 있고 방이 좀 낡긴 했지만 오래 살것도 아니고 침대가 편해서 괜찮습니다.
많이 이용하세요 ㅋㅋ 주인아저씨도 되게 좋은 사람입니다 코트도 빌려주고
The couch is very comfortable!

Ssameer is a wonderful host. I stayed at the location on 138th street. Ssameer welcomed me personally and gave me useful tips about restaurants and places to explore in NYC city, and in Hamilton Heights in particular. The room was tidy and comfortable to sleep in; the kitchen, bathroom, and living area were very also clean and well kept. I was given keys to the apartment as soon as I arrived and was free to access it anytime I wanted. Ssameer responded promptly whenever I messaged him over phone. He was very friendly and kind. Though I am very familiar with much of Manhattan, this was my first real introduction to the borough north of 125th street, and I really enjoyed staying in the Hamilton Heights neighborhood. It's a vibrant and colorful neighborhood, with many nice places to eat at walking distance, and the beautiful St. Nicholas Park and the City College campus architecture in close vicinity. The 1 train is also just mere feet away from the apartment, making it very easy to get anywhere in the city. 

I would highly recommend this room and Ssameer to others. 

Thank you, Ssameer.

Trip wasn't there for my stay however Hong his housemate was and she was very hospitable and helped me settle into NYC Decent place to crash for a very reasonable price.. close to the 1 line and quiet,safe suburb. I'd stay again..

It's a bit far from Downtown, but the subway is really close, and easy to get anywhere. I haven't met with Trip, but his flatmate is really friendly, she was helping with everything, and it was very nice to talk to her. The apartment is small, but there's everything, what you need. I recommend it to everyone.
Awesome place to stay close to the subway line and walkable to the Yankee stadium!

L'accueil fut cordial et aimable. Par contre le logement était dans un état lamentable: odeur de renfermé,  peu de luminosité. Les sanitaires étaient dans un état déplorable. Je les nettoyais tous les jours tellement l'état était dégueulasse: poussière,  cheveux partout (sol, baignoire, lavabo, miroir), abattant des WC abîmé. Il y avait même des cafards. J'en ai ramassé un qui est resté mort dans le couloir de l'entrée  2 jours durant, aux yeux de tous. Moi qui comptais prendre de temps en temps le petit déjeuner à l'appartement, l'état de la cuisine m'en a dissuadé. Quel stress! Cela ne me donnait absolument pas envie de rester à l'intérieur. Certes le logement est très bien situé,  mais je ne recommande pas ce logement dépourvu d'hygiène et de propreté. Surtout pour le prix payé...
Good localization
Very easy to get around. One block from train. Surrounded by every store imaginable.

Die Unterkunft ist super gelegen direkt an der Metro-Haltestelle. Man ist schnell in Down Town. Der Preis ist für die Größe des Zimmers sehr gut. Leider können diese Vorteile nicht über deutliche Mängel in der Sauberkeit hinwegtäuschen.
Trip was very friendly and helpful and his place is in a convenient location near the subway.
Trip was very flexible and accommodating!
Esta bueno pero pudiera ser  más (Website hidden by Airbnb) agua fría ni micro ave pero bueno la atención personal fue muy  buena.

I’ll begin by saying, “you get what you pay for”. Our room had no AC, there was trash in it when we arrived, and we weren’t confident that our linens and towels were clean. In addition, the WiFi was out, but it wasn’t a big deal because we were gone all day/night. Probably wouldn’t stay again unless significant improvements were made. This place would be okay for a place to crash for one night.

I had such a great time and pleasure staying with Teri. This place is a gem in New York, clean and neat, walking distance to all the trendy restaurants in Harlem, and most important of all, the place is warm and welcoming. Teri is a sweet and charming host; She is a lovely friend to talk to and connects to her guest from her heart.

Giving it My FFF +++ :)
Even though maybe I shouldn't because I should keep it a secret ;)
Friendly (as in welcoming, good kind person)
Fresh (as in Clean) & 
Freedom (as in feeling at home) 
I'll stay with Teri ANYtime again! As a matter of fact I wanted to book another stay right away, but  to my dismay, but not to my surprise it wasn't available! Until next time!
Great host for my first time in the city. Lives in a bustling area just a minute's walk from a supermarket, entertainment and the A train; 10 minutes walk from Columbia University.

What can I say about Teri and her perfect pad in buzzing Harlem without seeming like I'm gushing! Teri is full of gorgeous and positive energy, and so generous in the giving of her time, advice and local tips. 

The bedroom is incredibly spacious, and Teri's home is a warm reflection of the interesting and beautiful person that she is. It's situated so close to the subway, that you can be downtown Manhattan in a flash or alternatively, hang out in Harlem at the great cafes, bars and other night spots. 

I can't wait to catch up with Teri next time I'm in NYC!

Unbelievable! I haven't been in that area in a while, and the description was spot-on: it IS the best area in Harlem and I had an absolute blast. The apartment was clean, Teri was amazingly accommodating, friendly and just a beautiful person to be around, and the area offered more than I had time to explore. Just book it-it will be the best experience.

I was really impressed with the friendliness of Teri and the surrounding neighbourhood.  Her home was warm, artistic and comfortable.  She made me feel welcome and like I was a friend and not just a guest.  Thanks so much Teri and all the best on your future adventures.

Teri is charming for sure and just awesome overall.  The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable.  The neighborhood is also very welcoming with sidewalk cafes, nice restaurants and cool places to get a drink and listen to music within just a few blocks.  Teri's recommendations for local restaurants and coffee shops were all great.  For runners, you can start a run in nearby Morningside Park and then connect to Central Park -- you are just 10 blocks north of Central Park.  Getting around is also easy as there are subway stops just a few blocks north and south.  Columbia University and CCNY are both within walking distance.  Highly recommended.

Teri is a great and welcoming host. The place is exactly as described. Its clean and neat and the location is great. There is a large closet for storing your clothing.
The apartment is quiet although you can hear the street, which really just means "New York" to me.
Fredrick Douglass Ave has a lot of restaurants, Morningside park and Columbia is a short walk. The 125 street subway stop is very close and have lots of options including express lines that will take you anywhere in Manhattan end beyond. 
I would stay there again and I recommend others to do the same

I Absolutely loved staying here for 1 month! Teri is super friendly and easy to get along with. The apartment is clean, comfortable and in an amazing location, with the Express and local trains very close on 125th St. There is also an internal laundry, which was a nice surprise as this can be hard to find in nyc. The neighbourhood is safe and I wouldn't hesitate to stay with Teri again :)
Teri was a delightful host, and the apartment was pretty much perfect for my needs. Nice area, with places to eat and a really nice supermarket nearby. I had a great time!

Staying with Teri was great. 
Harlem is a really interesting neighborhood to explore and everything I needed, like restaurants, grocery stores and coffee shops, were nearby the flat. 
A Metro station is also close by, so I was very fast in other parts of town.
The flat was clean and nicely decorated, my room was big, the bed comfortable.
Teri is such a nice and helpful person, I felt very welcome during my stay.
I would definitely stay there again!

Me and my wife were traveling in the USA on Christmas and Teri is one of the greatest people we have ever met. The room was very comfortable in a very good neighborhood with shops and restaurants. So it was a big luck to be Teri's guest.

Teri is a fantastic, generous host who goes out of her way to make you feel welcome in New York! The apartment is wonderful and so is the area. Cafes and restaurants are just outside the door, there's Morningside park very close by and Central Park down the road. The apartment is also just a short walk from Columbia university - in sum a very good set up! If you are looking for a nice base from which to explore New York and would like to experience the Harlem area - don't think twice, book this place! ;-)

TERY IS VERY FRIENDLY I FELT REALLI COMMFORTABLE STAYING AT HER PLACE, THE EXPERIENCE WAS MORE THAN I EXPECTED. AND THE NEIGHBORHOOD IS AWSOME!!!!!!


!

Teri is a great host who ensured that my stay went well. The apartment is clean and the room comfortable. The location is great and easy to get to from the airports in Newark or LaGuardia. There are plenty of eateries nearby. The subway stations along 125 street will get you anywhere in Manhattan. Morningside and Central Park are close for walks or exercise. 
This was a repeat stay and with good reason. Highly recommended.
Teri made me feel welcome it felt like I had come home, her listing is accurate and the apartment is impeccable. The neighbourhood was safe and clean and I highly recommend this listing.

Teri is such a great host! Always friendly and if you ask her something you'll get all information you need also she's busy. The apartment is spacious and there's all you need. Our room was also spacious with a comfortable bed and a lot of storage space. Harlem is a great place to stay. Everything is close to the apartment, metro, restaurants, bars, bestmarket. The neighborhood is safe.

Nuestra estancia en casa de Teri fue maravillosa!! Su apartamento es muy acogedor, está muy bien decorado y la ubicación es perfecta. Teri es una anfitriona estupenda, muy atenta, discreta y disponible para cualquier cosa que pudiésemos necesitar. Y habla español! Volvería sin duda!

Teri was an amazing host, and the apartment is incredible. The description falls short to explain how comfortable and welcoming this room is. Teri's amazing taste into decoration just bring this room and the apartment to another level, a truly harlem apartment. I liked this apartment so much that I changed my travel plans to stay in New York all my stay, instead of travelling to DC after the first week. 

I staid on February, plain winter, nevertheless when I entered the apartment I had to take almost all of my winter clothes off and just keep my t-shirt, as this building central heating is just amazing.

Teri also leaves you towels and another set of bed sheets, making it really convenient for long stays. The apartment and the room are also extremely clean, and there is a lot of space for your clothes and any other luggage.

The location is perfect for travelling all around Manhattan, with the lines ABCD really close, all you have to do is just walk 3 or 4 blocks and you will be able to go almost anyway around the city. There is an amazing store 1 block away, which has EVERYTHING you might need in terms of food, no joking, it has everything you might think. I'm really picky with food, so usually for me its a challenge to find store were I can find something I can eat, but this place was amazing. There is also a smaller grocery store crossing the street, that has a very practical ATM, although there are ATMs all around, this one is really close.

This part of Harlem is really amazing, I walked alone almost everywhere around anytime after dark, and never even once saw something violent, or disturbing, or anything that made me even cross the street. The lack of big buildings is something to note, as you will most likely be able to see the sky from anywhere. Columbia University is close, and its an amazing place to visit.

You also have a cinema on 125th at USAHarlem, which present AMC movies. So whenever you had a night without plans you can just end up going to the movies.

I came here to both travel and work. I spent most of my days working, and then spent the afternoons visiting places and traveling around. My stay here was splendid, and I was able to work all day at my room, being really comfortable, as well as being able to go anywhere really quick from here. To be honest, I would have paid more for this room, is just amazing, evidently Teri's experience in Airbnb since 2009 has led her to the perfect price so I can't argue against that, I'm extremely happy with this room. Just stop looking for another place, this is the one.

Teri was so sweet and welcoming, flexible and full of suggestions. The room was spacious and comfortable and she had everything you could need available. The area is so fun if you stay you should definitely take the time to explore, my favourite neighbourhood to stay in New York yet! I would come back to Teri's place without hesitation, thank you teri!

Thank You so much Teri!  Teri did a great job communicating quickly and helped me book a last minute trip reservation at her place.  Her apartment is very nice, well kept, and she made me feel right at home.  The bed was very comfortable and the overall experience could not have gone any better.  The neighborhood was great and was close to good coffee, food, and nightlife.  I would not hesitate to book my next trip to New York with her again!

Teri is really a sweet girl! She's always optimistic, reliable and sincere. She was happy to help us for any little thing during we stayed at her home! Teri's apartment is warm and delicate. She has everything we needed at home and wonderful tea. We could also use her printer! In a word, stayed in Teri's home really made us feel like at our home. We miss Teri so much. She's absolutely a nice guy!!

You won´t find any better in Harlem. The bedroom and bed are super comfortable and there´s a useful desk in the room for you to work, study or place your computer. The bathroom is spacious, shower works perfectly and there´s a big mirror.
Close to A express train and Columbia University. 
Teri was an amazing host. She helped me when I really needed her and it was easy to communicate with her. I would come back and I absolutely recommend it.

La estancia en casa de Teri fue estupenda. Su apartamento está a menos de 10 minutos de la estación de metro de la calle 125 (lineas express y local) y a 5 minutos de la estación de metro de la calle 116 (local). Súper bien ubicado para moverse por todo Manhattan. La habitación es amplia y cómoda, con ventana, un armario amplio y una gran cajonera para poder colocar toda la ropa y el equipaje. La cama muy cómoda también. Teri es una gran anfitriona: es amable, simpática y ofrece mucha información sobre el barrio, cosas que hacer, dónde comer, etc. Ha sido una estancia muy agradable y sin duda alguna repetiría!
Everything was perfect. Teri is a great host!

Staying with Teri was truly amazing!
She sent an email with key information a few days before we arrived in NY and always gave us lots of advice on places to eat&drink. If you are planning a visit, Double Dutch coffee is the absolute best place for coffee!
The area is safe and full of amenities, including a supermarket. Very close to Central Park and subway. 125th Street is ideal if you are coming from JFK, with express A trains running every 10-15 mins (check timings on subway's website if you are travelling over the weekend).
Great chance also to spot little jazz concerts in the area and gospel choirs on Sunday.
I would definitely recommend staying at Teri's place: it will make your NY trip even more special!

Staying at Teri's place was amazing! 
Teri is a very nice and friendly host, and truly willing to provide advice or help. She is very familiar with the neighbourhood, and she can suggest lots of interesting and cozy places around! 
Her flat is really spacious, comfortable and well decorated, and Teri makes you immediately feel at home. 
The neighbourhood is very lively: there are plenty of bars, restaurants and shops only few steps away. Central Park and the small yet lovely Morningside Park are only few minutes walking, as well as train connections to the city centre and JFK airport. 
I really enjoyed my time at Teri's place, and I would definitely recommend it to other travellers!

I and my boyfriend were staying in Teri's house for 12 nights. House is great! Clean and very comfortable. Teri is very friendly and nice person. Apt. Is located in Harlem, but the area is very safe any time of the day. There are 2 subway statins very closed to the apt. One of them with express trains. That was very helpful. Also there are a lot of good stores on the 125 street very closed to the apt. Do I recommend Teri's apartment? Definitely YES!

Our stay at Tery's apartment was fantastic. Not only was the room clean and comfortable (the air cond was essential given the hot weather!), but also the location was very convenient to the subway and not so far from Central Park. Teri is a great host and an extremely kind person. 

We would recommend this accommodation to anyone looking for a safe and spacious place to stay in NYC.

I stayed for 2 weeks at Tery's apartment and it was great. Nothing to complain about! The apartment was tidy and clean. It offered everything you need. I always felt safe in the neighborhood. No problems at all. Close by, you find supermarkets (Duane Reade, Rite Aid & 7Eleven) as well as small groceries. The subway stations (116th Street and 125th Street) are just a few minutes away from the apartment. The express trains take you -as described- within a short time to Times Square. 
In total, I can highly recommend to stay at Tery. I really enjoyed it and would to do it again if I came back to NYC for one more visit.   
Teri is a great host and always  very helpful if you have any questions   !

Teri's place was fantastic. The location was convenient--a few minutes away from two subway stops and a ten minute stroll from Columbia's campus. The room has a super comfortable bed, a big closet and chest of drawers, and AC. Teri was very helpful with anything I needed. Overall I had a great stay in her apartment!
Her place is very cozy and safe and clean!!!

Everything was accurate, Teri is a wonderful host! Her apartment is cosy and welcoming in a gentrified safe neighbourhood and is ideal for getting around in Manhattan as it is located 2 blocks from the 125th St Subway. Would go back in a heartbeat!

Teri was lovely, relaxed and great to chat too. The apartment is a 5 minute walk from the subway A train downtown to Times Square, Empire State etc, and local to shops. The apartment is close to the hop on, hop off tour bus near Apollo theatre. There is a supermarket 2 blocks away. The room was decent sized and had good storage. We were very pleased we could use the kitchen and store food in the fridge. Apartment was tidy and we were given everything we needed. The only downside is the neighbourhood is extremely noisy with locals, traffic and sirens. The local shop assistants later told us the neighbourhood is dangerous and not to go out night.
Teri was nice and friendly. She went out of her way to assist me with questions I had about where to eat and directions. She provided her suggestions when solicited.

La casa es tal cual lo que ves en el anuncio, hermosa! El cuarto es grande con un escritorio para poder trabajar (en mi caso). Es una buena zona, con muchas familias, las estaciones de metro están a menos 8 cuadras y llegas al centro en poco tiempo. Teri fue lo mejor de estar allí, me hizo sentir como en casa, muy amable y atenta, siempre con una sonrisa. Genia!! Sin dudarlo me quedaría allí nuevamente.
We had a very nice stay in Teri's flat in Harlem. The room was comfortable and clean and Teri was a great host. Thanks!

Nous avons passé une très bonne semaine dans l'appartement de Teri. 
La chambre est spacieuse et l'appartement idéalement situé dans Harlem. La chambre était propre mais la salle de bains aurait pu être plus propre. 
Sinon la localisation a 5min du métro et proche de nombreux restaurant et commerces nous a beaucoup plus. 
Teri est quelqu'un de très gentille et attentionnée. Nous recommandons.
The apartment is more beautiful than photos show. We were very satisfied and we felt like at home. Teri is a very positive person :-) Thank you that we could be your guests.

I stayed at Teri's place for two months in October-November, and I could not recommend this place more. The apartment itself is lovely. A spacious living room, and the bedroom is plentiful in size, with a simply magnificent bed. If you need to get a bit of work done, theres a table and chair, along with flawless wifi. Theres heating for the cold seasons (I needed that) and there also seems to be an air conditioner in the room too. Of course ideally you will want to be exploring the city, but for the times you want to have a lazy day, the apartment and room will serve you marvellously.

Teri is an absolutely fantastic host, and could not be more helpful and kind. On my first night here, she helped me settle in and even bought a bottle of wine from the downstairs wine store to make me feel even more welcome. She's an amazing host, and an even more amazing person.

The area is simply wonderful for living in the city. Some fantastic bars and restaurants just a few blocks away. Far too many to name them all. A supermarket equally close with everything you would ever need, and express trains down to mid-town and beyond at just 125th. The area is safe, lively, and an exciting place to be if you're looking for that NYC feeling.

Honestly, I could not have asked for more from my stay here. If you were even a little bit on the fence about whether to stay here or not, then I hope that I have been able to persuade you to put aside any uncertainties.

Teri is an absolutely great host, warm and easygoing. I had nice discussions with her, got tips for restaurants and traveling in NYC. The room was good and the building was clean and felt safe. Traveling in Manhattan was easy and the subway stops were close.

This was my second time staying at Teri's home and I absolutely loved booking her place! Teri's home is spacious and the location is perfect for the express subway trains! I was happy to catch up with Teri again, as she's always good fun & it feels more like staying with a good friend! I look forward to hopefully visiting again in the future :)

Teri es una persona muy amable y siempre estaba preocupada para ver si nos hacia falta algo.
La ubicación es muy buena y la habitación es muy acogedora.
Lindo lugar!!
Very nice place to stay!

It is a ver nice and spacious house! In a very beautiful and funny street, very safe and with Train express to midtown very fast! Teri is a very nice person and She is often away so you have the house only for you! In the gode there are all home appliances! And there is also a garden on the back of the building! All my experience ess great!

Adorei minha estadia com Teri (27 dias).O apartamento é ótimo, bem localizado e confortável. Teri é amavel e solicita! Me senti bem (Website hidden by Airbnb) certeza indico seu espaço, e espero ter a oportunidade de voltar lá!

Teri is very sweet and easy to talk to! Teri made my stay comfortable by offering me full reign of the kitchen and apartment in general, recommending different places, asking me about my days, and giving me advice about traversing the city. Her apartment is quite safe, close to great coffee shops, restaurants, and bars, has a conveniently located supermarket within two blocks, and is also two blocks away from Morningside Park as well. The individuals within her building were also very sweet and friendly. Overall, loved staying in Harlem in Teri's apartment!

Teri was an amazing host! She saved us a lot of time by making sure we knew all the best places in the area to tour and eat. Her place was also very clean and warm. We felt at home. We enjoyed every second of our stay, and we would definitely stay again!

Very nice stay in Teri's apartment which is located on the 8th avenue in Harlem at a very walking distance from the subway (with the A line - express - 15 minutes from down-town Manhattan and also many other lines). We had a private large room with a comfortable bed plus a private bathroom at the opposite side of the hallway and could also use the kitchen to make some cooking and we did it a few times ! Same with the living room when Teri wasn't there and did it too. We had nice talks with her even if we didn't met so often because NYC is an amazing city where there is so much to do. Thanks Teri ! We highly recommend Teri's room.

This was a perfect place for me to spend a week! The apartment was beautiful and comfortable. The location was great- an easy walk to the subway, close to anything I needed. Teri was easy to communicate with and I'd definitely consider booking with her for my future stays in NYC!

Terri provided a lot of useful information before arrival. 
She's a very friendly person and we definitely enjoyed staying at her place.
The communication was perfect even if we had time differences.

Terri is awesome ! She makes you feel right at home and her appt is so cozy. The appt is near the subways, local restaurants, and bars . Go with Terri she was a great host! 

This was me and my husbands first Airbnb and she made it an unforgettable experience.
The host canceled this reservation 7 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Teri was an excellent host!  Her place is in Harlem, in a great neighbourhood close to the top of Central Park and convenient to the A and C trains. It is also close to the Apollo Theater and stores and restaurants. Teri provided suggestions for restaurants, coffee bars and also an excellent grocery store just up the street. The sunny bedroom was spacious with a queen-size bed and dresser, plus a desk and chair. I had access to a kitchen, a livIng room, and a washer/dryer. It was a great stay thanks to Teri’s hospitality!
She is a amazing host! Excellant communitcation and the room is in great condition. Thanks again Teri😊

I had a fantastic time staying in Teri’s very stylish apartment. She’s a fantastic and very welcoming host and her apartment is right around the corner from some of the best Harlem has to offer. Highly recommended!
Teri’s great

Es la segunda vez que me hospedo en el hogar de Teri.
Su hogar es muy cálido, muy buena calefacción y es amplio, su cocina equipada, dormitorio amplio.

Teri and her place are great! It's a super convenient location and the apartment itself is very comfortable and cozy! Teri makes you feel right at home. She is super kind and welcoming! It was my first time in the city and she made me feel right at home. The neighborhood is lovely and safe- close to restaurants, public transportation and the park. My only complaint is that I couldn't stay longer!
Teri是一个特别热情、可爱和善解人意的女生，浑身充满活力，特别友善，我出门很冷的时候她还会借衣服帽子手套给我，真的非常感谢她在我居住期间对我的关怀！她的房间装潢漂亮，家具设备一应俱全，厨房有各种厨具，床非常柔软舒适，离116街地铁和125街地铁有6分钟走路路程，好多辆地铁通过，非常方便，晚上也很安全，唯一不足的是沿马路，早上窗口有点汽车声音，不过我这个问题可以解决。

Eu e minha prima ficamos no apartamento da Teri por duas semanas. Teri é uma ótima pessoa e foi muito gentil e disponível conosco. O check in foi tranquilo, pudemos deixar nossas malas antes do horário de entrada e também contamos com flexibilidade no horário de saída. O apartamento é muito bom, nos sentimos muito à vontade para usar a cozinha, geladeira, fogão e etc. Foi como ficar na casa de uma amiga que mora longe. Adoramos a localização, metrô muito próximo, supermercado e bons bares e cafeterias ao redor.

Logement bien situé dans un quartier calme de Harlem, près de toute commodité tant sur le plan des transports que des commerces.
Teri nous fait partager ses bonnes adresses.

Teri is a great host, we were able to communicate well since before booking our stay!!
Also, her apartment is well located, in a nice neighborhood and close to subways and buses that can take you to downtown in less than 20min!!
We would definitely recommend for anyone looking for a long stay in New York!!
Location was excellent and Teri was able to accommodate me on a short notice which I truly appreciate. Very hospitable and a great hostess!!
The host canceled this reservation 23 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

I stayed in Teri’s apartment for 5 weeks and never once did I regret my decision. Her place is extremely warm and welcoming and nearby everything one might need. The location is bested only by the host’s lovely personality. I highly recommend Teri’s  to anyone visiting the city.

El apartamento de Teri está muy bien ubicado si el motivo de la visita tiene que ver con la universidad de Columbia. Si no es el caso, la zona está perfectamente conectada con el resto de la ciudad por líneas de metro a pocos minutos. 
La casa es acogedora y está decorada con gusto. La habitación en que me quedé es espaciosa; estaba limpia, ordenada -igual que el baño- y disponía de una cama amplia y cómoda. 
Teri es una excelente anfitriona, amable, atenta y rápida en las respuestas. Le volvería a pedir alojamiento sin duda.
nice place to stay and secure. Close to Metro stations. Teri will make your stay as easy as possible, really nice easy going person.

Value for money. Terri wasn't there during our stay but she was accessible via phone for all our question and needs. The apartment is very cozy and safe. The bed is super comfortable.  I would definitely recommend this place to everyone. It's a few mins walk to the subway. And if you take the A train, its only 2 stops from Times Square. I will definitely use Terri again in the future. Loved it.
Great location! Very personable and helpful host! If we return to NYC, we’ll be checking Teri’s space availability first.
The host canceled this reservation 31 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Teri's apartment is super nice and cozy. We felt like being at home there and we had everything we need. Thanks to the comfortable bed we were able to recover after our long days of 15+ kilometers of walking. Teri is super host as well. She's been always enthusiastic to get to know us better and to give us some tips and tricks for our stay in the city. It's a pity we were so busy and tired and we couldn't spend more time with her. I highly recommend this airbnb.

Teri was a perfect host and her house is in the best neighbourhood to visit NY: close to the metro and central Park, in a very quiet street. I've just spent two days but I feel like I ve found a home in NY: thank you Teri! PS: for Italian guests, she understand Italian perfectly!

basic comforts for a wide and quiet space, great hospitality, nice flatemates, 
cool and artistically scraffy neighborhood. 
you are in good hands with Andrea!

Andrea and his roomates are very friendly and helpful! The apartment is close to bars and restaurants
I had a great time in Brooklyn!

Andrea was a very kind and courteous host.  He made sure that I had everything I needed, and even went as far as going out of his way when I was staying (just moved to the city) to inquire about getting me a job with a friend.  It's just a short walk to the subway from here, but the best part about the place is that there's so much cool stuff around that you may not ever want to use the subway.  I have no problem giving this host 5 stars.
It was convenient location and fair price. Andrea was very nice and helpful. I had a great time in Brooklyn

great host. Don't see him much since he may be in a different apartment.  But he's still close by and ready to help. The place is unique in a good way.
I'd recommend him for sure.

Wonderful host, very helpful, helped me to find directions to go somewhere 2 hrs outside NYC...thank god or I would have gone the wrong way! The place is clean, everything you need...artistic...different but nice.

I havent Andrea seen to much but he seems to be a nice guy, and his flatmate, amazing. The place is cool, comfortable and close to very nice places. I reccomend it to anyone who wants to have some nice days in Brooklyn.

Nice guy and the coolest neighborhood in the world. Kinda dirty place, but lots of space and CHEAP.
RECOMMENDED.
Andrea's place was great. Amazing value, close to loads of great bars, shops and cafes, and within easy walking distance of the subway - Andrea is a lovely guy too. Would recommend.

the place was great, i had room B and it was private and comfortable, the shared area is large and was good to work in, shower/bathroom is fine, kitchen is nice and it was great to be able to do some laundry at home. i kept missing the bus so got used to the 15min walk to the L train which is a good and frequent line. Andrea is cool and it was a pretty easy going stay.

This was a great experience! We had never used airbnb before and we were tight on cash so the opportunity to live in Andrea's place was really ideal. Andrea is super nice and helpful with directions when we needed to get there. The living space itself is well stocked with all your necessities - kitchen, bathroom, computer with internet. There are even the perks of having a really large living room, a rooftop, a piano and a great host. Highly recommend!

Andrea's place was great! clean, spacious and equipped with everything you need
and more! sometimes we would come home to find a band in our living area having a jam session, which was cool. the only downside of this was that you could have randoms in the apartment at any time. but everyone who came in and out was super friendly and trustworthy. we had a great stay here

Great place.  The sleeping loft was comfortable (with A/C)and exactly what we needed for our short stay.  Andrea was easy to get along with and gave us our space without coming across as unwelcoming.  If you need a budget-friendly, practical stay then this is the place for you.  I'd say it's pretty private.  Convenient to two train lines and the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway (BQE).  Places to eat very close by. The roof-top deck was the highlight of our stay.
Great place to stay, very accommodating.

We lived at Andreas place for a week. He responded quickly to our emails, and gave us answers to all our FAQs. That was really nice and trustworthy. He explained us how we got from the airport by Taxi, Bus or Metro and how much approx. it would cost, which also was to a great help. We received the key and got a brief tour of the apartment and its facilities immediately. During the week we stayed at Andreas place, there was a relatively high turnover of other travelers. Everyone was extremely nice and we didn’t feel insecure at any time. The apartment is located just off of Interstate Motorway 278, so there is some noise, but we had no problem sleeping.
The apartment is located about. 15-20 min. walk from the nearest subway, but it’s very close to the really exciting area of Greenpoint. Overall, Andreas apartment is ok to the price, but could use a good cleaning from time to time
Peter and Elise Denmark
good place, nice price, everything OK!

Andrea's place is a great home base for exploring Williamsburg, Greenpoint, and Bushwick. His apartment is comfy, albeit spartan, and secure, as well as a nice place to chill out and spin some vinyl. The rooftop is a great amenity, and you'll find most of anything else you'd need to get you through the day within 15 mins walking or less. Andrea himself is a very mellow, accommodating and interesting guy.

Andrea's place allows you to be independant and live at your own pace. I've always loved the neighborhood and was glad I could find something so close to it. He's funny, available resourceful, and the other guests (several rooms are available for rent) were friendly and adorable. I've had a great time.

It just so happens that Andrea's place is also tornado-proof ;)

We had a great time with Andrei. Always present in case of questions, we felt like our home. His apartment leaves much independence. We hope to return very soon at our next visit to NYC. I recommend this place to all those who want to live differently in NYC
Great place to stay for a real NY experience. Andrea's map of local places to eat and brief rooftop survey of the neighborhood got us off to a good start and no problems at all with the facilities.

I absolutely loved my stay here with Andrea, if you are looking for a true New York living experience, this is it right here! The feel of the place has a very artsy and ecelctic essence to it. Andrea himself is a great host, he makes you feel right at home. The neighborhood itself has many different types of restaurants and cafes to explore. Not far from the L or the G train if you want to go to Manhattan. I highly recommend a stay with Andrea if you are ever in New York.
Nice host, very friendly and helpful- spacious place
Andrea is a great host his place is really well located and there is everything one needs when visiting Brooklyn. We had a great experience I recommand the place.
We had a great time at Andrea's (Website hidden by Airbnb) a great location and perfect for a weekend stay.

Andrea's place was great, really cozy private room in an awesome old fish factory. Lots of room for meeting other renters in the loft while still getting our own space. Even during the hectic New Year's time, Andrea's place was the bees knees for four wonderful nights in Greenpoint.

We were three guys from Denmark staying at Andreas place for a few weeks over New Year's Eve. He was nice to us, and it was a good experience to live there. It was a bit cold because of the weather, but there were plenty of heaters. The apartment has a lot of rough edges and some dust in the corners, but it has a comfy. The kitchen has the basic necessities. Bathroom is ok. Nice to have a piano in the living room! :) 

It's a 15 minutes walk to Graham ave subway - 15 mins to Union Square, Manhattan and 5 minutes to Bedford av in the heart of Williamsburg (lots of nice shops and cafés). Remember to stop by Variety café on Graham av just before you get to the subway. The best coffee in NY :)

Bottom line: You won't get a better place to stay at such a low rate.

Cheers,
Jakob, Frederik and Simon
Nice place! Kitchen had plenty of supplies & Andrea showed me around the neighborhhood a little. Would recommend staying here.

This is a great place to stay. Andrea is helpful, thoughtful, and understanding, everyone else staying there was friendly, but respectful of boundaries and no one was overbearing in any way. Really nice place.
Great spot great host!

The common room of this place was nice, but it was a cold night, and the room I had was *freezing!* The loft was also a bit sketchy, and although I had no doubts it would hold me OK, it did rattle every time a semi truck passed by the highway outside the window.

Andrea was great (especially at the rock karoake bar! ;0) safe area, 5 to 10 mins walk to subway - plenty of other places to eat & drink close by. Andrea was so helpful and helped me out with any questions I had & the roof terrace was just like in the pictures - def stay there again!

Andrea is a very nice, helpful, cool guy; very cool loft (the projector is recommended!); cozy, lofted beds; short subway trip to Manhattan; convenient if you're driving (right by the BQE); and, of course, there's Williamsburg...definitely worth exploring!
Defintely a cool artist hangout, sleep in a recording studio in a loft bed! Fun.
Andrea was a great Host. The loft was fine, the roof access a nice add-on :) I would stay there again.

Andrea is a very nice host. His place is well located and you can't beat the price. The view on the rooftop is amazing especially when the weather is nice. It's defenitely a good spot for young travelers who wants to visit NY and meet nice peoples.
Andrea was very hospitable and showed me where to find the supermarket and also nice places to eat. :)
Thanks Andrea for being a great host!.. Place is awesome for big groups. 6 of us stayed for 13 days.. plenty of space, clean,  15 min walk to Bedford station..awesome location..
Really cool house, nice rooms and Andrea is super chilled. It's a bit of a trek to the subway, but you don't mind walking, I would definitely recommend!

Not bad place areas not too bad bit of a walk from the subway (which was a lot nicer that I expected). Got a bit hot inside during the day and night. 
Over all not bad
The host canceled my reservation 14 days before arrival.
The host canceled my reservation 13 days before arrival. i don't think Andrea was messing me about here I think he had a genuine reason and emailed letting me know what the problem was.

Stayed with Andrea for 10 nights. Great apartment, in a bit of an industrial street but walk across the street and there are plenty of shops and restaurants! Good walking distance to the L train too. Andrea is very accommodating and great to deal with. Would definitely stay again!

Andrea is a wonderful host. Too bad that i couldn't stay more. Clean rooms, perfect place, close to everything (well, not too close to Manhattan but it's not hard to get there), wonderful places to go out. Five stars!!!:)

With this being my first booking through airbnb, I had no idea of what to expect from living in someone else's place. Was kind of thrown off by the area at first, as it looked kind of shady. But other comments on the place were kind of true, as it is a relatively short subway ride away from the city area. It's not a very short walk to the subway station, but as long as you stay near the main road, you should be fine. 

If you're planning to park on the street, make sure you park on st anthony and not lombardy  though. Our car got broken into and the gps got stolen after the 1 night that we parked on lombardy. we were kind of afraid that our entire car would get stolen with the broken window, but when we parked on st anthony, it didn't. (so i guess st anthony's really a lot safer with greater traffic) 

The place was kind of messy when we got there, and cleanliness can definitely be improved on. Otherwise, it was really cool to have almost the entire place to ourselves. It's a lot of space for around $30 per person per night in the city (had 5 people in my group)

If you have a choice of rooms, try to pick room 1. Rooms 2 and 3 are near the highway, and the trucks do make it kind of difficult to fall asleep for the light sleepers. 

Otherwise, Andrea was a great host, who provided tons on information on the area. It was a good stay if you're travelling to NY on a shoestring.

With three others friends we were hosted by Andrea during one week. Andrea gave us a very warm welcome and was everytime ready to answer to every touristic questions ;)
The place is well located about 15-20min to the subway and less than 45min to Manhattan. Rooms are furnished, air-conditionned and the highway noise wasn't a big issue to sleep. The living room is huge.
I would hardly recommand Andrea's place for everypeople who need a "home" for his stay in NY.

Our stay with Andrea was over all a nice experience, but there are some things that are worth noting;

- There is no shower in the apartment you are renting, you have to go across the hall and shower in Andreas apartment. It was a bit of a suprise for us, but we got keys and kind of got used to it.

- The apartment is very spacious, however there are only three bedrooms that have double mattresses, so two of us slept in the livingroom. We were both comfortable anyway (I can personally recommend the couch), but it is still worth knowing if you are more than 6 people traveling.

- If you can't stand clutter, this place isn't for you.

- The road noise is non-stop, but you get somewhat used to it.

Basically, there are a few things that could be better, but as far as the price goes, you will not get more space for the same money anywhere else that close to Manhattan.
Some other really good things about the place is:

- It is Very spacious. We were 8 people but there was no sense of being crowded at all.

- The soundsystem and the projector are great if you want to have a houseparty, which you can, because there aren't any neighbors! Except Andrea of course, who will probably want to join you anyway :)

- There is a 24h gas station with a small shop pretty much right outside the door, and the liqourstore is about a block away. The subway is only 10/15 minutes away. (The L train will take you to Manhattan in about 15 minutes)

When it comes to our host, we didn't have a lot of problems.
We hung out with him quite a bit, and he played Radiohead for our friend at Barcade, which was nice. He knows his way around Williamsburg, so ask him for directions if you need it.

Andrea's place was great! The price is amazing for New York. We had loads of room, it's a short walk to central williamsburg and a subway stop.
We had a lot of fun here, highly recommended! Thanks Andrea.

your going to NY.  you do NOT want to spend $1400 on a avg hotel and you want to really feel like a real NewYorker.  you must stay at Andreas place then!  it is a true loft built in an old smoked fish factory in the best neighborhood ive found in Brooklyn.  the location is great, short walk to the L train which is only two stops to union square!  make sure to grab a beer at the boulevard tavern and to wake up the morning after those beers grab an amazing Japanese cold pressed coffee at the 'Tar Pit'.  both spots are a 5 min walk tops.  the best part about Andreas place is the fact you also get to be Kramer when you use the shower across the hall.  Andrea was great at meeting me at the loft and showing me everything I needed for my weeks stay.  his (Hidden by Airbnb) map with recommendations is excellent making him a great host!  

i really recommend staying here and really experiencing real Brooklyn loft living!

Andrea is a nice guy. Apart from that, there a couple of minuses for this deal:


1) his apartment is directly located next to the highway, my room was just feet from the street. It makes for a very "urban" feel

2) the mattress and the shower are absolutely "not OK", even for the USD 50 per night. I mean, common, some cleanliness would be respectful of your guests. 

Other than those two major objections, I liked it :-) The subways are about 10min away and there is easy access to get into town.

A nice appartment but some bad details.
if you don't mind :
- being 20 minutes away from the subway in an industrial area
- being next to  the highway
- a dirty shower and sink and the bathroom is in another loft ! 
you can contact Andrea !

By the way, Andrea answered really quickly to our messages (text or e-mail), it was very pleasant.

I stayed here during December and it was great! Andrea was very nice and hospitable when he gave my friend and I a tour of the place. The main area is very open but the bedroom is very quiet considering there was a another group of people rooming in the room next to us. From the outside, the place looks a bit sketchy because of the location (pretty empty neighborhood, next to a gas station, highway is right above it) but I felt really safe once inside the apartment. Right next to Williamsburg and a pretty quick trip to Manhattan as well.

This is an interesting place to stay. But the time when my friends and I got there, it was not as organized and clean as shown in the picture. It seemed like renovation was going on and stuff was scattered every where. However, it's cheap and private.
Very good appartment!

We are a band that came for a week to Brooklyn for a recording session.
The place is awesome, not the cleanest, but very spacey and comfortable.
We had a lot of fun and if you're coming to brooklyn or even Manhattan (pretty nearby) I truly recommend.
Peace and enjoy music... Always!
 (Website hidden by Airbnb)

Andrea was a great host. We enjoyed coffee and dinner together. While my friends spent  their time galavanting around the city, I spent my time in the quaint apartment with my sewing machine. The roof was an awesome little getaway for when I needed a little break or my friends needed a cigarette break, and the record player was always playing sweet tunes. I definitely would stay here again!

Andrea is a nice guy ! He was always up for a good laugh. And he was there when we needed help.
His loft is kind of an artstic antique collector's space. There're lots of vinyls, books, instruments and a vidéo projector that you can use all mixed in the living room !
It's perfect if you want to be creative.

Not exactly the most tidy place I've stayed at, but the space and liberty to wake up/come back to the place at my own time is a huge plus. The projector was nifty to use in between outing adventures. The rooftop gives a great genuine view of Brooklyn, the BQE, and the diverse crowd walking the streets at any given time of the day or night. Andrea is a very nice guy and loves his cooking (randomly stopped by one day to look for hot sauce for his chicken, haha!) and genuinely cares and asks if you're enjoying your stay and having a nice time in New York. Again, the price is worth it considering how much space and breathing room you get here.  Wouldn't mind staying at again!

I stayed at Andrea's apartment with four of my friends and we enjoyed our stay. It is a very interesting apartment with many different things to keep yourself entertained and very decently priced for its location and view. Only a short taxi or subway ride to downtown New York and a convenient service station and McDonalds next door. The cleanliness was a little disappointing especially the shower and kitchen facilities; however, if you are willing to overlook this then everything else is great!

This place is  not for everyone.  The host is really nice, but the place is not suittable for families with kids.  The visitors should be aware that they are renting only some of the three tiny cubicles that are built in larger artistic- kind space cluttered with recording and other equipment.  They should not be surprized if they get in one of the cubicle 3 youngish Brits with interest in whiskey and local (street?) girls whom they will bring to the "shared area" and whose friend will crash there down on the sofa.  The transportation is not very convenient (the bus to the quite distance subway stop doesn't run on weekends), the place lacks shower or bath (it has a toilet with self-terminating water faucet that ejects water only for a few fractions of a second, for a thorough washing you have to incovenience the host by invading his apartment), the bed linen, the kitchen, and the place do not inspire confidence in their cleanliness.  And last, but not least, the apartment is situated in the middle of a highway (BQE) with trucks braking by down-shifting.  Imagine the noise and air polution 24 hours a day.   But, again, Andrea is really nice.

Pretty Fun place to stay..fast to get to the city and alot to do around the neighborhood itself..Definitly Reccommend it to anyone that needs a place to stay not too expensive but still close to the city :)

A very nice place to stay and relax in the evening!
Just the shower could be a turn off for some people....

If you're looking for a no frills place to stay to explore Brooklyn, you can't beat the price. Andrea is very nice and accommodating, when there was a mix-up about how many nights I needed to stay he couldn't have been nicer and more relaxed about it. Great host!

Andrea is very cordial, genuine and considerate.  The place is an artsy warehouse situated on a busy corner located within walking distance of bars, cafes and delis in Williamsburg. Most importantly, the neighborhood felt safe and the local bars are open late into the night. His price was reasonable and I recommend it if you are just looking for an affordable place to stay while in NYC.  I will contact Andrea next time I plan a visit back east.

Andreas's place is really cool and has some awesome stuff around. we had fun playing the piano and checking out all his cool collections. The room was small but with a fan and ac it was well airconditioned. The subway is close by and its easy to call a cab over. Overall, its great for a cheap and short stay not far from the city.

Finally, I could`t go to NYC, but my husband and friends went! My husband is a musician and he went to NYC for band`s tour. He said that Andrea is very nice guy and the house atmosphere is very match with the band. But after all, the choice to stay in Andrea`s house is one of the perfect thing for them. Thank`s Andrea!

We stayed at Andrea's for 7 nights. Great space, complete freedom. Loved the roof and the sight of ESB every night. If you want to experience the NY in a great loft setting - don't hesitate to book this place! The subway is a short walk away, there's a park not far away, lots of grocery and deli shops.

We had a wonderful time at andrea's place, he is a very good host. the place is nice and comfy and it's in a very nice neighborhood! i recommand this place to everybody that want's to visit new york and stay in a nice place close to manhattan!!

a satisfied traveller!!

françois

Well,
Andre was very nice, he looks like a very cool dude. Really is, cute guy. 
and the studio is building next door, looks amazing - would love to visit it when it's ready:)
The house has a lot of cool objects, like records, books, piano which is very cool.
The house is a mess, smelly and dirty. and if a guy like me say it - it means it really is..
The location is not the best one - on a highway, 15 minutes walk to find something interesting..
Bottom line - worth the price. girls - look out, it's not for you.

Andrea was a pleasure to stay with for my short time in Brooklyn.  The place is very well located and I was even able to extend my stay a few days without any hassle.  Can't beat it for the price, location, and hospitality
location is cool and host is nice!

Andrea has a nice and very big apartment. A few blocks away from some cool shops. It's very dirty tough. Especially the kitchen and the bathroom, they have never been cleaned. And don't go here if you can't sleep with highway noise. The Brooklyn-Queens expressway runs next to the building and is a very busy road.

Bien placé ! quartier très sympa ! 

 La chambre, assez sale , est  bruyante car un  highway  passe à coté, pas facile de dormir mais on s'y fait quand même.

Andrea est très sympa et  très flexible concernant les horaires de check in et chek out

Venir à plusieurs pour bien profiter du loft !!

Dans l'ensemble c'est un bon plan

Andrea is a really nice guy and a fantastic host.  I didn't expect to encounter that kind of warmth from a stranger in NYC.  His place is really cool - sort of what you'd envision if you were 19 years old and moving to the city for the first time.  All around good experience.

We had a nice time! Stayed for 3 weeks, 
In our bedroom the noise from the highway was really loud day and night. The place was not clean and the the bed not so good. 
BUT: The cool thing about the place was the people/artists that we meet living there at the same time as us. Thats what made the whole experience great!

Andrea is a great guy! Very friendly with a superb loft apartment. 
Super close to all that is happening in Williamsburg and Greenpoint and 5-10min walk from the subway.
Highly highly recommended.
Cheers Andrea

The good things about this place are that the host is really relaxed and that there is plenty parking space which is not rare in New York. The bad things are that it is full of dirt and dust. Looks like it has not been cleaned in looooong time. Also, it is quite a walk from the next train station and you have to walk through quite an abandoned area. I would not recommend this place to a single girl because I would be scared to walk home alone at night.
Great spot, no need for a hotel with a place like this around!
I really miss this place! It was amazing days there! I'm sure that I'll back there when back to New York. Andrea and Lee are two big guys!!!!!! (Don't give beers to Lee after midnight! heheheh!!!!)
Hi ! I went 5 days in andrea's appartment and it was vey good, a very nice place ! Andrea was very nice . The place is beautiful and lot of deli are near ! I enjoyed my vacation !

My stay here was literally last minute and Andrea was very quick on his reply and getting me the keys when I arrived.  I found the loft as you would imagine a home. it was open and clean, with plenty of space and use of electronics during my stay. My bedding was clean and the bed comfortable. IF you are looking for an affordable stay in Brooklyn then you must stay here.

Andrea's spot worked great for us. My wife and I were traveling with our 4 month old son and it was easy for us to walk to everything we needed.  The rooftop was an excellent place to hang out and the bed was very comfortable.  Accommodations were very basic, but a good value for the price. Andrea was very easy to coordinate with and very flexible when our arrival and departure times shifted a bit.  Would definitely stay here again.
This is the ultimate Brooklyn experience- The loft is awesome...feels just like home. Andrea was cool and accommodating. The roof is on top of the building!

El departamento de Andrea es el mejor lugar que estuve en NY. Esta un poco desordenado pero todo funciona bien y es cuestion de acostumbrarse. Estuve 17 dias y conoci un monton de gente. Andrea es una persona que esta para todo lo que uno necesite. Sin dudas pase el mejor viaje de mi vida. La zona es muy segura. Lo recomiendo 100%.

Je vous conseille d'y rester pas plus de 3jours parce que l'appart est grand mais mal entretenu. C'est bien si vous avez besoin d'economiser mais la salle de bain est vraiment crade (en + je suis pas du genre exigente) la cuisine aussi, sans parler du frigo degueu. Nous avons manger qu'à l'exterieur.  C'est un appart pour les gens un peu 'roots 'a l'arrache.. Nous on a aime le cote artiste de l'endroit mais niveau proprete ca craint, jai choppe une allergie dans les yeux. Le proprio Andrea est cool.

Ne louer surtout pas ici! 
Yes, Andrea is a nice guy.  However, our experience here was so bad that one of us took a bus back home after staying there for one night.  No wonder.  The place was super dirty and a lot messier than what you see on the pics.  
The fridge had old, open food, mould, flies and lots of spills.  To get to the shower you go through a really cluttered and greasy kitchen.  The shower was smaller than the one shown and was also very dirty - I was glad I had brought my flip flops.  
The place is a nice, open area with 3 adjoining rooms.  None of the rooms lock so you can't leave anything valuable there.  In fact, the door to our room didn't even close properly!  One of our sheets had a blood stain on it and the pillows, which had no slipcovers, were sweat stained.  The towels, though clean, smelled mouldy, as though they had been forgotten in the washing machine.  
Our room was miniscule. 90 % of the space was occupied by queen size bunk beds, leaving no room for luggage and shoes.  I was grateful for my eye mask and earplugs as the curtains were non functional (the sun shines straight into your face) and the building is directly beside a noisy freeway that is nothing like the "ocean waves" mentioned in the listing.  The building shakes when trucks go by. 
As well, the nice plants you see in the pics were all dead in a forgotten corner and the pot for the coffee machine was broken   so we could not make coffee.
Fortunately, the other guests were really nice and even did some cleaning to make our stay more bearable.
This reviewer has done plenty of camping, backpacking, etc. and therefore not a stranger to a certain amount of dirt and discomfort.  Nonetheless, I was most disappointed in the accommodations.  I will be returning to the Williamsburg area, but will be staying elsewhere.
I would never stay at this place again. such a mess this apartment.

Incredible place. Very creative and lots of energy. Lots of funky things to check out. Even has American Beauty on DVD great locale for the movie. One thing, there are some relics from the past that you may think you steps back in time by seeing an old iMac or an old G3 tower but great experience for a flashback. Andrea is a creative & funky but straight to busy dude loved his demeanor.

We stayed at Andrea's only a couple of nights - it was a little different than expected but still a total NYC/Brooklyn experience that we liked.  We had a lot of privacy which was nice - other guests only showed up on the last night we were there.  
The location is fine - close enough to great food, shops, etc.  We walked everywhere and got to see a lot of the area.
Andrea is great!  Super friendly and accommodating.  Gives you everything you need and leaves you be.  
I would definitely recommend the space if you're open to a true experience and not expecting the cleanliness and order of a hotel.  You have to rough it a tiny bit but its worth it and fun - and so affordable!  

Thanks Andrea!

I stayed in Andrea's place for a month. I had a good stay here. It was quiet the vast majority of the time. It felt cozy and homey. Andrea is a cool, helpful guy. I met some cool people who stayed during my time there. The road noise can get pretty loud, so I would recommend earplugs while sleeping (which I had).
Our stay was so sick! Andrea's apartment is in a cool spot easy to access everything and he was a super nice dude, help us out in many ways! Thanks man!
Great place , Great guy, Great fun.
Super séjour! L'appart est vraiment sympa, ainsi que l'hôte :)

I stayed at Andreas extremely late notice and also added an extra night late notice and Andrea was extremely accommodating in the circumstances. His communication was great and accessing the unit/keys was super easy. The unit/room itself was tiny but exactly what I needed for my short stay. It has to be mentioned that the room is right beside a busy road, so bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. The room was very inexpensive, you get what you pay for, if you're expecting a five star room you will be disappointed. BUT if you're a simple traveller who just needs a place to recharge then I would definitely say to lock it in. Train station 10 minute walk away and easy to get to. Thanks Andrea!
Andrea is awesome! Nicest guy ever and his place is hella cool.

We were not very comfortable in this place. The location is quite remote from williamsburg. To go for a shower, you need to go out of the apartment and into the host's apartment. This shower is shared between everyone. We didn't find anything ready, the sheets were cleaned after we arrived but never put on the bed or anything remotely as that, we didn't receive new towels troughout our stay. We only saw the host the day we arrived in the place. It's very noisy, you can hear the highway traffic from your room. The whole place is full of things, would be quite spacious otherwise, and the kitchen is no exception (it has a lot of things but lacks other basics like a sharp knife). The people were ok but we didn't find the place confortable at all and wouldn't stay again.
Place is as described. I loved my room and the location was great for the price. Well heated, slightly cluttered, def suits younger guests.

Nous n'avons pas rencontré Andrea, mais il a toujours été sympathique et réactif. 
L'appartement est identique à la description, un peu roots, mais spacieux. Nous avons été seuls pendant les trois quarts du séjour, ce qui était plutôt agréable. Je confirme que l'endroit n'est pas le plus propre du monde et que l'autoroute s'entend assez fort de la chambre, mais eh les gars, un logement à un si petit prix, on ne peut pas demander le beurre et l'argent du beurre. Je me suis senti plutôt bien dans cet appart. Le quartier n'est pas incroyable mais plutôt safe. Williamsburg et le métro sont à 15 minutes à pied, et par là bas c'est vraiment cool. De toutes façons à New York, il ne faut pas s'attendre à éviter de marcher, de manière générale. On a aussi trouvé un bar bien typique américain à quelques rues de l'appartement, ce qui était bienvenu pour boire une bière après une grosse journée. Je vous recommande cet endroit si vous êtes fauchés mais que vous voulez un bon deal. Maniaques, passez votre chemin :)
Thanks Andrea for the nice experience :)

I stayed at Andreas place for one week to visit New York basically. We nearly spent the whole time in the city, so we only came to the apartment to sleep and have shower. 
Although the place looks like a warehouse from the outside, the inside is very cosy and definitely a nice place to live in. Andreas seems to be a person with a big interest in all kinds of art and music which i really appreciate.
Only disadvantage is the motorway which is quiete close and made it difficult for me to get over the jetlag... 
Anyway- good and safe place, worth the price (for NYC).
Great host! Friendly and place was exactly as described. 15 min walk to most transportation and things to do. Thanks for a great stay!

We had a great time. Perfect location, great rooftop, helpful host!
Not the place to stay on your honeymoon, but if you're traveling with friends (or like me, my band) it's perfect. 

Thank you Andrea (especially for helping us out with the gear)!

This was my first experience staying somewhere through Airbnb and it couldn't have been better! Andrea was a great host and his place was right up my ally! Fun, funky, eclectic, comfortable and in a great location! I would definitely recommend staying here to anyone looking for a unique experience in NY : )

We had a great time staying at Andrea's place in Brooklyn. The place is unique, large and fairly close to the subway. Andrea is a kind and polite person, very helpful with food recommendations but also very respectful regading your privacy. We would definitely recommend this place, especially for young people who want to explore NYC.

We came a bit before the hour Andrea told us and he came to pickup at McDonalds when I told him we were there, it was very kind from him to do that.

The apartment was a bit dirtier and louder (because of the highway) than we thought but also bigger.
