The district is fine and the apartment is not that far from subway (L line is really convenient to go in Manhattan) and also restaurants from Williamsburg (about 10-15 minutes by walk).

To conclude, this apartment is a really good deal for people who search for a cheap place to stay in NY (honestly I think you can't find cheaper anywhere else in NY) and Andrea is extremely accommodating BUT the flat is not made for obsessive cleaners ;)

Thank you again Andrea !! 
BR from France

Andrea was a great host! he showed us around some of his favourite bars in the area & was very useful if we need anything.
The loft is HUGE and has everything you need. Its quite noisey from the traffic outside but me and boyfriend slept the sleep of the dead with ear plugs. 
The heart of Williamsburg with all its bars and nightlife is only a 10-15 walk away. And the nearest Subway station is graeme avenue which is 10 mins walk away and is on the L line which takes you straight into Manhattan in no time at all. The location is perfect!

The only good thing of this place is the cheap price, we found the place really really dirty. We stayed there one week, and we got back here just for sleep because wasn't that comfortable. The noise from the highway is pretty annoying during the night. Anyway Andrea is a great person, really kind and helpful.

Andrea is a very kind and helpful guy. He had lots of good recommendations for nice food places and made our trip to NY easy and pleasant. The apartment is cool and we really liked the location (of course there is some noise from the highway, but with earplugs it worked just fine for us). The view from the roof is amazing. Just if you like it really clean and tidy this place isn't possibly made for you. Expect for that, this great apartment will give you the perfect NYC experience.

Andrea was the perfect Air BnB host - friendly, knowledgable about the neighborhood, reasonable in his house rules, considerate, well-prepared, up for grabbing a beer if you are but perfectly fine leaving you alone if you're not.  The space is convenient for the price... the train is about a 10 min. walk then a 10 min. ride to all the Brooklyn/Williamsburg stuff and a 20 minute ride to the lower Manhattan sites.  Accomodations are functional - it's a neat and tidy specimen of a Brooklyn musician's loft, with lots of worn but comfortable resale furniture, the sound of the nearby expressway softly audible (and the auto body repair shop loudly audible during weekday business hours), lots of great records and movies that you're welcome to enjoy and a slight draft from the windows in winter time.  In short, for those used to traveling this way it's great - if my band ended up here after a show back in our touring days, we'd consider it the Ritz.
Andrea was friendly, helpful and always quick to reply. The apartment was comfortable and close to public transport. I had a great stay.

Andrea was an amazing host! He met me upon arrival and gave me a detailed tour of the loft with instructions on how to use the TV, record player, etc. He was also full of recommendations for places to eat and drink in the area. He keeps to himself if you want your space for the rest of the trip, but I enjoyed picking his brain, as he has a wealth of knowledge about NYC and is just a generally cool guy to chat with.

The loft itself is clean and very comfortable. The other two rooms were occupied during my stay and all of the guests were quiet and considerate of one another. We were all laid-back young people, and that is definitely who will enjoy staying in the loft the most.

It's worth noting that it is not located close to the subway, by most standards (at least a 15-minute walk). But If you don't mind a nice stroll through the neighborhood, then it's nothing to fuss about.

The room was simple but functional. It has a loft bed that was pretty high up. As I was there in a cold wave it got a bit chilly in the night if you didn't turn on the electrical heating. If you turned it on it even got a bit warm during the night. 
The big room is really nice to hang out with sofas and comfy chairs. There are instruments and mixing desks around so has an artistic feel to it. This is not a place for people who need a perfectly fixed up place but more for flexible folks who don't put a great emphasis on order and cleanliness. 
Andrea is a great host who was friendly and welcoming even though I was two hours late getting there due to airport security and travel problems. 
The location was convenient to get to Manhattan and Williamsburg. I was in Manhattan with the L train in 30 minutes max. The area is pretty industrial so that was unusual in the beginning but had a certain bohemian charm.

Andréa avait parfaitement décrit le logement, et a été force de conseils en ce qui concerne les choses à faire aux alentours.
Andréa est quelqu'un de très cool et de très agréable, son appartement est très atypique, dommage qu'une telle surface soit difficile à entretenir, certaines pièces ne sont pas toujours très propres.
Dans l’ensemble l'appartement est très agréable, surtout pour des jeunes qui décident de visiter New York entre potes ;)

Had an absolute blast Andrea and Chris we're both awesome dudes and more than willing to recommend some places to check out while I was in town!  The room was great and because of the amenities I was able to listen to a record I purchased while in town!  Awesome place with plenty to do within walking distance.  I hope to return one day soon!  Thanks!

Andrea is a really nice guy and there are lots of good things about the apartment. Location was good and close to the subway. Easy to get to Manhattan and lots of bars and restaurants close by. Hostel atmosphere was fun.

実際にホストに会うことはなかったが、丁寧なメールはくれた。ただ鍵の開け方が難しくて、一日目の夜は家に入れずダイナーで夜を明かしたので、きちんとホストが出迎えて客の目の前で鍵の開け方を教えたほうが良いと思う。鍵が開けにくいことに関しては、他に泊まっていた人たちとも意見が一致した。家の場所は安全だけど、最寄駅から近くはない。それから、私たち以外に泊まっている人たちがいることを知らされていなくて、到着してびっくりしたので、シェアの可能性があることをホームページに明記すべきだと思う。

We had a great stay at this flat, it's a bit shabby but great for the prize, the metro is a 15 min walk away and it's close to Manhattan avenue who has a lot of things going on. Andrea helped out with everything we needed. Thanks

It was very nice to stay at Andrea's place. He is a very sweet and helpful guy and will help you with anything you need. The price was very reasonable considering it was New York and what was offered. The atmosphere in the apartment was chilled and laid back which was also represented a bit in the cleanliness of the apartment.  If you like it extremely clean if wouldn't recommend staying here but if you prefer fun over having a spotless clean surrounding like us it is the perfect place! Also like the others mentioned, don't get scared off by the exteriour of the house there is definetely an aparment inside! Also the rooftop is very nice! Thank you for the host Andrea!

Accueil très agréable. Malheureusement l'appartement est assez sale. Mais il est bon de savoir que les draps des lits sont très propres et que les serviettes de bain sont fournies. Sinon, l'appartement est vraiment intéressant et est rempli de trésors. Nous avons pu faire la cuisine à l'appartement, ce qui est très pratique. Il suffit juste d'acheter sa nourriture. 
Il faut un peu marcher pour aller à une station de métro, mais le parcours n'est pas désagréable et le quartier est sécuritaire.

Andrea was just lovely. Got in contact before we arrived to see how we could best arrange handover of keys etc. etc. Kept himself to himself, but was also very approachable when we did bump into eachother. Re. other peoples comments I can only say that the space is fun, extremely priceworthy, close to charming little coffee shops and bars and more. You do share the communal space with others so - of course - Andreas can't always ensure that they clean up. But, again, it's fun and I will most definately go back.  Also, the idea is quite clever - smaller rooms to sleep in, and a big communal space to hang out in. 

Oh, and in Swedish - väldigt trevlig person, framförallt roligt ställe, med små rum att sova i och ett stort gemensamt rum där man hänger med de andra gästerna. Mellan två charmiga kvarter, så små promenader så är ni omringade av diners, cafeer och barer. Avslappnad stämning, och under vår resa, roligt folk som kom och gick!

El barrio está en un polígono industrial, junto a una gasolinera y una autopista. Hay obras cerca que hacen un ruido ensordecedor y que tienen pinta de durar meses y que siguen ¡de noche! Unido al ruido de la autopista no recomiendo el sitio a nadie que pretenda dormir. El baño está fuera de "el piso" (es un ahumadero de pescado reconvertido) y cerrado con cerradura, en el pasillo, porque si no se cuelan los homeless de la zona y más sucio incluso que el cagadero de dentro del piso. A Andrea probablemente no lo verás y no esperes nada de él (bastante arrogante y de nula ayuda)... Aviso paa aquellos que esperan más por un sitio tan barato, aunque es incluso caro para lo que es. Lejos del metro, además.

The apartment of Andrea is perfect for short term allocation. Is a bit far from nearest Metro station, but the Bus stop is right there. The neighborhood is OK. There are good places around. It take 30 minuetes or leas to get in Manhattan. The apartment is not for order obssesives, and the workers of the highway construction start really soon in the morning, but despite that, I found it OK and I had a good time there.
Andrea is a nice guy . When we have something help and he will come and help us.

Andrea was a good host didn't see him much but he was helpful and accommodating. If you're looking for a quiet place to crash out this is not the place for you. I didn't mind as I'm used to living in a space similar to this space. Overall it was a good experience.

Andrea made us feel completely welcome, and his apartment itself was about as welcoming as anything could be. It is a wonderfully eclectic place, and we would happily return--in fact, since we were quite busy during our stay, and did not get to spend time in Brooklyn, I suspect we'll stay there again soon. 

My only word of caution: if you can only stay in 5-star hotels, this is not your place. And to be clear, this is not a criticism of the place...

Andrea was very accommodating and made the entire experience very good. The communal area is very spacious and there is easy access to a kitchen, Netflix, movies, records, etc. The listing was very good for the cost. I would definitely recommend staying with Andrea.

Some things to note:
While the main room has A/C, the sleeping area does not (though there is a fan and that was good enough.
The Nassau G station is 15 minutes away (Morgan Ave -> Driggs Ave -> Leonard St).
The Graham L station is 15 minutes away (Morgan Ave -> Lombardy St -> Kingsland Ave -> Woodpoint Rd -> Metropolitan Ave).
The Bedford L station is 20 minutes away (Morgan Ave -> Driggs Ave -> N 7th St).7

Andrea's place is really cool. Rooftop access, records & vinyl player with lots of room to chill out. Andrea is a welcoming host and has a good sense of humour. One thing you will want to be careful for is making sure you don't lock yourself up on the roof in the middle of the night.. Haha..... Sorry for waking you up dude. Thanks for helping us out, and letting us stay in your awesome home. Take care!
Andrea is a very nice person. The apartment is good for low budget travellers and if you spend most the time outside. The inside is rather old and not super clean.

The place is amazing. its hidden from public, you never guess where it is if you dont have the directions - but its so cool. I had a huge bed above the ceiling and there was an exit to the roof where u can see the city. The whole place is very arty and interesting. Ii met Andrea once and he was very friendly and helpful to me. I like the place and i would recommend it for youth

Andrea was an excellent host. Communication was clear and easy from the outset and he was very welcoming on arrival. The flat is located in a warehouse type building which is great if you are looking for something a little bit different for your stay in Brooklyn. The price was very good and I believe I got real value for money. The room was comfortable for what I needed as someone travelling alone. You will also meet other travellers at the apartment which is great if you want a little bit of company in the evenings. The first night Andrea kindly offered to go for some drinks and he was very helpful in recommending good places to eat and drink in and around Greenpoint. Williamsburg is a nice walk away - definitely worth checking out. Moreover, Andrea was kind enough to let me keep a set of keys on my check out day as my bus was leaving at midnight. A great experience. Thanks Andrea for everything

Andrea gave us all the information we needed in order to get to know the area. He welcomes us to the place and make us familiar with the apartment and the facilities. The overall experience was satisfying for the amount that we paid.

Andrea was a fantastic host, and helped us with directions for getting to the loft a little late once we'd arrive all the way from Sydney, as well as tips for where to eat and hangout around the area. The place was an awesome spot to start out time in New York, and super close to all Brooklyn has to offer, with plenty of space to chill out at home too!

The house is huge and fantastic. You can find many interesting things in it, like piano and Xbox. Andrea is very warm-hearted, friendly and helpful. Although one of the rooms is near to the street, it's still worth the money.

The loft seems slightly better in the photograph than in real life, but it was a nice and atmospheric place to stay for Christmas. There is a great collection of vinyl records with the record player. It's a quiet neighborhood with some grocery and liquor stores nearby, 10-15 walk from the subway station. There is a great view of Manhattan from the roof. The room is quite noisy due to a highway.
The apartment was spacious and livable. It was a very pleasant stay and the host was very friendly. It was a little far from the city, but the metro was really close and very easy to use.

When we arrived Andrea was helpful and welcoming, he showed us around the apartment building and how to use the different utilities. The photos of the apartment are pretty accurate, the interior is rather cluttered. An important note to make is that it is located in a very industrial part of Brooklyn, there is construction blocking off the road that we were not notified of. The subway stop is a solid fifteen minute walk away. The room is advertised as a private room for four people which isn't an accurate posting. Yes, there was enough space for four people to sleep, there was not enough space for four people and luggage. There is a larger room outside of the bedroom however this is meant to be used as a “community space”. Our main concern, however, was that Andrea would let himself into the community space without notifying us. On one occasion he entered and started yelling at us for having our stuff in the community area and cursed at us. On a different day we came back to the apartment at 11 pm to find Andrea’s friend in the apartment. Another note to keep in mind if you are considering renting the room is that to use the shower you have to walk across the hall, through Andrea's apartment and use his bathroom.
Great and helpful host and a spacious and comfortable loft! would definitely stay here again.

Andrea was a fantastic host. Very helpful with finding the place and getting me settled in. Quite hospitable in showing me the surrounding area, places to eat, do laundry, etc. My stay was enriched by Andrea's continual assistance and willingness to make the place very guest-friendly.

Adjectives to describe Andrea and his pad: Chill. Comfortable. Relaxing. Welcoming. Organic. Good vibe.

Thank you!
Looks more kind than photo. Helpful and good.

We had a wonderful time staying at Andrea's place, everyone was really welcoming. There was also tons of really good food and shopping within walking distance. He was a great host, the place was totally adorable, I'll definitely be visiting again thanks to his place!

La descripción es muy fiel al lugar. Andrea fue muy amable y nos ayudo a llegar al lugar con direcciones y recomendaciones, ya que llegamos tarde en la noche. 
Si eres aventurero y no te molesta el ruido de la carretera, este lugar es ideal. 
Esta en un barrio muy ameno y lindo.

Firstly, the positives; I made a mistake on the listing and Andrea was good enough to provide a sofa for the first night.

Unfortunately, that's about as far as the positives go...
The sink adjoining the loft space was half blocked the whole time that I was there and full of nasty stuff. Andrea was missing the key to my room so when I locked myself out and asked about it, he couldn't help. He also told me that he was 150 miles away and hadn't organised any backup in case things needed attending; luckily I managed to break in or my whole day would have been spent waiting for him to return. He seemed to think this was my fault because he'd listed "the rooms don't lock" on the page. In actuality, if he'd disabled the locks or gotten keys cut, this could have been avoided. Since I booked this trip for business, I need to protect my valuables, which I couldn't do. The seperate bathroom was also very dirty; the apartment hadn't been cleaned properly in months by my judgement. Cables are trailing all over the floor as well. It's like if a group of male students had made an Airbnb (sorry males and students for the stereotype). The bed provided wasn't very comfortable and the ladder used to climb up wasn't secured so that I could easily have toppled it backward (I nearly did on one occassion) and injured myself

The loft got the job and was close to good amenities. The floor was extremely dirty and we never even Andrea though. He relied on a friend to let us in and was apparently out of town but never told us. Seemed unprofessional but good location and he did accommodate early arrival.
Affordable place.
This loft was not tidy. Also your room can be noisy because of the road right in front of the window even at late night. If you don't care these, it can be nice to stay here.

Nous avons passé un très bon séjour à New-York. Andrea est un hôte accueillant et disponible. 
L'appartement correspond aux photos, happy mess.... ;)

C'est un peu bruyant car proche du periph donc n'oubliez pas vos boules quies ( après de longues journées de visite, il y aussi des chances que vous dormiez sans en avoir besoin

Andrea Could Have Been More professional. Didn't give good directions was very hard to find the place. Our room was not ready when we got there... The place is JUNKY, Smelly, Overall Dirty. He Checked us in ....and he never came to check on us after like days after. Also THERE IS NO SHOWER IN THE LOFT !! You Have to Go To His Apartment across the hall which we felt was WEIRD and the bathroom was Not Clean... Honestly Before You BOOK READ THE REVIEWS I Wish I Would Have... Pictures didn't match what I Saw upon arrival!!!!

If you want somewhere cheap and cheerful to stay then this fits the bill. If you want somewhere clean then this place isn't for you. The whole place needs a really good scrub, airing and the bathrooms are pretty grotty. 

The room being rented out to air bnb'ers is a mezzanine with the bed upstairs. Gives you plenty of space for storage underneath but does mean a climb up to bed.

The late check out at this apartment is a real plus point.

Andrea is a super great guy! This place is good for if you're wanting just a quick place to crash. Wouldn't necessarily recommend if you're looking for something a little more romantic to get down with. Lol, but there is a lot of good stuff in the area

Typisk warehouse feeling, ligger i ett industriområde bredvid en motorväg, men med alla roligheter på promenadavstånd, 5 minuter till mataffär, park, barer och citi bike dock. Bedford avenue är typ 20 minuters promenad. Rekommenderas till avslappnade personer som vill hänga i Williamsburg och är chill med att dela med andra. Andrea var en trevlig typ och gav lokala tips.
Place is close to the metro.

Andrea was nice and communicated well via phone and in person, but his page communicates an apartment that isn't the reality of it all. The photos are partly accurate. The shower picture was so inaccurate. The bathroom sink next to the kitchen was blocked the entire time. There were flies everywhere...the room, the bathroom, the kitchen. It was so disgusting. I used the toilet once during my stay of 4 days and showered at a friends place. There were so many outlets, the light were dusty, and so was the fan. There were no central lights in the bedroom or bathroom. The bedroom door didn't lock and there were always people in the apartment. The mattress and pillows were so thin. I woke up with my back hurting. There was no comforter on the bed either. He made it clear that you had to go across the hall for a shower..but he never mentioned walking through a gross kitchen that he was usually in, with his shirt off. I wouldn't recommend anyone staying here, let alone a single female unfamiliar with the area. It was clear there was an overwhelming lack of time and effort spent on maintaining the airbnb and he didn't think the way it looked was a problem because he lives the same way or worse in his other space across the hall. 

The smell around the building, in the building, and the apartment were not appealing. The apartment and the building smells stale. The street smells like fish. The street has no street sign, and the place is confusing to get to with or without a GPS. The place was in a sketchy area with nothing nice in the vicinity. Everytime I got out of an Uber or lyft the driver was confused and waited until I got into the building to leave because they thought the area looked unsafe too. The nearest metro station was a 15/20 minute walk. The bed is literally next to the loud highway.

The place is advertised as a nice loft in East Williamsburg with a roof. The loft was a cluttered man cave, that looked like hoarders lived in it. Though it was in Williamsburg it was in the undeveloped industrial area... it is more like Queens than Brooklyn...definitely nothing like typical Williamsburg. The roof had the most pitiful/no existent view ever. He definitely zoomed in and enhanced the picture that is on his profile.
Andrea was a helpful and easy going host. We had no trouble getting around and exploring Brooklyn. The rooftop with the view was also a bonus.

Andrea is an awesome host, super-responsive and fair. The place is a great option for groups, and people on a budget, but not for romantic getaways or fusspots. It's three 'pod' bedrooms opening onto one lounge. Tonnes of space, and full of cool stuff, but the experience will depend on who you're sharing with - and it seems a lot of people for one shower, although that wasn't an issue this time. But if there are any problems at all, Andrea will address them immediately. Don't hesitate to ask - he is friendly and will act quickly. I asked for some things to be fixed/cleaned, and they were, within a day. His place is on the edge of the residential/industrial areas, so everything travel/trendy is 10-15 minutes near, but if you're looking for exterior aesthetics this might not be your thing. It doesn't look great from the outside, but the streets are busy and it felt safe. The main road goes past the place, but it wasn't too noisy - earplugs if you're a light sleeper tho. Perfect if you are on a budget and don't mind a few rough edges - the kind of necessary AirBnB that allows you to experience a decent stay in an expensive city, without taking out a mortgage - just make sure it's right for your needs and you'll be good here.
What a cool place. Andrea was awesome, I just wish I'd had more time to dig into the movie collection.

Had an issue with keys when checking in, all solved now but was an issue when arriving late at night and he was out of the city. The place is as described but just needs a clean. Andrea was a nice and easy host no complaints for him. Also let us leave our bags until our bus left which was great.

This place was super  great for exploring Brooklyn and Williamsburg. There is a lot to offer within walking distance. The roof was such a great component and Andrea was great at keeping in contact and responding to messages.
Awesome place very stilish and in a quite area of grenpoint
My stay with Andrea was comfortable and easy! The place was exactly as described in the listing, and the location was very central. Thanks again.

Es ist ein sehr günstiges Appartement. Es könnte etwas ruhiger (Strasse und Autobahn) und sauberer sein. Andrea ist ein sehr netter Gastgeber, die Kommunikation war sehr gut. Ich habe sehr interessante Menschen als Mitbewohner kennengelernt.

Bien que le logement soit "roots" comme dit précédemment. C'est une bonne place pour des étudiants ou un couple de jeune qui cherche un logement pas chère pour visiter NY.

Qui plus est Andréa est un hôte très sympathique et enthousiaste.
Great price and 15 minute walk to the subway and about 40 minutes to get to Times Square . Also has food and dollar tree tree right next door which is really convinient

C'est un loft spacieux entre Greenpoint, Bushwick et Williamsburg. Des endroits super cools sont accessibles à pied (20 min de marche) dans tous les sens. En plus, une bonne collection de vinyls, accès au toit, tout pour passer un séjour agréable.
Casual and chill place. Walking distance to a subway station. Ideal if you want to see or go out in Williamsburg. Andrea was a great host and obviously knows loads about the neighbourhood.
Real horny, very good.
Cute spot in Brooklyn with a great record collection. Accessible to bus and easy to get in the city. Great spot if you're doing a lot of exploring

Andrea's home is a really great spot. We stayed here in 2010 and came back for old time's sake. It has every thing you could need! It was really nice to have a shared space with other guests. We were able to share a new episode of Game of Thrones together. Loved the piano and the impressive selection of media options. It's also super clean! 
Andrea is a really cool dude. Thanks for your hospitality, your suggestions and all around friendliness!! You made our trip special! :)

The place is practical, it's perfect for young travelers who just need a place to sleep for a few days and don't mind roughing it a bit. However, it is dingy and a little messy, and the rooms are very small. The pictures and descriptions are not adequate. The noise from the highway was especially disturbing.
All in all though, the place had all we needed and suited us perfectly.

Value for money and location is great for exploration of the hipper areas of Brooklyn and Manhattan.

Andrea is great, pleasant, helpful and communicative. Expect exactly what the pictures show. This isn't glam but that's not what you're paying for. We used this as a place to sleep and shower before heading out to explore all day and that was perfect!
Sehr cool, eine Wohnung in einer GTA Gegend und mit coolen Leuten - und einem korrektem Gastgeber- auf jedenfall empfehlenswert!

Best bang for the bucks! If you just need a place to crash at night, this is what you're looking for. Subway is 16 min walking, bathroom is accross the hall and it's not super clean. But if you want to find a cheap place in Williamsburg, this is it!

This was the perfect place for my partner and I to stay during our trip to NY! It's very simple and a bit rustic, which is what we were looking for. Great for if you're out exploring most of the time. Might be a bit intimidating if you're socially anxious, as it's a shared space and you have to go across the hall for the shower. Right near a bus stop, and a nice 15 minute walk to the nearest subway station. We had a great time here! It's not a 5 star hotel, but who needs that when you're busy checking out the city? 

Andrea was very kind and responds quickly if help is ever needed for anything. Also the roof is perfect to crack a few beers and chill out on.

The place was simple and had everything you needed. The door of the room was not lockable. Andrea was very friendly and easy to talk to. The shower was in a separate space and was not as clean as I wished for. It was super loud due to highway just in front of window, so don’t forget your ear plugs. All in all, it was ok for the price you paid.

Loft original et intéressant dans son agencement et sa déco. Bien que je n'ai rencontré Andréa que la veille de mon départ, tout a été fait pour que je sois l'aise. Idéal pour personnes comme moi souhaitant visiter New York sans trop dépenser d'argent (et amoureux de pop culture).
Great place to stay on a budget to see New York, 15min walk for the L line into Manhattan or the subway into Down town Brooklyn. The apartment has alot of character and a great view from the roof!

I liked the place, which matches the explanation. The area is a little industrial, but you can see that from the explanations as well. I felt safe coming home from subway alone and there is a little gas station close by where to get coffee. I recommand taking some flip flops for walking around and entering the bathroom. The key delivery was a little chaotic but in the end worked out. People hanging around were nice. Make sure you are not getting charged for something you didn’t use as for instance a second bed.
Great place to stay. Amazing hospitality.
Very charming place. Perfect for exploring Brooklyn. Would stay again.

The apartment is very cool. Its a bit of a walk from a local coffee shop or where "everything is". I found this to be nice as it gave me a 10 min walk in the morning through a calm area. There was a local stray cat that was very friendly amd would say hello most nights.

Purtroppo una pessima esperienza, e non mi riferisco ai contro indicati nell’annuncio dei quali già sapevo (vicinanza con la highway, bagno in un altro appartamento ecc), bensì al fatto che l’alloggio è stato ricavato all’interno di una fabbrica in disuso situata in una zona industriale tutt’altro che raccomandabile. Fuori dall’ingresso dell’edificio rifiuti e svariate siringhe ed anche all’interno dello stabile le condizioni igieniche lasciano a desiderare così come nel bagno con doccia adiacente all’appartamento. Andrea scrive “Questo appartamento non è per tutti”. Come dargli torto?
Andrea's place was great value for the money. As his ad indicates, it is a little dusty but not overwhelmingly so (thank goodness). Would definitely stay at his place in the future.
it was a very nice room in a cool apartment. i love brooklyn now! thank you, Roderick!
Great place in the best area of brooklyn. Thanks Roderick, you were very helpfull.
Very nice host, he came through at the last minute for me.

Nous avons apprécié notre séjour d'une semaine dans l'appartement de Roderick à Brooklyn, ce qui nous a permis d'autant plus de découvrir cette ville .
La chambre et l'appartement sont conformes aux photos publiées juste une  route qui passe à proximité mais sans doute toujours moins bruyante que dans Manhattan.
Roderick est une personne sympathique et sérieuse et répond toujours très rapidement aux messages.
Vous pouvez lui faire confiance sans aucun problème.

We really appreciate our stay in Roderick loft in Brooklyn, not so far from the bridge, it was the opportunity for us to visit this city.
Room and loft are like the photos you can see, just a road outside but probably less noise than in Manhattan
Roderick is a nice and serious person, he always answer very quicky to messages you send.
No problem, you can go !!!

Even though it was a very short stay Roderick made everything nice and easy for me, which was awesome since it was a last minute sort of situation. His place is cool, the room is fantastic and if you get to stay here for a few days I'm sure it will be an experience. Also, falling asleep to the sound jazz on the radio and waking up to it was a treat.

Roderick's place is fantastic. He was really nice, it was clean and spacious and exactly like the pics. It's a little far from the subway and noisy -- its near a busy freeway. The subway isn't a big deal at all during the day, but at night when you're tired and walking in the dark, it isn't great. That's the only reason I didn't give the place 5 stars. He has a really adorable dog, too! Haha!
Greate loft! Nice Roderick and adorable bulldog Turbo! I recommend to everybody!

The place is lovely, his small cute dog is the sweetest thing. The bed is comfortable, warm and w/lots of space to put your things. Roderick is a really cool guy. The whole experience was just way better than what I expected. I will keep in touch for my next visit. Definitely want to go back :D

There is a delicious restaurant and a cafe next to the building where you can eat very good, clean and a very good price

This stay with Roderick was great.
We had a great time, the room is clean and looks exactly like the photographs of the site.
Roderick is very kind and available to give information.

The roof terrace is large and the view is great, Turbo dog is adorable. The area is very quiet, you feel safe.

The fridge help to manage your shopping and save money. The bus passes right outside the building and a supermarket is around the corner.

We had a great trip and we recommend this place.

Roderick thank you!!

Roderick came through for me at the last minute and offered a private room in his place in Brooklyn for 4 nights. He was really nice and accommodating however I didn't see him that much as I was out a lot.
Great big room, just like the pictures. Standard house rules and even had my own bar fridge. Everything was provided, closet space, towels - the A/C came in handy. The place was clean.
He works from home so is there during the day and also a friend of his was staying on the couch for a few nights so it was a bit of a share house vibe. But I didn't spend much time at home and came home really late anyways so that worked out ok.
Awesome that there is an organic grocer just downstairs, morning fresh juices and coffee were great. Also good to buy fruit etc.
Rooftop was awesome - great views of manhattan. Didn't explore the area too much around the place other than to get some dry cleaning done - just got cabs into the city or went over to williamsburg which was really easy. 
Thanks Roderick!

The apartment and the common area was clean and tidy. The bedroom was large, spacious, and clean. The bed was also very comfy. =) We picked this place because there is free parking across the street and subway is only about 10-15min walk. The neighbourhood is pretty hip, with a great organic food store right at the corner. Overall it was a great experience. =)

We loved our trip ! the location is perfect, the room was perfect and even bigger than it seems . The flat is awesome : you'll find everything you need , and it's super clean. Last but not least, and our host was the best one ever !!!!!!!  always helping us ! we'll def come back
An overall pleasant experience. The room is very spacious and the appartement very clean. I recommend staying at Rod's.
Good memories, cool team (Rod and Turbo) and great appartment!  Rod is ready to share the good tips ;). Thanks a lot!

Everything was as advertised.  Lots of space, comfortable, clean, friendly.  Turbo is a great dog.  We didn't see much of Rod, as we were in only to sleep, leaving early and coming home late. Very convenient for our purposes!  Thanks, Rod.

I stayed at Rod's place for about a week with a friend over New Year's Eve. It is located in the Clinton Hill area of Brooklyn. The area is not particularly nice but it doesn't take you very long to get to the really nice places Brooklyn has to offer. There is a bus stop right in front of the door that takes you to Williamsburg, for example.

If you want to go to Manhattan you can take the Green line and switch to the Blue line. The train station is a 5 to 10 minute walk away which can be a little inconvenient but it is not too bad.

The place is really spacious and clean. Rod likes to keep his place organized and neat. We left relatively early and came home quite late sometimes but this wasn't a problem. It was very cool that Rod didn't raise his prices over the holidays like most others did. I doubt you can find a better spot for this price in New York City.

The room is really great, I especially loved the perfect wooden floor that is in the whole flat. It is very clean, the bathroom is somewhat basic but everything works well, towels are provided. The room has two large wardrobes to use and there is enough space to put things. It is room located in the first floor and has windows facing two sides, one of them faces the yard, the other one faces the express way, so it is not particularly quiet. Rod's little dog is extremely well mannered and never crosses the door sill and does not bark but loves to get some attention.
Rod is very helpful, and gave us great recommendations for bars, but does not seek communication, though he was in most of the time. Next time I come to New York, I would book it again.
The reservation was canceled 6 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Rod is not only a Great Host, is an amazing guy, cool and supportive.

Thanks so much!

Kate/Rod are great guys. Cool and discreet. I really felt like home. I definitely recommend their apartment (being exactly as it advertised). And Turbo is the most adorable dog out there. See you again guys...

I actually lived in this building from 2004-2005.   If you want the NYC loft experience than this is the perfect option and a good price.   Clean and exactly as described/photos.    My only regret is that I wanted to play with the adorably sweet puppy doggy but my schedule was too busy ;-)

I had a nice stay in Rod's apartment. It is very clean and the room is big with a very comfortable bed.
Everything is pretty much as described, so you can be sure that everything works out. 
There is a fridge for you, so you can keeo your stuff there and you can use a very clean bathroom as well. 
The area ist great and the next subway station is not too far. You have your own set of keys, so you can come and go whenever you want to.
The only thing I am sad about is that I couldn't spent more time with the dog ;)

Very cool place, extremely spacious and private room. Big kitchen with everything you need for cooking and your own fridge. Awesome rooftop and laundry in the basement. Just outside a big grocery store with fresh food. A few blocks away you can find lots of restaurants and bars. 10-15 min to subway, can't really recommend to use the bus since it's always late. For me it was not well situated because I needed to go to 41st street which took me 45-60 min. But that's just for me. Kate and Rod were very nice and helpful, had a good experience and would recommend the place for others (also as a couple). Thank you for having me
Barely got to meet Rod.  Place was as advertised though ~ 10 min walk to closest subway & grocery store in building was convenient

The room was clean and spacious, as described. We didn't meet Kate, but Rod was friendly and very accommodating. The apartment is in a good location next door to a grocery store, a Citi Bike stand, restaurants, and a good coffee shop. We had a good overall experience staying here!

Когда я приехал в эту комнату, первая мысль - а не ошибся ли я? На airbnb были отличные отзывы, но проживание полностью разочаровало. 
Начнем с того, что квартира расположена прямо возле дороги и спать в ней невозможно от постоянного шума. 
Формально, в комнате есть кондиционер, но гул от его работы сопоставим с шумом проезжающих машин. 
Еще больше сюрпризов ждало утром, когда обнаружили на диване в общей комнате спящее тело, просящее таблетки от головной боли. 
Кровать короткая и неудобная, ноги упираются в диван, которого нет на фотографиях. 
Из плюсов - небольшая цена и хорошее расположение.
Really nice place and hosts, recommended!

The room was perfect for our stay in NYC. The area in Brooklyn has a lot of nice restaurants and there's a grocery store right outside the doors. Walking to the metro took about ten minutes, getting around Brooklyn or into Manhattan was easy.

Nice place, creatively decorated. Did not feel particularly welcome, but that's okay - we were out and about for most of the day. They also rent out the couch for single travelers - not sure this was mentioned in the initial listing. Turbo's the best.

The room was nice, clean, and the location is very close to Manhattan.
Rod is accommodating and friendly.
I will surely get in touch with Rod again.

The Room is very large and comfortable - just right for two people.
You share the bathroom with Rod and it's could be clean. 
Also you should know that the Room is next the main street - it's very noisy.
It was great that we had an own fridge and a lift in the House. A supermarket is located next door. The Subway to Manhattan is 15 min walking.

マンハッタンまで行くのにとても便利な立地です。スーパーマーケットも隣、バス停も目の前。部屋も広く居心地がとても良かったです。Rodさんもとても親切でまたNYにくることがあればここを利用したいです。道路が近いので一日中騒音はありました。
Huge (Website hidden by Airbnb) to Manhattan.Bus stop is in front of (Website hidden by Airbnb) convenience.Rod is kind and super cool.Turbo is smart and cute.I wanna come again here.
The location is great and so is the host.  It was very tidy and close to everything. Rod was very helpful also the roof terrace was big plus  (:

I wish the ap was cleaner and less mess y. It was really disappointing. Both bathroom and other rooms. Also it could have been nice if the host was friendlier and more polite - at least introduced himself, asked if everything is ok, said goodbye. 
the windows in the room are so old, it was so loud in the room and very cold. It felt like the window was literally open... 
location is not really close to subway, 30 min walk approximately. 
And there were “0” shops or cafes close to it, so breakfast was always a problem.

Rod was awesome and his place is super cool with a very happy creative vibe.  The room is HUGE, the apartment is close to everything and was super clean and comfortable.  There are so many cool restaurants and bars right up the street. I would highly recommend this airbnb for short or long stays. ... and Turbo the puppy is SO CUTE!  Great airbnb and excellent experience.  Rod’s an awesome host and will definitely stay again!
A bigger bed may make the room even perfect : )

i really liked it here. the carpet/flooring of the place is worn (though surely clean), as age happens, so i wore flipflops and it was fine. very clean and convenient location. i had the privacy in my spacious room, with big windows, and a TV and enough furniture. the kitchen was shared but everyone kept it clean and i had total access. just what i needed! the mattress is nothing to rave about, but despite my bad back, i survived adequately. if i can borrow another blanket (i tend to get cold at night), which i think will not be a problem, i think i'll come back here to stay next time i'm in nyc for sure! for the price, what you get is very, very reasonable, and angela is very responsive and professional.

Some things I really liked about the apartment were the spacious and well furnished room, big screen TV, and a fast internet wireless connection. The housekeeping service was also good but was available only once a week. Kitchen was very well maintained and have all basic utensils, cutlery, refrigerator, stove, and oven. But the fact that it is shared between three rooms and is cleaned only once a week was a challenge at times. The location of the apartment was pretty good, it was quite close to the subway and took just 10 mins from Chambers St. by Subway to transit to Manhattan.The single shared bathroom was a little challenging at time especially since I had to leave early morning. Overall I liked the apartment and enjoyed my stay!
Pleasure to stay at her Angela's room share. The room was fantastic and clean just as i expected. No surprises. I would definitely suggest Angela to host to anyone visiting New York. I had a blast!
The location is so great, 25 mins to midtown. Just three blocks to the Franklin Ave. station. The room is very clean and Angela provides all stuffs that I need. I had a good experience living here.

Angela's place was great. It's the perfect place for anyone looking to stay in NYC temporarily or even for long-term and need a reasonably priced place to live. It was always clean and well-maintained. It's just two blocks from the C train (one of the better subways) and very close to convenience stores, groceries and laundromats. Overall a great experience. Highly recommended!
I booked the place but was not able to stay due to urgent trip. However Angela responded quickly and all the information was correct.

This place is exactly like the pics, beautiful interior, clean and quiet. The location is not the safest late nights, but convenient to transportation. Only negative is the frequency of cleaning, it's only once a week and that isn't always enough for 4 people. Otherwise my 3 weeks stay was great.

It felt like home! It was so comfortable and clean! Felt like I was living in my own apartment. It was a convenient location and the best part was laundry in the building! The place was as nice as the pictures. Angela is a perfect host. She is trusting and helpful! When I asked to extend my stay an extra week, she was very cooperative. I look forward to staying there again

Great place! Our room was spacious, equipped with our own cable TV, comfortable bed, couch and air-conditioner which worked a treat! The kitchen was communal, but very well organised and clean, and a great place to meet other guests. Bathrooms clean and nice hot showers. Location was good, close to subway for all your touristy needs, About a 15 min ride into Downtown Manhattan. Great priice for NYC!

+ We contacted Angela just about a week before the day of our arrival and she replied immediatly. 

+ The room we stayed in the most of the time was large and clean. We first were given a smaller room which wasn't just as nice (the wall between that and the other room seemed to be as thin as a paper). Anyway, staying in the other room, we felt like we had all the privacy we needed and it didn't bother us to share the bathroom and the kitchen with other guests.  

+ Location is convinient - just like we expected. 

+ The general atmosphere was all very relaxed and homy at Angela's place. The guy, Chaz, who works for Angela, is very helpful and easy-going and takes care of everything. 

+ Angela was very flexible with us and let us store our luggage there after check out time.  Overall we enjoyed our stay very much.

The location is very close to the subway, so it's easy to get wherever you need to go. The building is clean and has a washer & dryer for only $1.50 each, so a pretty good deal if you stay long enough to require doing laundry. There is a ton of closet space, so you can easily store your stuff. Overall a pretty comfortable place to stay in a great neighborhood.
The rooms are great, the neighborhood is safe, and Angela makes sure you have everything you need! If I ever come back to New York, I will definitely stay here again.

I arrived at Angela's B&B style room on Franklin Avenue in the driving rain, an hour early, but after a quick call to Angela the superintendent was over in 20 minutes. I stayed in the apartment over Thanksgiving break. It was perfect! It's a room to sleep in, which was all I needed. The subway is like two blocks away, and the neighborhood is not terrible (check out the Daily Press, a coffee place on the way to the subway). Didn't really see anything of the other residents, so it pretty much felt like an apartment to myself.

Angela has an interesting setup that works pretty well. I've been getting along reasonably well with the (Hidden by Airbnb) , the C train being 3 blocks away is very convenient, the neighborhood-- while not super nice-- is safe. There's a deli/grocery across the street that's cheap and good. All in all I'd stay again.

The place was more or less exactly as I expected standard-wise. Everything was clean and well-kept, and both Angela and Cas (the 'house-keeper') were friendly and service-minded. The place is also close to the Metro and has a fairly well-sorted supermarket close by. The only minus might be for anyone who has a problem sleeping as the area was a bit noisy night-time.

Angela's is a great place to stay! The room was clean and very cozy. The apartment has a great kitchen area and bathroom. The neighborhood is nice, the subway is only a few blocks away. I recommend this place also for long-term stays. I would definitely go back there.

Estuvimos en la primera semana de Abril, muy buen espacio, muy limpio y acogedor. Lo bueno esque está muy cerca del metro donde uno puede por muy pocos dolares recorrer Manhattan. Definitivamente nos quedariamos nuevamente en este lugar. No conocimos a Angela, pero Cass nos facilitó todas las cosas. Recomendamos este lugar con toda seguridad..

Thank you Angela. Your home was wunderful. It was located central and we we felt very safe. Next year we will come back

Birgit and Niklas from Germany
best place to be in NYC....all nice and clean and big enough for two.. connection to the subway...  my first choice, always

We stayed at Angela's for 6 nights. It was two of us girls. I asked for early check in, there was no problem. Angela is very flexible with The check in & check out time. Just let her know in advance. During our stay we cooked a couple meals. The rule is simple, you use it, you clean it. We shared the entire apartment with may be a couple of people but the privacy is not an issue at all. I never have to wait for bathroom, kitchen or anything. It was never in use when I needed it. 

We did use a washer and dryer, keep your quarters. You gonna need 6 quarters for washer and the same thing for dryer. 

Subway is 5 mins walk to C train. From there, you can transfer to anywhere. Just a tips for a first time visitor like us, get the unlimited 7 days metro card. So you don't have to worry about refilling your card. 

On the way to subway, when you walk on the left hand side of street heading toward Fulton st/Franklin Ave station, you will find a cute coffee shop called Daily Press, grab a cup of coffee before you head down to subway. Their latte is amazing.

We are grateful for our stay. No problem, no hiccups whatsoever. 

Thank you, Angela!

Where we stayed was not the place shown in the pictures. I was very disappointed in the state of the place - it was quite dirty. The doors were all sticky with dirt, the carpets were trashed, and the bathroom smelled like a college dorm bathroom.

That said, for $50/night, it's not a terrible value. The A/C worked great, which is important for NYC in the summer, and our sheets and towels were fresh and clean. The person who greeted us was very nice and made sure we had enough clean towels, two sets of keys, etc.

Although in a relatively sketchy neighborhood, the place felt very secure. If you decide to stay here, make sure you don't get lost - we almost got robbed after we took a wrong turn from the Subway station a few blocks from the place.

If you're doing NYC on a budget, this is a suitable option.

The apartment we got wasn't the same shown in the pictures. Also turned out to be shared apartment which was not stated in the description. We also got to pay an additional fee of $20 due to late check-out though it said flexibel check-out in the listing. Beside that everything was ok.

We had a great stay at Angela's B&B style rooms!  Our room was spacious, clean and cheery.  The bathroom was also very clean.  Although the entire three floor house seems to have rooms, we rarely encountered anyone.  Angela and Cass were very accommodating and made sure we had everything we needed (including toothpaste)!

As for the location, it is great and we encountered no problems (even coming home late at night).  Lots of neat restaurants and other areas are within walking distance.   The subway stop is a 5 minute walk away and the ride into midtown Manhattan takes 15 minutes.  All in all, a great place to spend your time in NYC if you are looking to stay somewhere outside of the norm!
Everything is fine, silent neighborhood and subway is close to home. Bed is large and Angela is very helpful. Nice to know her.

We, three friends, spent entire seven days in that lovely appartement. And in the end we kind of felt like home there. 

* About the appartement: Everything was clean, Angela supplied us with towels, shampoo etc. The kitchen is equipped with everything you might need. If you are travelling in a group of 3 or 4 persons the bedroom could get a little narrow - but because of the huge kitchen which works fine as a living room, we didn't mind.

* About the area/neighborhood: You definitely notice that the area gets slowly gentrified by the folks up from Williamsburg - so you have really nice and hip restaurants around you (--> 'DUN' and 'The Black Swan' are awesome. The distance to the subway is about a five minute walk. There you got trains up to Manhattan and down to JFK and the Rockaway 24/7. But if you are going to do a 'Manhattan trip' you should consider that it takes about 30/40 minutes with the C-Train to places like Times Square or 53rd/5th.

All in all: A lovely appartement in an up and coming area with convenient connections around the clock!

Staying at Angela's apartment was great! She kindly waited for us to arrive from a delayed flight at night. Spacious kitchen with everything you need to cook, clean bathroom and cozy bedroom. We stayed 3 people for 9 nights! Lots of space to keep your luggage. The neighborhood is great, silent at night, there's a supermarket and a cozy cafeteria nearby. The subway is only a few blocks away and a 15-20 min ride to Manhattan. If possible I would stay here again. Thank you Angela! :D

We had a great time at the B&B style rooms in Brooklyn. It is a save neighborhood. The apartment is clean and you have everything you need. Angela was really helpful with everything and was available 24h. We can just recommend the apartment.

I had a great time at Angela's place. In an overwhelming city like NY it was great to have a place that feels like home in a safe neighborhood. It was clean, comfortable and very close to the subway. In addition, Angela  is a very attentive and generous host. I felt that she tried her best to keep the apartment so pleasant.
Next time in NYC I'll be happy to come back to Angela's.

Angela is an extremely attentive host and goes to great lengths to ensure that each of her guests has an enjoyable stay. The room in which I stayed was very spacious and had a walk-in closet with more room for clothing than most any traveler will need.

There's an organic market directly across from the apartment and a larger supermarket 0.2 miles away on Fulton. There's a C line stop just down the street, so it's very convenient to reach Manhattan by subway.

The neighborhood itself was nice. There are a handful of cafes within walking distance, and the people I met were very friendly. I walked home late at night many times and always felt safe.

Overall, highly recommended if you're coming to New York. I'll definitely consider booking again whenever I'm in the area.

We had a very nice stay here. Angela is very nice and helpful, the room was nice and clean, so was the kitchen and the bathroom, it really felt like  a home. The neighbourhood is safe and there is a supermarket nearby and some fastfood joints (I recommend Crown Fried Chicken). Close to Prospect Park and the Brooklyn Botanic Garden, which are very nice and close to the subway which will get you to the upper east side in an hour and to downtown manhattan in half an hour.

Appartement très bien placé, bien entretenu, l'accueil est très chaleureux...

A conseiller!
Angela is an exceptionally friendly and helpful host.The place is well run and clean and an excellent location for a short stay in New York.

Très grande chambre et espace commun propre et spacieux également. À 5min a pied du métro C qui mène au centre de Manhattan en 30min environ. Seul défaut: impossible de régler le chauffage de la chambre donc chaleur obligeant de déformer la fenêtre ouverte... Je conseille cet appartement
The reservation was canceled the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

My 1st experience on airbnb for a long stay : more than 1 month.
Well located, clean and very cozy.
Angela has been a great host, easy to contact and very helpful 
Léa

Angela is great! The room was nice and air-conditioned -- with one of the most comfortable beds ever. And the cleaning lady was amazing. I've already been here for a month and have had no issues. Angela is really responsive and will usually text back very quickly.
The room was lovely and big. Nice area, which is very close to the train station. Angela cleans and changes linens every week, so the place was always clean. Recommended.

We had a great two weeks at Angela's place. We found a nice clean room, well furnished just perfect for our stay. We even had access to a small garden which was a nice surprise. 449 Franklin Ave is easily accessible by subway (A and C trains/Franklin Ave stop) either from JFK airport or from Manhattan. So it's very easy and convenient to go to Manhattan or to other places in Brooklyn. 
If we decide to go to NYC again we will definitely try to stay at Angela's place again.

Me and my boyfriend stayed at Angela's for 3 nights.
Angela was very helpful on how to get around in the neighbourhood. The room was nice and very private. The neighbourhood might seem a bit rough at first sight but it is safe and you don't have to worry walking home at night. The apartment was clean and in good condition. There are 2 metro stops within walking distance and lots of places to eat.
I'd definitely stay there again if I come to New York. This place has everything you'd want: nice host, large room, very well connected, places to eat out, 24h deli just across the street!

Un accueil parfait !
La chambre est à deux pas du métro, à 10-15 min de Manhattan,  donc une situation idéale pour un prix mini (pour NYC).
La chambre est grande, la cuisine bien équipée, la salle de bain est nickel. En cas de problème et questions, Angela est super disponible et très réactive. Bref, un séjour idéal !
Seul petit hic pour les sensibles au bruit, cette chambre donne sur la rue....mais rien de bien méchant.

It was really good, and the appartment very clean and Angela very kind and helpful. The neighborhood is dynamic with a lot of nice cafés and bars. It's near to the metro, we had a wonderful days there. I recomend it.

C'est un lieu parfait pour rester sur New York !
A proximité des lignes C et G, et des lignes 2, 3, 4, 5, B et Q grâce au shuttle. En 20 minutes on est à Manhattan.
La chambre est grande, propre, non bruyante et le ménage et les draps sont faits toutes les semaines.
Angela est là pour vous accueillir, pour répondre à vos questions si besoin.
Des commerces et supermarchés à proximité pour faire ses courses, une salle de sport à 5 min à pied, quelques magasins de vêtements à moins de 10 minutes à pied.
La proximité des transports, et la qualité du logement est vraiment bien par rapport au prix. 
Un séjour très agréable.
The reservation was canceled 12 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The reservation was canceled 14 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

The apartment is great the room is really big, the kitchen is well equipped and is really close to the subway, markets and restaurants. The area is really safe  Angela is a great host, very kind and helpful. I really recommend this place.
Me and my friends really had a great time in Angela's place. Angela is very nice and helpful. The neighborhood is very nice too! Her place is close to subway station. Thanks a lot!

Welcome to Angela's NYC beginner's Inn. The location is at it's prime and the hostess at Brooklyn's best. Here you will find numerous oversea travellers, some are here for fun, some are taking a shot at the big apple, some already working in New York and we all share drinks around the table. Angela cleans the house almost too much (but that's how we liked it!) and she is super attentive to your needs to make your journey more comfortable. If you want to experience living in Brooklyn, then Angela's place is a good place to start. 

The area is safe, and it comes with two deli grocery convenient stores within 1 min reach. At night it's surprisingly quiet even when Fulton Street comes to life. The fridge has a big enough space for everybody, and there's in-house washer and dryer.

Chris

Angela is a great host. Everything is provided and ready. The neighborhood is absolutely convenient -- 3 mins walk to the train station, 2 mins to the library, 3 mins to YMCA. Definitely a great place to stay, both long and short. Thank you for everything Angela!
Great host that had a very good communication. The apartment is nice and in a convenient neighborhood in walking distance from many nice restaurants etc. We had a great time!
We stayed for 7 days with Angela. The experience was way beyond perfect. Considering the price, location, privacy and hospitality of the host, I would definitely recommend the place for travelers.
Angela was a great host! The neighborhood was wonderful I felt very safe. Subway was a 4 minute walk from the apartment!
It's a great location in New York! And the bed is so comfortable!

Angela was the best host to stay with. Her apartment was kept incredibly clean- the rooms, bathroom, the kitchen, everything. it was also so close to the subway- literally 2 blocks. It was a wonderful location and not too far from Manhattan. There were also 2 deli stores 10 feet from the front door so that was also sweet deal. Angela was incredibly friendly and cleaned so much of the apartment every week. Truly a fine person to stay with if you're visiting/dropping by New York!! Thanks so much Angela. :)

Muchas gracias a Angela por su espacio , todo calefaccionado, ordenado y limpio.

Me gustó mucho todo y lo mejor es que esta cerca de una estación de metro 

Gracias y recomendada

Angela was a great host! What a great location! easy to get there from the JFK airport and also easy to get to Manhattan -> subway is less than 5 mins. The apartment was clean all the time, we received new clean towels for our second week and we reached Angela quickly if we had any questions. She also took care of us that everything was ok.  We would recommend her place to stay.

Angela was exactly what I wished in a host: someone who was easy to contact, but who was not overly present. That doesn't mean that she wasn't nice, however, as she really did all she could for us to be comfortable. My girlfriend and I stayed very little in the house and did not use the kitchen at any point, but all we had to use was clean and in order. We really appreciated our stay.
Was confortable my estay there, the place was clean. Nice person as neighbors. The Deli store is in front of the apartment has cute tender from Puerto Rico great person. Thanks Angela

Angela was a great host. She's very nice and helpful.
The place is very close to subway, restaurants and delis, super convenient. Great value!
Thank you Angela I have had a perfect time. The apartment was clean and quiet. Close to the subway and safe area. True pictures.

Hi everyone! I spent one month at Angela's and to be honest it was great. She is always available and ready to help you in any matter. She is willing to make your stay really comfortable, every time I asked her for a favour she gave it to me. The room is big and very clean. The location is good, plenty of stores, bars,... and you have a train station really close that in 15min you can get Manhattan. I like the neighbourhood, people are friendly. Overall I would say you won't find anything better at this price. I would recommend Angela's place to everyone. If I come back to NYC I would like to stay at Angela's again 100%.

This house is really close to the metro station and it just took about 4 minutes of walking. Angela is a great host as she will make sure the cleanness of the house because she want everybody has comfortable stay here.

We very much enjoyed our 1 week stay in Brooklyn. The place was perfect for day trips around Brooklyn or to Manhattan. Subway station is very close. There are two Delis across the stress and numerous cafes, bars and stores only a stroll away.
We did not get to meet Angela but check-in and out worked fine and she was very quick in answering any questions. 
The apartment is rented out to several people so you share kitchen and bathroom with strangers, but being out the whole day, we didn't really run into each other much.
Make sure to bring earplugs, there is a trafficlight right infront of the house which makes traffic noisy.

Ubytování splnilo naše očekávání. Oblast byla v dosahu centra města (cca  30 minut) - dobré spojení metrem i autobusy cca 5 minut od ubytování. Hostitelka nám umožnila ubytovat se večer a při zpáteční cestě ponechat zavazadla v bytě i po domluveném času odjezdu. Ubytování doporučujeme.

Our stay with Angela was great. Located only a few blocks from the C-line that goes straight into Manhattan, close to a convenient grocery store, good WiFi, nice and tidy room, and Angela was very helpful (even though I mixed up the date and the address). I definitely recommend staying here!
Great place, good host
The room is beautiful with a backyard. Angela is very nice. She comes clean the apartment as well as the room every week - you cannot get this with every Airbnb host. Great experience!
The host canceled this reservation 11 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Todo encontrado como estaba descrito así que para nosotros genial.

Flat is in a good location in Brooklyn near the subway and shops and very quiet at night. The kitchen and bathroom are shared and while we were there we had one lovely neighbour to share it with who was very easy. Angela was very helpful and accommodating and was always quickly available whenever we needed any kind of advice or help. We had a brilliant week.

As always we had a good stay at Angela's!
The appartment is close to the C Line subway and many groceries around.
Angela is vert helpful and easy to communicate with.
I highly recommend.

The room that I rented was lovely and very comfortable. The neighborhood was nice and the location was close to a subway station, grocery stores, and options for food. The host was also very hospitable - I would definitely come here again!

We stayed at Laurie's place for one night in september, and that really was much too short. We really liked the hostess, her amazing house and the neighbourhood. Brooklyn has a lot to offer, and so has Laurie. Won't forget her waffles! Next time we will stay longer!

Great place in Brooklyn and close to NYC by sub. (no risk at all).

Correct room, good and quick breakfast! 

Merci Laurie pour votre accueil chaleureux. 

Et entrainez vous pour une partie de Tennis WII avec Peter sut le central parisien.

Four star. What a wonderful hostess she is. Very knowledgable about Brooklyn and especially where the good food is. The house is comfortable, attractive, quiet, with great beds and an excellent shower. I only did morning coffee, but there was fruit, cereal, breads, fresh orange juice if I wanted. Laurie and Peter, her son are the best.

Well.....here's the thing....

To begin with, New York is the greatest city in the US. Period. Second....Brooklyn is the biggest little hamlet of niceness that exists in New York City. From Wms burg back to Park Slope....great.music...GREAT FOOD, and yet quiet on the street.....this is life as it should be. Now couple that with Laurie's expert tips on the neighbourhoods and her son's (Website hidden by Airbnb) cannot be beat! We just finished our holiday and still ...we want to be right back. Laurie and Peter's  place is everything and then some. And they has good tea with breakfast too!!!

Eric and Stacey

When you stay at Laurie’s place in Brooklyn’s Park Slope, you end each day of New York fun and exploration by going ‘home’.  It’s warm and welcoming, clean and comfortable, filled with lively art, loads of sun, and is home to 2 beautiful big-eyed cats. This large home is on a quiet street so you aren’t kept awake by street noise, traffic, and lights. Still, it’s close to the action. There are restaurants galore and quick and easy access to Manhattan and other NY areas via all major subway lines. Laurie and Peter are able and eager to advise you on the many attractions and activities in the area and across the city, and the best travel options, to and from.  I’m so glad I found this wonderful and affordable accommodation in New  York where hotels are famously impersonal and over-priced. I’ll be back, for sure. Thanks Laurie and Peter!

To experience the real New York, stay in Brooklyn with Laurie.  Her comfortable, quiet home is full of art, books and music and Laurie is a terrific ambassador for her neighborhood.  Manhattan is a short (15 min.max) ride away on the subway, and there is a ton of great activities right in Brooklyn including the outstanding Brooklyn Museum, Botanical Gardens and many little character bars and restaurants right around the corner from Laurie's place.  Stay here, you'll love it.  Highly recommended.

Laurie's home was a wonderful respite for us after long fun-filled NYC days. Traveling via subway just a few short blocks from her house got us everywhere we wanted to be with ease. We saw 6 shows in 5 nights and never had any trouble coming home late. The room was spacious and very clean and located on the top floor away from the living areas. There is a private bath and plenty of privacy. Laurie was so welcoming that we quickly felt as if we were visiting a friend. I would highly recommend her rooms to anyone.

Fabulous!  My family had a great time in New York thanks to Laurie and her wonderful home.  They felt welcome and the fact that she shared all the neighborhood treasures with them was priceless.  The next time we go to New York - we're staying with Laurie!  Thanks Laurie!!  
Peirce, Eli and Sylvie from Santa Fe, NM

My friend and I had a wonderful week at Laurie's. It's a beautiful house and it really looked like the pictures on here! Laurie's a very friendly and laid back host with lots of good tips and information and materials to look through. Happy with the room, too - this was located next to a lovely bathroom. And the neighbourhood is very nice, too - great brownstone houses and nice coffee places, restaurants and shops, all nearby. As well as Prospect Park - we were lucky to be there for the free Sharon Jones concert. But again - without Laurie we probably wouldn't have known that this was on! Nice fruit salad, croissants and coffee in the morning, Internet access no problem and good chats with Laurie. It was our first time in NY and it was so much nicer to stay privately than in a cheap and nasty hotel room. I can highly recommend staying in Brooklyn and especially with Laurie. (Didn't meet Peter who was in summer camp, but one of the cats was there - super cute!)

Laurie has been a perfect host, we spent marvellous days in New York City also thanks to her suggestions and help. The house was so nice and the atmosphere so friendly that we are looking forward to he there again! Thanks a lot!!!

We had a wonderful stay at Laurie's beautiful home in Park Slope, Brooklyn. The beds were very comfortable and we were able to have a washroom and washer/dryer right next door to our room which was very convenient. We would recommend bringing small luggage as the room was on the top floor of a 3 story walkup and the stairwells/hallways are very narrow, navigating that was a bit of a challenge, but that is minor. The subway station was quite close, and it was an easy commute into Manhattan, getting to the upper parts of Manhattan took awhile, but its nice to sit and relax on the air conditioned train after a long, hot day of sightseeing. Laurie was super friendly and helpful, and had many suggestions for things to do and places to see during our stay, it was really nice to have the advice from a local who knows her city! Our only complaint would be having to watch out for the escape artist kitty every time we came back to or left the house, there are two sets of doors at the entrance, but the space between them is very small, and we had to enter and shut the doors one at a time, while trying to keep the kitty away. It was very frustrating and time consuming, and if someone else left the inner door open, it was very hard to keep him from escaping, he got out twice during our visit :(

All in all, it was a very pleasant visit, thanks again for your hospitality Laurie!

The house is in a great location in Brooklyn - very close to Manhattan via the subway.  The rooms were lovely, quiet and clean - very comfortable beds!  Laurie was such a lovely host, she went out of her way to help us with directions and in deciding what to do out of all the choice there is in NYC!  She even found a bed for us early on the first morning when we arrived after a 32 hour trip! (thanks Peter - love your comic/ book collection). The 2 cats are sweet, as were the squirrels running along the phone lines outside.  And despite Lauries claims that it wasn't at its best, the garden was just gorgeous.
Thanks Laurie!!PS still remember that gluten free bread - was amazing!

Laurie 
-gave lots of info re where to eat, how to find out about cheap tickets, how to get around etc
-gave us free rein of her pc for internet browsing
-showed us how to use her great coffee machine
-had a lovely room with great bedding 
-was fascinating to talk with
-lives in a lovely house in a pretty street

What else can I add to the many reviews by others? I would only say: "Home away from home",Laurie is someone you can fully trust ( and she trusts you) a great host , a great house, a great neighborhood, a great great Prospect park, great public transports etc etc.

Laurie is a fabulous, knowledgable host.  She is right there for you to suggest wonderful opportunities to explore Brooklyn and beyond but recedes into her busy life to let you be on your own.  The house is quiet and the neighborhood is amazing.  Lots of places to eat, bistros and the like, and Laurie will steer you in the right direction.  There is wonderful opportunity to meet interesting people that are also staying at Laurie's - I do not think I could have had a better experience or a more affordable opportunity to get the best out of my stay in Brooklyn.  And, if you are a cat lover - Batman and Robin will make the most out of your affection and open door.

Highly recommend. Location was great. (Park Slope and Brooklyn are wonderful, subway was a few blocks away.) Clean house, comfortable beds, clean bathrooms. Sharing a bathroom with only one other bedroom meant very little/no waiting. Laurie was friendly and helpful. Good breakfast foods on-hand and she gave my husband a great Red Hook breakfast reco. Lots of local guidebooks and maps too, in case you like to digest stuff that way. Already thinking about when we can go back.

Staying with Laurie was my first experience with AirBnB, and she was an absolutely wonderful host. Her house was lovely, very quiet, and perfectly located. I will definitely be staying with her again if I am ever in New York!

Our days with Laurie was excellent!

Her house is quite confortable, the room reserved for us was wide enough and spotlessly clean.
Laurie is an excellent person, friendly and a very good tourist guide. She gave us very good tips about Manhathan e Brooklyn. This is an excellent point to stay with her.

The location is excellent too, are just two blocks from Lines D, N, R, F and G subway, with easy access to any part of NY. All types of stores can also be found nearby.

Five stars for our new friend Laurie.

Laurie was an excellent host. She knew the neighborhood extremely well and was happy to offer advice on uncrowded cafes for me to work from, as well as restaurants, music halls, and other attractions. The room was comfortable and the house had lots of character--this was my first time using airbnb, and the whole experience felt a lot more authentic than the chain hotels I usually stay at. I'd definitely like to stay here again if I'm in the area.
Great visit. It was our second time. No problems at all. Laurie is helpful and the location can't be beat. Wonderful chocolate croissants!

A lovely querky house with lots of history. Laurie is a wonderful host and is so helpful with information on where to eat , where to go, how to get there and avoiding the queues. 
Essential you like cats as Batman and Robin love people.
Once you have learnt the various foibles you can get your own breakfast (delicious) and come and go as you wish, which suited us perfectly and we had a wonderful time. Locally there are some excellent restaurants and wide choice, so no need to head back to Manhattan. An enjoyable place to stay.
Great location, nice clean rooms and excellent shower. Easy walk to subway for 20 min ride into Manhattan.

We spent a fun week with Laurie and Peter and very much appreciated here. The house is situated in a quiet neighborhood with a large choice of restaurants of all nationalities who have been recommended by Laurie. The Ten (Japanese) has been our preference. Too bad we did not meet Laurie and Peter, maybe next time. Still, everything was all set to get a good breakfast and lots of information to a pleasant stay. We had the company of a charming English couple and also we will not forget the two cats who were very sociable. A big thank you to Kim and Dani who helped us provide the best for our stay is in good condition. Finally, a place we strongly recommend to all

Laurie is a gracious and very knowledgeable hostess. She knows Brooklyn very well, and she was incredibly helpful in guiding me to the  best places to eat, shop, etc. in the area. I stayed at her place while waiting for my husband to arrive from the West Coast; we just moved into the area, and Laurie made the initial transition much easier. She also has delicious croissants and cheeses available for her guests!

Our stay at Laurie's is probably the best experience one could ever imagine through Airbnb.  Laurie is an amazing host, a knowledgeable tour guide of New York, and a museum curator all in one.  Her home is in a great part of the city, yet on a side street where I never had a problem parking just a few feet from her front door.  Her house could be a Better Homes and Garden showpiece, and yes, it even has a large garden in her back yard.  There is artwork and books everywhere.  In fact, the photos on Airbnb don't even do justice to the beauty of the place.  The rooms are large, immaculate, and the beds are comfortable.  The espresso maker in the kitchen and fresh croissants and OJ every morning was a treat, and much better than even Starbucks can deliver!  The house management team, Batman and Robin (Laurie's two cats), were friendly and ever-present.  I couldn't think of a nicer place to stay.

It was great to stay in Laurie's well situated and welcoming home in South Slope.
