She gave me a map and showed me where to go in NYC, and walked me outside and showed me where all the bus stops were.  The only CONS, I have for this stay were 
1. My reservation was modified to stay in a different room in her room than what I booked. She said that she had some regulars come in for the weekend and she gave them my reserved room.  The room I was moved to was fine, however, the main reason I requested my particular room was because of the private bathroom.  So my friend and I had to use the bathroom down the hall, but Julett assured me there would be no one else using that bathroom at all but me.  On at least 3 occasions, I went into that bathroom and the toilet was unflushed from someone using it, I knew it was not me or my friend, so someone in the house was obviously using the bathroom as well, and also not cleaning up behind themselves.  Also, one morning that I was taking a shower, someone kept knocking on the door and twisting at the handle, when I finally exited the bathroom I saw that there was a 7 or 8 year old girl standing there like she was waiting to use the bathroom, again I was told that this would not be a shared bathroom.  When I was walking back to the kitchen, I also noticed an older man brushing his teeth in the kitchen sink.
2. I'm assuming the other people that were staying there were a family of about 5 or so people, so it was uncomfortable for me to walk to and from the bathroom because they would be sitting at the kitchen table just kind of staring.  My friend and I even came home one night at about 1 am, and they were still sitting at the kitchen table. So again it made me uncomfortable going back and forth to the shower.
3. The home is extremely muggy, I'm assuming because the air does not run much. I had a wall unit in my room, but it still did not really cool the area down, so it was hard sleeping being so hot.

All together this is a pretty nice home and my experience was not that bad. However,it is just extremely far from the city so be careful with coming back so late the trains only run like every hour. I found out the hard way!
Jullett's a nice host. Comfortable. Easy access to Manhattan. If I have a chance to go to NY again, I would stay her house and talk with her more.
My experience during our short stay with Ms Juliet was superb. The place was very clean and well kept. I whole heartedly recommend her
Yes, yes.

c'était la première fois que j'utilisais airbnb et je  me suis permise de lui téléphoner de France pour voir comment je récupérais les clés puisqu'elle ne savait même pas à quelle heure j'arrivais et comment aller chez elle. Elle m'a demandé si j'avais un numéro de réservation et dans ce cas lire ses recommandations. Je lui ai exprimé mes difficultés en anglais…toujours pas du tout aimable. Pas du tout rassurée. Elle m'a ensuite bien expliqué pour aller à NY City, parfait pour cette partie là. La chambre est correcte, le lit bon, par contre un(e) voisin(e) au dessus fait du bruit( marche comme sur un plancher) jusqu'à 1h du mat et recommence à 5h …quand dort il (elle)? très bruyant aussi avec les avions…10 minutes de l'aéroport et mauvaise isolation phonique.

Jullett is a very friendly and helpful host. She arrived when we reached the place and explained everything to us, along with helping us with a map of NY and directions on how to get around and what to see. Overall, very satisfied. :)
Also, the place is 5mins from JFK airport by cab. But almost 1.5hrs to Manhattan if you take the bus and subway or 30mins if you take the Long Island Railroad.
Nice comfortable place but far from manhattan

Everything was as expected nothing more nothing less. Very clean and spacious.
One suggestion is to provide the contact of the care taker for easier communication.

The room is tidy and clean, so is the common area. The neighborhood is also nice and people are very friendly. Only downside is you can hear the noise from upstairs pretty well, so it gets annoying during night time cuz people upstairs were moving around stuff even after 12am.

Upon arriving at Jullett's Airbnb I introduced myself and extended my hand but she stated "that won't be necessary", so the initial experience was not welcoming. The handle to the front gate came off in my hand in front of Jullett but that was replaced later. The place was as described. Room and bathroom were clean, but one of the towels although I felt it was clean it had some yellowish stains. I called and texted Jullett but got no response at first, then seeing  a family member on the property and asked them to help me out which occurred a day later exchanging the towel and providing me with a requested bath towel. She was very nice. The only nightstand lamp was broken (there was an overhead light) and I informed Jullett about that with no response. I did feel safe in the neighborhood. The parking was A+. Although the two dogs behind the gate made alot of noise they were nice but walking over the poop when departing wasn't. And as a previous reviewer stated there is alot of noise heard over those hardwood floors when trying to sleep. Lastly, I only communicated with the host on check-in; luckily nothing urgent came up. Overall, it's a tossup, you can't beat the price, the place is clean, safe, great parking and some compromising as mentioned above. Thanks.
The host canceled this reservation 22 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
My plans fell thru last minute and Jullett was very gracious to allow me to book right away. thanks
The room was clean. The place is in a good neighborhood, many ways to go to Manhattan. We enjoyed our staying! Thank you Jullett!

Juliet made me feel welcome by allowing me to get to know the home and be familiar with the surrounding and be comfortable like it was my own home. The place was clean and tidy and parking on the street wasn't a long wait for parking. The neighbourhood was great and I felt very safe.

A good and well described room ! 
The communication with Jullett was easy, we had no problem during our trip to New York !

Firstly let me say that I went to this apartment with an open mind as it was my first time using the service however I was given an instant shocker when the host didn't turn up until over an hour after my scheduled arrival time and with no one to assist me with checking in I had to sit outside and wait, I tried calling her posted number without success only to see her arrive and as abruptly and unapologetic as ever she walked in with a blande hi. No explanation or apology for being so tardy was given and despite her being rude throughout my entire checking in process I went along with it as she outlined to me when I asked about canceling she swiftly mentioned to me the she won't allow my payment to be released to me. Throughout my entire stay I had no one to get information from as she never answers her phone I had to just do without basic stuff that should have been provided, it was mostly noisy at nights waking me up several times per night. The only positive thing I can say about the apartment is it isn't dirty but the hosts attitude is and on my final day during packing I was made aware that my car which was parked out front was broken into and when the police came to take a report even before I got a chance to thoroughly check my vehicle she told them that they can leave because I don't seem like I cared. All in all I must say it was four days in a nightmare for me and I only went along with it because at the point when I arrived I had no choice but I definitely wouldn't recommend the place as a place to be , the host is rude, the area isn't safe , the place is noisy and generally it wasn't what was described on the site, highly disappointed.
The location is convenient near the JFK airport. Also is very easy to go to Manhattan using the public transportation
Place was beyond clean & I will book again if necessary
The Jullett's place is very good.

A really great place we got to stay in after our hotel room got canceled on us.
The room is exactly as pictured, the space very clean and spacious. The bathroom was great.
I highly recommend the deli down the street. Overall, a great and relaxed area.

Only “complaint” if any is that the walls are kinda thin. I could hear the people upstairs moving about at various hours of the day and it was LOUD.

Another thing to know, AT&T users, is that the service in that area is poor. I could barely send text messages out.
Fair

Alex had a spacious room for us. He was helpful in marking locations in Brooklyn when we asked. 
We were reluctant to stay in Brooklyn, but we enjoyed the old brownstone neighborhood.  We felt it was a very safe neighborhood. It was easy to get to Manhattan on the many express B and Q trains. We enjoyed seeing the skyline of Manhattan and the East River each day.
Alex was very friendly and helpful. The place is conveniently located near a nice park and trains to the city.

Great location: stone's throw from Ft. Greene Park, the DeKalb Ave scene, lots of subway lines within short walk (easy & fast to get to lower Manhattan).  Brownstone on tree-lined street creates a relaxing, neighborhood feel.  Alex made sure all of the logistics went smoothly--nice spacious room with desk/wireless to get a spot of work done.  And the cat was great company!
Alex was friendly and welcoming.  The building is comfortable and interesting, very much like the neighborhood.

Alex's apartment is genial, interesting, eclectic--very much like him.  The location is supreme, on one of the loveliest streets--engrossing brownstones, lush trees, cafes/restaus/shops just a meander around the corner-- in Brooklyn.  Your privacy is assured in Alex's apartment but, should he be around, and you're keen to receive excellent conversation, or prosaic and poetic hints and leads about gems or happenings in the city, he's a wonderful resource.  Thanks for a great experience, Alex.  ...and perhaps again, in the future!

Alex is such a great host, very nice, considerate, helpful. The room is clean, spacious, comfortable - nicely decorated. The common areas and rest of apartment are very clean and well kept as well. Great location - on a beautiful street just off the main part of Fort Greene with all the great shops, restaurants etc it offers. I really enjoyed my stay!

What can i say about Alex that has not already been said in this forum. He is a very likable, gracious and generous host with a wonderful spacious room available in his apartment. He was also really considerate giving me lots of space and quiet to research and study at the very adequate desk in my room.

The room was very clean and light filled by two towering windows and a large palmy pot plant. the grand 4 post Balinese bed with firm futon was also a treat - as was the super fast/reliable internet connection and vast book collection. 

Bathroom and kitchen were also suitably clean and functional. 

I would happily recommend alex and his house to anyone coming to new york and i would happily stay there again.  

Thanks for being a champ alex!

JK

ps: his friends are great too.
Alex was a very good host, full of local knowledge and very helpful.  The apartment is in a fab spot.  Great fun.

A thoroughly enjoyable trip! Apartment was great - nice location, safe, homely and an ideal base for exploring the city. Alex is a friendly and knowledgeable host who was keen to help us make the most of our trip to NY. Highly recommended!
Alex is a thoughtful and generous host. His apartment is in an excellent location near so many wonderful restaurants, and he keeps it nice and clean. I would highly recommend.

Alex was a fun host. Despite a busy schedule he was very accomodating to us and made us feel at home. Great, eclectic apartment in good, safe area of Brooklyn. Easy subway access to everywhere. About 20 min on subway to lower Manhattan. We had a good time with Alex and Frankie the cat (!) and would def stay again!

Alex was away during my stay, so Frankie (the cat) and I had the apartment all to ourselves and had a great time. I absolutely loved the neighbourhood, great bistros and a very relaxed and friendly feel. It's only a short subway ride or a slightly longer walk to Manhattan and the apartment itself is very clean and comfortable (though the mattress is a futon, and firm, which might bother some). I would highly recommend the apartment, so much so that I am going back for a couple more days before I leave town :)
Second stay at Alex's was just as good as the first time, with the added bonus of getting to meet Alex! I highly recommend a stay in Fort Greene.

I stayed with Alex last week and it was fine. The room and bed are comfortable; the bathroom good. Plus, you have the wonderful company of an aged cat named Frankie who is friendly but not intrusive. My few conversations with Alex were interesting but too short. I look forward to staying with him again.

I spent an excellent and fun 1 and a half weeks with Alex.  His place is very spacious and big.  You are about two to three block walking distance to everything in the Fort Greene area.  Or if you prefer, you can take the train to Manhattan and it only takes about 30 minutes from the door to Times Square!  

Alex himself is a very relaxed and trusting person.  I just met him for one hour only and he just handed me his keys to leave for a 2 day video shoot!  We shared some great stories and he even made breakfast a few times, which were very delicious.  

He does have a cat named Frankie but he is very chill and relaxed.  You can pet him all you want and then close your door to leave him out.  Frankie doesn't care.  I would recommend staying with Alex.

Alex's space is large and clean and very warm in winter. It is so well located that everything - including subways, BAM, wine, great food is in walking distance. He is very helpful and a delightful and charming host. 
The bed is a fabulous adventure. Thanks!

Alex was a great host. Very personable and helpful. We had some fun conversation. He can give you lots of pointers. The room was pretty good size, bigget then you'd typically find in a New York hotel.  There is lots of space to store your stuff and Alex provides towels and all the bedding.  The location was great as well.  It's close to Fort Greene park and the nearest DeKalb train station is only 1 stop from Manhattan.  15 to 20 min, and you are in Manhattan.  Will definitely stay again.

This is a great spot. Plenty of space, very clean, lots of interesting books to skim and in an ideal location. Alex is a lovely host and I appreciated all his insight. I would most certainly come again.

I stayed with Alex for a whole month, he is a great roommate, I had to leave suddenly due to a family illness and he was most accommodating and helpful with my adjusted travel plans. He is a most lovely man, a font of information on the neighborhood, the borough and indeed even the city. Be sure to try his family's olive oil, it is delish! And his library is most fun on a winter's day.

Alex is a very gracious and friendly host who made me feel right at home.  And the room itself is very spacious and comfortable, with a great book collection and nice desk space for any work.  The neighborhood is charming as well.  I enjoyed my stay and would stay again!
Alex was a thoughtful and friendly host. Apartment was lovely and in a great location. Would definitely recommend staying with Alex if you get the chance!
Alex was a fabulous host!!!! Place was perfect and he makes a mean coffee... Will definitely stay again... Thanks Alex!!!

I loved the bedroom here, it was spacious and big enough for me to hang out and relax in. It took very little time to make myself at home!
Alex was a very helpful and accomodating host. We didn't see much of each other during my stay but that was due to both of us having busy work schedules.
You will be sharing the apartment with Frankie the cat too, so if you're not a cat person then this probably isn't the place for you. However, I got to really like Frankie and his ways but kept my door shut in order to have my own cat free space. 

Overall, a great bedroom and a great part of Brooklyn to stay in, highly recommended!

Beautiful, clean apartment in a safe neighborhood.  Alexander is a great host with lots of info on where to eat, places to visit (neat farmer's market nearby on Saturdays).  I would highly recommend this place, if I come back to NYC I would stay here again!

We stayed in Alex' room for 3 nights and it was very good. The room is big, clean and there is a lot of nice books and funny stuff. Alex is really nice and we felt very welcome. The area in Brooklyn is beautiful. There is a really nice cafe on the same street, good coffee and food... really chilled out. We would both like to go back and visit Alex again. Thanks

I could not have asked for a better start to my time in NYC! Alex was an incredible host. Helpful, interesting, respectful and full of great stories, advice and directions. His apartment is clean, comfortable and full of interesting pieces of furniture, art, books and objects.  Fort Greene is gorgeous and the apartment is close to everything you could possibly need. The cafe at the end of the street does great food and coffee and the local farmers and flea markets (where Alex sells his olive oil)  are great places to head on a Saturday. There is never a lack of things to do and places to eat in the area and is also the trip to Manhattan on the Subway is quick and easy. 

Hint: Always say yes if Alex asks you to join him and his friends on a night out! 

Thanks Alex!
Alexander was great! Very friendly and accommodating. I would stay there again if I had to. Location is great and Frankie, the cat was very friendly as well.

I had a great stay with Alex. The apartment is on the parlor (main) floor of the building, thus the room has wonderful high ceilings, is spacious with lovely details. The Balinese-imported bed is really quite stunning, and will comfortably sleep 2. 

I had full use of the kitchen, and laundry facilities, which made my stay all the more homey. 

Frankie, the 18-year-old cat that hangs out in the kitchen, is really sweet, though incredibly frail. Then again, I'll be frail when I'm 89.

I had a wonderful stay and Alex is an extraordinarily generous host who made sure I had everything I need.  He was away on business but I was completely taken care of and he was very responsive through email and text.  

The room is huge and beautiful, lots of character.  The location is perfect, very close to subway, in sweet and charming Fort Greene.  Coffee shops, grocery stores, restaurants, wine shop, all within a few minutes walk.

Highly recommended!

Alex's brownstone apartment was very charming and comfortable.... beautiful street and easy access to public transportation. As a host, Alex was friendly, accommodating and informative.... also a funny, likable guy. Will definitely be my place to stop in Brooklyn

Alex is a great host. He is friendly, hospitable, easy going and supplies you with all the basics. We didn't see a lot of him during our short stay.

The place is great. Clean, nice room, easy access to transit, close to prospect park and all the other great spots in Brooklyn. Alex's flat is perfect for couples, and it is located in a good neighbourhood.

The neighbourhood is great, many restaurants, a nice park, and the trains to Manhattan are a short walk away. The firm, comfortable bed and spacious room were just what we needed to relax after a busy day. Thanks Alex !

Alex was an awesome host :) 

Frankie the cat is adorable too ... definitely a nice companion to go home to!
It is a very nice area in Brooklyn, close to subways and plenty of places to go nearby. We had a great stay.

Alex, Frankie and friends were a joy to be around.  Beautiful apartment, very homey for the homies; my sis and I felt very comfortable, as though we'd lived there for awhile.  And Alex even listened to our last minute acting skit!   Staying with him was nothing like a hotel, but rather like a visit to an old friends place.  While we were given our own room and space, it was just a huge plus that our host couldn't have been friendlier... or suaver **.  Also, French honey is the tastiest... and the olive oil.

Alex's place is flat awesome. The room is spacious with eclectic-hip decor and remote controlled lights! Alex himself is generous, informative, and full of interesting stories. Plenty of good restaurants/cafes within walking distance, though the subway is about 5-10 min away (upside, the daily walk past Ft. Greene Park). Overall, highly recommend this spot in downtown Brooklyn.

This is a lovely room in a spacious flat in a great area. The bed is comfortable and the bathroom and kitchen facilities are good. Transport links are close and plentiful.

My experience of staying here was not ideal, however, because Alex's twenty-year-old cat had quit using his litter tray, and I spent much of the time cleaning up cat poop. It's not the cat's fault, twenty is pretty old for a cat. But my advice is to check with Alex before you book. If the cat is still going to be your roommate, you may want to stay elsewhere.

Alex, a hospitable host, all cleaned and carefully!) Great area with walking distance to the subway, not far from where you want to just in New York. Hopefully see you again, we had a great time! Thank you very much))
Alex is an interesting, generous and welcoming host with a comfortable apartment convenient for cafes, restaurants and transport.
I really enjoyed my staying there and Alex's got a really nice apartment.

La situation est parfaite, environ 15mn pour gagner Manhattan par la ligne express et j'ai adoré Brooklyn!
J'avais beaucoup aimé la photo de la maison et je n'ai pas été déçue.
Alexander est très accueillant, "easygoing" et donne des conseils judicieux pour sortir des sentiers battus. Nous nous sommes tout de suite senties très à l'aise. J'y retournerai volontiers demain!
Alex did everything to make our stay most agreeable and so it was! A great New York appartment in a beautiful and welcoming neighbourhood! I would instantly move in there! Thanks again!
Great place to stay.  Nice neighborhood, easy access to transportation and good restaurants.

We had a lovely time in Alex'x apartment, though our favourite part being Smooch cafe on the corner, Kirk made us feel like locals. Best flat white in NYC. Sadly we missed the cat by a couple of weeks...

Thanks again
You will feel inspired and relaxed at Alex's place. A wonderful experience. Forte Green is the best place to stay in New  York. Thanks Alex!

Had a wonderful stay with Alex. A great guy, very interesting, and a fantastic place in Fort Greene. The apartment is in a very good location, close to all of the major subways. Would happily stay here again!

We had a perfect stay at Alex's place while we looked nearby for an apartment of own own.  An excellent launchpad for such a search because he lives in my favorite neighborhood in Brooklyn. 

Alex was away during our stay but he made sure to think of everything.  Getting the keys was flexible and easy even with him away.  Also in case of any issues that might come up he had people in the neighborhood with keys of their own etc.  

The apartment itself is quite comfortable - a brownstone parlor floor with the high ceilings - beautiful design.  The guest bed is detailed with wood carving a kind of canopy (?) style bed. Cool!  Little details around the apartment suggest worldwide adventure.  
Great stuff.

Alex is a great host - even though he was not there during most of my stay, he respondend promptly to any questions, and he had lots of practical advice and tips for the neighbourhood and movies around town. 
The room itself is spacious, with a large and comfy 2-person bed. There was a row of plants right outside the windows to the street, which was lovely. The kitchen is fully equipped for home cooking. Kitchen and bathroom are not all new and shiny, but they are kept very clean.
The best thing about the place is the location: just steps from DeKalb Avenue with its lovely cafés and restaurants and one block from the park. Many subways at close walking distance take you to Manhattan quickly. But you may just want to stay in the area :-)

Great location in a lovely neighborhood - easy access to transit, and good local restaurants. Alex's room is quiet, comfortable, and has a great collection of books that could keep me entertained for quite a long time. Alex couldn't have been more accommodating - the key exchange was easy, and when I managed to lock us both out of the apartment (yay, me!) he was completely gracious about it. I'll be back next time I'm in Brooklyn!

Alex was so accommodating - my stay was last minute and he generously improvised a key pick-up and other arrangements that worked for me.  The room was just beautiful - enormous and flooded with natural light, filled with bookshelves (of quality stuff, too) that made me feel like working or reading instead of going out to see brooklyn....But I did of course, because Fort Greene is a wonderful, relaxed place to stay with great eating and strolling to be done in the surrounding blocks. And Fort Greene park around the corner is delightful.  Although I didn't see Alex much he was lovely to briefly chat with.  Recommend to others without reserve.

I had the most amazing month staying at Alex's in Fort Greene.
The room Alex offers, is gorgeous and felt like home almost immediately, infact that was my experience of the whole apartment. Everything you need is there, it's on a gorgeous tree lined street with fabulous neighbourhood bars, restaurants, yoga and parks and the wonderful BAM about a ten min walk away.
I was so fond of Alex too, he is a caring host who makes you feel 100% at home and I really enjoyed seeing him when our paths crossed - he gave me great advice in things to do alongside just being a really great guy. I will be back for sure and can't recommend a stay here highly enough.
I never met Alex, but had a really comfortable and stress free stay in his apartment. Very easy and convenient.

This was quite a last-minute trip to New York, and Alex couldn't have been more accommodating and helpful.  The key pick-up was easy, and he gave me lots of helpful information about the nearest subways and taxi prices.  The apartment is in a lovely area in Fort Greene, a nice big comfy bed and spacious room.  I was out for most of my short stay, but it was always great to come back to at the end of the evening.  I met Alex briefly on my final day and he was very nice and charming.  I would certainly stay again.
My stay at Alex's was great! Alex is a super generous and thoughtful host. All the logistics were clear and simple. Apt is perfectly located and the room is cozy and nice! Highly recommend.
Alex was a great host! He was away at the time of our stay, but everything was well organized and went off without a hitch. We would definitely stay again!

Alex was a great host and very good at communicating, he even  managed to arrange a check in despite of  his own flights being seriously delayed due to bad weather and storms.
The room is really spacious and facing a quiet street.  Sitting by the window in the morning, with my cup of tea, planning the day ahead became my daily routine, it was easy to feel at home.
I am happy I chose to stay in Brooklyn and at Fort Greene, on my first visit to NY, Alex´s place was good to come back to after my trips to (more noisy) Manhattan.
Oh, and there is a dream of a wine store on the corner, with organic wines and super knowledgeable staff. 
I would recommend Fort Greene and Alex´s place to my fellow travellers.

Alex's lovely brownstone in the heart of Fort Greene was the perfect place to stay in the neighborhood while I was hunting for my own apartment there. It's just steps to amazing dining (Madiba and Smooch Cafe) and unique shopping. A block or so from the trains into the city. Large, roomy and cozy during an especially snowy week. Alex was particularly hospitable to accept my last-minute booking, and when I left behind my iPad and shoes after leaving, he was nice enough to drive them to me.

This is basically a bargain. You get more than your moneys worth. The neighborhood is centrally located yet quiet and the room is clean, filled with light and is comfortably spacious. Alex is super friendly, super smart and super 
helpful. The spot is nicely located close to several subway lines which makes it easy to reach both Manhattan and other areas in Brooklyn, such as Williamsburg. I thoroughly recommend this spot for NYC visitor. That being said this probably gives most value to visitors who know the city and what to appreciate.

Had a fabulous time in Brooklyn at Alex's beautiful home. Although Alex is frequently out, he made every effort to ensure our stay was both comfortable and enjoyable. Would easily stay here again, and recommend anyone else do the same!

Fort Greene remains just the best neighborhood to stay in in Brooklyn.  Alexander's apartment is on the main (parlor) floor of a 130 year old brownstone. The room you stay in is what was formerly the parlor (which means it's in the front and is large) when this was, in long ago times, a one family home. It has been converted to an 8 family, but Alexander's apartment is very good size, with a large kitchen and bath. The queen size bed and pillows were very comfortable and my frequently temperamental neck gave me no problems. The stay was totally smooth, although Alex was not there as he was away on business. Highly recommended!

Alex has been a wonderful host - very communicative and generous with tips and information.  The apartment is exactly what the profile promises and completely wonderful in every way - perfect location, great value and very homey to come back to.  I can't imagine anyone would be disappointed staying here.

I stayed at Alex's for 2 months and it was amazing ... fantastic location, safe, secure, beautiful and light.  It was like living on the set of every fabulous movie ever made about Brooklyn, only better!

Alex was a wonderful host, even though I only saw him for a couple of days while he was in town briefly before heading off to the World Cup in Brazil.  He made arrangements for a friend to meet me at the apartment when I arrived - I was late and Miki was super patient and gracious in waiting for me.  He was always communicative the whole time he was away - super thoughtful in sending me tips on things to see and do in Brooklyn and NYC - and left me a bunch of numbers for local contacts who could assist while he was in Brazil.

This was a fantastic place to stay - the location is superb, the communication with Alex effortless and the apartment itself is charming.

We had a lovely stay at Alex's brownstone for an extended weekend. The apartment was perfect and located in the beautiful neighborhood of Fort Greene. It was the ideal retreat after long days of exploring New York. Alex was always available when we had questions and was happily forthcoming with suggestions for restaurants in the area. We had the apartment to ourselves as Alex was out of town during our stay. There is nothing like sitting on the stoop of a brownstone with your morning coffee. Beautiful.

This is a gem of place. I found it an easy to walk to the subway, loved having a park nearby to wander around, and there are a number of streets nearby with restaurants, bars, and convenience.

The street itself is lined with trees, and building has character.

The room is huge, and Alex is often travelling for work, so you may end up with the whole place to yourself, but if not then Alex is a really warm and friendly person that will make you feel at home. I'm a bit on the quiet side, but it didn't seem to bother Alex at all. Wish I had a change to take him up on opportunities to go out, but unfortunately the timing didn't quite work.

My only struggle was that there was some construction going on across the road during the day and I was doing some remote working, but there are places nearby to go, and the double glazed windows keep a lot of the sound out if it's a real issue (I preferred having the fresh air).
The apartment was great and Alex was a fantastic host!

The room is really big and comfortable, and Alex was a friendly and generous host. It's in a really nice part of Brooklyn too, a minute's walk to Fort Greene Park and surrounded by cafes and restaurants. I really recommend staying here.

It was all great; the arrangements for getting in (Alex was away at the beginning) worked seamlessly, and the flat was lovely in itself, and a wonderful base for exploring in Brooklyn and Manhattan (very handy both for walking and for subway system).  When Alex returned we were room-mates for a while, and we had some good chats about common interests.  I'd highly recommend this as a place to stay.  One thing that some people might be sensitive to is that the heating is controlled centrally so the individual room control is limited to opening or closing the window; a minor point, and it didn't bother me, but if heating is a bug-bear for you...
Had a great 2 week stay at Alexander's place. The location is prime Fort Greene next to bars, restaurants and the trains and of course the park. Always again!

Alex was a superb host and made my stay very comfortable. Since he is a world travel himself, he knows exactly what a visitor needs to hit the ground running and what to look forward at the end of the day: an extremely comfortable bed, nearby bathroom & shower, kitchen -- all very tidy and clean -- plus a view of a beautiful Brooklyn street. You can't help feeling the building's history as well of the surrounding neighborhood. A few easy minutes to the subway and BAM. Great location. Highest recommendation.
As a first time user of Airbnb I had a very positive experience. Alexander is a helpful and friendly host. The apartment is lovely and in a great neighborhood.

Great neighborhood and quiet street. The room is huge to NYC standards. Subways, that can take you anywhere in the city, are a walk away. I only met Alex one time to get the keys since he was traveling, but he was kind and helping me even while being abroad. Good place to stay!

Stayed at alex's and what a brilliant trip it was. The house was great as was Alex. His place was a splendidly friendly place, very relaxed. The location is spot on in a great part of Brooklyn and subways into Manhattan are close enough to get either there or to the beach of Coney island in half an hour (or just walk into manhattan over the brooklyn bridge). There wasn't a single thing wrong with our stay.
Stayed at Alex's apartment and had a great time! Even though he wasn't there, he made sure every detail was covered and my needs were met. I highly recommend it!

Alexander was a perfect host, even though he was away while we where staying in his place. No problems checking in and getting the keys, and with any question we had, he responded very quickly. A great (quiet) place to get to know New York, with Manhattan close by metro! Lots of shops and restaurants around, a nice Bitter Sweet (recommended!), so, all considered, a nice appartment to stay!

We liked our stay at Alexander's apartment. Although he wasn't at home, he was a good host. The apartment is spacious and the neighbourhood just great! Good coffee in the street and around the corner. :-)

Alex wasn't around while I was there, but he was a good host nevertheless: available and helpful. I could leave my bags at his place until the evening the day of my departure, which was very convenient. The room is beautiful, with lots of light. Great book selection and a comfortable bed. The neighbourhood is lovely as well: calm but lively enough, with some nice restaurants and shops around. Lots of subway stops in close proximity. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks, Alex.

Alexander was a great host, really easy to deal with, got to stay at short notice, the place was really awesome! Beautiful part of Brooklyn, really peaceful but close to transportation, like 10 mins into Manhattan! I would definitely stay there again, highly recommended!
The host canceled this reservation 20 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

I and my friend had the pleasure of staying at Alex's place and really enjoyed his company. We didn't feel like we were just guests at his house, we definitely made a new friend! Alex has awesome NYC recommendations and just an overall great person to talk to. He was welcoming and made us coffee and let us have anything in the fridge. 
You're awesome, Alex. I'll be sure to stay with you again for my next visit!

Foi muito bom ter me hospedado com meu filho na casa do Alex. O quarto é grande e o apartamento oferece tudo o que precisamos. O Alex viaja bastante e ficou pouco tempo conosco, mas no período em que estava no apartamento foi bastante solícito, nos ajudou no que precisamos e foi muito simpático. A localização é muito boa, próximo a pelo menos três estações de metrô. As ruas são tranquilas e arborizadas. O apartamento é antigo, mas charmoso e limpo. Eu me hospedaria novamente com certeza e recomendo.
I was in kind of a bind needing a place to stay on short notice. Alex replied promptly and was very welcoming.

O Alex fica pouco em casa, me senti bem à vontade no espaço. Inclusive, para usar a cozinha. O bairro, é ótimo, eu já conhecia. Uma região ótima do Brooklyn, perto de estações de metrô, parques, restaurantes... ideal para quem busca qualidade de vida em NY.  O aprtamento é bem espaçoso e confortável. O Alex fala um pouco de português também... foi um ótimo anfitrião, bastante sociável e atencioso, mesmo quando ausente.

Accueil très chaleureux de la part d'Alexander qui a tout fait pour que nous nous sentions à l'aise et chez nous dans son appartement et dans le quartier. Il nous a raconté l'histoire de fort greene et nous a aiguillé sur la vie culturelle de Brooklyn. Nous avons vraiment pris plaisir a rester ici. 

L'appartement est très bien situé ; idéal pour partir à la fois à la découverte de Manhattan et de Brooklyn ! Le quartier est très sympa avec beaucoup de bar / resto aux alentours. Nous recommandons vivement cet appartement et cet hôte !

I had a great long weekend stay at Alex's apartment. The room was perfect (lots of interesting books) and a large,  cosy bed. Alex was extremely helpful in terms of prompt responses, flexible check in and out times and places to check out around the area. I'd highly recommend his apartment! Thanks, Alex!

Absolutely great stay. I've been coming to New York for more than 16 years now, but I have rarely seen a room as nice as the one Alex provides to his guests -- beautiful wooden floors and shutters, high ceiling, great library. The neighborhood, Fort Greene, is very pleasant, and the park is literally around the corner. Alex was very welcoming, even though I gave him only -very- short notice of my arrival. Crucially, he seems to really enjoy having guests over, which is important, as one is sharing the facilities (kitchen, bathroom) with him. I never felt I was 'in his space' or anything like that. Instead, we had nice conversations, even while he gave me my space and was out of the house most of the time I was there. In short, highly recommended.

Alex place is located in a great neighbourhood with two nice coffee shops close by ("Smooch" right down the street, and "WTF coffee club" on the next block which makes extremely good coffee!). The room is huge, with high ceiling, a good bed with a very comfortable mattress, the apartment is clean and the street is quiet at night. We just had a chance to meet Alex the first night and talk a bit over a couple of Pale Ale's. Besides english he parle francais perfectly. He'll tell you more...
He was really busy with the Pope's visit and UN council etc. plus we were out all day visiting NY and came back only late in the evenings. But we can recommend his place as part of your NY experience - it's definitely not an impersonal hotel room, it's not hyper modern, but you'll find lots of interesting books, art and personality.

Alexander est un hôte très sympathique, accueillant et généreux.
Très bien située dans brooklyn, avec une belle grande chambre propre et lit confortable, cette adresse est juste parfaite !

Excellent location, 10 minutes from different subway lines (B, Q, R, 4, 5, G). The neighborhood itself is really nice, with many cafes and restaurants and the feel of a real community. The room is really spacious and well equiped, with cool decorations and a lot of sunlight. Everything is clean. Alex was helpful and contacts with him (mails and phone, we didn't meet) were smooth and precise.

La estadía en la casa de Alexander fue muy grata. La casa era cómoda y el barrio era muy lindo, un típico barrio de brooklyn. Está bien ubicada, a pocas cuadras de un subte y cerca también de estaciones de citybike. Durante nuestra estadía Alexander se encontraba de viaje, así que no llegamos a conocerlo en persona, pero fue muy buen anfitrión y se comunicó constantemente con nosotras para explicarnos todo y que nos sintiéramos cómodas allí.

The room was cozy, bright with natural light and perfect for our needs.  I was surprised at how quiet it was. The bed was very comfy and the room was clean and full of wonderful literature.   We very much enjoyed meeting Alexander and had time to get to know him a bit.  He's easy-going and flexible. We were attending a reunion at Brooklyn Tech HS, so the location was perfect for us and we found some small, lively, excellent restaurants within a very short walk.  A great experience overall.

Fort Greene park is one of my favorite places in Brooklyn, especially before 9am when it's off-lease time for a legion of four legged creatures. A very fun part of my morning commute for my week of work. The room is plenty large with nice tall ceilings and amazing morning light through 2 tall windows. The room is sparsely furnished but has lots of books and enough space to store a week's worth of clothes(hanging and in drawers). The door to the room is a sliding door which doesn't do much for audio privacy but works fine visually. Host was easy to plan with. This room is on my short list for my somewhat regular work trips to the area.

Alexander is a very nice person. He did everything he could to make my wife and I have a good time at his house. He gave us tips of restaurants, free concerts and museums. We talked about our jobs, our cities... It was a pleasure to know him. The neighborhood is safe and calm. Brooklyn is an interesting place to explore and the Alex's house is located in a strategic area, not far to the Brooklyn Bridge and 3 blocks to the subway. It was a good exploring experience because although we know some of Brooklyn, it was the first time we stayed over there. Amazing.

Cannot recommend enough! Such a beautiful area and neighborhood, plenty of things to do, easy commutes and a washer/dryer to boot. Stayed for a few weeks with my girlfriend and we had a great time here. Alex wasn't around but was attentive and quick to respond. A little hot in the summer months without the AC, but a few fans managed to keep us cool

I recommend saving yourself the headache and avoid staying at Alexander's place.

The problem isn't the place, but how Alexander deals with disagreement and in general his communication skills.  He not only refused to discuss the matter, but called me a series of names unpublishable here.  

In Alexander's advertisement, he wrote in his all caps, "YOU'LL HAVE THE APARTMENT TO YOURSELF."  Approximately, two to three weeks before I was going to stay, Alex emailed me to let me know that three different sets of guests may end up staying with me in a separate room.  

I noted to Alex that this was different than the advertisement.  I offered however that perhaps we could limit to two out of the three potential guests.  

Alex wrote back twice that it was "not negotiable." that  "luckily for you, the apartment will be empty almost the entire time."  Alex told me that he could have as many guests there as he wanted, and that he could come back anytime if he wanted to as well.  

At that point, I called AirBnB.  As a courtesy, I told Alex that Air BnB might call him.  He wrote back that "knowing that the person staying there is not worthy of my welcome rankles me", that "he dreaded to learn of my true intentions."  He added, "I said your request was non-negotiable."  "What is my problem?"  

He called me his "skittish prima donna guest from Bogota."

He wrote, Truly I would rather not have dealt with you at all."  

"Can we stop talking about this (cuss word).  You are getting 27 days on your own far more than I ever get - so just enjoy the solitude."  

Air BnB called him and told him that I was in the right, to please modify his favor.  Alex told Air Bn B he wouldn't do so.  We settled the matter with Air BnB.    

I add that in my letters I was always polite to Alex in all my emails, rarely bothered arguing the point, and never responded in kind with aggressive or hostile language.  

Lastly, in general Alexander sends three to five emails to answer one simple question.  Four emails to say how to water the plants.  A lot of them are unclear and repetitive.  It just creates a lot of confusion and wastes time.  

The apartment is great and probably nothing will happen.  But if you do end up disagreeing with Alexander, even if you're clearly in the right and are still willing to compromise, Alex will overwhelm you with hostile emails.  

Why risk it?

The host was really kind and nice, and the room was very comfortable. 
The Fort Greene area was also beautiful. 
And the location was quite close to all the areas that I wanted to visit in Manhattan or Brooklyn.
Everything was nice, lucky to stay there :>

Très bonne expérience dans l'appartement d'Alexander. Nous ne sommes pas rencontrés physiquement mais avons longuement échangé avant notre arrivée. L'appartement a tout ce qu'il faut, il est très bien situé dans Brooklyn (pas trop loin de JFK et à quelques stations de métro de Manhattan). Le bâtiment est un vrai brownstone très mignon. La rue est calme mais le quartier est animé pour qui veut sortir ou aller au restaurant.
Tout a été facile (check in tardif, check out à une heure qui nous arrangeait)
Je recommande vivement cet endroit !

My dad had a wonderful stay at Alexander's place. The room was gorgeous and he slept super well in the tranquil surroundings. Alexander was super communicative and accommodating throughout the whole time. Fort Greene is also the loveliest neighborhood. Thanks!

The apartment was just perfect for us.  The room is very large with high ceilings and terrific light through large windows that open for fresh air.  In addition to the opening windows, there are three fans for your comfort.  The location is great, friendly, and safe.  The bed was super comfortable and plenty big enough for two large people.  The bathroom and kitchen are very adequate and well-equipped.  Alexander was wonderful to work with and, even though he was not there very much during our stay, we shared a lot and he was most helpful in making our stay comfortable and enjoyable.  We will gladly stay there again.

Alexander communicates well and fast. The apartment is very much like being advertised. Very good location in Brooklyn, very nice to take every day citybike (just arround the corner) to manhattan over brooklyn bridge in less than 20 minutes. The place is clean and I guess a typical way many people live in new york which is a nice change to the normal smaller hotel rooms.

Alexander's room is just as described here, large, private and separate from his living space. The neighborhood is ideal, on a quiet street close to lots of grocery stores, restaurants, a great bookstore, places to see cinema, concerts and theater, and lots of convenient transports. Very convenient for both JFK and locations in Manhattan. 
From the moment I made the reservation, Alex was extremely helpful. He is often away traveling, but I was fortunate to meet him just at the end of my stay, because he is lovely company (also speaks French fluently). Very highly recommend!
Lovely room, nice library, great neighborhood, and Alexander is a kind, helpful and generous host.
We enjoyed our stay and exploring the areas nearby.  Vanderbilt has great restaurants and shops. Lots to do along Flatbush (a bit of a walk).

Alex was fantastic--communicative and friendly,making sure everything was taken care of. The place was essentially all mine. It was clean and comfortable, stocked with all essentials. Great location as well.
Everything was really nice! Felt like home! Thank you!

Location is awesome and what a nice big room. Alexander was gone for the majority of my time there, so I had my own apt! When he did return I enjoyed meeting him. Throughout my whole stay it was easy and pleasurable to communicate with him.

This is my second time staying with Alex. I love this place. Fantastic location for me. Old style charm. Fort Greene park is a magical park of Brooklyn. Alex is a wonderful host. Full of information and friendliness but also leaves you with plenty of private space. Nice green grocer and plenty of good restaurants a couple blocks away. A short walk to downtown Brooklyn where I was working for the week. A quiet residential street. A classic old yamaha keyboard for composing your next masterpiece.

Alex's place was great! The room is large and beautiful and the building is located close to the subway (convenient for getting to manhattan), and within walking distance to many restaurants and bars. I would definitely stay there again.

Alex's place is in a lovely neighbourhood, close to the park (visit the weekend farmers' market) and some lovely bars, cafes, and restaurants. Public transport is close by - you can be on the LES in 20mins - and (for women travelling alone) it's a nice safe neighbourhood.

The room itself is lovely, with a comfortable bed, space to work at a desk (if need be), and a view onto the street through a thriving balcony garden. Alex was friendly and helpful with the check-in process: even though my flight was delayed and he was out of town, everything went perfectly.

Very clean and comfortable space in one of those brownstones which make you feel  you are in an old movie. Good location, diverse neighborhood, easy access to the subway. Alexander is a very attentive host. We greatly enjoyed our stay.

Super lovely place with a great personal note. Alex is very nice & always available 24/7 for questions. I felt like it‘s my place, the street is very quiet and green, lovely neighborhood w/ a lot of little charming places, restaurants, coffee shops. Close to DUMBO & 2 stops away from Manhattan - the perfect stay if you need & want a place to rest after work & enjoy the weekends out of the bubble. Beautiful charming historic district known for its many tree-lined streets and elegant low-rise housing. will be back for sure.
Zeer goede locatie. Het huis zelf was prima. En Alex heeft ons nog een aantal goede tips in de buurt gegeven.

Alex’s place is perfectly situated for anything you may need, it’s close to the city, but quiet and peaceful. There’s a lot to do in the surrounding streets, including the farmer’s market on Saturday’s. The apartment is clean, comfortable, well equipped, and really felt like Home at the end of a long day. Alex is a great host, making great conversation, while respecting one’s privacy and not being intrusive or anything. This was really the perfect experience, and I’m definitely going to try to stay with Alex on my next trip to Brooklyn. 100% recommend.

Хозяин очень отзывчивый, все объяснит, расскажет. Но квартирка, как из прошлого века, очень колоритная, даже запах из прошлого века. Не хочется обижать хозяина, но лучше заплатить чуть больше, но жить в чистоте или хотя бы ближе к центру. Район, вы увидите, добраться можно, при желании, хоть куда. Но стоит все взвесить, плюс дорога, и сколько бы ты заплатил....Или может ты хочешь тихо и спокойно, и ехать никуда не надо.

Staying with Alex was super easy and the place is cozy and perfect for a trip to NYC-- the bed is ridiculously comfortable with plenty of pillows; the bathroom is well-stocked; the kitchen is clean and perfect for cooking  meals; btw if you are an art and literature nerd you will have a hard time prying yourself from the bookcase; and above all Alex is a gracious host. Fort Greene can't be beat for all the different trains you need to get around and this place is a short to medium walk to all of them. I will definitely be back next time I'm in town. Thank you Alex!

I loved my stay at Alex’ place and intend to return.

It’s in a beautiful brownstone, very old but all in all pretty cool.

The decor wasn’t fancy but definitely quirky, the space offered was exceptional and a pretty good book selection for the lonely rainy days in :).

Alex is a great host, friendly thoughtful and always trying his best to make sure you’ll have the best from your stay. He travels a lot but even when he is not around he always touched base with me to check if I needed anything or if I had any problems.

Definitely a good place if in need of privacy too... really if you need a large room with good private space this is it.

The location itself is about a 10-15 minute walk from the closest stations which will get you pretty much anywhere in Manhattan... you are literally a couple stops away from downtown.

The area is safe and there are cool coffee shops and nice pop up restaurants and quiet bars if you choose to explore... right down myrtle avenue as well as Delkab.

Thanks Alex!

Yannick
The host canceled this reservation 10 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Appartement très charmant et typique dans l’une des fameuses browning stones de Brooklyn.
Alexander est extrêmement accueillant, disponible et avec qui la communication est très facile ! 
Foncez, vous passerez forcément un bon moment.
Great, simple accommodation in a fabulous location in Ft. Greene. Super charming host!

To all my fellow travelers and adventurers - look no further, Alex's place is the place to be in Brooklyn.

As a female solo-traveler, I travel with precautions. I look into the safety of the area, ask my questions in advance, and scope out the food and drinks near by. I want to have the best, safest, and most pleasant experience possible when traveling, as everyone hopes to have.

From the beginning, Alex was the first to respond to my inquiries out of the other hosts in the area. He was helpful, detailed and thoughtful in his responses to all my questions. His communication didn't end once I hit 'book', his helpful communication was constant throughout the trip. When I was trying to figure out how to get to EWR in NJ to his Airbnb, he provided me the exact route to take. Traveling, to and from the airport, and place to place was a breeze with his help.

Highlights that I think will help others:
-  Subway is a close walk; Lyft drivers readily available throughout all hours
- Beautiful & safe walk to Barclays Center in the mornings
- Cafe (vegan-friendly) right on the corner
- Place was clean; Room was prepared very nicely; bed was freshly laundered with clean laundry smell and had nice matching, coordinated sheets with lots of pillows
- Room is huge with natural light coming through the tall windows
- Neighborhood felt safe, looked beautiful

Alex was friendly and polite from the moment I met him. He gave me space throughout the whole trip. Since I'm a friendly person, I enjoyed engaging in conversation with him, and when I did it was always a great and interesting conversation.

There are so many more things I could rave about my experience. This was my first time using an Airbnb by myself. I told Alex he has set the bar high for all the other future Airbnb's in other locations I will stay at. This experience has also encouraged me to be more comfortable using Airbnb as alternative to hotels. I tell my family and friends all about my trip and they say I'm blessed and lucky because they've never had as great of an experience the one I had.

Seriously worth the book!

I had an excellent 2-night stay! The description is spot on and the location couldn't be better if you want to be around the L train or Williamsburg / Greenpoint. 

Marisa is sociable and generous, and her cat Rusty was never a bother. Thanks, Marisa!
Rented the space for a couple friend of mine. They are very happy and found a very friendly host. The apartment is not too big, but she knows how to make you feel comfortable.

Marisa is a wonderful host, friendly and helpful. We stayed at her place for a week and we had a great time. The location is just perfect, safe and full of nice bars and cafes and it's one metro stop from Manhatten. We would really reccomend Marisa's place for your stay in NYC.

Marisa was very kind and thoughtful, and fun to converse with.  We shared wide ranging discussions on everything from neighborhood development to ethnic foods.  Her place is just about a block from a subway into Manhattan.  I would have been comfortable staying for a while.  Thanks for the welcome to NYC!
Excellet location. Marisa is a super-friendly and helpful host. The room is clean and nice. No complaints whatsoever!

We had such a great time with Marisa and Rusty (the cat)! She made us feel extremely welcome and we ended up extending our stay another week. She's easy going and we had some great chats!! She was super helpful with suggestions about where to go and what to see. We would definitely stay there again. The house has lots of character and the location is absolutely ideal - right on the Bedford L line. Rusty is fat (big boned!) and adorable - we wanted to take him home with us. 

We would highly recommend staying with Marisa!

Marisa was a great host - she was nice, easygoing and lovely to talk to. The place is surrounded by a bunch of awesome restaurants, bars and shops which, we had a really great time exploring. Marisa was also very flexible, responded quickly to all my emails and was generally really reliable. I had an awesome time staying here and would definitely recommend it to anyone who is thinking of visiting.

My 16 year old daughter and I jut returned home after spending 3 nights at Marisa's apartment. This was our first air bnb experience and because of our experience with Marisa we are looking forward to many more.
Marisa was extremely helpful in helping us navigate our stay in NY, provided us with umbrellas because of the weather, maps of the subway and her recommendations for restaurants and shops. She even interrupted her telephone conversation to help us figure out an alternate way to get to Manhattan, because the subway service on her L line was flooded due to the downpour of the preceding 2 days.
The apartment was clean, quiet and we had all the privacy we needed.
Several good restaurants and shops in the neighborhood and Marisa is eager to share her 20 years of information collected living in the area. Marisa seemed to share my passion for finding good inexpensive restaurants and the Malaysian restaurant she directed us to was excellent.
Marisa permitted us to leave our luggage at her apartment when we checked out in the morning for pick up later that day, so that we could spend one more day in the city.
I have no hesitation in recommending Marisa as a host.

Marissa was wonderful host with great knowledge of the city, Williamsburg and how to save money on local attractions. (Very useful!) The room I stayed in was spacious, and the air beds were very, very comfortable. The location of the apartment is a minutes walk from Bedford Ave and  the subway making it a great location. There are lots of great shops, bars around! I would definately stay with Marissa again.
Marisa was a lovely host, I would definitely stay with her again. The location of the apartment is great, and the airbed very comfy.

My girlfriend and I had such a good time staying with Marisa!  She is a brilliant host.  The apartment is great and in an amazing location.  Marisa is very friendly and helpful and her cat, Rusty, is quite a character!  Like I said, we had a great time, great conversations and were both really sad to be leaving.  Couldn't recommend her place more!!  Thanks again!

Highly recommended! We loved staying at Marisa's place. 
1. Her house is perfectly located in vibrant Williamsburg: easy peasy logistics to wherever, loads of places to hang out and superb people watching.
2. Marisa is super cool. She is a wonderful combination of laid back, funny, interested and interesting. Staying at her place definitely made our trip to NY more special. Otherwise we would have not only missed a car ride to colorful Queens, great Vietnamese food, the very impressive exhibition Detroit Disassembled, the beautiful Panorama (!). But also her view on things, her ridiculously laid back cat, her great 90s CD collection. It added much local and personal flavor to our first NY trip. A very happy experience!

Искренне благодарю Марису. Она очень коммуникабельна, так что ожидание неловкости быстро исчезло,  Очень удобное расположение- 2 мин от метро. Район хороший и добираться на метро до Манхеттена всего одна станция. Цена вполне разумная. Рекомендую оставаться.
Мы успели подружиться!

I sincerely thank Marisa. She is very sociable, so expectations of awkwardness quickly disappeared. A very convenient location- 2 minutes from the metro. The area is good and get on the subway to Manhattan is only one station. The price is quite reasonable. I recommend to stay.
We managed to make friends!

We selected this listing based on Marisa's reviews and they are accurate.  We love Bedford Ave and being located so close to the L train (one stop from Manhattan).  Marisa was a great host and very personable.  I wish we had more time to take her up on her suggestions for visiting Queens.

The apartment itself was ok as it was cluttered and could have been better kept.  But we had the living room to ourselves and primarily only slept there and the air beds were fine.

We loved it here. During our stay, Marisa was good enough to give us the run of her spacious lounge room. Her apartment is cosy with great views of the city lights, and the location is killer -- right in Williamsburg's thumping heart and only one stop from Manhattan on the subway. But Marisa is the real selling point of this place; her quick wit, great conversation and amaaaaazing restaurant recommendations made this trip one we'll never forget. Oh, and Rusty is our new favourite cat. Thanks for everything, Marisa, we'll definitely be back.
Williamsburg is a great place to stay if you are visiting New York! And Marisas place lived up to the positive reviews. Very helpful

Marisa is a fantastic host, warm and friendly, very knowledgeable about the city. Location couldn't be better, just one stop from Manhattan, 2 mins from East River Park that has gorgeous views over the NYC skyline. Also it's in the centre of the happening Williamsburg area (I just love it when you actually find what's advertised for)... Thanks Marisa & Rusty for a great stay!!
Marisa's place is located in a great central area in Williamsburg. She's a nice and considerate host.

Esta ha sido mi primera experiencia en airbnb y al principio tenia algo de temor por como resultaría, pero gracias a Marisa lo volveré a repetir sin lugar a dudas y lamentandolo mucho por mis futuros anfitriones, siempre los comparare con ella aunque no quiera. Marisa ha sido increíble, la verdad, mejor que lo que esperábamos. Nos proporciono toda la información q necesitamos en cada momento, nos dejo espacio para nosotros, fue discreta y silenciosa y ni se notaba que estuviera. Muy amable, simpática, cercana y acogedora. Ojalá hubiéramos hablado mejor ingles para poder comunicarnos mas y mejor con ella. Y bueno, la ubicación del apartamento increíble. El barrio mola mucho. Y el apartamento en si super distinto a todo lo q haya visto antes. La verdad que solo tengo palabras buenas para Marisa y su apartamento. Si volvemos a NY seguramente le preguntemos si tiene sitio para nosotros y espero que lo tenga. Un beso Marisa!!!....y ya sabes, si vienes a España tienes cama!!!...jajaja

My boyfriend and I originally booked to stay with Marisa for just a few nights but ended up extending because it was such a lovely place to be! Marisa is a great host - helpful and so friendly.  We also loved Rusty, the fattest cat we've ever met.  The location of the apartment couldn't be better - right in the heart of Williamsburg (as the advert describes), next to a subway which is just one stop from Manhattan. Highly recommended.

Great location right off bedford ave.  I loved the convenience of the location and highly recommend this place for travelers not wanting to pay high prices for hotel accommodations that you do not need.  This unit is simple and perfect for a place to sleep and store your bags at a great price.

Located in a perfect spot within the nicest area of Brooklyn, we really enjoyed our stay. Moving to Manhattan was easy and Marisa was quick to explain us whether we needed anything. Directions, recommendations or whatever. 100% recommended.

My stay with Marisa was outstanding. She was a very friendly and helpful host, always generous with information, and consistently very quick to respond the any questions I might have had (be it via e-mail, text, or telephone), and equally so prior to my arrival, during my stay, and after that I had checked out, and that was something that I found very comforting when you are visiting a country for the first time. She made feel right at home in NYC. She is also a person of great intellectual resources, and if you show the least bit of interest you will have the opportunity to learn about life in general and about NYCs in particular. For me personally it has been very valuable to get to know Marisa, not least because of her ability to describe the political, social and historical background of much of what is going on in NYC. The apartment is located in Williamsburg in Brooklyn, one of the hippest neighborhoods in NYC (with lots and lots of culture, music, boutiques, vintage clothing, coffee shops, great little bars, etc. if your into that), and it is literally 2 minutes from the subway. Just hop on the L-train (subway) and you'll be in the heart of Manhattan within just over 5 minutes. The apartment is homy and got a lot of character, but don't expect it to be like a hotel with everything neat in order. But the toilet and bathroom were very clean and nice. You sleep either on an airbed or on the couch. And even if I worried beforehand if I would get any sleep on an airbed I was pleasantly surprised. Marisa was also very generous by providing you the privacy you might want. Moreover, the price is great, I mean really great! You won't find anything in this price range at a great location like in the heart of Williamsburg. So if you want to keep your costs down while in NYC, I can definitely recommend Marisa's place. And if you want to learn about NYC at the same time, It definitely is a great place to stay.
Location Location Location.  Marisa is a friendly host and her apt. is in one of my favorite neighborhoods.

Marisas apartment was a great place to stay during our visit in New York. We stayed for almost two weeks. Marisa is a very good and attentive host and she gave us great tips on things to experience in New York. We had many nice conversations with Marisa and felt us part of life in NY while staying at her place. The apartment is centrally located in Williamsburg and easily reached by the subway. The neighborhood is interesting with small nice restaurants in Bedford street. Highly recommended!
You couldn’t wish for a better address in NY. The location is perfect and Marisa is a superstar, ready to help in every possible way. Heartily recommended.

she is a lovely person , i felt like at home ., the location is perfect  .,
i sleep on the sofa becouse i don't like air bed ., i will definitely go back

My girlfriend and I had a great time staying in Marisa's place in Williamsburg. It was clean and well-kept, and as described, very close to the center of the action on Bedford. Marisa was very responsive and had two sets of keys so we had no trouble coming and going.

It is the case that there is not a completely separate living space and that guests have to share a bathroom, but as Marisa is a great host, very considerate and fun to talk to, I still recommend her place to anyone looking for an Airbnb spot in the neighborhood. We had a great time and would definitely stay there again in the future!

I stayed at Marisa's place for several weeks which served as a base for me while I looked for work and settled into the New York way of life. 

This place is awesome mostly for the sheer convenience of its amazing location. Right in the buzzing hub of Williamsburg, but just off Bedford so as to not get too much of the noise. You have shops and eating a plenty. The Bedford ave subway around the corner, and being on the top floor ( I hope you like stairs) you have views of the Manhattan skyline.

Marisa is about as good as they come as a host. Great sense of humour, very communicative (she was in Chile on holiday during my stay but was always quick to respond to email) and full of info.

If you're looking for hotel style accommodation you wont find it here but you will find a comfortable base to help you explore this great city. Highly recommended. Thanks again Marisa and get well soon Eddie (Marisa's cat)!!

Marisa is a realy nice person. Very helpful, she likes to talk about the city. Very interesting! Perfect location near the subway, many restaurants and bars around. The appartment is charming. I stayed in a sofa bed in the living room.

Marisa was a great host. She was very nice, communicative and really quick to respond any questions we might have had.
The apt location is perfect, the subway station (Bedford Ave, just one stop to Manhattan) is just around the corner and the neighborhood has a very cool and young atmosphere. 
I would definitely stay at Marisa's again!

This is my favorite place in New York. I stayed at Marisa's place for several weeks in 2012 and again in April 2014. The location is perfect, in a quiet street but close to the riverside, parks, and a lot of restaurants and bars. Marisa is just a great person, we had a lot of fun and good conversations. I really miss her. And Eddie, her awesome cat, too. Thank you so much and see you soon!

I enjoyed my stay at Marisa's apt in Williamsburg. The location was ideal, and the space was quaint and suited my needs. She was great energy and presence, and definitely helps to make you feel at home in the space. Would definitely stay there again, and recommend to future guests.

Marissa is a very good host and her cat is wonderful. Marissa is attentive to a guests needs, respectful and helpful. The area is great. It's three blocks from the East River Ferry and 1 block from the L train.  There's also lots of places to go out to eat and drink in the area.  The room is good sized and quiet. This is a good apartment if you're on a budget, want to be centrally located, and rent from a great person.

Marisa's place is situated in the heart of Brooklyn. Easy access to subways and buses. The place is pretty big and has a lot of natural light. The best part was to get to know Eddie, the cat. The cutest cat! Marisa was a great host. Never got a chance to meet her but she was always fast to respond and very helpful. She has a lovely sense of humour. I would love to stay there on my next trip and hopefully then meet Marisa, a five-star host!

Great host, best location... Perfect stay! Communication was impeccable.
 Eddie the cat is lovely.

The flat is situated in the heart of Williamsburg, where all the little shops and flea markets are. It is also close to the station, and takes just 15min to get to Manhattan, which is great. Eddie (the cat) is also super sweet and nice, giving you so much love)

Marisa is also so so lovely. I wish there were more people like her.

Marisa's place it's awesome, very cozy and very nice to chill out after a NYC day. It's in the heart of Williamsburg, lots of places to brunch, eat or drink. It's very very near to Manhattan, just one subway station. You'll feel like home.
Marisa is a very nice person to talk to, she's a very cult person, interesting conversations and she'll tell you very nice stories about NY. Eddie the cat it's just so awesome too, so chill and cool.
I'll definitely come back here really felt like home.
Marisa was a great host and I enjoyed my stay very much!

We spent a few days in Marisa's flat just before New Year's. Merisa was friendly, very responsive and everything was like described. We had lots of nice conversations with her. We liked her cat as well!

Although we didn't cook much we had the full run of the kitchen and could have done without a problem. Merisa kindly let us use the condiments and other items like umbrellas when it rained :) . Marisa was also very helpful in suggesting sites and things to do. The area is very active and steps away from cafes, restaurants and the subway to Manhattan. 

The flat is small, functional and as described in the advert. Our room was large with a large futon and big TV. The room was heated well and was made to be very comfortable. No complaints.

Thank you for hosting us!

Marisa is just amazing, just as life itself. She is flexible, generous, and tells great stories =) I'll have to thank Eddie for being such a sweet cat. He is a fun and tough guy! I enjoyed my stay here very much in this airy, spacial, and artsy place! Plus, great location! Highly recommended.

Marisa is the best host and Eddie the best cat. Their appartment is lovely, with a perfect location right in the heart of trendy Williamsburg, with the very convenient subway station just around the corner. Definitely the perfect place to stay, and also a real pleasure to meet Marisa, who is a wonderful person!

At first we can say that we really enjoyed our stay at Marisas apartment. Marisa is a really nice person. She was very helpful and had always good advices for us. Her little apartment was perfect for our needs. She welcomed us with a good glass of bear what we enjoyed together. In the morning we got her self made coffee wich was also really good. When it was raining she had umbrellas and little bags for us to take for our trips. We had always good conversations when we arrived at home in the night. What's really special about marisa's flat is the amazing view of the One World Trade Center. And of course not forgetting Eddie the cat, he might be the cutest cat ever. 

The surrounding area was exactly what we needed. Williamsburg is great and offers many places to go at night or for dinner/lunch. And most importantly, the subway station (Bedford Ave) is just around the corner and it takes only one Station to get to East village of Manhattan. So all in all it was a great trip to New York and Marisa made it even better.

We had a lovely time staying with Eddie the cat at Marisa's apartment for eight days. The location is unbeatable! With the L just a block away and the East River Ferry just five minutes' walk there are always good options. And the apartment is surprisingly spacious. We didn't do much cooking but the kitchen had plenty of room and equipment for it, and the living room was a cozy refuge from the busy city. Highly recommended.

(A bonus for vegans - Vinnie's pizza, offering a dozen (!) different vegan pies, is just a block away, and Screamer's, an all vegan pizza joint, is only about a ten minute walk.)

If you stay here it's almost the perfect deal with the exception of cleanliness. There's a train right around the corner and a bunch of food and night places on every block, but something that might make you want to spend a few more bucks for a different place is the lack of cleanliness. This could be easy to get around if you bring your own towels and linen.
Our stay in Williamsburg at Maud's place was great. So affordable and fantastic location. 'Mr Eddie' is a wonderful host too!

Marisa (Maud) was a fantastic hostess despite not getting the chance to meet her at all! She was great at communicating and setting up a smooth check-in process. Ran into a minor issue with opening the door, but Marisa was quick to call/text me to try to help me remotely. The apartment was incredibly convenient to public transit and was nearby a bunch of really amazing restaurants and store in Williamsburg. Perfect for a short trip in Brooklyn!

perfect stay. just absolutely perfect. brian is a super nice guy. he made sure we felt at home, and even left us with some snacks and bottles of water. he was available for anything by phone/text, and also left us a list of helpful tips for around the area.

the area itself was super nice. not as touristy, so you get the feel that you actually live in NYC. but it is just one block from the subway station so you are a few minutes away from times square and all that, and on one night we walked from the subway station to the apartment at 3am with absolutely no fear. it was a great area, there is a pizza place across the street open 24hrs, and super cool shops all around.

the apartment is PERFECT. there were two of us and it was super comfortable. it really gives you the "i'm living in NYC" feeling. it was super clean. brian provided everything from towels to toothpaste. it was just real cozy and warm.

i could go on and on, but this was my first time using airbnb and the trip could not have gone any better. amazing host, perfect apartment, and great city.

thanks so much brian! i hope we will be able to stay with you again sometime.

This was my first time using AirBnB, and it went great. The apartment was large for a studio (while still fitting the "cozy" title), nicely furnished, and in a great neighborhood. Everything was very clean; our host pre-stocked the refrigerator with food and the bathroom with soap, provided clean towels, and even had cookies for us.

Simple, easy, and comfortable experience.

Charming Cozy Studio was PERFECT! My boyfriend and I stayed there for 3 nights, but we wish we would've booked for more days! It is located in a safe area with many restaurants and the subway station is within walking distance. After spending a night out in Time Square, we felt completely safe taking the subway and walking the two blocks to the apartment. The only thing we didn't like was the fact that there was a few flights of stairs and no elevator. The entrance was not very impressive, but hey, it's what's inside that counts! Brian was very personable and nice to communicate with and we only met him on day of arrival. He provided everything necessary from food and bottled water to clean fuzzy towels and soap. This was my first time using Airbnb, and fortunately I had a great experience and will most likely do it again! Choose the charming cozy studio and you won't regret it! You'll feel right at home!

Brian’s apartment in the Upper West Side is conveniently located to the 72nd St subway line and close to several shops, cinema, supermarkets, drug stores and restaurants/diners/bars. It also walking distance to Lincoln Center, Museum of Natural History and the beautiful Central Park.
