Es un lugar bien ubicado, muy cercano al metro, apenas a una cuadra. Tippy es una anfitriona extraordinaria, no tuvimos el gusto de conocer a JT, pero Tippy nos orientó bastante bien para poder aprovec har al máximo nuestra estancia en Nueva York.

What a wonderful experience staying with Jt and Tippy! Tippy was very helpful and warm, she was very informative about where to go shopping and siteseeing. We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommand it.

Tippy was great to work with. She provided perfect directions, a comfortable sleeping space and great conversation. I'd certainly recommend the Blue Room for anyone traveling to Brooklyn, NYC or Manhattan.

It is really nice!! My boyfriend and I do love Jt and Tippy, also the room!! We do recommand this room. It is very close to subway station. You can get all you want near the house, cuz there are supermarkets and restaurants. 100% good review!! You won't regret booking this room!

We'd like to stay longer, but this room is too popular, so that we must check out for those who booked it before than I. What a pity that we did not have so much time to spend with super friendly host. My boyfriend and I both thought that we are very lucky to meet host Jt and Tippy!! That's a great trip in Brooklyn~
Tippy was a lovely host! Her home is most interesting with it's unique art and furnishings. Her home is also very close to the subway. Thanks Tippy!

JT and Tippy were wonderful host! Tippy sent us a box of chocolate for just a slight inconvenience, and JT saw us off personally even we had to catch a flight on 5 a.m. The house was decorated with interesting artifacts and even if the blue room was slightly older than it looked, it was still quite comfy in every other way. My only complaint might be the exclusive (beautiful!) bathroom which was equipped with a tub but without something to hold the sprinkler. Maybe i should've asked the host about it.
Anyway, i will definitely recommend it!
My parents stayed in this room.  Loved every second of it.  Jt and Tippy are very warm and accomodating.  Couldn't have hoped for a better experience.  Their house is wonderful!!

This is a very good experience, room and bathroom were large, clean with lots of charm. They overlook the garden, the view is nice and quietly. The neighborhood is quiet and yet close to the metro, so the house is well situated to move. A small kitchen at our disposal, so all you need for a pleasant stay in Brooklyn!

So helpful & friendly! Very cheerfully accommodated my rapidly changing schedule. Room was bright & spacious with lots of lovely built-ins, and the proximity to the train was great. We especially loved how sweet the kittehs were!  Will definitely be recommending to out-of-town family/friends.

My mom and I stayed at the Blue Room for 8 nights and we even had our own bathroom. We had a great time, even though there were a few inconvenviences. The sheets on our bed weren't clean when we arrived but our (very friendly!) hosts immediately gave us fresh ones when we told them and they even put chocolate in our room the next day, which we thought was a nice gesture. However, the mattress is kind of worn and the bed sags in the middle. There also seemed to be a problem with the electricity because the power went off as soon as we turn on the lights, air conditioning and hair dryer at the same time - this happened 3 times but our hosts were always there to fix it.

All in all, we had a fantastic time. The hosts are very nice and welcoming, the neighborhood is nice and the subway is just around the corner!

Marcus my son stayed with Jt and Tippy and said it was easy to stay and be their guests. He liked how close it was to transportaion too. Thumbs up for sure. They are prompt with communication which is very nice also. He said he would stay again.

I booked a room for my friend, Nathalie, at JT and Tippy's place. It was easy to communicate with Tippy while organizing my friend's visit. Tippy was always ready to answer to all my questions. Nathalie said the room was spacious and clean; close to the subway station. She loved the place and said Tippy was a very sweet host. So, I'd recommend.

We (me and my husband) had a great time at Tippy en JT's house. Spend three weeks at their place. I really like the house and the room/bathroom we had. JT and Tippy are very nice and good people. And also enjoyed the cats! Especially "big momma" she was sitting in front of our door, very sweet :) Would love to come back!

JT and Tippy are awesome hosts. Would have liked to hang out but this was a quick visit.  Their place is a funky cool space.  Quiet at night which was a real plus.  Bed in the blue room was way too soft and saggy for me-that's my only complaint

JT and Tippy were really nice hosts. We took the blue room for 2 plus bathroom, both are as described and shown in the photos - really nice and lovingly arranged! The cuddly cats are great! Tippy and JT helped out every time we needed direction or information, they were great. We arrived very late (about two hours later than we thought) but this was no problem at all, Tippy waited for us to come. The house is full of culture and books - I loved it. Unfortunately we were in NY right when the hurricane came. The subway wasn't running and it took us all days about 1,5 to 3 hours to get the single way to Manhattan from their house. 
Unfortunately, the mattress is worn. And we first didn't know how to use perfectly the tub without something to hold the sprinkler in the bathroom but we arranged finally. ;-)
Very nice place, I definitely would go there again! It's a really nice place to stay and hang out.

Just got back in town today from our trip. We stayed at JT & Tippy's for one night, right after the hurricane-slash-superstorm Sandy messed up the coastal areas and took out electricity around NYC. The house was inland away from the worst of it and everything was safe and sound in their neighborhood, and actually very quiet. They made us feel right at home, even pulling coats and scarves out of the closets to make sure we were bundled up for the weather. As sundown approached, we got caught up in the height of rush hour trying to get back for our bags. Running very late, JT got us a cab and out the door in 3 minutes and delivered to JFK in perfect time! Everything worked out and our hearts managed to slow down once we got checked in. But at least we got a great story to tell.

JT and Tippy were my very first Airbnb-hosts, and the experience couldn't have been better! I had a wonderful room in their really lovely brownstone full of atmosphere and beautiful things. 

The house having its own spell would yet be nothing without the people who live in it. Specially Tippy was very welcoming and supported me in every way. She kindly invited me to their vivacious  Christmas tree ceremony and proved strong nerves in helping me find a further host for the last days (their place being already booked). It turned out that we have a lot of interests in common, and I would have loved to have more time for talking. Not to be forgotten the cats, 4 lovely ladies, who always care for a cozy moment with inclined visitors. Thank you so much all of you for this wonderful experience!

Love love love! JT and Tippy were great hosts and we felt just at home! The house was filled with beautiful things (not forgetting the cutest cats on earth, play with Sophia - my personal favorite!), definitely one of a kind. Tippy was especially welcoming - she showered us with gifts during the holiday season and also let us receive mails and packages via her home address which was really nice! The guest kitchen that was made available to us was perfect as it was fully-equipped and stocked (Sophia came in often to watch us make supper, she's so cute). A couple of things to note, the bed is really old and yet to be changed, and the bath tub has no shower curtain (because there is no way to install one, it is meant to be a tub). It also bothered me a little that the curtain in the bathroom does not fully cover the area of the window. But these matters were small, and my boyfriend and I were able to get by perfectly fine! We had problems accessing the house wifi a few times but Tippy responded to our needs very quickly. We had the best brunch over at Peaches restaurant while staying at JT and Tippy's - highly recommend!! Anyway, I really loved staying there and it felt like a home away from home. Thank you for having us JT and Tippy, all the best!!!

Tippy and JT are two truly impressive and kindhearted people, and  are the best hosts one could wish for. Their home was a sanctuary for us  over our three month stay in New York, during one of the coldest winters the city has seen. We quickly felt completely comfortable and cared-for in their home, sharing breakfast together one morning soon after we arrived, lunch in chinatown, coffee and chats in the kitchen and late night catch ups in the lounge room. I always felt comfortable to drop in on Tippy downstairs to ask her a question – which often turned into a great conversation, eventually ending in me being ushered out by the most gorgeous landlady ever, only to realise I'd forgotten to ask my question! Their place is old, grand and homely, with four cats lolling about in the lounge room, on the staircase and in the kitchen just waiting to have their head scratched. The room we stayed in (the blue room) is very generously sized, with a huge walk-in wardrobe space, a big cupboard for storage, a lovely big bed, a couch, a dining table, dresser, and still enough room for two people to lay out yoga mats and have a morning stretch on the floor. The house is in a great neighbourhood, with a strong sense of community. The local cafe (The Pantry) was like an extension on the lounge room for me, and Peaches Restaurant around the corner an irresistible weekend brunch spot with live jazz and a totally buzzing energy. When I return to New York, I'll be making a bee-line for Tippy and JT's place.

I booked with JT and Tippy the first time I used AirBnB and had a fantastic experience! My 8-yo daughter and I stayed with them when vacationing in NYC, and their house is a lovely, quiet place to relax after spending each day exploring the city. I couldn't have asked for a better experience, and could recommend them to anyone! 

Jen

We had to sadly cancel our stay at JT and Tippy's, but they were so gracious and generous to us.  Tippy even kept our reservation open for us in case we're able to come to NY in the future!  Great hosts, even from afar!

I stayed with my boyfriend at JT and Tippy's in the blue room for 5 days. The house has a very particular and warm design, the room is big and the bed comfy. Tippy was very kind and available. We checked in very early in the morning 'cause our flight landed before 6am and she welcomed us and was responsive in keeping in touch all the time before that moment. We had a whole bathroom for us at the same floor, very colorful and relaxing. A couple of cons may be the wifi network in the room, not working amazingly and the bath tub not very comfy for showering but I definitely recommend this airbnb. The subway is very close, less than 5 min walking. The neighbourhood is not that charming but it's fine. Thank you for hosting us!

Had a great stay in New York in this characterful brownstone in Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn.  Very good instructions on getting to the house on arrival (arrived in the evening, NB actual entrance quite unobtrusive, with ivy over one side).  Tippy also kindly sorted out cab booking back to the airport on departure.  Excellent transport links once there make this an excellent base from which to explore Manhattan and Brooklyn.  Was so busy doing this I didn't get time to talk enough to Tippy, which was clearly my loss.  Ah well, there's always next time, would be delighted to stay there again.

My friend and I needed a place in new York for a  long weekend. Tippy's place was perfect. Quiet , warm and inviting. Tippy is a lovely person. Very friendly and ready to help with any questions you may have. I loved the little quiet neighborhood and the subway was a block and a half away. The room and bed were very comfortable and very clean and very spacious . The kitchen had everything you could possibly need. Great environment and when I go back I would stay at Tippy's again.!!!!

Lovely space, lovely people, lovely cats. We stayed for a full month and enjoyed living here. The subway two blocks away makes everything accessible, the kitchen is well-stocked, and Tippy and JP are ever-gracious hosts. HIGHLY recommend.

Thank you so much for letting us stay in your lovely home Tippy and JT! It had everything we needed to get out and explore NYC. Was wonderful talking to you when we saw you. A fun and very memorable part of our honeymoon.

I am super late with responding but Tippy was A-mazing!!! When I first arrived it was cold and I was ready for summer wether coming form New Orleans, but she went out of her way to help me find warm clothes since I had none, gave great recommendations for food, and was really like a mom away from home! I absolutely adored my room and everyone that stayed there was nice. I made some really good friends there and hope to come back! 

Oh,  and the cats! they were so sweet and loving!
The bedroom Was amazing,Close to the subWay !! A lot of shop around !!! I adviise everybody !!! Very Great moment In this house

We had a very pleasant stay in the blue room. It has a genuine and romantic atmosphere, which makes you feel at ease. We would certainly recommend it. We loved the cats, especially Olivia. Tiziana called a taxi for us at the end of our stay. Thank you for that!
In One word great house, beautifull room, very kind and warm people and a great Location in town. So: its perfect!

Tiziana e JT sono molto accoglienti e disponibili per ogni richiesta di informazione e supporto turistico per chi visita la città. La stanza grande, il bagno e in generale la casa corrispondono alle aspettative e alle foto e descrizioni. Il quartiere e tranquillo, ben servito sia dai negozi che dalla metropolitana. I gatti di Tiziana sono molto discreti e coccoloni.  In complesso siamo stati molto bene.
Overall positive experience in nyc - beautiful house with cats in a quaint neighbourhood. Great hosts- JT has travelled everywhere - speak to him to know more. Thank you for the stay!

JT and Tippy are such gracious and considerate hosts. We felt very at home in the Blue Room and had plenty of storage for all our stuff (and we had a lot of it). It was so nice to have a kitchen to cook in and cats to play with, especially the little calico! Their home is beautiful and full of fascinating details from around the world. It's on a quiet, lovely street very convenient to transportation, laundry mats, coffee shops, and restaurants.

The host made us feel very welcome. They were warm and homely. We chatted at length with both of them. The house is old an provides a unique experience I havent had before. It felt royal and antique. 
The host was very understanding and let us store our luggage there before check in time, and let us check out later than required.
We love animals, but, we werent prepared for the strong pungent cat odor that permeates the building. The only day it wasnt there was when the host had the windows open.
An extenuating situation occurred during our stay which the host apologized for, and we understand these things happen. However, it could have been dealt with much better if we had been informed earlier so we could have changed our plans accordingly: Due to some construction going on, the house had a cockroach breakout and the host tried desperately to get a professional to come help, but due to Christmas/holiday period they couldnt find anyone right away. They had noticed the cockroaches in the week leading up to the start of our stay. I wish they had told us so we could have changed our booking.
The house and furniture in this room is quiet old, the curtains cannot be pulled shut and the couch cover is torn.

We only stayed one night with JT and Tiziana, but it was great. Exactly what we were looking for. They are very friendly and accomodating. The room was comfortable and looks exactly like it does in the pictures.  They're close to a bunch of shops and a short walk away from the subway. The location was great for us. We'd definitely stay again.
Tippy and JT are one of a kind, warm, hospitable, super humans. We spoke days in advance and she was so patient with every question I had.  The listing looks the same as in the photos.

This place is so lovely! I came here for a photo shoot (didn't stay the night) but it was clean and quiet and I would have definitely stayed here if I didn't already live in Brooklyn. The house is awesome-an original brownstone in Brooklyn, not renovated into tiny apartments like so many of the houses here. JT's friend Amanda let us in, and they were super accommodating for our same day last minute request. 10/10 would book again.

JT and Tiziana were amazing hosts and helped us whenever we asked them for anything. Their house is an original Brooklyn townhouse with charming interior and our room was really spacious. There are also four lovely cats which will pay attention to you if you pet them :) 
The house is located in the centre of Bed-Stuy which is a vibrant neighborhood from which you can easily reach other parts of NYC. 
We really enjoyed our stay and are grateful to JT and Tiziana for their hospitality!

We had a great time in NYC staying at  JT and Tippy's place. The space was quite lovely and very welcoming. We only stayed for one night but the experience was great and easy. It was a very short walk to the subway which made traveling especially nice and we also got an parking space very close to the apt. The only critique that I had was that it was a bit dusty in the room and bathroom. It was nothing that really bothered me to bad, but if I had my daughter with me (who is allergic to dust) it would've been a bit of an issue. Without her though, I wouldn't hesitate to stay again. We had a great experience. Oh, the bed was super soft and comfy too.

JT and Tiziana's place was wonderful! What a treat of a place! And Tiziana was a great host, easy to communicate with and attentive. The room was big a spacious and the bed so comfy! Having access to a full kitchen as also so great.  The neighbourhood is beautiful with rows of brownstones and the local cafe "Brunswick" does great coffee. An easy half a block stroll to the subway was great for getting anywhere around town. Would have loved to stay longer!
I had booked a room for 3 days. JT and Tiziana are very communicative persons. They answered immediately and tried to make our accomodation as comfortable as possible.

JT and Tiziana were very welcoming and clearly experienced hosts. There was a fresh pot of coffee every morning and were always available and helpful. The neighbourhood was perfectly authentic and the subway couldn't have been closer. We had a wonderful time and would absolutely stay with them again.

Jt and Tiziana made me feel very comfortable at their home. I stayed in the blue room, is very spacious , the bed is very comfortable and has plenty of room to store things . The bathroom is beautiful, everything was equipped and clean when I arrive. Tiziana is very friendly and I always help you need , giving me information needed to enjoy my stay in New York. Cats are adorable and made me feel at home. The neighborhood is very safe and there are many shops that are open late in case you need something, the subway is only two blocks away and takes you straight to Manhattan. Definitely if I ever go to New York again, I would choose this airbnb

A charming and very comfortable place to stay. I would not have imagined being awakened by birds singing and the chiming of church bells while in Brooklyn, but it happened every morning. The house is big, the room is full of space and the bathroom was excellent.

I totally loved my staying at Tippy and JT beautiful brownstone house!
The house is absolutely astonishing, authentic Brooklyn brownstone  and beautifully decorated. The location is very good and well connected with Manhattan; this is a safe area of Brooklyn (I was a female solo traveler in my first time in NYC and I felt abs safe)  in a very alternative and lively neighbor with so many little shops, cafe', restaurants...you can just spend hours walking and exploring it! 
Tippy and JT are adorable! they made me feel totally at home, I really didn't want to live them and the house! I cant wait for my next trip to NY for meeting them again! Sabrina

JT and Tiziana were great hosts. Their home was clean, spacious, close to the subway which made it great for my commute into Manhattan for work, and close to neighborhood restaurants and cafes. Their company, friendly cats, and beautiful home made me feel comfortable and relaxed while I stayed here for two months! I highly recommend staying with them for longer stays or a weekend away!!
Really fun to get out of Manhattan and stay in Brooklyn. Close to the subway. Room is large and a private bathroom. Good communication and great directions.

Beautiful old stone house in a vibrant neighborhood. Tiziana and JT are wonderful hosts. I definitely recommend it for anyone who's looking for a quiet place to escape to after long days of exploring NYC and Brooklyn.
Beautiful old brooklyn home.  Comfortable,  loads of beautiful things and full of charm. Welcoming, friendly host. Would go back again any time.

Very charming home and equally charming hosts! Lots to look at and admire in a beautiful home. The Blue Room+bath are incredibly spacious and comfortable and the house is very close to the subway.  Appreciated the readily available books, ample seating, plenty of electrical outlets, soft towels, iron/hairdryer, and extra in-room storage space for clothes and bags. The neighborhood was both lively and quiet, we had no trouble sleeping in until the early afternoon and felt safe walking home from the subway at 4am. We didn't have time this trip to explore much of the neighborhood restaurants so can't advise as far as meals but check out the corner bodegas for 24 hour fresh homestyle food and snacks. And remember to fuss the cats on your way in or out, Mama Sophia monitors the front door at almost all hours!
JT and Tiziana sont des hôtes agréables et à l'écoute qui veillent au bien être des résidents. Chambre bien située pour se rendre en métro à Manhattan. Adresse à retenir pour un séjour new-yorkais.
All was really awesone! The host did our living very comfortable! Very friendly, thank u!

This home is really close to the train, which it very convenient to travel.
It's in a more traditional part of Brooklyn so there aren't any cafes around but since the train is no near that it didn't matter to us.
Since this was our first air B and B we didn't know what to except but we were pleasantly surprised with our hosts.The communication was excellent and the room was clean as well as our private bathroom.
The only negative thing I would say is as a single female I would be cautious walking around late night.
Really nice and interesting place to stay, the hosts are really lovely and accommodating people. Beautiful building and a really nice area to stay. Very easy to get into manhattan
Buona posizione vicino alla fermata della metro e quartiere tranquillo. Tiziana è gentile è disponibile alle esigenze.
Really nice neighbourhood, everything was near and easy access to subway. JT and and Tippy were helpfull and easy to communicate when needed. Would stay here again!
We enjoyed our stay by JT and Tiziana and had a great time in NY, and we will proberbly be back one day. Thanks from DK.

It was great to stay with Tiziana and JT. 
All communication was fast and they were really kind to me and my husband.
It´s very close to the subway. So, It is easy to go everywhere from their place. 
Unfortunately, I didn´t have enough time to discover more about Brooklyn and the places close to their house.
JT and Tiziana are awesome. The room is spacious. the bath wall color was my favorite. 2 min to the subway. We enjoyed our stay.

Both JT and Tiziana were great hosts. Friendly,  accommodating,  responsive and respected guest's privacy. Tiziana was very hospitable,  she made lovely coffee and offered help with luggage! Their place is very close to subway, in a quiet and safe neighborhood.  Room was clean with private bath.  They were well equipped with necessities.  I had a comfortable stay, would love to revisit.

Beautiful, unique, historic and charming vibe space. Great for photography.
It would have been nice to control the heat in our room because it was very cold and then we asked to turn on the heat we were hot all night because we could not open the windows. Besides that we really enjoyed the space and atmosphere. 
Uber from our location to the Lower West Side cost about $25 one way which we did twice because it was very cold out.

This was a very nicely decorated housing arrangement. The room is very spacious, bed is comfy, and the bathroom is right next to the room. There is a subway less than two blocks away also, which was very convenient for travel. And the hosts were lovely, very pleasant and welcoming. I would like to stay again and recommend to others for sure!

We have a wonderful stay with JT and Tippy.  They are considerate and thoughtful hosts.  Response is timely and accurate.  Tips on local breakfast place is superb.  Subway is just around the corner.  And ride to JFK via subway and air train is cheap and quick.  Will definitely stay with them on our next visit.

Amazing vibes and a gorgeous space! Check in and check out were very easy, the host had lots of recommendations for us and was very relaxed. Room was gorgeous and incredibly comfortable. Will stay again!
JT e Tiziana ospitali e gentili, ci hanno dato consigli su cosa fare che abbiamo molto apprezzato. Metro vicinissima, stanza molto spaziosa, cucina fornita di tutto. Grazie!
Wonderful home with lots of history and stories.  A home that shows lots of love
It is always a joy to stay with JT and Tippy. This was my second time and it was just as lovely as the last. I will always come back. Thank you for your hospitality. They are truly wonderful people!

Чистая и очень просторная тёплая комната для двоих, отдельная ванная комната, кухня со всем необходимым. Безопасный район и близкое расположение к метро(100метров), продуктовые магазины в шаговой доступности. Хозяева очень добродушные, открытые к общению и уважают ваше уединение, всегда готовы помочь и на связи. Уверена, что в следующий раз вернусь сюда.Спасибо большое Тициана!

Chambre et salle de bains spacieuses, avec un coin repas dans la chambre très pratique. L'accès à la cuisine est appréciable. Un bémol quant à la vétusté de la maison qui mériterait un bon rafraîchissement. La station de métro est vraiment très proche ce qui est très pratique. Tippy est très disponible en cas de besoin. Elle a été très arrangeante pour que nous puissions récupérer nos valises à l'heure qui nous arrangeait le mieux le jour du départ (vol à 21h30), ce qui nous a permis de profiter du dernier jour sans ce soucis.
We had a wonderful time at JT & Tiziana’s place and felt very welcome. Close to public transport, this is an ideal place to discover New York and to stay for a longer time.

The room was great and lovely decorated.
If you're cat person, you will definitely love this place.

We enjoyed our stay in Brooklyn so much! It was so lovely and JT and Tiziana were great! We really loved the place and how big it was. The bed was great and the private bathroom was huge! We would love to come back to their place someday. Thank you so much for having us. Getting to know you and staying at your place really let us enjoy NYC even more!

JT and Tiziana’s place is gorgeous and rich in character, a peaceful sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan and Brooklyn (but still so close to it all). 
A 2 minute walk to the subway and a direct line to Manhattan makes it easy and accessible at all hours. Don’t overlook all the things to see locally, though - our favorites were Lunatico around the corner (particularly gospel brunch) and Peaches restaurant. Prospect Park is also a stroll away.
The bed is so comfortable and perfect for long coffees in the morning. The bath is deep and perfect for bubbles at anytime. If you’re lucky you might hear music coming through the floor from JT’s studio.
JT and Tiziana are always around and open to chat, but definitely give you plenty of privacy. The cats are also there to cuddle when you want. We almost felt like we had our own place for our 2 month stay, which is a rarity. Thanks for having us!

The room was perfect, I never wanted to leave! The house just felt loving and comfortable, like another home. JT and Laura were as kind as can be and I look forward to spending more time there in the future :)

Siamo stati ospiti di JT e Tiziana per 14 giorni durante le vacanze estive questo Agosto. Siamo rimasti soddisfatti in pieno.
La casa è situata in una posizione strategica ottimale: fermata della metro a pochi passi dalla quale ci si può recare in Manhattan in circa 15 minuti.
Il quartiere multietnico è assolutamente vivace e tranquillo . Può sembrare difficile per un italiano non abituato a vivere con diverse culture così a stretto contatto ma ci siamo sentiti più sicuri di camminare di notte qui che a Times Square in città. Inoltre il posto è Ricco di posti non turistici dove recarsi per mangiare ad una qualità diversa da quella che trovereste a Manhattan.
La casa presenta un ingresso con soggiorno comune, una scala di legno che porta ai piani superiori (con le relative camere) e alla cucina con frigorifero in comune.
La camera da letto dispone di letto matrimoniale, sgabuzzino, aria condizionata e bagno privato.
Durante il nostro soggiorno purtroppo non abbiamo potuto conoscere di persona Tiziana. Lei però è stata gentilissima e sempre disponibile  tramite telefono. Suo marito JT simpaticissimo ci ha sempre trattato bene con premura che fossimo soddisfatti.
Non vediamo l’ora di tornare
Grazie

This lovely old brownstone is full of character and charm. I loved the claw foot bathtub and the artwork. It’s got a bohemian vibe that may not suit all tastes but it was indeed right up my alley. Access to the subway couldn’t be better. JT was interesting and extremely hospitable and responsive. He recommended the Sumner Cafe down the street and it was fantastic. I felt very comfortable & it all made for a lovely long weekend in NYC.

Authentic brownstone close to subway and some excellent eating places. We particularly liked Sumner cafe for breakfast (corned beef hash a real favourite) and Besa restaurant where the tapas was really good. We also liked Peaches restaurant. Location to subway was a bonus allowing us to be in central Manhattan in about 30 minutes. Will return.
The place was awesome! Clean and super cute. It was right by a metro.
The apartment is extremely convenient and Joya was very accomodating of my schedule.  Also, it is an exceptional bargain.

Great location and great host. Can't wait to go back. 

Thanks Joya! Apologies for the late feedback. =)

The apartment is really cute and cozy, just right for a single traveller on short stay in NY. The location in UWS is convenient with metro lines both on Broadway (3 blocks away) and just round the corner. The only drawback is the tiny kitchen that is not really suitable for proper cooking and like most brownstones in the city the lack of an elevator. In spite of that I would definately like to stay at Joya's place again.

The apartment is absolutely lovely, very clean, very large and in a great neighborhood. Renters should note that although the per night charge is very low, Joya charges additional $60 for cleaning; was a surprise to me. But otherwise, I would recommend.

Had a really nice stay at this place! Very close to a subway st. and lots of facilities The Hostess was really nice to me and had no problems during my stay! 

Lovely place!
It was a great place to stay. Very convenient. And Joya was very helpful. Cheers!

We did not meet Joya, as she was away on business. She left clear instructions about the key exchange, and was able to graciously accomodate a last minute change in our schedule. Her apartment was spacious for a one bedroom, neat, quiet, and on a lovely street close to the subway and retail. We were surprised by a cold wave in NYC and had not brought enough warm clothes; there was a thrift shop a few blocks away that had everything we needed. We very much enjoyed our stay and would recommend Joya's apartment to anyone looking for a quiet and convenient UWS location.
Joy was a wonderful host; she was prompt in responding, checked in to see if we needed anything, and her apartment was clean and quaint. Loved the location as well!

Great neighborhood - very convenient for Central Park and shops and restaurants on the Upper West Side.  Apartment was quaint and cosy.  Clean towels and sheets, welcoming note from Joya.  Great place to come back and relax after exhausting day with a grandchild!  Altogether a very enjoyable experience.

Joya provide details timely and detailed response to my booking inquiry.  Apartment is located a stones throw from Central Park, which was ideal for my morning runs, but close to a number of great ethnic restaurants

Joya was very responsive and answered all our questions. She was very flexible with our check-in time and the check in process was very easy. Fabulous location less than 1/2 block to Central Park. This was the highlight of our trip and we walked in the park every morning. Joya's apartment is very spacious - especially for NYC. Comfortable couch, 4 person dining room table, very simple but functional kitchen, decent sized bathroom with bathtub and good water pressure. She is a 4th floor walk up so keep that in mind & try to pack light. House is decorated with interesting, international & eclectic art - a bit cluttered but cute. We couldn't turn down the heat (original fixtures in an old building) but with the windows open we were comfortable. Overall we had a great visit and enjoyed staying at Joyas and it was almost half the price of nearly any hotel over Thanksgiving.
Excellent location.
Joya's apartment looks exactly as pictured and is in a great location.

Joya's place is a nice and spacious one bedroom apartment in the Upper West. Nice neighborhood and very close to subway that allows you to go anywhere in Manhattan fast and easy. Any questions I had about the apartment Joya would always text back to me within seconds! Staying at her place was a very nice experience overall.
Great location and beautiful apartment.

We had to make a very late reservation, and Jaya made a special effort to help us out. She was outstanding in making arrangements for our checkin.  
The location is also outstanding, half a block away from Central Park,  on a quiet street.  The bed was comfortable, as was the sitting room.

I loved this apartment! Very cozy, very NY, very close to everywhere I wanted to go, including subway stations. I loved it and I would love to stay there the next time I travel to NY. Thank you very much, Joya!
Lovely quiet location. Be aware that this is a 4th floor walk up. Close to the park, museums, theater, and lots of local eateries. Nice cozy place.

Great location on the upper west side, easy walk to Central Park and Museum of Natural History.  MOMA just across the park.
Apartment is in an older building on a quiet residential street in a clean and safe neighborhood.  Numerous restaurants and shops located just a block or two away, as well as subway access.  (Please note that apartment is on 4th floor with no elevator.  If this is a concern you may want to look elsewhere.)
Apartment was clean and spacious (by NYC standards).  Kitchen is small but clean and functional.  Wifi worked with no issues.
Host instructions were clear and easy to follow.  Host was responsive to questions and very professional.
Overall we had a great stay.  Highly recommend, and would definitely stay again.
A perfect place that makes you feel right at home in the upper west side
Joya’s apartment is absolutely perfect - large space, super clean and comfortable, great location!
Everything is as described. Fantastic find. I would stay again!

Great location! Lots of restaurants nearby, close to Central Park and still feels like an oasis in the city.This apartment is in an old brownstone up three flights of stairs. Quiet. Comfortable. Good bed. Nice stained glass windows. Joya is quick to respond to any questions.  I enjoyed my stay there and would pick it again.
You can’t beat the location of this property. Easy access and a nice quiet, safe neighborhood!

.I had a wonderful stay. The space is large clean an
d close to subway. James is very easy to work with

Incomparable:

* The space is absolutely inspiring and flooded with natural light, particularly during the late morning.

* The location happens to be conveniently nearby both the L train (takes you midtown) and the J train (if you're going to lower Manhattan).

* James is a chill host who knows what he's doing.

Anyway, if you do rent this place, do us all a favor, 
and try to keep it a secret, k?
James is a great host. Very nice and helpful. And his place is perfect. Lots of sunlight and so close to subway. Strongly recommending it...

Me and my girlfirend stayed there and everything was great! Was our first time in NY, and If you check the street view, maybe you get scared like us, but the area is completely safe, and is kind of a new created neighborhood, lots of artists, good cafes, great organic supermarket, and only 10 minutes to manhattan by L train....  even if you dont get this house, go to this area to eat at roberto.s pizza, everything on that pizzas is organic!

James was great helping us for everything, and house was clean and big, also you can cook at home so you spend half money in your travel.

We really have to say thanks to James! We hope we,ve been same good as guests, like him as landlord.

Seleka & Laura

My boyfriend and I stayed here for two weeks at the end of April and absolutely loved it. The neighborhood was surprisingly filled with life, tons of cute little hipsters hanging at Cafe Orwell and outside the Brooklyn Natural grocery store. Although it's an industrial area, people are everywhere and the L stop is super close. Roberta's pizza two blocks away is amazing, as well as Life cafe (two blocks away in the other direction).

We liked it so much in fact that I'm looking at a loft a block away today to move into. 

All in all, a pleasant stay. The accommodations were perfect. Ton's of space to work and relax and James is as nice as can be.

My father and I were fortunate enough to stay at James Henrys loft in Bushwhick for almost 3 weeks, this september. The flat is excellent, both practically and designwise. James is generous and a great host.
As a photographer I especially enjoyed all the light coming into the loft-space.
The neighborhood is very interesting, with hidden qualities, great bars and restaurants. We warmly recomend both the flat and its surroundings.

I stayed at this loft with some friends for a great weekend.  It was a wonderful experience... seamless.  I we found the neighborhood inspiring, and the loft was everything that James said it was.  The space is clean, artful and you feel at home. You will love it.  My highest recommendation.  Thanks James!

James was terrific and the apartment absolutely beautiful. The location is close to the train, the coffee at Cafe Orwell is as good as everyone says, and it's a wonderful, unique space. I recommend this place wholeheartedly!
Great place, great neighborhood, great host. Highly recommended for a true Brooklyn experience.

James is the a very welcoming artist. His broolyn loft is huge, comfy, the light is just amazing. This is a place to relax and have some ideas for a new project. I was there with 4 collegues friends for three weeks, I had the best time in Brooklyn ever. The area is great, Brushwick is the place to be in Brooklyn now for artists and all kind of easy going people. With the L-train, we are in the city in 15minutes. This is a fantastic place to stay. I wish I come back soon. xxx all the best to Jame's next guests, astrid serafini

I stayed in James' loft for 4 days in the beginning of November with a friend of mine and had an excellent stay. The place is even better than the photos - lots of light and space. It's very comfortable, clean and in a great part of Brooklyn. You can chose more hip spots like Cafe Orwell or walk down to Broadway & Flushing for great soul food and bargain hunting. We were two single girls and didn't have any issues walking home at night. The loft is under a flight path, but you don't hear the planes over head after a night. Other than that, it's relatively quiet. James is a great, welcoming host and has plenty of tips and is incredibly helpful.  Can't wait to stay here again during our next trip - thanks again!

The brooklyn loft was perfect.  Clean, spacious and had everything we needed. It was an easy commute to Manhattan and quick to get into Williamsburgh from Montross or Morgan Ave L trains.  I'll definitely be back!  Thanks James!

Wonderful loft apartment! Location is incredible - 2 seconds from the L train which is perfect if you want to check out the Williamsburg area, or go to Manhattan. The building was great - quiet and safe. The loft sells itself - it just like the pictures, but comes with a great host! (Thanks so much James). Laundry is on the corner of Bushwick street (drop off cost us 12 bucks and was ready the same day!). Perfect place to stay in New York - we will be back!! Thanks so much James!

Fantastic location, James was an incredible host, thanks James! The loft is amazing!
Alex, Australia
Very good place to stay if you are abble to feel good vibrations from the up to date space.

Loft was just as lovely as we had hoped.
In a really nice part of town, and very close to the subway, so it was easy to get everywhere.
Host was very very helpful and accommodating with our late night arrival.
Would definitely recommend it!

Our stay in James' loft was magical. It's a great spacious flat that is lofty but has a very homely/ comfy feel to it which is usually hard to find. 
We liked the neighbourhood which has a few great places to eat (Roberta's) and drink (The King's County). There is very easy access to Manhattan by walking to the Morgan L stop in about 5 minutes tops then getting on the most reliable subway line (we think) straight to the heart of NYC. 
We felt very much at home and Brooklyn is a great place to stay when in New York.

We enjoyed meeting James and staying in his Brooklyn loft. Nicely laid out and equipped. There was plenty of room for all 5 of us and it was located very conveniently for getting in and out of Manhattan. Also some good restaurants and coffee shops nearby too. We'll definitely stay there again if we visit New York in the future. John S. and family.
Amazing part of town, close to some of the best restaurants in Brooklyn (Momo and Tandem). Don't let the distance to Manhattan scare you off, this place is magic.
The host canceled my reservation 2 days before arrival.

James is very easy-going and even on a trip to Europe we found a way to make things smooth. Great guy!
Very nice loft, the pictures are not lying at all. The location was perfect to me : close to Williamsburg and Bushwick. The best of both worlds : hipsters on fixies and puertoricans :) ! 
You feel like a new-yorker @James'

Be aware though: this place is not for first time tourists.
But if you wanna feel the vibe and the culture of a disappearing New York, this neighborhood is for you.

Nice view from the rooftop, graffitis on the streets' walls, if Keith Haring was still around this where he would be !

This is the ultimate NY experience in this loft. We felt like we were right at home at this enormous space. There are too many things to mention, James was delightful and would definitely stay again. Thanks
The place was great and James was a very kind an accommodating host. I'd definitely recommend it!

James' loft apartment is beautifully lit, well situated [right next to the L train, which is perfect for getting in to Manhattan] and stylishly decorated. The key hand over was simple as he used an external agency and my correspondence was replied to even though he was away, which I really appreciated.

The loft was a really amazing place to stay at, me and my daughter spend over a week here, we loved to hang around in the apartment and in the neighbourhood. James is a great host, and had recommend a lot of nearby restaurants that we really enjoyed. A special experience to stay here, and we can really recommend it!

I couldn't have wished for a better place to stay on my 2 week trip to NY. That goes for both the loft and the neighbourhood. James was very easy to communicate with. Handing over the keys went smoothly.
I loved exploring the industrial neighbourhood with its nice restaurants. Convenience store, great wineshop and L-train which takes you to Manhattan in 15-20 min around the corner.
The loft is a great place to hang out and do some work if you need to. It's really quiet, I slept like a baby.
Everything was perfect. James made everything so easy. Place was immaculate. Will absolutely be calling again.
Everything was perfect. Thanks again!
Loved James' (Website hidden by Airbnb) much character...Really inspiring. Also location was spot on. I will definitely try to stay there again! Thanks for being a great host, James!

Had a great time staying in Jame's loft with my best friend!
The loft is exactly as it looks in the pics and is huge.
Anything we needed James was at the end of the phone for even with the time difference.
Also the area that the loft is in (East Williamsburg/Bushwick) has some of the best restaurants in the city and is super close to the subway.
Thanks for the stay James! Would highly recommend
X

My friends had a great start of their honeymoon in this place. 
The loft is situated in quite but developing and cool part of Williamsburg. Building has nice and friendly neigbours. James was a great host, very helpful and nice. Highly recommend it!
It's great spacious loft in nice safe location.
Great place, lots of space. A bit hot in the summer with no air con. Really good area, apartment is very close to Morgan station.

everything was as expected and the neighbourhood was really nice when we got to know it a little bit.
we stayed for 11 days and I was glad we chose this place every day when we came home from a long day of hardcore tourism.

James's loft is nice and incredibly spacious - even bigger than it looks in the photos. We enjoyed staying there for the most part and even though there was a miscommunication about check in, James did his best to rectify the issue and was accommodating. There were a couple of noisy nights during the 8 that we stayed there, but Bushwick isn't exactly known for being a quiet neighborhood.  Would definitely recommend for a larger group, especially if you're interested in staying in the neighborhood.

Very large loft---looks just like the photographs provided. Easy access to Manhattan, close to the L train and basic necessities (e.g. market, coffee shop, etc.) It was quite hot in the summer with no AC and it is a four floor walk-up but overall great place and price for an extended stay. I'd definitely recommend for large groups.
We had a comfortable stay!
The host canceled this reservation 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

The Loft is huge, it was actually kind of too big for just the two of us. Also the bathroom is a bit of a bummer, very small, no window, just not as nice as the rest of the loft. But other than that, the loft is a great place to spend a few days, especially if you like to explore Bushwick and Williamsburg. The area is great, good shops around and fantastic restaurants. You must try the pizza at Roberta's!
Very good place

It was a great spacious apartment with a good stereo system, a projector and good WiFi. It's a 5min walk away from Morgan Av metro station and the neighborhood is quiet and nice. I enjoyed my stay there :).

James responded quickly to my questions and the apt had everything necessary to live in it.

The space is exactly how it seems in pictures. Huge with an awesome kitchen setup. Only a few blocks from the subway with lots of cool bars and restaurants right around the area. The projector for watching movies is awesome.
Very spacious apartment as described. 5 minutes walk to metro and modern neighborhood. We've enjoyed our stay very much.

Stunning loft in a really cool area of Brooklyn. Nestled on a quite street on the border between Williamsburg and Bushwick, the two hippest areas, lies James incredible apartment. We were absolutely amazed by the unique decor of this place. Coloured pipes; retro furniture; hundreads of interesting objects and tree trunks hanging from the ceiling. An absolute joy to look at and to spend time in. 
It's also very close to one the best pizza places in town and incredibly convenient, if you want to grab the L Line into Manhatten (25min door to door to my office in Chelsea market). 
Overall really enjoyed my stay in this super quirky and stylish property.

Appartement très bien situé dans quartier industriel plein de restaurants/boutiques (Website hidden by Airbnb) tres simple de rejoindre Manhattan.
Nous avons adoré notre sejour et reviendrons avec grand plaisir!!!!

We stayed at James apartment for around 3 weeks. The location is great. It's less than a couple of minutes to the L train at Morgan and when that is closed J&Mnaf Flushing Ave are less than 10 mins walk. We enjoyed all the bars and cafes close by. The apartment itself was just as described. Lots of space. The only small problem we had was the Internet was not particularly strong, so this is worth considering if you are travelling on business.
Really cool loft with great projector space. Right next to Robertas, one of the best pizza place in New York. Walkable to the heart of Williamsburg

Great place in a great location, we had a great stay.  Guests should be aware that the second bedroom is an elevated loft, with a low wall, and no door. It had sufficient privacy for our purposes though.
James's flat is amazing - super stylish and a great location for exploring Bushwick or for heading into Manhatten as seconds away from the L Train. Would definitely stay again!
Great location and amazing space!
Really neat space in a great Brooklyn neighborhood.  Location is perfect.  All in all, a great stay!
This place is amazing! Its very large, cozy and has beautiful natural lighting. Would definitely stay there again.
A beautiful and enormous space, the pictures don’t do it justice. Felt like home during our stay.
Loved this space! Perfect location, close to subways. Such personality and style. I look forward to staying here again.
Great place to stay for a weekend, really open plan and cool. It was perfect for us.
Loft is exactly as is described, secure, clean, spacious and extremely well located for a base to explore Williamsburg and then Manhattan. Would definitely stay there again.
Very cool place; stylish and a huge space. Loved our time there.

Truly an amazing space with beautiful touches. James being a photographer as myself, have many cool details around the loft that really make you feel that you're in an artist's space. I came there to create and it was perfect for me. Great little spots around for coffee, organic shopping or night out. 5 mins to subway, 10 mins to Manhattan on the L train. Perfect spot

Le loft de James est parfaitement conforme à sa description. L'espace est très confortable, nous y avons séjourné avec plaisir. Le quartier, industriel et très tendance offre une vision de New York surprenante et différente. L'accès à Manhattan est très facile par le métro. Nous recommandons vivement le loft de James !
L’appart de James est idéalement situé james nous a laissé quelques adresses de resto très sympas
James' place so awesome, very cool loft to stay in NYC. Definitely would stay here again.
The appartment meet all our expectation and they allow us to check in late. The area have lot of trendy places and the subway is very close.

The apartment is very spacious and a great place to stay while exploring New York. It is conveniently located close to 2 metro lines, with several restaurants and a good grocery shop nearby. Check-in and check-out process was smooth. We can highly recommend James's place!
Great place! A very cool apartment with everything you need. Comfy beds. Recommended.
This place was great for an adult. They correctly noted you have to climb stairs (4 flights). Not a problem for me with luggage but the climb was worth it.
A fun, cool space in a great neighborhood. Excellent value for Brooklyn.
Killer style. Cool Neighborhood. Great host. 10/10 would recommend

BOOK AT YOUR OWN RISK!!! This is the airbnb that you do not what to book. James was unreachable for 9+ hours on the day of my check in. He accepted my booking and did not send any check in information. Upon trying to reach him i find out that his number is international and not available. So he is not even in the country. He could have left me with an alternative contact knowing he was going to be unreachable. When he finally gets in touch its with absolutely no remorse for his inaction, just with a phone number that I can call and he goes off-grid again. At this point i have been hanging on the street for 5+ . hours with 3 massive suitcases. It took Airbnb another 3 hours to cancel this reservation and release my funds so i could book an alternative accommodation. I spent a total of 2 hours back and forth on the phone and texting with the most bias and unhelpful Airbnb support staff who used delay as a tactic to try to force me to check in to this apartment. After i clearly communicated that i did not feel welcome there. I can go on.....but i think you get the picture. This experience defeats the concept of finding a space that you can call home away from home. Zero hospitality and massive FAIL on the host and Airbnb

Great loft in an up-and coming neighbourhood, with trendy cafés, restaurants and fashion shops nearby. Same for groceries, all within walking distance. The L train stops at Morgan St., only a short walk from the appartment, and will take you to downtown NYC Union Square in 15 minutes - fantastic !

The apartment was beyond expectations. It was so spacious, amazingly decorated and in a good location in Brooklyn. We were delayed arriving in New York by about 20 hours but Jacquline went out of her way to give a friend of ours the keys, and then we lost a key and she was quick to help with that and very understanding. All-in-all an amazing stay. Would recommend to everyone!

We enjoyed our stay at Jeanne's humble abode :) It was super cozy and well-kept. I would recommend this place to anyone. Only one thing to keep in mind, the walls are thin, you may hear a bit of noise from time to time because the apartment is in the basement. But other than that the place is Lovely and Jeanne and George were the most hospitable!

My stay at gorgeous in greenpoint was wonderful!! The place is beautiful, as well as the neighborhood. I definitely recommend staying in greenpoint when visiting NY!!! Thank you Jeanne for making my family vacation such a wonderful one!!!!

They did an excellent job converting a basement into a very comfortable apartment.  The bathroom tile and kitchen were amazing. The only negatives are the footsteps of their two kids running around early in the evening and the low ceiling support across half the apartment, hit my head a few times.  I also was quite surprised by the additional cleaning charge or $50. Personally I think that should have been a part of the rental charge, but oh well.

Just returned home from a weekend in New York City where I stayed in Jeanne's adorable apartment in Brooklyn.  We really enjoyed the Greenpoint neighborhood which is still not totally hippified and yet has plenty of excellent (and reasonably priced) restaurants to enjoy.  Getting into Manhattan takes a bit of effort, but is not a chore: the "G" train, or a convenient bus takes you to a number of train-lines that speed you into the city.
Especially enjoyed coming home to the apartment with its separate entrance, and which Jeanne has lovingly furnished with every thought for the comfort and convenience of her guests. One caveat: as this cozy apartment is carved out of the basement space, the ceilings are somewhat low; a tall person would need to mind.  I would definitely stay there again.

A nice apartment- thoughtfully designed, and a pleasure to come home to after a long day out. It's true that there is a bit of noise from footsteps above, but not late at night, so we slept very well. The glass tiles in the kitchen and bathroom are amazing and the place was immaculate. I would recommend this place to anyone!

I had a great time staying at Jeanne's apartment.  It's lovely, comfortable, and within a short walking distance to a subway stop and a variety of restaurants.  There were some footstep & dog noises but I didn't find them any worse than staying at my friend's Brooklyn apartment.  I would definitely stay at Jeanne's again.

Our stay at Jeanne's was perfect, everything we needed was provided.  The place is very comfy and home-like which was one of the reasons we wanted to stay there.  She was very helpful and answered every question we had.  We will definitely stay at Jeanne's again in the future

Jeanne's apartment is beautifully decorated and a great size considering its location.
We only got to meet the family on the last night as they'd been on holiday, they were very helpful with information about getting to airport and Jeanne even booked us a taxi. Its a very short walk to the subway and one easy train change and you're in Manhattan. There are plenty of Grocery stores in the main street (which the apartment is in a side street from), the area felt very safe even when we walked back from the Subway around 11pm.
We had a wonderful trip in NYC and if we're ever book wouldn't hesitate to stay here again! Thanks Jeanne and family and my mum would like to say how much she loved your cats.

The place was absolutely wonderful! Cozy, tidy, and neat. We definitely will use this apartment again, located in the great area of Greenpoint full of ethnic restaurants! Jeanne had provided maps of New York, local restaurant menus, all the  toiletries, towels, a fan, all the kitchen necessities and so much more! Neighborhood is quiet and safe, just note there is quite a bit of noise from the footsteps upstairs. Personally I would rather hear the footsteps of 
a family home than all the screaming, yelling, loud music, and more that come with an apartment complex.:) 
thanks Jeanne!

We stayed at Jeanne's gorgeous apartment in Greenpoint from July 11-17th and had a wonderful time. It was a lovely, quiet place to relax after long days in the city. The air conditioner felt awesome during the heat wave that we experienced. 

Make sure to have breakfast or lunch at Brooklyn Label (great prices, just a few blocks away) and stock up the kitchen with lots of food to save some money.

Beautiful accommodations.. friendly and helpful host, great communication, easy stay.

Slept 4 comfortably.. great deal for this neighborhood! If you want to stay in Greenpoint the nearest hotel is in Queens and there is not public transit.. this place was great... just a short walk to the train and you can be in Wiliamsberg or Manhattan in no time at all! 

Wonderful neighborhood with lots of cute shops, restaurants and bars. Thanks Gorgeous in Greenpont for a wonderful stay! 

I would recommend this rental to anyone!! It was great and we will defiantly book for our next visit!!

My family was visiting from out of town and had a great stay at Jeanne's apartment. She was very attentive and helpful, and my family could not stop expressing how pleased they were with the place--it was very clean and decorated nicely. It was perfect for their visit. Would highly recommend, and when they come back, they'd like to stay there again!

Whether blasting around NYC on business or just visiting the area, this apartment is a peaceful sanctuary located on the quieter end of Greenpoint that is a pleasure to return to at the end of the day. Jeanne has thought of everything you might need, and the other reviews that remarked on how spotless the apartment is are absolutely accurate. Not sure if anyone mentioned the beautiful shower--a real treat.  (And runners--this is a great place to get in the miles! Flat, interesting, and offer a nice over the East River and into Central Park if you are so inclined.)

Jeanne was a gracious and friendly host. Everything was as promised, clean, comfortable, and quiet. Apartment is very well appointed with every imaginable need addressed. Highly recommended for short or long term stay in Brooklyn.
Mike and Judy

I will definately stay here the next time I am in NYC. It is affordable and perfect for a family of 4. Once u get the hang of the subway it is an easy ride to manhatten. The 4$ dollar ferry to Pier 17 is an easy option, as well. All in all a wonderful stay in a perfectly cosy/clean appartment in a convenient/safe location.

Thanks Jeanne & George!

brgds,

Lisette

Jeanne and George's place was just perfect for our getaway.  We just loved it.  The place is perfectly renovated and decorated with excellent taste and timeless style.  The kitchen and bathroom were perfectly stocked with everything you could possibly need.  It was like a luxury master suite at a 5 star hotel but with the warmth of a cozy home.  I'll add it was super neat and clean.  

The location is just prime, everything you need within a few blocks walking distance, groceries, food, shopping, great restaurants, getting to the City or Williamsburg is a breeze and just minutes by train.

From the key-less entry to the cable ready living room and serene bedroom, it was the perfect stay and we look forward to coming back real soon.  We didn't get to meet Jeanne until check-out but she was just adorable, lovely family, and they are NY Ranger fans to boot, GO RANGERS!


Note: If your from the UK or a fan of a Proper English breakfast!.  Jeane and George's place is just minutes from one of my favorite places to eat breakfast, Gordon Bennett's in Williamsburg, they serve up the best proper fry-up you'll ever get in all of NY, it's just Pucker!

Thanks again to Jeanne & George for hosting a wonderful place.

Chris & Melissa

Jeanne is a great host! Everything was perfect!! Location (Greenpoint Brooklyn, great & quiet spot, well provided in restaurants,bars & convenience stores, the appartment (big,new,well equiped, very clean and finely decorated), public transportation (few steps to MTA, 10 min to get midtown Manhattan by ferry with wonderfull views) and the kindness of Jeanne and George! I definetely recommend staying at Jeanne's. Thanks for the experience. Rafael.

Our stay at Jeanne and George was great. This is a perfect getaway location. After all the huzzle and buzzle of New York it feels great to arrive back in Greenpoint. There are all kind of shops for your convenience in the neighbourhood. 
The apartment is clean, tidy and cosy. And what a lovely shower!
The subway is nearby and it takes about 30 minutes to get from Greenpoint to Times square and 42nd street. With one transfer.

It was also very nice to meet Jeanne, George and the kids.
We will definately come back to Greenpoint!

We loved the little apartment and found Greenpoint fascinating.  Had a great breakfast at Papacitos and would like to go there at night.  Great neighborhood feeling.  Sorry we couldn't try the ferry from India road.  The apartment was in great shape and had some nice guidebooks. Took the G down to Willamsburg for some great restaurants.  Would recommend this.  We did not get to see Jeanne--- maybe next time.

gorgeous in greenpoint it's a real home away from home! we've loved everything about it. it had everything that we needed: linen, extra blankets, a million of towels, shampoos, shower gels, coffee, sugar, ... saving us space in our suitcases. every morning we walked 15 min accros the bridge and grabbed a metro there, so we were on times square in no time. would love to go there again. thank you, jeanne :)

Great experience, exactly what we were after. The apartment is perfect as a base to go and explore. This part of Greenpoint hasn't yet changed into the madness that Williamsburg has become, yet there is a great collection of little places opening up. Great coffee, Thai food, polish food and no more than 20 minutes walk gets you to PS1/Moma. 25 minute walk in the other direction and you are in Williamsburg. Can be in mid-town in less than 25 minutes.
Nice and tidy apartement. Everything worked very well in contact with Jeanne. Close to everything and wonderful neighborhoods. We could have spent our 9 days only in Brooklyn.

This was my second stay at Jeanne's, and it was as excellent as the first. Jeanne is stunningly easy to work with, crystal clear about everything, and gracious to boot. The apartment is immaculate and quiet. Heaven for anyone looking for a place that both soothes the nerves and feels homey. Be sure to try the East River Ferry service at India St., as it is a great alternative to the subway. Also, be sure to try Anella's or the recently opened Gwynnet Street. Fantastic food. And the nearby Ashbox Cafe is a great place for breakfast (cash only).

Staying at t Jeanne's apartment made a great trip perfect!  The apartment had everything our family of four needed and was wonderfully finished.  We loved the Greenpoint neighborhood with its array of eateries, Champion Coffee, markets, playgrounds, etc.  It is also super convienient to get anywhere in the city due to its proximity to the subway and East River Ferry.  One of our favorite parts of our time there was talking with Jeanne and getting an insider's view of living in the area.  We can't say enough good things and are looking forward to our next visit!

Jeanne's basement apt in Greenpoint was our first stop on an extended vacation into New England. I agree with all the positive comments about the apartment. Our stay was for 3 nights and it was very confortable space for 3 people. Much roomier than a NY hotel room. I especially appreciated the air conditioning, as it was hot and muggy during our stay. The walk to the subway or the ferry was about equal distance and I would recommend using the ferry at least once if you want some views of New York City from the East River. Note: The ferry stops very briefly  so you must have your ticket from the kiosk and be ready to board when it arrives. 

We never met Jeanne, but she had plenty of maps and references for us in the apt.  Local Brooklyn restaurants are great and reasonably priced. One we really enjoyed was Cafecito Bogota, 1015 Manhattan Ave., Colombian cuisine, a short walk from the apt. Another a short distance further was OTT, a Thai restaurant, 970 Manhattan Ave. This area in Greenpoint is a Polish neighborhood and we  bought some of the old country pastries. However along Manhattan Ave there are a multitude of coffee houses, bars, small markets, and more.

The only reason I rated the overall experience 4 out of 5 stars was the car service, Java. The apt had their cards as part of the information so we used them when departing. What a mistake.  We were very disappointed with the rudeness of the driver, the quoted price to Grand Central Station had undisclosed additional "charges" and the driver did not want to help unload our luggage from the trunk when we arrived. He did not want to get out the the car due to some concerns he had about him being able to stop at the curb there.

In comparison, the times we took a taxi we had no problems other than giving the driver major cross streets in Brooklyn. And taxi fares to Greenpoint from Manhattan were generally less than $20.

The apartment in my opinion is a 5 out of 5 stars and what a relief to come back from a day in Manhattan to a quieter place in Greenpoint.

Jeanne's apartment is perfect if you want to be easily into the hustle and bustle of Manhattan but with the option of returning to a homely and relaxing base.

The apartment was more than big enough for the two of us, was beautifully and thoughtfully decorated, and had all the mod cons we needed. The kitchen was perfect for making our breakfasts before a day exploring, and the shower was great.

Greenpoint itself is a very nice neighbourhood from what we saw of it, and a nice contrast to other parts of NYC we visited. The apartment had easy access for both the G and 7 trains too which was helpful.

Our biggest tip would be to use the East River Ferry, $4 to Wall Street from India Street, and the perfect opportunity to cruise along the Manhattan front and under the Brooklyn Bridge.

We have had a fabulous time and would not hesitate to use the apartment again on a return to New York, nor to reccomend it to our friends and family.

I spent a week in Jeanne's apartment with my family and it really does have everything! Neighbourhood has everything you will need, from coffee houses with free wifi to laundromats to great choice of eating places. Subway is nearby and you're minutes away from Manahttan. The apartment is clean and cosy and Jeanne and her husband were very helpful setting up the heating and the internet for us. Kitchen is fully equipped with everything you would need to cook, which I did a lot of for my 3 year old daughter. wifi and tv were great. I've used other airbnb apartments in NY before but Jeanne's place will be my first choice from now on. 

Thanks Jeanne!

This apartment was awesome. Having lived in the neighborhood, we were very familiar with the area and the apt. felt like being at home-well planned, designed, and though out it fit our family of four + baby comfortably. The hosts were responsive and excellent and we look forward to staying again on our next visit.
This was a great spot in our old neighborhood,Greenpoint.Quiet simple apartment that was perfect for our small family to get over our jet-lag and explore Brooklyn for a week.Highly recommended!

Jeanne and George offer a cozy, clean, comfortable and homey place that had all the amenities on a quiet family block. They are wonderful hosts and made the experience like staying with friends. The kitchen has all the needed items to prepare simply meals and the bedroom offered much storage for all our needs.

My family and I spent 4 nights here in early April. Way, way better than paying for a hotel. Plenty of space and comfort for the 4 of us and literally a 10 minute walk to the 7 train and then only 2 stops to Times Square. If heading to the south end of Manhattan a short walk to the G train. The place was perfectly clean and it was great to have a kitchen with basic provisions to have breakfast before we went out each morning. Every night we came back around 11 or 12 and never felt anything but perfectly safe walking back. 24 hour mini market just a 1 minute walk away perfect to buy bread and eggs etc. Also great to be able to pick up a few beers each night when we got back.

If we make it back to New York we will definitely be trying to stay here again. It was quite soothing to be staying in this neighbourhood and not the madness of Manhattan. Also only about a $20 taxi trip from LGA.

This Greenpoint apartment was perfect for us. It was clean, very comfortable, and close to the subway and great restaurants. The neighborhood is quiet, and very diverse, which we enjoyed. We had no problems during our stay and would happily stay here again. Jean and George are great hosts who have clearly given a lot of thought into making a safe and enjoyable place for their Airbnb visitors.

Jeanne's beautiful apartment was perfect! It had everything we needed and was very conveniently located. We'll definitely be staying here again during future visits to New York. It was really nice to come "home" to a cozy apartment instead of an impersonal hotel room at the end of a long day.

Aside from some Wifi connection issues (macbook doesnt like WPA on AES) the place was great for what we needed, about a 10 minute walk to a couple of subway stations. It felt clean and modern even if the bathroom is a bit of a squash. The $50 cleaning fee is a bit cheeky but it is what it is. A washer/drier would be nice but there is a laundromat down the road. Noise from above was minimal and the AC kept things cool even if it is a bit noisy. No electric kettle so you'll need to boil it on the stove or microwave if you want a hot drink. Overall it was what we needed.

Das Apartment von Jeanne ist ausgezeichnet, wenn man nicht nur im Trubel von Manhattan unterwegs sein möchte. In der Gegend gibt es viele gemütliche Bars und Lokale und trotzdem ist man mit der Fähre bzw. der U-Bahn schnell in Manhattan. Das Apartment ist sehr sauber und gemütlich - ideal für zwei bis drei Personen. Wir haben Jeanne leider nicht persönlich getroffen. Es hat aber organisatorisch wunderbar funktioniert. Alles in allem: Sehr zu empfehlen, wenn man Zeit in Brooklyn verbringen möchte.

Great place to stay.  Quiet, lazy little neighborhood to retreat to after a busy day in the city. Great restaurants and bars nearby.   Easy access to the city.  We used the bus or ferry to the subway and generally cab back($12).  Clean, comfortable and well equipped.  Never had the pleasure of meeting Jeanne, but access into the property was slick with the lock box/pin number.  Would highly recommend to others.

the appartment is exactly what you see on the pics
warm and fonctionnal
Jeanne and her husband are very kind and helpful
we love our stay and we will come back

This apartment was PERFECT in every way.  My husband and I were visiting our son and daughter-in-law and they were only a block away.  Jeanne gave us a "home away from home" welcome the minute we walked in.  The entire apartment is warm and cozy and we wanted for nothing.  Everything we needed was provided.  The location was close to everything, and we just love this Greenpoint neighborhood.  We will definitely return for future visits.

Good communication with Jeanne. She had everything ready for us and we were able to check in early which help with the luggage.  The apartment is well positioned close to several subway stations, shops and eateries. The apartment is cosy and has everything you need for a comfortable stay.

The apartment was nicely appointed, cozy and immaculate!  It is situated in a charming neighborhood on a very quiet street.  We especially appreciated that the outdoor steps and walkway were cleared of snow for us! We enjoyed our stay very much.

With my wife Anna spent 15 days in NY pleasant. The apartment of Jeanne is exactly as shown in the listing. We especially loved the excellent cleaning, and the provision of equipment in the kitchen.
The location is very convenient to the metro station and the ferry that let you get to the center of Manhattan in less than 30 minutes.
Only negative to report is warming below our expectations, partly because of the very cold weather outside.
We highly recommend the apartment for a pleasant holiday in NY in warmer periods.
The reservation was canceled 195 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Jeanne's AirBnB.  It was very clean and comfortable and my wife enjoyed the provided coffee in the morning.  We liked the location as the neighborhood was quiet and it was a few blocks from our daughters apt.  I highly recommend Jeanne's Greenpoint AirBnB.

Great convenient location for getting to Manhattan, check out the East River Ferry stop just a few blocks away. Apartment was clean and well stocked with amenities. The neighborhood is a great backdrop to a visit to NYC.

Our stay was very nice in new york. The apartment Was very clean and with all the stuff that you need to cooking. Everything is close ( restaurant, super market.. )and Subway. I highly recommend this apartment.

Wonderfully quaint and perfectly clean apartment in a quiet neighborhood with a bunch of bars and restaurants in walking distance.
Close to subway stop, which was perfect for convenient travel by public transportation.

Great host who made us feel very welcome. Entry by code worked perfectly!

We had the most amazing stay! Jeanne and George are wonderful hosts. always there when we needed them. the neighborhood was absolutely gorgeous even walking home at 3 a.m. we felt 100% safe! we loved loved loved the apartment! so beautifully decorated! definitely going to come back again!

We arrived easy and a taxi from the airport was around $55. 
We had mistaken the photos and thought there were 2 separate bedrooms so a little disappointed, but reviewing the photos again afterwards, we see that it was our mistake. 
The kitchen is nice and there is a big fridge and coffee and drip machine. 
It's a basement apartment so this helps keep coole in summer. Has low ceiling.
Nice neighbourhood away from the main street, and nice restaurants/bars hidden on back streets on the other side of Manhatten Rd.

Thanks very much for leaving kids toys around for us, they were much appreciated.
We had an excellent stay at Greenpoint enjoyed the well equipped kitchen and easy access to Manhattan either by metro or ferry. Greenpoint is a great place to rest after a Manhattan day!

Sehr nette Unterkunft in Brooklyn und sehr nahe zum Zentrum von Manhatten. Alles hat reibungslos funktioniert und Jeanne hat netter Weise bereits einige bestellte Sachen im Vorfeld angenommen. Die Ankunft bei Taxi und Zugang per Pin waren völlig problemlos. Ihr Mann George hat uns dann sehr nett empfangen und auch sehr hilfsbereit nach einem vermisst geglaubten Handy zu suchen geholfen. Die Lage ist prima, wichtige Geschäfte direkt im Umfeld und nach Manhatten sind es ca. 25 min.

Vielen Dank für die nette Zeit.

Thank you for kindness and helpfulness, we feel very welcome!

Super séjour à New-York dans un appartement décrit à la perfection, très propre et soigné. Le quartier était très calme et le métro à 5 minutes.
Nous y retournerons avec plaisir.
Greenpoint place does have it all!  GREAT locations, considerate and helpful hosts, quiet, safe and charming.  Thanks, Jeanne

Jeanne was really welcoming, came down to chat with us for a while the day after we go there. The apartment is lovely, not a vast amount of natural light but who needs that, when you're going to be out and about in New York all day?! The area is lovely too, amazing $1 oysters, $3 well drinks and yummy chicken wings right around the corner from the apartment. 

When you walk to the 7 train each day you get an amazing Manhattan skyline view - I was gawping at it so much I walked into a lamppost!

It's the best place to stay, away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan, and doesn't cost the earth unlike the hotels in New York!
