Luiz's place is fantastic! Great location, terrific hospitality and most important for me, a really comfortable, quiet place in the middle of everything in NYC.  I'm a fussy sleeper and was really impressed with how comfortable the bedding in the sleep loft is.  I'll definitely stay here again!
Place is just as advertized. Central location, close to Penn Station and Times Square. Cozy and comfortable. Plenty of restaurants and shops close by. Would stay here again.
La ubicación es muy buena para llegar a cualquier atracción en NYC en metro. Lo único es que compartes cocina y baño. Buena relación costó beneficio

I can't believe the morons who have made negative posts. Luiz has been very clear in his description of what the apartment is like.  READ CAREFULLY. I needed a shower, a bed, Wi-Fi and a room to safely spread out my stuff.  That's what he described and that is EXACTLY what I found when I got there.  If you assumed certain "services" would be available, but failed to verify ahead of time, that is YOUR failure, not the hosts. Luiz exemplifies the best qualities in a host and I highly recommend contacting him if you are going to visit Times Square and Hell's Kitchen.
very good location for being close to New York attractions and transport. Luiz will respond and be very accomodating in ensuring your stay is a comfortable one.
Great location in heart of the kitchen

This place is an awesome value in a great location, but make sure to read the description! The layout is a little odd, with the toilet not in the actual apartment, and the room with the shower and sink is really small. I had some issues with the wifi being a little in-and-out - not sure if this is typical. The window unit A/C was greatly appreciated, and the lofted bed results in a really nice sitting area. Luiz is great and really flexible with check-in and check-out. Everything was nice and clean. If you're looking for an inexpensive place to stay really close to Times Square, this is a wonderful option.

The apartment have a very good location, close to time square, many subway around, restaurants everywhere. Excellent for a first time in New-York if you want to see Manhattan and principals tourist attractions.
But, there is a building construction just in front of the bedroom's windows, so there is a lot of noise early in the morning. It's not a problem if you wake (Email hidden by Airbnb) but if you want to sleep, you can't.
There are many homeless in front of the building, but never had a problem with them. Quite and clean place, I had 2 different roommates and there were quite and polite.
Tony made my check-in and he was very patient cause my shuttle took 2 hours to get me to the apartment (take the subway).
Luiz was very king and accepted at the last minute that a friend can stay with me for few nights. But I don't recommended this place for two peoples. The bed is too small for two and the couch is too hard. But we were in New-York so we dealed with it ! :)

L'appartement est parfaitement situé, proche de Time Square, plusieurs métro aux alentours, des restaurants partout. Parfait pour une première expérience à New-York si vous souhaitez visiter Manhattan et ses principales attractions touristiques.
Par contre il y a un immeuble en construction juste en face des fenêtres de la chambre donc beaucoup de bruit tôt le matin. Ce n'est pas un problème si vous vous levez à 7h mais si vous souhaitez dormir, c'est impossible.
Beaucoup de sans abris devant l'entrée de l'immeuble mais je n'ai jamais eu de soucis avec. L'endroit est calme et propre, j'ai eu 2 colocataires différents qui était discrets et polis.
Tony a fait mon check-in et il a été très patient car ma navette a mis 2h pour me déposer (prenez le métro).
Luiz a gentillement accepté à la dernière minute qu'une amie se joigne à moi pendant quelques nuits. Mais je ne recommande pas cette chambre pour deux, le lit est trop petit pour y tenir à 2 et le canapé beaucoup trop dur. Mais nous étions à New-York alors on a fait avec ! :)

I really enjoyed staying at Luiz' apartment! The best thing about it is definitely the location in the center of manhatten. Also, it is very clean and the check-in and check-out was very easy! The apartment consists of two bedrooms which are rented separately, means you share the living room and bathroom with another person. But that's totally okay because if you don't want to meet the other person you can stay in your bedroom which is big enough. The only negative point is that the bathroom is very small but it's okay.

Really enjoyed my stay here! The location was perfect. It was only a 10-15 minute walk away from all the places I wanted to go. There are plenty of food options and things to do nearby. The apartment is small, but cozy and surprisingly quiet. I felt very safe there. Luiz and Tony were very responsive when I contacted them beforehand. They were even nice enough to let me check in early on the day of my arrival. I would definitely stay here again.

The room is one of two in a second floor apartment, located 2 minutes walk away from Port Authority bus station and 5-10 minutes from the theatre district. Despite its central location, the place is generally quiet and the other guest was barely noticeable. The bedroom itself was spacious thanks to the loft layout, and the bed and sheets were amazingly comfortable! The entire place is extremely clean and tidy and the hosts are very hospitable and responsive.

The place is strategically located in Manhattan and is easily a great choice to those who prefer to be close to where the hustle and bustle are in the city. Tony, who helps familiarise occupants to the place, is very helpful and responsive through SMS to my queries.

It is advisable that occupants keep the shower room unlocked to avoid accidental lock outs. Keep your keys with you all the time.

Amazing value since accommodation in NYC is ridiculously expensive. The place is very close to Times Square and the theatre district. Room was large and clean. It did get really hot up on the loft bed even with the a/c on since hot air goes up, room probably could do with a ceiling fan. Shower water pressure was a bit bad and I sometimes couldn’t get hot water running so had to take a cold shower. Toilet being outside is a bit of a pain but it all worked fine. All in all, this is a good place to stay, being in manhattan and not going to break your bank.
Great location! Exactly what I was looking for

Ideal for a solo traveler if you're in the city for a few days. Luiz was very easy to communicate with, responsive and a super easy check-in and check-out. The apartment is located in Hell's Kitchen, a few blocks from Times Sq and close to bars and restaurants.

욕실과 화장실이 분리되어 따로있는데 굉장히  작습니다.
대신 잠은 편안히 잤어요

I give 5 out of 5 stars for the location. For anything else I will not give more than 1 star.
I do not recommend this place.
Luiz's place was a great value for the money. It was a nice room in a good location close to Times Square. The apartment was functional and the bed was comfy.
Nice, small space in a very convenient location and the host was very responsive.
Great place, clean, everything you need and in a great location for everything central in manhattan. Thanks!
Great value. Nice and quiet place, very central. AC in the summer was much appreciated.
Cozy space located in a good location. A good choice for the solo traveler

Luiz is a really good guy and he makes a hell of a cup of coffee if you're fortunate enough to have him there while you are. This place is quite small, a bit smaller than the photos show, but it is certainly what affordable NYC looks like. Especially the toilet room (outside the apartment) is no larger than an airplane lavatory, and it is very tricky to stand square at the sink in the shower room without one foot in the shower. Most everything was very clean, but I did find a bug on the wall one night. I had the privilege of sleeping in both rooms of the apartment. The room with the loft is larger, but be wary of the loft temperature - it was a hot summer week when I was there and the loft area was around 20 degrees warmer than the floor with AC on full, which for me was extremely uncomfortable, especially because memory foam absorbs heat. I had to convert the couch into a bed and sleep on that the first night. The loft is also pretty unforgiving - rough wood and visible screws at the corners - so make sure you can always see where you're going. The other room had a larger bed, but as a 6'1'' man, I couldn't lay all the way flat even diagonally without my feet up against the wall. Both mattresses are very comfortable and the sheets were very clean. Luiz's friend Tony was a gem when helping with check-in. Overall, this is a pretty darn good way for a young solo traveler to learn what living in Midtown would really look like for them, and I'm glad to have had the experience, especially because it was less than half the expense of nearby hotels.

Great spot! Right by Midtown, with easy access to the Upper West Side, Downtown, and even a short-ish walk to Grand Central. The place is very quiet, only on my last day did I see another person in the hallway, and someone in the other attached AirBNB property. A welcome relief from the hustle and bustle out on the streets :)

Great location, lovely room, 10min walk to time square, 20min walk to Central Park. 
Host is lovely as well!
Will stay again

I had a great stay at this place. Andrea and his roomies are really cool, and everything went smooth. I would love to stay there again, so naturally I would recommend this to anyone visiting the city...
Everything worked out perfectly! Andrea is a very nice guy and a great host. The room is simple but very convenient and a real bargain for this price!

Andrea! Awesome place! Totally loved it. Gorgeous living space, not too far from anything. But not too close, either, if that makes sense. A great rooftop to sit on, and a ton of space to hang out in or play piano or pass out at eight am in or whatever you're into. The other travelers staying in the house were lovely. Andrea--also great. Met me at the train station and showed me around. Didn't see him again after that. I would stay there again for sure. In a second. Good times, all around.

This place is laid back, you can feel free to do what you want.
It has good cooking facilities.
Also great to have a piano and a good sound system.
Nice to go on the roof top and overlook the highway and city.
Ten times better than staying in a hostel and has a unique bohemian vibe.
Close to eating places and bars in the neighbourhood.

Issues for me personally were with noise (from the freeway being your direct neighbour) and a not so clean bathroom.
Also he needed to change the photo and description of the place, as he had said it was quiet and there is a washing machine but it was for the room across the hall not the one I stayed in. So was disappointed about that.

However, overall I enjoyed  staying here and Andrea is very honest and trustworthy.

Highly recommended, once he changes his description and photos to be more accurate.
Great place, great service. :]
All good.  Nice apartment with a really ace roof, with cool views.  Enjoyed my stay in Greenpoint.
Andrea Z. was an excellent host, and the room was nice and comfortable.  Do not judge this room by the exterior of the building!  Nice place to stay.
The place was awesome! Good location and transit is easily accessible. Andrea was a very hospitable host and very helpful! I would definitely stay here again.
Loved the space, Andrea Z very easy to work with, everything went to plan.  Thanks!!
Cool room in an expansive hip Brooklyn apartment--and the price can't be beat. Andrea is a thoughtful host too. ...
Great Stay, Great Place, Great Host!
It's the Rock n Roll Hotel for Brooklyn!
Good experience for me... convenient location near Greenpoint/WIlliamsburg. Thanks, Andrea...
Had a great time staying at Andrea's place. Not only is the pad hip, cool, and bohemian but so is he. Would definitely stay again.
chilled
I came over with two full bags of mcdonalds and although he doesn't eat so unhealthy, we pounded thru everything while having a few laughs. I enjoyed it very much

You can see Manhattan from the rooftop! The collection of reading material is pretty terrific, should you be too knackered to venture out. Convenient and clean and well-suited for the budget-minded traveler.
Cool roof
Andrea was super! even lets us change our travel plans at the last minute and was able to accomodate us a day early... Nice spot in the BK! Thx again Andrea :)!
Brooklyn's unofficial rock n roll hotel....great view from the roof, funky neighborhood nearby and a pleasant 10 minute walk to the subway...

Andrea is a really nice guy - his place is exactly as described. Its definitely not one for the clean freaks but great for an authentic feel of Brooklyn life. Its in a convenient location too, really near the bars and buzz of Williamsburg. Only annoyance we had was that there were 7 other guys staying in the place as well as us, and from the description we thought there would have only been a max of 6 across the 3 rooms. This meant that all the rooms were slept in as well as people sleeping on the couch, chair and floor in the lounge! Perhaps worth asking who else is booked in when you contact :)
Andrea was nice! Good location, easily accessible... Good times!
It was a great stay, loved brooklyn!
Andrea is a great host his place is really well located and there is everything one needs when visiting Brooklyn. We had a great experience  I recommand the place.
The host canceled my reservation 17 days before arrival for a good reason and helped me on finding a new place. I hope to stay at his place next time!
Very cool apartment and only about 20 mins walk to some of the best parts of Brooklyn. Andrea was a great host and I'd thoroughly recommend staying here.
Great place to stay especially if you are into playing/listening to music.  Great host.  Thank you.
The host canceled my reservation 6 days before arrival.
Andrea was a great host! Fabulous taste in music too. Highly recommended!
The host canceled my reservation 4 days before arrival.

The loft itself, as a room, with its big open space and the piano is great and the neighborhood of Greenpoint is pleasant and interesting. Andrea was always available when we needed him and he gave us excellent recommendations on where to eat out. However, and despite the fact that it's inexpensive for New York, it was a pity that the loft was so messy and dirty. Also, the traffic is very loud (our bed trembled when towing trucks were on the ramp) and you shouldn't  mind other guests possibly sleeping in the living room if you decide to stay here.
good times, fun funky place, flexible host, worth the $

In 2011, two friends of mine and me stayed in Andreas apartment in Brooklyn. It was an awesome experience. Andrea lives in a very unique building, in Williamsburg. We had a great time, jamming together and going out in the vibrant neighborhood. The rooms are very basic, but nice. If you want to have a fun and unique stay during your trip to NY, this is the place to be. Thank you Andrea!

I stayed in Andrea's place for 5 days after relocating to NYC. Andrea is a really nice and friendly guy and made me feel welcome. It's about 15 mins walk to the L or G trains to get you round Brooklyn or into Manhattan. It's a cool pad - It's not the Hilton but it has everything you need and it's good value. It sure beats staying in a hostel.

Andrea was the perfect host and made me feel totally at home. He knows how to be friendly and helpful, at the same time maintain a distance that gives his guests a sense of privacy. Andrea's loft is amazing!! If you're into trashy horror movies and mind-blowing music choose this spot. Its located only a short distance from Williamsburg, very easy to get there by bike. Andrea was there to meet me when I arrived and gave great suggestions about the area. We had an amazing time exploring the restaurants, bars, and shops! The noise didn't bother me much. If you've ever lived in a urban spot, you know what to expect!  I really did not want to leave! BIG UP! 3
Great spot for a short stay in New York.  Neat, clean, Andrea's got everything covered.

Andrea is a really nice guy. He is fun and we went out for a beer and a game of pool one night - great! He was helpful with advises about the neighborhood. Though we had a great time at Andreas, the apartment needs a thorough cleaning.
Andrea is a really great host ! I stayed during 2 weeks , and this huge living room was really a good place to chill sometimes.I really recommended it .

it  was great to be back after 25 yrs,,to see what has and has not changed. Williamsburg has definitively changed, don't particularly like the look of the new condos. All in all NY is young, alive and looking good!

Andrea is a very friendly guy and we had a good time with him, drinking some beers... BUT :

But the place is really dirty. We planned to stay 2 nights but we left on the 1st day because of that. Bedlinens smelt bad and the litter in the bathroom  was full of sanitary pads... The price he asks to pay is really expensive for that experience. I really regret to have booked there. We had to pay for an hotel on the day after....

For my first AirBnB experience, I stayed at Andrea's place in Greenpoint for six days. Although I never had a chance to meet him, I found Andrea to be a communicative, very helpful, and friendly host -- he rapidly answered any and all questions I had and helped me get basically situated with the area. 

Some caveats: The street this particular place is located on is somewhat desolate/warehouse-ey, and I was initially concerned about that. It ultimately felt quite safe and is just a block away from normal residential streets. I also rather enjoyed walking through this part-Polish, part-hipster, all-relaxed corner of Brooklyn (it's about a 20 minute walk to the nearest subway). Also, to echo what some other people have said, the living area is a little cluttered and not the cleanest. The bedroom was fine (with fresh sheets and towels, and air conditioning!), though a little smaller than it looks.

Thanks, Andrea!

I didn't meet Andrea but he was super helpful with directions and details. The place was in a great location, near general stores and only a 10 minute skate to Bedford St. Would defiantly stay there again!

The place is a kind of audio studio with rooms close to the hipsters districts of greenpoint and williamsburg. Having air conditionning was really a important point during summer. I was glad to relax reading a comic in the comfy sofa a rainy day. Even if I didn't met Andrea it was fun to meet other guests in the place. Andrea was very helpful providing the key and gave me interesting tips and clear information and kept me informed by text messages.
On the other hand the place was a bit far from the subway and it took quite a long time to get to Manhathan. Sheets were washed but a part from the mess, that doesn't bother me, the room was dusty and the toillets kind of dirty which really annoys me. I don't expect a daily clean up but at least a weekly, when you have guests... So I reccomend the place if you are really looking for a cheap place near the hipster districts and not that far from Manhattan, and you are not really strict with cleanning or you bring your shower sandals and do a bit of cleaning in your room.
I had an emergency after making reservations with Andrea and was unable to stay at his place. He was very flexible and understanding about the problem. Thank you!

hi,
me and my brother had a nice stay in brooklyn. although the apartment is not the cleanest one we enjoyed it very much. the subway is not far away and if you don't want to walk you can go by bus.
andrea was very nice and gave us some useful tips. 
during our stay, there were various other people staying in the same apartment. but it was no problem at all, they were really nice and we had some great talks.
thank you!
Stayed here with 3 others for 3 1/2 weeks. Had a great time, made good use of the stereo and Andrea's vinyl collection!

Great place to stay if youre just looking for a super cheap place thats conveniently located. You can walk out the door and be in Manhattan in around 30 minutes. Lots of great delis/bakeries nearby on Nassau and Metropolitan and it's only about a 20-30 minute walk to Williamsburg. Also, Andrea is a great host...he was super friendly and accomodating when I got in (he let me borrow his laptop when mine crapped out) and he's even gonna mail me my cell phone (because I'm an idiot and I left it in my room).

Andrea is a very experienced host and extremely nice and helpful. His place is enormous, and he lets one make liberal use of his entertainment system. For the price, in NYC, you can't do much better. The downsides are all things he states up front: collegiate level of cleanliness, and surging traffic from the expressway (which is fairly well remedied with application of earplugs). Andrea helped me with all my questions and ultimately recommended a car service for the airport that arrived faster than it took me to exit the building. I'd be happy to stay in his place again.

Andrea is an excellent host. The place is spacious and artsy.  The vibe is very much a "bachelor pad"--it's fine for the average joe looking for an affordable, warm, convenient place to crash. I would not recommend it for neat-freaks or germaphobes--the bathrooms & kitchen are in need of a deep clean and major decluttering. The shower is across the hall. The room itself was fine, basically a mattress and pillows, which does the trick. Wifi worked great. Good location, but next to very busy streets, so probably not ideal for people traveling with children. Overall, it's good accommodations for the price.

Andrea is a great host, he went through quite a bit of trouble to make sure I got the key alright and settled in ok. 
Nevertheless, the rooms are tiny and the flat would need a proper clean up, in my opinion
Apart from the fact that you'll sleep 20 meters away from a highway, that the bedroom door doesn't close and that it smells a bit like wet cigarettes, the value for money is hard to beat to stay that close to Williamsburg.

Before i got here, the only thing i was worried about was the shower and the type of neighborhood the place is in. Andreas place exceeded all of my expectations. Its a beautiful place located really nicely in brooklyn, a short walk from most places. andrea is a really nice guy too! I would not hesitate in staying here again or recommending this place to a friend. Also, the shower is just a shower! Theres nothing wrong with the shower, and im a classy, classy guy!

This review will be a cliche in the fact that it echoes the same sentiment as all the previous reviews. Andrea's space is a nice place to stay in NY. While some may gripe about the walk from the nearest metro to this place, I think its fine. So go ahead and book this one for your next stay. I know I will. 

P.S : Make sure you inform Andrea about the time when you will be reaching the place approximately. I didn't and I had to stand infront of the house for quite a while as the buzzer was malfunctioning.

Andrea's place seemed scary at first (the location is empty at night as the entire street is warehouses), and the building seemed abandoned, but eventually, we had a nice stay, also thanks to the fact that we were the only guests there those days! Andrea was kind enough to accept three of us and our puppy for 2 nights. The bathroom, like the others say, is not very clean, and definitely Andrea could improve the bathroom cleanness by scrubbing, and using better products, but it served its purpose of a quick shower. The big hang out space is comfortable for chill, sociable people, and Andrea offers many good movies/CDs/records for entertainment. I'm not sure how my experience would have been had there been other guests in the apartment, but for what it was, it was a nice stay, quite chill, relaxing. I did not take the train so I cannot comment on that, but it was only 4 miles to Manhattan (by car), which was convenient. All in all, it was a cool stay, and this place is for cool, easygoing, chill people who do not mind some dirt in the bathroom, and basic sleeping needs. If you are a neat freak, and expect a real bed, or a super clean living area, then this is not for you, but if you are rock-n-roll type of person, then this is great chill place!
This place has a big public space. It's easy to hang out with people of other rooms. I met nice people there and was very comfortable the whole time.

Andrea's place was great and just what I was looking for. A cozy bed to sleep and good wifi while I explored the city in the day. I spent a few days in my room studying which it was also ideal for. Thanks much!

Great place to stay! 

Pros:
- Affordable
- Lots of space
- awesome area (one stop beer shop!)
- flexible host

Cons:
- cluttered / somewhat dirty
- noise from highway (you get used to it though)

I would stay here again.
Totally awesome. Andreas was helpful and nice. Made friends with the other guests and loved the atmosphere of the place. Will definitely stay again

Andrea has an awesome apartment! He is very nice and helpful if you have any questions/problems. The area is cool, too, seemed very safe to us and there is a bus stop just 1 minute away, which takes you directly to the subway (without the bus, it's about 15 minutes walking). The shower is not the cleanest shower you have seen before, but it's alright. You have an awesome view from the roof! We also had very nice roommates, and if we ever come back to New York / Brooklyn we will definitely consider staying here!

I rent this room for 2 of my friends and they have a great experience. 
Andreas is so helpful guy and attentive .
I recommend this room for anyone that want came to NYC to have fun.

We stayed at Andrea's place for four days. Andrea was really nice and welcoming. He showed us around and gave us restaurant recommendations on the first night. He had also prepared a (Hidden by Airbnb) map with shops and restaurants in the area. 

The apartment is spacious and there are lots of things to keep you entertained (Netflix, N64, music, DVDs, books...), it looks just like on the photos Andrea provides on the website. As noted in previous reviews, the bathroom is not particularly clean but we didn't mind too much. 

The area is nice, many places to eat and buy groceries, 15 minutes to the G or L metro. 

We had a good time, would stay there again!

excepté la photo d'Andrea sur le site, nous ne savons pas à quoi il ressemble ! il ne nous a ni accueilli ni dit au revoir ! son appartement est un SQUAT !!! il n'a pas dû faire le ménage depuis le siècle dernier ! rien n'est rangé, la cuisine est insalubre, le frigo immonde ! la douche est le summum, c'est absolument DEGUEULASSE !!!!!! à part un groupe punk, je ne vois pas qui pourrait y trouver son compte. autant dire que je ne recommande cet appartement à personne. fuyez, fuyez, fuyez !!!!!
Great place. Really enjoyed the welcome. Definitely recommend to others. Fun experience!

My experience in this loft is totally negative. The loft itself is a deposit of old electronic devices. Everything is dusty and dirty. The kitchen is full of bottles with remains inside. The room is dirty and very noisy as it is very close to a highway. It is impossible to sleep. The door cannot be closed, because the lock is broken. I had to take my laptop with me because I couldn't leave it there. Shower and bathroom are old and musty. I saw the tenant only once, when I handed over the keys, then never again. I strongly discourage everybody from this apartment.

Meine Erfahrung in dieser Loft war sehr schlecht. Sie ist ein Abstellplatz für alte Elektronik. Die eingebaute Küche ist mit herumstehenden Flaschen zugemüllt. Das Zimmer ist schmutzig und sehr laut (man sieht auf eine sehr nahe Highway hinüber), das Bett ist unbequem. Man kann die Tür gar nicht zuschließen. Ich musste mein Laptop immer mitnehmen, weil ich es dort nicht lassen konnte. Die Dusche ist alt und schmutzig. Ich habe den Vermieter einmal gesehen, als er mir den Schlüssel aushändigte, dann nie mehr. Ich kann es niemandem empfehlen.

La mia esperienza in questo Loft è molto negativa. Il loft stesso è un deposito di vecchi pezzi di elettronica. Tutto è impolverato e sporco. La cucina è piena di bottiglie con resti dentro. La camera è molto sporca e molto rumorosa in quanto dà su una highway. È impossibile dormire. La porta non si può chiudere, perché la serratura è scassata. Ho dovuto portarmi dietro il laptop tutto il tempo, perché là non potevo lasciarlo. La doccia e il bagno sono di una sporcizia unica. L'affittuario l'ho visto una sola volta, quando mi ha consegnato le chiavi, poi mai più. Sconsiglio vivamente questo appartamento.

This place is pretty much ok if you're a back packer and not used to stays in 5 stars hostel. It's nice to meet your roommates in the living room. Rooms are small, but it's not ment to fit a family trip. The shower definitely needs a cleaning but i've seen worst. It worth what it cost. andrea is a nice guy who is helpful when you're in needs.

Andrea is nice and is keen to make sure you are comfortable. The apartment and room itself were a little cluttered and untidy. The rooms do not have keys and as the apartment is shared with other guests I would have appreciated the option to lock my door. Also if it is possible request the room away from the highway, although I am not a light sleeper the noise was quite considerable at times.

location is good, nice area, with an excelent view of the rooftop; but the apartments is messy and dirty, the shower is small and dirty, we had to clean the restroom because one of others guest left it impossible and Andrea said he couldnt clean it until next day. 

   The rug of my bed was dirty with a lot of hair, I preffered not to use the pillows... is not easy to access the bed (in a mezzanine) from the wood stairs, you have to be vary careful.

For the price and location of this place, it was so worth it. Upon checking in we met Andrea, who by far was one of the best hosts we had during our stay in NYC. Besides sharing some yummy brews on the rooftop, he made us feel very at home as we played records during the day and recommended some awesome places to check out at night. 

The place is lofted with each room separated for privacy and although cluttered the space was very very cool. We stayed there when there were other guests as well so it was nice meeting some new faces. The location was 15min walking distance from Williamsburg, which has tons of bars and food places but there are a few places down the street to check out as well and a very convenient little market. I would definitely recommend this place for future guests!

Hey! The place is ok for the price. The kitchen and living room are nice. Andrea is a really nice guy altough we didn't see him very often. 
The bathroom was quite dirty but it didn't bother us a lot. We weren't at home much. 
The rooms are ok but right next to a huge Highway so there is a loooot of noice. The bed was vibrating from time to time because of the big trucks on the Highway. 
The Subway is the one that bring's you right into Manhattan. You have to walk about 10-15 min to get to the station. All in all we liked the neighbourhood. It Is close to cool places in Brooklyn williamsburgh.

Great dude, great place, great price! Perfect for people who want to go out in and around Greenpoint, 15$ cab ride to manhattan, the roof is amazing. Do I need to say more? I don't think so! Totally worth the price, oh yeah and parking space right in front all the time!
place was just as expected and andrea was very chill about us sleeping in and leaving whenever

This place is great to stay! The subway is about 15 minutes away walking. I was a little nervous before arriving because (Hidden by Airbnb) maps didn't make a lot of justice to the area, long story short, the area is pretty safe and I walked by myself a couple of times. There are three rooms in the loft, it has  half bathroom inside and the shower is outside. The place is pretty comfortable, kitchen is small but we managed to cook large meals for the four of us with no problem. The rooms are a bit small, but there's plenty of space in the living room to hangout. I read that the highway was noisy but we could sleep up to noon with no problems. Andrea has a great music collection, and movies as well, everything you need for a snowy day. The place is a bit messy, but I think ithe was mainly because all three rooms were rented the time we were there. I fully recommend this place, and I would definitely stay here again. Thanks Andrea for the hospitality :)
This stay was just great! The room was quite charming. I loved the livingroom. I felt very comfortable. Andrea is an outstanding nice, and very relaxed host.

Everything was exactly as expected! Our host provided us with all the information we needed to feel comfortable, and at home. This was my first time using this site and i'd say it was a solid first experience. I would recommend this place to anyone. I will admit, it was a little off the beaten path, with the nearest subway being a 15 minute walk away. On the contrary, there was some really good food and beer in this neck of the woods. Greenpoint Heights I believe it was called, is a amazing brunch spot only a few blocks away. Overall, good stay!

Everything was perfect. Andrea is a nice host!
the only disadvantage was that it was really load because the loft is next to the highway I-278..

I was there for one month and the house has good points and bads:

Good: bigger, roof, the area, the room, lnowing people if u want because u share apartment, near manhattan 20 minutes 

Bad: dirt ( the big problem), some subway noise (no so much), 15 minutes from the house to subway, the shower isn't in the same apartment. 

Andrea was a good owner with me and i hadn' t any problem. Thanks so much :)

My two friends and I  stayed at Andreas place for two nights. He is a very nice host and was very patient though we arrived later because we missed our bus.
The Apartment looks just as in the description, it is a big livingroom and a smaller bedroom with a bunk bed. We had fresh Sheets and towles but in a Girls view it could be a Little bit more clean...I would describe it as a typical Bachelor Apartment;-)
the bathroom with the shower is in Andreas Apartment so you have to get out to the hall way to get into the shower but that was ok!
There live some other People in the Apartment with us but they were all very nice.
Andreas place is very Close to Manhattan, it took us about 15 minutes to walk to the Metro Station and then another 15 minutes to get into Manhattan.

There is a TV with Netflix and lots of other movies so you wont get bored at night!
we had a awesome trip, we love New York City:) thanks Andrea for having us!!!

We were a group of 4 sharing one of Andreas rooms. Andrea is a very relaxed and talkative host, the first night he went out with us for food and drinks and gave us a rundown of greenpoint. He also got out of bed at midnight once to let us in when we didn't have keys. Fantastic.

The apartment is spacious with a great common area, fat speakers and a piano we played every day. However the apartment is pretty dirty and there's a ants nest somewhere close to the shower, which of course is not very nice. The experience was great nonetheless.

I wouldn't suggest booking with Andrea. I booked an extension to my time at his place. Andrea cancelled my extension reservation while I was already a guest at his place and asked that I pay him cash. I questioned Andrea's motive for the cancellation and he told me not to worry and I could pay him upon my return from a weekend business trip. When I insisted that he take the cash, he told me he booked the room to someone else. He intended to move my things out of the room while I was away and inform me of his "mistake" upon my return. After questioning him further, Andrea admitted to the very unscrupulous behavior. I have no issue with anyone canceling a reservation; however, I do take issue when a host is dishonest about it and potentially leaves me without accommodation upon my return from a work trip out of the city at 1 AM in the morning. Furthermore, I take issue with a host additionally intending to take my things out of my room while I am away. I'm still unclear why Andrea wasn't honest about his desire to earn more money from a group booking and giving me the opportunity to find additional accommodation in a stress-free manner as opposed to his admission literally 15 minutes prior to my leaving the city for work.

Andrea is a by-the-numbers host in terms of response time, settling his guests in, and laying down the house rules. He was extremely flexible and accommodating to my numerous special needs during my 2 week stay. If you are an open-minded and self guiding tenant, this space will serve your needs adequately: spartan, a tad funky, but a good place to hang your hat after a looooong night partying.

This was my first Airbnb experience, and it was a great one! Everything as described and Andrea was an awesome host. The room was small, but the common area totally makes up for it. It's a really neat loft, and it was cool to get on the rooftop. There's a lot of neat gear in the loft. It's a true city living environment! I will definitely stay again. Thanks again Andrea!!

We didn't see Andrea during the weekend, but the description was really accurate.
The appartment was well-located, but a bit dirty and noisy. I would recommend it for a short stay in New York.
Andrea is a great host and I can definitely recommend this place for a true Brooklyn experience.

Location is pretty good. Not far from two subway stations and a cheap and quick cab from lots of good areas at night . It's a bit of a dead industrial area though so not the nicest walk at night. 

If you struggle with road noise this isn't the place for you. The motorway was right outside the window, I can sleep through it but my friends struggled.

Unfortunately, it is properly dirty!! Clearly hasn't been given a serious clean in months (and I'm genuinely no clean freak). The showroom is particularly grimy. 

A real shame because otherwise I would of given it a fairly good review. Wouldn't take that much effort on the hosts behalf. 

To be fair, it is cheap though so if you don't mind dirt and road noise then go for this.

Andrea was a great host. Extremely welcoming and friendly. The place was exactly as listed. The place had a nice chilled feel to it and it was nice to share the flat with other AirBnB-ers who were also visiting NYC. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Andrea was quick to reply with all my questions and was very friendly to us when we arrived. The room was cozy and was in a good convenient location with a gas station right downstairs of the apartment with many other shops around. It's a 0.7mile walk to the closest subway station so it's good to know the bus schedule if you don't want to walk that far. The room and shower can be quite cold in the winter as there's no central heating but a portable heater which takes a while to heat up the bedroom and shower room. Great location to explore Brooklyn from.

Four of us stayed at this loft for 6 nights. We are all college students and didn't need anything fancy. We were taken back by the location at first but quickly grew comfortable. It's 3 small rooms that connect to a living room. They're quite cozy. It's a laid back living situation. The shower isn't in the room but it isn't a big inconvenience. Overall, if you can handle a pretty bohemian living situation then you'll be fine. The sounds of the highway can be pretty loud sometimes. Two of my friends minded a lot but two of us didn't care so that's all contingent on who you are. Andrea was very nice and told us everything up front. He even gave us suggestions for where to eat and what places to check out, a really great host. I would recommend staying here.
The apartmant is dirty. The location is fine, Andrea is nice, and it is really good price, if you don't mind that you live like in a dirty bachelor's apartmant.
Had a great time nice people sweet loft!
Andrea is very nice&cool.

Andrea was a great host! He even let me come one night earlier when it turned out I have no place to stay.
His loft is spacious and filled with the most surprising things - records, instruments  and records again :)
Bedrooms are pretty simple and not too big - ideal if you only want to sleep there.
For any other activity common space is great. Access to the kitchen area as well as chillout living room.
Shower situation might be tricky for some as it's in the apartment down the hall, but other than that, everything works perfect.
This place is not fancy or super clean, but it's ideal for young, not demanding travallers who just need a spot to sleep and recharge batteries before heading to the city.
Neighbourhood is great - full of cool restaurants and bars. Plus live music.

It was great place, very good location .. just 10 minutes to subway station and then 30 minutes to Manhattan. We had everything we needed. The only disadvantage is highway very close to windows .. there is quite noise at night.

Andrea was a great and nice host. Very humour person!
This is a great, cool place to stay at. And the room is good too.
The first night he showed me his studio, it’s awesome!
i had a great time and people here!
Ir was pretty cool, Andrea is really friendly and that Made our stay even better

Don't be scared, when you arrive at the place.. the looks not that nice from outside but inside it is cool and one minute away you are in the most beatuiful area of Williamsburg! It takes just 30min to Manhattan and you have access to the roof were you can see the Manhatten Syline. It is a studio and Andrea works and lives there. Andrea is friendly and comunicative. 
We met nice people, who were airbnb guests too. The comunication with Andrea was very good!

 It was warm and cosy in the flat BUT unfortunately I have to say that it was not clean! It is ok if the host has not much time to clean it like in a hotel but as I am a host as well, I'd be embarrassed to offer my flat like that. Just take some dollars more to pay a person who cleans for you. The price would be still ok and at least the guests would feel more comfortable to shower

We had much privacy and you can cook, which is good. I'd have felt more comfortable if the door was working. You should fix that!

The price is good, the place is very nice so we had a good time there though! I still recommend it!
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Andrea was a great host.  the apartment is enormous and full of comic books. There's an N64. What more could you want

Andrea was great. I arrived a little early and he was able to make things happen so that I would have access to the apartment. 

The space itself is a lovely apartment. Don't be confused by the facade (it's an old factory), once you step in it has a cool "Brooklyn" feel to it. The people staying were extremely polite as well. 

Good experience if you're a young traveler. Wouldn't recommend for older travelers (with families and such), but still a great time.

The space in general is very chilled out... The room we stayed in was comfortable and had a good use of the space. It is a little bit far from the subway but is a nice 10-15mim walk. Also is well located, you'll find erything you need around the corner.
The host canceled this reservation 4 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

10/10 - definitely coming back here.  Andrea was a great host with a sweet set-up and was very accommodating during my whole stay.  The loft is as you expect and the pictures do it justice.  The roof is a great place for some fresh air or to catch some iconic views.  Close walk to food, bars, and the J line that takes you to straight to Manhattan.

If you're very lucky, two Russian guys will also be staying in the loft during your visit.  They are seriously nice guys that may even go barhopping with you if you ask nicely, just make sure to whisper 'Garry' to them inaudibly several times, they'll get it! :D

Really nice loft, best for young guys or couples between 20 and 30. The bathroom could be cleaner. The rooftop is beautiful. Great view over Manhattan. 
See you next time there
Nice place with specific design.

Things I loved about this space:
PRICE: You really can't beat it. It's not glamorous, but my husband and I weren't planning on spending much time in our airbnb anyway--we wanted to be out in the city--so we wanted something inexpensive, and this was perfect. 
LOCATION: It's close to Greenpoint and Williamsburg, which are both really cool areas. Also a 15 minute walk to the subway, which we used everyday. Super convenient.
SECURITY: You have to go through three doors before you even get to your room. From the street, there's a heavy door that opens into a stairwell, then another door that opens into a hallway, then another door that opens into the loft. All of these doors lock, which made us feel super safe.
SHARED SPACE: The place was a lot more private than I was expecting, which was nice. We had two housemates while we were there, and they were both incredible! The host, Andrea, was super kind and friendly.

Things I didn't love about this space:
DISCOMFORT: The bed was pretty uncomfortable, to be honest. We were so exhausted at the end of each day spent in Manhattan that we ended up sleeping pretty hard anyway, but if we hadn't been so tired, it might have been rough. 
BATHROOM: There's no shower in the loft space, you have to go across the hall and use Andrea's shower. A little awkward, but it is what it is. The shower itself isn't very clean, but after a long day, it still felt nice. The bathroom in the loft has a sink and a toilet, and it wasn't the cleanest either, but it did the job.

All in all, it's not a beautiful space or some kind of dream-getaway, but Andrea is really up-front about that. We knew what we were getting into, so we really enjoyed our time there. It's perfect for young solo travelers or young couples who just want a cheap spot to store their bags and catch a few hours of sleep in between frolicking around the city. It's not super clean or aesthetically pleasing, but the location is awesome, the cost is unbeatable, and the company was fantastic.

Andrea is an amazing host. He's quick to respond, the perfect guide, and willing to come keep two travelers new to the city some company and show us around  town. while the outside of the place is not the most appealing, the interior is amazing (large space kept very clean and organized). If you want to stay in, he's got you covered. If you want to to out, it is a bit of a walk to get to places or the subway, but that's all manageable. An awesome place to stay while in NYC.

Andrea was so friendly and welcoming. I felt like I was visiting a family member. There was plenty of space, multiple bathrooms, he even has a amazon fire stick with netflix and prime hooked up to the flat screen. A stereo system with an aux chord if you're into playing music while your cooking or whatever.  Each room was private per guest with our own couch/futon and bed. Although we brought our own towels and toiletries he had those available per guest. There was access to the rooftop where we could smoke. Wouldn't have minded seeing more of him just because our first encounter was so great but there was plenty of privacy which I really liked. I've seen reviews on other airbnbs and I've read of some sketchy things hosts have done. I would highly recommend this to everyone especially international or business travelers.
Was a great stay! Had my own privacy and very spacious! Had no problems and loved my time in New York while staying here!

What a great place. I loved it here and it was perfect for me. The Host is Cool as well and  laid back, I'll be rebooking here for sure. Thank you. 
Sean :-)
Location is definitely plus... McD is just next to gas station which gives to comfort to grap food any time...

I loved Andrea's place. It felt super homey and cozy. The room was quite small, but I loved it regardless. The bed and sheets were really nice and the kitchen was well-stocked with pots, pans, etc. The unit is in a converted warehouse, which means high ceilings and open layout but also means temperature swings. In the room and common area, there are heaters and fans to combat that, though. The apartment is right next to a freeway but that didn't bother me too much. Of all the Airbnb's that I've stayed at in NYC, this is the only one that I would seek out to stay in again.
Great value for this room. 10 mins on foot to the underground that goes straight to Midtown. Price/quality ratio cannot be beaten nowadays in NY. Andrea is a very nice host. Highly recommended

Andrea is super amicable. Upon my arrival, he showed me a tour of the warehouse and gave me a beer. I actually lost my keys the first night there so I crashed at a friend's place and the next day I met him for brunch and then paid for new keys to be made. He was very patient and lenient. He made sure I was comfortable. 

My only (and biggest) issue was the dust. There was like a thin film of dust coating the bedroom. My allergies are really terrible but luckily I had allergy meds on me. I think the place could use a deep clean cuz even on meds I coughed up a lung.  One day it was really hot and I wanted to turn on the fan but I could see it was coated with dust so I just opened the windows instead and saw dust on my hands after lifting the window open.

We choosed the place because of privacy. Not very clean, but after couple of days it did not bother us anymore. The bedroom is exactly next to very traffic highway and we used earplugs and then it was ok. Andrea was very helpful and nice. Overall it is great place to stay.

Andrea's a fantastic host! He's flexible when he can be, and there's always clear line of communication which is really important when you're arriving in a big new city you've never been before! It's a pretty cool loft, it really had an authentic New York feel to it. It's not prim and perfect, it certainly feels lived in but that's a nice appeal to it. It's entirely worth the price. 

I wish I could've spent some more time in the loft, Andrea has tons of awesome records/CD's/Books. Even though we never even got the chance to meet him, definitely felt like we did just based on his artistic selections! 

The location is pretty perfect. There's a gas station just below you, so you can start your day out with a water/get smokes/ whatever stuff you get a gas station lol. 

Tons of restaurants and beautiful parks just within walking distance. (Try out 5 leaves!! so dang good! esp. breakfast!) About 15 minutes. There's a music venue that we specifically went to New York that was just 5 minutes away from this location. The Brooklyn Steel. It's a perfect location if you find a good show there! 

The only thing that I'd warn to expect is that the shower is very small, and the shower head has a pretty weak stream that can't be moved in any direction (i'm small so it just shot me in the face the whole time, pretty comical) and the freeway really does whizz by your head the whole night. But it's true! If you can get to sleep with ambient noise, this is no bother. We actually liked the sound of the traffic. Again, an authentic NY feel! Although the sun does burst into your face and force you to get up in the morning. Which was no problem for us because we wanted to see as much as we could. But if you're planning on spending a day hungover in bed, it might not be the most comfortable! 

Overall, this place was perfect for the kind of trip we were taking. A safe place to lay our head, somewhere to shower, towels, soap, a good line of communication. You can't beat it for the price. And Andrea's a fantastic host. I highly recommend!
Great stay.
Great place to stay. Ten minutes from Graham ave station, which is very convenient. Also, there are great places to eat and have a drink around the area. I definitely recommend this place.
There were some issues, especially with the shower that wasn't working well, but Andrea tried to solve it and he also gave a parcial refund for those inconveniences.
Andrea’s place was perfect, and exactly as described. Easy access to everything, and the room was comfortable

The neighborhood looks a bit shady at first, especially if you arrive in the night but its actually a great place in Brooklyn. It takes a 15 minutes walk and 10 minutes train ride to Manhatten. The place itself is really spacious and has a great vibe!
This place is to me is a decent travellers way of staying in Brooklyn. Thanks Andrea!
Really cool place, and a bunch of great people live there. Made us feel really at home and made the stay easy and fun
Alles top.

Communication and check in were very easy. I didn’t meet Andrea, but felt like I could contact him if I had questions. The place is as described: quite basic setup but a good value for a place to sleep. At first it feels like a bit of an awkward location, but once you know your way around you’ll appreciate the area and easy way to get around with public transport.

You should know going into this apartment that you won’t be sitting in the lap of luxury but it’s a very cool place with a good vibe, especially when you have nice roommates (which you usually do). More space than I’ve seen anywhere in NYC plus free street parking. And Andrea is a fantastic host! Very communicative and responsive to any questions or complaints.

This place was so much fun! Tons of music to enjoy. The roof offers an amazing view and is a great way to spend your evening with some beverages and snacks, especially in good weather. The location is great for catching the L or for touring Brooklyn. A little road noise, but nothing that kept us from sleeping. Think of Hotdog, the neighborhood outdoor alley cat, when you bring back leftovers. We really enjoyed our stay!
We loved that place and we would surely recommend staying there

Andrea's place has a lot of soul. From the people who come in and out to the people who live there. Kerry and his wife were very hospitable and very cool people to hang out with. The A/C alone made this place worth it to me. I'd definitely recommend for people traveling alone or with one other person.

like some of others mentioned already, it is not the place if you want a spotlessly clean space. But it is close to Manhattan and has wonderful rooftop which has 360 view. Personally the best thing about this place was Kerry and Lily. I strongly suggest to talk to them, they are the best people ever! We had wonderful time hanging around and a great rooftop bbq that I will never forget. I'm glad I chose this place.
Nice and easy stay.

First off, it's an super spacious apartment.  700sq ft is hard to come by around here. Ted was an amazing host.  When the last renter left the space a bit sparse of bed linens, he was quick to bring a bag full over. The kitchen has the essentials but I didn't do any cooking with so many places to eat around here.  It's within 3-5 min walk to subway station (Website hidden by Airbnb) so it was easy to get around.  The internet speed is fast, the water pressure in the shower is amazing, and the laundry in the basement is very convenient. Overall great place to stay for a month.

Location: Amazing! At the intersection of Nolita and LES. Soho and Little Italy as well as subway stations serving to many lines are within 3-5 minutes walking distance. Wholefoods is just a couple of buildings away.

Building: Mid-rise condo building with elevators, hard to come by in Lower Manhattan. 24/7 security and front desk receiving your packages on your behalf. They are very polite and helpful, offering help to carry your luggage or bags if you are coming from grocery for instance. A well equipped gym and laundry facilities are available in the basement floor.

Apartment: Quite spacious and hard to come by in Lower Manhattan. In my opinion it can easily accomodate 4 people as there are two sofas in the living room. The apartment receives ample sunshine. The queen size bed is sturdy yet extremely comfy. TV is small but has lots of channels. Internet is pretty fast. Lots of storage is available. Abundant kitchenware is available. The oven, stovetop, microwave and fridge are all large size. The rear side of the large mirrors in the bathroom has quite a lot of shelves which would easily accomodate your personal grooming supplies like comb, razor, shaver, toothbrush etc. The water pressure of the shower was great and got hot instantly. The toilet flushing power/pressure was amazing. It won't get blocked unlike many old apartments in Lower Manhattan. I did not personally meet any of the neighbors but the people I saw when entering/existing the building or the elevators were quite well-dressed and neat. The radiators generate a great deal of heat so I am sure you won't get cold even in the coldest days of winter. I assume the A/C would work great in the summer because the panels serve as both radiators and A/C with different settings. Last, we received the apartment in a very clean condition. Therefore the additional payment Ted charges guests for "professional cleaning" is well justified as his cleaners are professional indeed.

Host: I did not personally meet Ted as he had left the keys to the front desk and I left the keys to them when I moved out. This allows for very convenient 24/7 check-in and -out. Nonetheless, he was very prompt and helpful when I contacted him via email, SMS or his mobile. Before our check-in when I had asked him about whether towels are available in the apartment, he noticed there were none and arranged that brand new sets for two people to be available in the apartment prior to our check-in.

Negatives: None, if you don't consider the absence of hair dryer as such.

Final words: I cannot recommend this apartment and host highly enough.

An incredible apartment in a great part of the city. We stayed here for three months and could not have been happier with the space. The building has a lot of amenities that made for an even better stay: a doorman for packages, laundry in the basement, fast internet access, full cable TV, a full kitchen.

You're essentially right there in between SoHo / LES / Chinatown, so everything and anything we needed was just a walk away. It turned out to be a great home away from home for a few months and just what we needed.

Ted is also incredibly responsible, either over text or email. That made the experience that much better.

If we ever needed a place to stay in the city, I would definitely choose this spot, both for the neighborhood it's in as well as the convenience of the apartment.

The apartment was very nice, comfortable, and of good size for a Manhattan apartment.   The location is, as described, excellent for access to Chinatown, Soho, etc.  There is a subway station just around the corner.  The building is secure with a 24-hour doorman.   Ted was very responsive to questions, and was a good host.

I highly recommend this apartment if you want to stay in this area of Manhattan.  I will likely stay there again.

Ted's apartment is a great base in New York.  There are so many neighbourhoods (Nolita, Soho, Little Italy, Chinatown, LES, Noho) within five minutes and it's very well located for a number of subway lines.  Lots of choices for food and WholeFoods just couple of blocks away.

The apartment is described as spartan but I found it just perfect.  It was free of all clutter, but with bedding, towels and kitchen equipment.  TV and wifi all in good working order.

A good downtown apartment.

Ted always very quick to respond to questions or requests.

Great location. Close to everything you need. Great apartment, door man is so nice. And Ted was so helpful during my trip. I have changed my schedule for 3 times, and he always try to fit in my schedule.

Ted was a very good host. He welcomed us in, made sure we were settled and took us around the building. He was always available for questions when needed and very responsive. The location is good, right next to Soho and close to the subway and Whole Foods. Apartment was as described.

My host, Ted, was an amazing host. He was very polite and nice with me at the time of checking-in/ out. I was also very impressed with the apartment’s accurate description. The apartment is sunny, clean and spacious. The oven, microwave and fridge are all large size. The Internet speed is fast, the water pressure in the shower and the toilet flushing are really good, there is also a hair dryer in the bathroom and plenty closets in the bedroom. There is an excellent laundry in the basement and the people at the front desk are very nice and helpful with your daily packages. The neighborhood is near many good trendy places, boutiques and great restaurants in NY. I will love to stay again in this apartment on my next trip to the city.

I stayed in Ted´s apartment for five weeks and Ted was a great host available to answer any questions I had. The apartment is clean and have all the amenities needed. Also it is perfectly located in soho/LES area close to many cool restaurants, bar and shopping.
Ted was really flexible for check in and was quick to answer our questions.

Very spacious apartment, with ample closet room and all the utilities you could need in the Kitchen. Super fast wifi. A minute walk to the J subway line so very convenient if commuting to the Financial District. I stayed here for two months and would recommend it. Ted was very responsive and pleasant to deal with.

Overall ok apartment and large enough. Furniture and amenities are a bit old and tired and I would not certainly call it "luxury". 

The street is Bowery, not great due to the nearby soup kitchen. But you have nolita and soho at a stone throw, lovely areas full of coffee shops and restaurants. Also great access to several subway lines. 

So luxury it's not, but it gets the job done

The apartment is amazing! Lots of space, clean and near to everything you need! Ted and his girlfriend was really nice and helpful!  They make sure you will have a great time. The building is great and secure and all the doormen are so nice. You feel home
Great host and fantastic location

I booked teds apartment for my parents to stay in while they visited NY for a month. Everything about the apartment was great. Location, comfort, cleanliness and amenities. Ted was a great host who was always very responsive and accommodating whenever we needed anything or had any requests. Would highly recommend this apartment to anyone looking to stay in a lively neighborhood near all the best shopping, restaurants and nightlife in the city.

The apartment is spacious by NYC standards. The building staff is great. Kitchen was well stocked with appliances and utensils. The mattress was a bit uncomfortable because it’s a bit soft so we ended up using the futon quite a bit. Overall a good stay

Almost SOHO,  just one block away. Ted is right it is SPARTAN, that is accurate, but for location and friendly doormen, bldg cleaners, you cannot beat this place. Staff at building is 5 star. The elevator and door men were the most important to us and that is what we got. Thank you TED!!

Merci Ted et Janet, pour votre accueil, votre disponibilité et votre réactivité.
J'ai bien apprécié l'appartement, les équipements très complets, la localisation. C'est un hôte et un appartement à recommander.

My boyfriend and I had a great stay with Cristina! Her apartment has good energy and a lot of character. The bed is comfy and everything was clean. She's really sweet and a great hostess. Cool restaurants and cafes nearby. Thanks, Cristina!

Amazingly warm and hospitable women. I have stayed here for a month now and have had the best experience getting to know Cristina. She is funny, smart and very welcoming. I would recommend anyone stay here as long as you are respectful. The room is nice, and located in a perfect place. About equal distance from the L train and the JMZ lines. I had a pleasure staying with her. Thank you Cristina!
Had a great and easy time at the cosy place that definitely earns the definition of cosy. Enjoyed some really quiet nights and a very friendly and helpfull host - cristina!

Had a great 3 day stay at Cristina's place, comfy bed, clean and tidy and great location, about 10 mins walk to the L train at Bedford ave, past all cool shops and bars etc.  Hardly saw Cristina as she was away when I arrived but her friend who let me in was lovely, as was Cristina when we finally met

Had a perfect time at Cristina's place! Close to the subway, in a great, fun part of Brooklyn, by the Williamsburg Bridge (beautiful walk over the bridge). Great host. WIFI a bonus! Good, quiet space to rest after all our NY adventures.
Not only was Christina a pleasant and attentive host, but her warmth and positive energy really made me feel at home and as though I had made a real friend.

Mi amiga Ana y yo, tuvimos la suerte de hospedarnos en casa de Cristina. La vivienda es muy confortable y agradable, te quedarias a vivir en ella. Durante nuestra estancia no tuvimos ningun tipo de problema, es más Cristina nos ayudo en todo lo posible.El barrio es muy tranquilo y bonito cuando te pones a pasear por sus calles. La casa se encuentra en medio de dos estaciones de metro, lo cual facilita la movilidad para ir a Manhattan. Cristina es encantadora y simpatica y tiene una vivienda muy acogedora. Si alguna vez volvemos a Nueva York volveremos a su casa!!!!

Me and my sister had the best time in NY staying at Cristina's place in Williamsburg. The location is really good, and we spend two hole days in the neighbourhood just walking around and enjoying the great atmosphere. 
Cristina is really friendly, a great  host. easygoing and relaxed. Would recommend this place to everyone and would stay there again next time.

I spent two days at Cristina's place and it was very nice.
A cozy apartment in a nice neighborhood, good location close to subway and restaurants and very clean and comfortable. Cristina was very helpful and nice and I would definitely come back to this place. I recommend Cristina's house to everyone who doesn't want to stay in Manhatten but needs to be close anyway. Thanks Cristina.

Our stay at Cristina's was great! She lives in a fantastic location (just 10 minutes from the L train) and she's got great shops/restaurants/cafes located everywhere around her. 

Cristina was a great host. Provided us with perfect directions on how to get to her place and constantly communicated with us.

We had a wonderful stay at Cristina's. She is super nice and a great hostess, full of good energy. The location is great, close to the L train (10mn) and JMZ trains (15mn), super safe and right in the heart of Williamsburg with tones of nice restaurants, bars and shops around. The apartment is really cozy, quiet and peaceful. Definitely a great place to stay ! Thank you Cristina.

We stayed the month of January 2014, her apartment in Williamsburg is great, the location was amazing. The apartment is very homely and welcoming and above all, Cristina is a great host and very easy to get on with. We loved it so much we're planning on staying there again in the future. We both would highly recommend her and her lovely little home.
Stacy & James.

Great Experience! Thanks Cristina for a great stay.A traveler's dream: comfort, style, subway access, and friendly host. The apartment of Cristina  is as cozy as it seems on the pictures.The room is very spacious , lovely, clean and well organized. The bed is great. Cristina was a wonderful host, the location was awesome and everything went smoothly She was very helpful on providing precise and useful information about how to navigate the city. Her directions to the place were excellent, as well as the recommendations on places to eat  in the neighborhood. The location in Willimasburgh is excellent too - very close to subway and all the good stuff in Brooklyn is walkable. I stayed in the flat one month, it was a wonderful experience, and I hope to have a chance to visit her again. Cristina is very relaxed and friendly and happy for you to do your thing - thank you!! Description and pictures fit very well.

Cristina was a lovely host during my stay in her apartment - the room is comfortable and cozy. However there was a bit of street noise at night and the room got a little cold in the evening, but other than that the apartment is clean and extremely well kept with enough bedding to keep you warm :) The apartment is in a good location, about 10 mins from the Bedford L stop and close to all amenities, and a hop skip and jump from great bars, restaurants and boutiques.

We stayed in Cristinas cozy home for one month and really enjoyed our time there! Cristina is a very welcoming and gentle person. The pictures give a good impression of the flat, which was clean, tidy and very good located! We loved all the little Cafés nearby and the short walk to the waterfront. We would recommend to stay with her and would come again. Thanks again Cristina for being our host, we had a great time!

Cristina er en hyggelig vert. Hun er lett å prate med og er vennlig. Utleiestedet var koselig og rent. Jeg likte veldig godt nabolaget med masse koselige spisesteder/kafeer. Williamsburg kan absolutt anbefales.

La experiencia en casa de Cristina no ha podido ser mejor. 

Mi amiga Sara y yo hemos estado un mes viviendo en este apartamento que ha sido nuestro hogar. Cristina nos dio todas las facilidades posibles: nos hizo un juego de llaves extra, nos recomendó sitios y nos dio a probar su deliciosa cocina.

La habitación es muy bonita, con espacio de sobra para la ropa y la cama es muy, muy cómoda. Todo el apartamento está decorado con muy buen gusto. La habitación no tiene puerta, pero no ha sido ningún problema: una cortina proporciona la intimidad suficiente.

El barrio nos ha enamorado a ambas. Encontrarás todo lo que necesites: supermercados, tiendas vintage y, sobre todo, sitios para tomar una cerveza y comer algo. El metro queda a 10 minutos y es un paseo agradable. En menos de media hora podrás estar caminando por Manhattan.

Pero lo mejor de este piso es, sin duda, Cristina. ¡Muchas gracias por hacer que nuestra estancia en Williamsburg sea una experiencia que nunca olvidaremos!
Cristina is a wonderful host, I stayed with her for a month and had a great experience. Her place is very cozy and clean. The location is great!

Cristina was amazing. I got in touch with her 2 hours before getting the keys. I was 'homeless' in New York and she welcome me to her home with no problem. Thank you so much Cristina. The appt is in one of the best neighbourhood of New York.

I have stayed in a lot of Airbnbs in New York and Cristina's is one of the nicest and certainly the best value. I stayed for one month at the begining of 2015. She welcomed me on arrival and is a very easy person to connect with and is a warm, funny and interesting. The room has a lovely energy to it, feels very laid back, and has great light in the morning. The kitchen is great and we had many nice dinners there. Cristina told me about many good places in the neighbourhood. The area is great, quick walk to the subway, great bars and restaurants around. Although you are in the heart of the action the room is very peaceful at night. Highly recommended.
I had a pleasant stay! Cristina is a really nice and valuable person! The apartment is great just like the neighborhood!
The place was really great! It was so easy to get around and the location is perfect. Cristina is super nice and the apartment was great! Thanks!
Very nice！ A++++ place
Great place in all ways. And Christina is an amazing host. No doubt about it. Couldn't be more willing to recommend it :)
I had a lovely stay at Cristina's. She was incredibly hospitable and helpful. The apt is very well located and cozy as described. You'll enjoy your time here.
Great place to stay. Very clean and great host! The location is also perfect.
I had an awesome stay at Cristinas place for one month!

I had a wonderful stay at Cristina's. The location is ideal ( in the heart of Williamsburgh,my favourite area of NY so far). The appartment is tiny but perfectcly tidy, and very very luminous. Also the cuisine is fully equiped, so if you like to cook it's really great. I stayed for a month and felt in the flat like i was home ! Cristina was a great host and made everything she could to make my arrival and my stay nice and easy-going. So if you're travelling by yourself i would highly recommend to stay with Cristina in this amazing neighborhood !!

Christina is a pleasant and hospital host and made feel at ease in her apartment. It is my first time in the States and her tips were very useful. She sent me clear instructions on how to get into the apartment at first when I arrived ( as she was at work) and this was very easy and useful. She also keeps instructions on how to do stuff in the apartment which makes it very comfortable. 

The room is clean and although tiny but I had plenty of space for my stuff. Bathroom is clean and overall the apartment is comfy and most importantly bright due to the sunlight. 

I will definitely recommend her place for friends coming to NY

I stayed at Cristinas place for a month.
The apartment is really small but super cozy. The room is just enough for the stay - with a real bed, window, closet and some space for sitting and drinking your morning coffee or evening tea - as I was anyway out exploring all day. . The location is great as there are connections to the M and L train just 5/8 min walk. Whole foods market, laundry, restaurants and yoga studios are just on the corner. This area is super calm but close to the happenings in Williamsburg. So I would totally recommend it to anyone.
I really enjoyed it and would totally come back!

Cristina's place is exactly as described - incredibly clean and cozy, in a FANTASTIC location close to everything in Williamsburg and Cristina herself is super-helpful and easy-going.  I stayed a full month and everything was so easy.  It is a small place but I think that adds to the charm - and it never feels cramped... which is partly due to Cristina being such an easygoing host. If you're looking for something great value in an awesome neighborhood, I'd definitely recommend staying here.

Cristina was a lovely host. She gives you maximum space and is adorable to be around. She has beautifully maintained her apartment with plants all over. The place is sparkling clean and she takes a good amount of effort to make sure it stays the same way. The neighbourhood is pretty lively and is close to domino park, which offers a beautiful view of the Manhattan skyline and the sunset. I will recommend staying with Cristina any day. :)
Nice place. We had a good trip during 10 days there.
Vert nice and comfortable place.
We had a great time staying with Thais and Greg. Clean, quiet and convenient. Thanks, Ben and kate.
kann man empfehlen nicht gerade ein Luxus aber sehr sicher und eine sehr nette Gastgeberin
Fantastic experience

We stayed there for 4 days. First of all, the house and room was clean. Actually we were worried about heater system, but no worries. The room was more than warm.:) We could use all facilities including kitchen and refrigerator. It is cheap regarding what we could get. The owners were also friendly and helpful. We really appreciate it. :D

We spent 4 nights for New Year Eve at Tahis's place. The room is clean and comfortable and the owners are very very kind and helpful. I suggest this place to travelers who don't want to spend too much money staying at hotels.
Nice apt, just as title, cozy suite. Although we've through the crazy snow storm in NY, but we certainly have a warm and cozy times in here. Thank you!!!!

I stayed in Cozysuite Fortress for three days and it was great time. Kitchen and bathroom were very clean and the room was not cold at all. The room was exactly same what you see in this picture. Moreover, bus station is very close to this house so it's very easy to get to the subway station. It's perfect place for people who want a comfortable travel :) Thanks!
I like CozySuite, and I lived there with my boyfriend three days. Kitchen and bathroom were very clean, and  Tahis is very nice. Thank you:)
It's a really good place! The room is clean and warm. And the location is very convenient--very easy to get to the bus stop and the subway station. I enjoyed my experience there!

We just got back from staying a week at Thais and Greg's Apartment. We had a wonderful time and are very happy we went with the Cozysuite! From the time we checked in to the time we left, they were very helpful in helping us get settled and made recommendations of places to go. They also helped get us a taxi to the airport. The price is great for everything you get! The place was very clean with a modern feel, we really felt at home. The location is very convenient as well; you're not on Manhattan, but a short walk or bus ride to the subway station will put you on Manhattan in no time! If you're worried about safety of your belongings (which you don't have to be); from the front door on the street to your room there are 5 locks, which you will have your own keys to - we felt very safe. Upon check-in you will be given internet access; it was very fast and safe, so if you have a computer, I would recommend bringing one. The only minor thing I would have liked to see in the Cozysuite would be a microwave, it would have been more convenient to be able to re-heat leftovers or prepare a quick meal on the go. Again, the place is great; you won't be disappointed with your choice. When you're on vacation, or need a place to stay, you want it to feel like home, and we definitely felt at home while staying at the Cozysuite!

Great experience. Thais was extremely friendly and helpful. The apartment is great, the bed and linens are comfortable. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice place to sleep that is a well located. I'm very pleased we found CozySuite, and look forward to visiting again.
we had a nice stay at cozysuite. bed was a bit small, but all in all it's okay for the price. thais and greg were nice and always helpful.
The room and floor I stayed on was very clean and private.
We had a great stay in CosySuite!  The rooms and apartment are nice, light and clean.  Only a short walk to the metro, it's quite the bargain!

Thais was really helpful.  This space is so clean, private and comfortable.  I think I had housemates, but I never even met them.  Locks on all the doors, it feels really safe.  The neighborhood is mixed - some old families who will greet you on the street, but some shady characters will, too.

CozySuite Fortress

overall it was a good stay. but here are the details. for the price, i give it 4stars.
---------------------------------------------------------------

1****.i saw 2 coackroaches (one in the kitchen/front room area and the other in the bathroom) the first 2 nights i stayed at Cozysuite. it made me really paranoid.
